description:
The first Philz Coffee storefront. This was one of the places I was looking forward to when coming back to California. I didn't even know Philz started in SF! I am so lucky to have stayed a few blocks away from this location. I came here probably every day and sometimes even multiple times a day when i was in SF.

You can not go wrong with any drink you order here. I am normally not the biggest fan of coffee but I can drink Philz coffee for days! I wish they would open one in NYC. 
This place is kind of unorganized as the line is suppose to start at the back but people who don't know just walk up to the counter, skipping everyone who is waiting. You order at the counter and pay at the cash register!

The staff are always nice and friendly! I love this location!
author: Flora L.

description:
Philz is one of those made with love chains. This flagship location is located right on 24th in the mission. 

Philz Coffee is a personalized experience. They don't have the traditional drinks of a classic cafe, yet provide a menu with beans from around the globe. When you walk in, you approach one of the baristas and give your order. They'll always check with you on the milk content and the sweetness, and after they serve it will always check it's up to your standard. Philz brews their coffees one cup at a time, so perhaps don't go when you're in a crunch. 

A couple of their drinks contain fresh mint, but the one I find myself always returning to is the Mint Mojito. It's sweet and creamy and is topped with a fresh mint. I'll admit the name is what drew me in, but the taste has me coming back. Their coffee is definitely one of the more caffeinated ones, so beware.

Blue Bottle, Philz, and Equator are my top choices for coffee in San Francisco.
author: Navila H.

description:
Last weekend in SF and I finally decided to stop by the original Philz that has been within walking distance from me for the past 3.5 years... 

And wow, I'm so glad I did! I grabbed my handy Yelp tumbler with lid and reusable straw and headed over to get some work done. All the table and couch spaces were filled so I ended up sitting outside. The wifi is still plenty strong so it was all good. 

I'm not a huge coffee drinker but I've always been happy when I've grabbed something at Philz. Bring your own cup and save a buck. I got the mocha tesora with medium sugar and cream. My barista put less ice, which was GREAT. It was just enough to cool it down without condensation forming all over my cup. The mocha tesora was creamy, a little frothy with strong coffee notes and a hint of sweetness. Next time, I think I could even go with light cream and sugar as I felt like I wasn't even drinking coffee anymore! Super smooth overall and I'm sure even without the cream there would be little bitterness. 

Overall, definitely stop by if you're looking for a good cup of joe in a low key spot. The baristas are friendly and the shop very cozy.
author: Liza X.

description: I've only traveled to the bay once before.  But on that trip, i discovered Philz.  I was also directly instructed to come here, so that helped a wee bit.  Yes it's coffee in a coffee house, and i am a tourist here.  That said, everyone here is super nice, and service is fantastic.  I also saw a barrista sporting the triforce.  Google it if you don't know.  This is the OG location, or so I was told.  Unlike the other locations i have sampled, this one has that cozy feel.  They put up with my tedious requests, and make a bomb cup of caffeinated nectar.
author: Jason D.

description: Lots of coffee shops around the area but they don't have something that Philz has which is Philtered Soul. My day isn't complete without a large Philtered Soul straight up (no creamer no sugar). Just enough sweetness without being too rich and a hint of chocolate/cocoa flavor coffee.
author: Gerard Y.

description:
Not all Philz are created equal, some baristas are better than other.
This Philz is a good one. I tend to always get Tantalizing Turkish with the mint leaf, so good. The spot is a block from Basa seafood and 3 blocks from El Farolito, perfect for us
author: Michael A.

description:
I used to live in the Bay, and decided to drop by Philz on my visit back. Since I'm here, why not got to the original, right? 

I'm so glad I did. I was happy to see they did some minor improvements to the bar area without losing the integrity and charm of this place.

The menu threw me for a bit of a loop because Greater Alarm used to be a banging light roast. It's now listed as a medium. Kinda trippy. I got a Dancing Water, which was a medium roast, now a light roast.  I've been dreaming of a chocolatey and smooth DW for a couple years now. 

I roll up to the place, expecting the usual crazy line. However, it was super chill, playing some light hip hop, per usual.  There were only two rockstars on bar, so my order was taken pretty promptly.

I got my cup, took a sip, and melted into heaven!!! The soy milk was perfectly shaken, perfect amount of medium plus sugar, perfect customer service, perfect experience. Thanks for caffeinating me oh so good on my relaxing vacation home away from home!!
author: Eli'jah C.

description:
My first time at philz was terrible and I swore off this cafe ever since. I'm so glad a few years later I decided to give it a second chance due to a friend visiting out of town. We got the mint mojito iced coffee as well as the tesora. They were both phenomenal! I suppose my barista the first time I went wasn't the best because this time around I could tell the coffee as great, and I like how you they will customize about almost everything in your drink (ice, sweetness, milk) so you dont have to do it yourself. I'm usually a black coffee drinker but I'll make an exception for a philz mint mojito. 

I cant recall if they serve food here but I also went to a different location where they served a walnut banana greek yogurt with some honey drizzle, and it was amazing! Would highly suggest to grab that if you're a bit peckish.
author: Noor H.

description: Was so bummed that I didn't enjoy Philz Coffee but it was probably my own fault because I ordered a bold roast and ended up tossing it the garbage outside because for me, it was undrinkable. I like dark roast, or at least I thought I did, I always drink the dark roast at coffee places but holy, this was, way too much for me. My boyfriend had one of the medium roasts and that too wasn't great for me. This place is super cool though and definitely has a bunch of people working here who are super passionate about what they do. The girl helping us was knowledgable but she did recommend the brew I got as one of the most favorited cups so I was disappointed. She was also unable to tell me whether or not the coffee was made straight from the beans or if there were added sugar in there. The calories on the board indicate the coffees can be 200 calories and change so when I asked about that she didn't have an answer. Luckily a gentleman working behind the register was able to tell me that the coffee is straight from the bean and the calorie counts are from the cream and sugar people can add to it. Again, super cool spot. My boyfriend liked his cup and he also got an almond croissant that was bomb. The coffee definitely isn't cheap but this place does coffee right, even though I didn't like it, I can understand why people do. They indicate what flavors you're going to get from each brew, which is awesome. I'd definitely try this spot again if I come to town however going with a lighter roast would probably be best, for me!
author: Samantha S.

description: Stopped here on the way to the Bart. I got an everything bagel with cream cheese. It was good and very doughy, I couldn't finish it. My roommate got the jacobs wonderbar drip coffee and said it was great. Sadly they were out of hot chocolate.
author: Anoosha A.

description:
So I love Philz... What else is there to say? I'm addicted and have tried every blend + been to multiple locations (hey, when are you starting that loyalty program, Philz??). This location is probably my favorite Philz.

When you step in, you just take it all in: the mural, the hanging pictures, the slightly worn out furniture. It's cozy and warm and lived-in; it doesn't feel generic. There are cute little touches sprinkled throughout the store, and the place is just brimming with personality. Friendly employees too.

I came with a friend, and we sat on the couch, and boy, those couches are hella comfortable... maybe too comfortable. They're soft without much integrity, so you start sinking in and want to fall asleep. But I guess that's what the coffee is for! 

I got an Iced Silken Splendor straight up (my go-to at Philz) & it was perfect. The coffee is great without cream/sugar. Food is overpriced, but the avocado toast and yogurt with fig/honey. 

Of course, I love everything else on the menu. If you've never been, I recommend:
- Silken Splendor (yum)
- Philtered Soul (great nutty taste)
From their specialties:
- Mint Mojito (everyone should try it their first time here!)
- Gingersnap (love the spices)
author: Anthony T.

description:
After 7 years of drinking Philz, I finally got to sip at the heart of it all. Right here on 24th & Mission! Coming to this place brings this timeless classic atmosphere with that neighborhood gem feel. There's lots of regulars who come in and study, read, etc. It's a place where people come to just enjoy a great cup of coffee. If you're a true Phil'z fan then you have to make it here.

There are so many vintage pics from when this store first started. I love how there's photos of Phil and his family along with friends and others. I describe this location like an enchanted forest coffee house because theres lots of plants inside with dim lighting. 

Every location has it's unique style but this one here is a must go-to. Even their sign in front of the store is classic style!
author: Allister D.

description: My favourite coffee place in San Francisco! The best iced mint mojito;it's really addicting!! This place is only 6mins walk from my fiancé's house so it's really convenient.. I love the place and the barista's are always nice!
author: Jo A.

description:
So my friend said I had to check this spot out because I'm a person who loves coffee shops. From what I've been told this is one of the more famous coffee shops in the area. 

Upon entering I was a little surprised by the interior, for some reason It gave me a Venice beach kind of vibe. Kinda hipsterish but not quite. Anyhow, it was rather busy but the line moved quickly. 

I ordered their mint mojito and it was pretty good. While I thoroughly enjoyed it, I don't think I'll get it again because it was pretty sweet and I do my best avoid sugar. However, if you're cool with sugar then you should definitely try it out. 

Unfortunately, there wasn't any seating so my friend and I left. 

Overall, this place lives up to its reputation.
author: Juan Carlos H.

description:
First timer at the very first location of Philz Coffee. This location definitely has a lot of character. Parking is a little tough so you may need to find parking a bit farther and walk. However, not surprising since you're in SF! Hehe. Anyways, we found a spot fairly quickly and upon our arrival, there were quite a few people sitting around but there was no line to order. With that said, a friendly barista took our orders immediately. Both my friend and I got a mint mojito (our fave) and it was delicious. Just as I expected. Our cashier was vey friendly and personable as well. 

Overall, it was a great experience at the their very first location. This store has a lot of character, very friendly employees, and delicious drinks. You'll definitely want to stop by this location. It's totally worth it!

If you haven't tried their minto mojito, I highly recommend that you do soon because you're missing out and it is soo good. Thanks, Philz coffee. I'll be back soon
author: Misty T.

description: The mint mojito is one of their best sellers and for good reason! I'm usually not a fan of coffee but this was really good! The mint was a very nice touch and it looks pretty
author: Steven Z.

description: I didn't know this was the original location until just now, after having come here many times before. I also don't know much about Philz as a concept or a cultural institution, if you will. So all I can say is the coffee is strong and satisfying - it's got substance to it, y'know? - and surprisingly filling (takes me a while to finish the whole cup), and I like their variety and their informative menu, which helps non-connoisseurs like me choose. I also like their scones and croissants, of which I find the bacon variety addicting. And bonus points for all those couches.
author: Alan X.

description: One of the more earthy, less techy Philz in the area. Went at 3 pm and there was no line. Good service, nice wall paintings. Worth a peak.
author: Olivia G.

description:
I love this location! Great staff and really good for people watching. I met my friend here (who introduced me to Philz) and we were able to sit outside and catch up. There is a lot to do around this area so it's perfect to stop and grab a cup of coffee in the middle of sightseeing, urban exploring, etc...

Inside it's a little tight with chairs, tables, sofas all over the place but most people expect that when you are in the middle of the city. I personally love the charm of it and it's one of my favorite spots. 

Consistent with other Philz coffee spots the coffee is good, the service is friendly and the locals will chat you up in line if you're open to it. 

Also, the bathroom was really clean and nice, which considering the traffic and time of the day was impressive.
author: Adri L.

description:
This Philz coffee is probably the best coffee shop I have been to (in the US).  I say this not particularly because they have the best coffee but the few times I have been here, the staff members were extremely nice and helpful.  Its very ironic because this is probably the worst looking Philz Coffee location I have ever been to! (Please see my pic of the front of the store).  But as they say, don't judge a book by its cover.

The four times that I have been here, each and every time, the barista was able to answer any and all questions I had regarding pretty much every single type of coffee that they serve. Not only that, they reassured me that if I did not like my drink, they would make me a new one for free!  (I liked all of my drinks.)

The customer service I got here was by far better than any other coffee shops or even any other Philz Coffee that I have been to!  I guess it's not surprising why this place has thousands of reviews with 4.5 stars.

Next time I'm in town, I will definitely be back!
author: Jang N.

description:
It's like a coffee lover's paradise. The options are vast and very interesting to choose from. I actually had two coffee's from here at one go! 
If you're in the bay area it's worth the shot
author: Sujoyee C.

description: Like everyone else recommends, the mint mojito with almond milk is a must. It's actually worth the hype. Doesn't taste artificial like most mint coffees and is super refreshing. 10/10 would order again.
author: Kimberlee G.

description:
For some, coffee is a religious experience. I would include myself in that category, and I would gladly give reverence to Philz Coffee any day.

Stopped by on a day of exploration in the area. Post 6 hour flight from the east cost and a burrito from down the street, coffee was needed. Based on the overwhelmingly positive reviews we decided we had to try this spot.

It's pretty hipster inside and unless you're a regular you don't really know where to stand in line how to order. But, once you figure that out its pretty smooth sailing.

The team here makes each coffee to order - from grinding the beans to topping them off "Philz Way" which is medium sweet with cream. They have got your caffeine fix covered in a serious way. You order with your barista, pay and then return back to your friendly caffeine crafting best friend.

I ordered the Dancing Water, Philz way. Woah. Mind blown, church organs playing rejoicing music, and my praises for Philz coffee began. So much so that my coworker who took a sip ended up splitting the cup with me.

PS - if you want an extra cup, they charge 25 cents. Worth it if you don't want the entire large cup.

All the feels for Philz.
author: Diandra L.

description:
Allow me to begin this review by stating that I'm pretty new to coffee drinking. I'm ultra sensitive to caffeine and usually cant drink coffee unless it's super sweet and tastes nothing like coffee. I usually prefer teas, but after a friend recommended this spot, I decided to throw caution to the wind and try something new. 

The process of ordering was confusing and overwhelming. I stood staring lamely at the counter for 3-5 minutes before someone finally offered assistance. While I WAS standing under the "order" arrow, she sounded slightly aggravated by my presence. For all I know, it was tottaaalllyyyy not in her job description to help me, and i never quite figured out where the hell the line was supposed to start. Oops! 

Theres a fun variety of coffees, and the menu is pretty self-explanatory (thank goodness). Iced coffee is a dollar more than hot ones which i dont quite understand, but I sprung for one anyway. I got the Gingersnap with vanilla soy and it was sweet enough for me without asking for additional sweetener. For some reason tops for the cups are available only upon request which makes things needlessly chaotic. I saw a man topple his coffee over seconds after retrieving it. While cleaning up the mess, I almost spilled my own coffee! Curses! 

Overall, I quite like this spot! Interesting variety, awesome prices, and tasty coffee.
author: Kendall G.

description: I like the idea of mint in my coffee but it's disappointing that they don't offer cappucino/latte. I don't enjoy my coffee black and even though they top off the coffee with some milk of your choice, it doesn't come close to the taste of a steamed, well blended creamy drink like a latte. I got the medium roast and it tasted quite bitter to me.
author: Preeti R.

description:
Wowzaaa the first ever OG Philz location!! To think this place started in a corner liquor store, and back then, a cup of Joe was $2.50?!? I had my first cup of Philz a little over 2 years ago, and honestly, I wasn't super impressed...but I gave it another try, and before I knew it, I WAS HOOKED. I'd been meaning to check out this Philz location for a while, and I was so glad when I finally did!!

There's a lot of room (multiple tables, couches, outdoor seating) and quite a few power outlets. There's also a lot of super hip decor throughout the store. I think part of the ceiling was painted with clouds, there was a buncha cool painted artwork on the walls, stickers, signage, all adding to the authenticity of this place

My two go-to drinks are Philtered Soul (sweet and creamy or medium medium) and iced yerba mate with almond milk and honey (medium medium or medium almond milk and light honey). Philtered Soul is a medium blend with aromas of hazelnut flavor and chocolate, and yerba mate is tea with aromas of Earth, grains, and toast. I haven't tried the food at this location, but most of the choices seem the same as at the others. I'm a fan of the ancho chile breakfast burrito and the apricot bar!!  I think there's even a Mission location special where the blend of the month is $4 for a large and $3 for a small instead of the regular $4.50 and $3.50??

Bottom line: If you're a fan of Philz, you've gotta check out this location!! I don't really like coffee...BUT I LOVE PHILZ. No matter what your coffee preference may be, there's sure to be something here that satisfies you. They have sooo many options, and you can get your cup made just the way you like it
author: Kithumini J.

description:
Good for coffee snobs and coffee noobs alike. 

Coffee: quality beans and roast selection made using a pour over technique. For those looking for something sweeter, the mint mojito lates are good (I usually customize the sweetness level to half).

Location: most of the locations I have been to seem busy on the regular with wait times anywhere between 5-40 minutes. There is limited seating, so it is best to grab and go.

Staff: always friendly and ready to provide suggestions or answer questions.
author: Steven U.

description: I had to update and apologize for my last disgruntled review with Philz. I'm realizing now that it's not the bagels and food what makes Philz a great mission staple, it's the coffee. I get coffee at Philz almost every other day and I truly do think it's one of the best cafes in the mission. I have now updated my rating to 4 stars. I also thought it was really genuine that the owner reached out to me and offered me a drink on the house because of my immature tantrum. Keep up Philz, you guys rock.
author: Laurence G.

description:
I had large mint mojitos in Washington DC location (Adams Morgan) and Original location in San Francisco (Mission 24th st).
still not my cup of coffee ..
author: Rudy H.

description:
Awesome atmosphere and great coffee! I do wish they didn't change the ether mix I enjoyed the charcoal flavor and in your face taste! 

Have to add that staff is awesome here and friendly once u show ur face here a few times! Nice to be appreciated and acknowledged in this rat race we survive in! Peace to the Mission St crew! 

Just an update the staff is sooo nice and happy here! Thanks for uplifting my day with a brute smile and excellent cup o'ether, Philz way!
author: Paul D.

description:
Been here a few times and I'm not very impressed.  The only thing I somewhat enjoy here is the mint mojito, and even then I feel like I could get better drinks elsewhere.  The one other drink I tried here was the tesora, which was recommended to me.  I did not enjoy that coffee at all - it was very difficult to drink and I could feel all of the heavy cream that they put in there.  In San Francisco, a city with an abundance of other great coffee shops, I would definitely go elsewhere for my morning fix.  

The service here was actually really great, and everyone was super friendly.  I'm just kind of disappointed at the products they're selling.
author: Tim L.

description: Don't do a good job of keeping up with their mobile app orders. Great coffee but maybe another location is better
author: Sarah D.

description: The original Philz stablished by a Palestinian guy. He is the nicest guy and that's the key to his success! Give it a try!
author: Jay G.

description:
Loved, loved Philz Coffee. Went during a recent visit to San Francisco and ended up going to three different Philz in a five day span. Wish they had one on the East Coast!

- Coffee: So the main reason people rave about Philz, is of course the great quality and variety of their coffees. They had many unique blends and recipes and wish I got to try them all, however just tried two -- the Mint Mojito and Julie's Ultimate. 

Mint Mojito: This was by far the most recommended by friends who lived in SF and my favorite out of many coffees I've tried, ever! It's Sweet, Creamy and includes a freshly picked Mint Leaf (they pick the lead in front of you from a mint plant) ($5.50 for large). It comes Iced and you have the option of making it decaf. I got this on two different visits and love it. 

Julie's Ultimate: This is one of the Darker Coffee Blends and the recipe includes Berry, Toast and Vanilla ($4.50 for a large). This was ok and I tasted subtle hints of the vanilla and berry flavors, but a bit too bitter for my taste to be honest. 

- Food: We didn't get to try the food, but different locations had different varieties and options. The one we went to in the Mission had cookies and baked goods, while the one we went to near Berkeley had a full spread, including an Avocado Toast that looked really good!

- Service: The service by the baristas and the cashiers was great -- they were friendly, helpful and made sure we got our coffees the way we wanted them. 

Overall, Philz was a great experience and I can't way to go back the next time I visit San Francisco area.
author: Amit J.

description: This coffee spot is a true gem. When my fiancé and I walked in during a weekday afternoon, we were instantly welcomed in by one of the members of their staff. He asked about the type of characteristics I liked in a coffee, and was instantly able to suggest one of their brews. I don't remember the name of the brew I ordered, but he made the correct suggestion. I was very pleased with how it tasted and the price in accordance to the high quality. We took our coffees to go, but there is a good amount of space available if you would like to hang out inside.
author: Yvonne I.

description: Philz was on my must-do list during my visit to SF and it did not disappoint. The mint mojito is so tasty and different! I sat outside and did some people-watching before exploring the area and it was a great way to start the day. Thank you Philz!
author: Meghan W.

description: Well priced, lots of variety, plenty of room, friendly staff. That's how I sum up Philz. Best coffee in Mission. They've got a couple of tables outside to lounge at. Big couches inside. They've got a variety of dark medium and mild blends. Cool staff. Cant beat it in Mission
author: Jared J.

description:
Mint mojito for the win! 

Multiple employees working along the line gets things moving a lot more quickly. 

Service is pretty fast, but the layout is a bit of a cluster. I wasn't sure who was in line to order, who was in line to pay, or who was waiting for their drink.
author: Cam C.

description: Was told by a friend I had to try Philz Coffee, especially since we don't have it on the East coast. Each cup of coffee you order is made fresh per cup so that is awesome. My friend had their special of the month, brew black and it was a good cup of coffee. I went with one of their specialty drink the mint mojito sweet and creamy. I'm a fan of coffee and mint, and the taste of it was actually good. However I'm not use to heavy drinks and after 4 sips I was done, it was extra sweet and extra creamy/heavy. Probably because I'm not use to heavier drinks, I had some stomach pain and bloated-ness the rest of the day and didn't eat anything else. So for anyone who has sensitive stomach I would recommend to go with the regular coffee.
author: Ann S.

description:
Officially my favorite hipster chain coffee place--which says a lot since I'm not really a chain kinda person but this is one of the handful of exceptions.

I've been in SF for years now but never tried Philz--every so often someone raves about how great their coffee is. I was finally dragged to one by my manager who was craving Philz and the rest is history. 

At this particular location, i tried the Mint Mojito (see photo!). I took it how the Barista recommended, a little lighter on the sugar and with milk. It was so goooooood. Perfectly refreshing, the fresh and perfectly excessive amounts of mint gave it this beautiful early flavor that was just perfect for a sunny stroll through the mission.

I was definitely a little confused by the location so I went with the flow--got in line, ordered my drink. sat at the bench facing all the coffee brewers, and then took my drink to the counter. 

This location is nice, lots of seating, with some outdoor tables/chairs too and it's pet friendly!
author: Nerissa C.

description: Amazing coffee!! I had the medium blend Philtered Soul. So good! If you love hazelnut this one's for you!
author: Inès L.

description: This is my first time at Philz Coffee, and what a pleasant surprise it was! I ordered a hot Mocha Tesora extra creamy and it was delicious! So many fine flavors on each sip, their coffee blend and cocoa powder is superb. The Barista was super friendly, smiling and even gave me a little bit of the shop and the owner's history. I'm very satisfied and will surely be back for more!
author: Hiram M.

description: The coffee mojito was so original and crave worthy (non-alcoholic!!).  I heard that we have one in DC so I have to check it out. Quirky decor with a hipster flare. Excited to have a slice of San Francisco in DC now!
author: Lauren G.

description: Cozy place and nice staff.. i like the black and green tea here.. good music selection and cool atmosphere
author: Ray K.

description: Philz has very friendly baristas, customized drinks with a homely and eccentric ambience. Very recommended from the usual run-down starbucks or peets.
author: Maria G.

description: I don't drink coffee often but when I do I like to have it custom-made. My server seems charmed by my lack of know-how regarding how to order a coffee, and I appreciated his graciousness and patience in educating me.
author: Camille L.

description: On a trip to SF we found this gem of a coffee shop - laid back atmosphere and good coffee!
author: Maytzavel R.

description:
Wow very unique coffee shop! The hipster vibe is amazing and have this antique feel when you walk in. The staff are friendly and energetic and there is always a line up to get coffee, so the shop is always full.

We got the mint mojito and it is definitely as advertised (by word of mouth of people who recommended it to us) delicious. 

I could taste the mint and the mojito flavour, something that's hard to do when it is a coffee too. Will come back next time I'm in town!
author: Lesley Y.

description: Coming to SF and not a coffee lover, I decided to keep an open mind and try the mint mojito iced coffee. It was very interesting! The barista also made sure it was just right for me (meaning extra sweet!)
author: Chloe C.

description: This is pour over coffee, just to be clear.  The same kind of coffee (effectively) that my grandparents used to make in their Mr. Coffee maker. Adding a few mint leaves, and having it served by a hipster doesn't make it anything more than drop coffee at day's end.  I'm not hung up on espresso-based coffee, we use a French press at home, just have a really hard time getting excited over what turned out to be pretty ordinary drip coffee at 3x the price of a diner....
author: J G.

description: The original Philz coffee in the heart of the mission. From the outside it doesn't look like much and really from the inside either. But thats not why you come here. Its about the coffee. Simple ordering process with a wide range of blends to choose from. The coffee is always consistent in flavor and quality. The variety of blends lets you sample across a wide range of flavors. I like the dancing water Philz way (creamy and just a little sweet). The staff here are very friendly and chill. Its worth a visit if you're having a coffee craving
author: Peter P.

description:
Convenient location in the Mission area, with lots of seating inside and a few small tables outside as well. This location gets a lot of foot traffic, so lines are line and seating is usually filled up. Works the same way Philz works in any other location - order with a barista first, then pay, then head back to your barista to wait for your drink.

In case you didn't know, you can add soy milk to your coffee (either vanilla or regular) as an alternative to dairy. It's not advertised and I only found out via word-of-mouth, so feel free to ask them for any kind of customization you might want and see if they are able to prepare it. The baristas were all very nice and my coffee was delicious. 

This location actually doesn't look like a Philz from the outside -- their logo wasn't there, but once you walk by and smell the coffee aroma, you know you're in the right place :)
author: Jennifer W.

description: Cool place to chill and have cool variety beans!! If you like drip style coffee, you'd LOVE it here. I'm more like an espresso person so I can't really get that excited about this but I liked what I've tasted. This location is always packed tho, so if you want more quite place to work, maybe here won't be your first choice.
author: Ploi S.

description:
The bad thing about Yelp (and food recommendations in general) is the fact that EVERYBODY has different taste buds. What's too sweet for you may be just sweet enough for your friend, and what's too bland for your friend may be just enough flavor for you. How can everyone agree on a good coffee shop, then?

Well, for starters, the baristas at Philz will ASK you to try your coffee and see how much you like it before you take it. Like, they'll leave the cover off and actually wait for you to take a couple of sips to see if they should make any adjustments to suit YOUR taste buds before sending you off on your morning. How sick is that?!

I tried the Tesora, with medium cream and no sugar which is how I usually like my coffee. Oh my god dude. Please believe me when I say this is the BEST coffee I've had in recent memory, and maybe ever. And when I took the first sample sip and my barista asked how it was, I wanted to jump on the counter and yell in his face "OMG DUDE THIS IS F'ING AMAZING! THANKS FOR ASKING, NOBODY HAS EVER DONE THAT BEFORE!". But alas, I was still a little groggy (7AM) and could only mutter "oh yeah, it's pretty good." Man. Top 5 regrets in my life.

The Tesora is just like the menu describes - deliciously nutty and buttery. It was actually so rich that I would probably get lighter cream next time so I could enjoy the coffee flavor more. And I'm the type of person that usually gets a LOT of cream because I'm too much of a little bitch to drink it black. But hell, I would try the Tesora and every other brew here black, just to taste raw coffee excellence. I'm gonna be pretty sad when I have to go back to Texas and drink Starbucks again.
author: Zhida Z.

description:
I seriously can tell that the food are wonderful and the customer service is superb.

My good friend bought mint mojito and I purchased iced coffee which I find perfect. I had a little sip of what he tried and think it is ordinary.

My time here was delightful. I will probably return here.
author: Brenda L.

description:
I recall coming here when it was a liquor store. Great to see a local spot turn into such a success and grow with the gentrifying as opposed to being squashed by it! 

Overall the people here are great! Occasionally(once) some  punk hipster type may come through but that's to be expected at this sort of place...
author: H K.

description: Been a while, needed a nice cup of java to begin my day , really enjoyed my Mocha an i finally found a chair in order to enjoy
author: Robert G.

description:
A bit too hipster for my taste. The ordering process isn't my favorite as they make you stand there like an idiot until they look up and acknowledge you - sometimes when you're at the front of the line this can take up to 3-4 minutes. 

During this time, I feel like I'm being judged by a 22 year old grunge kid with tattoos that has anti-trump and save the whales stickers on his 2003 used prius, who is from rural Virginia, and who left home at 19 because he wanted to be an artist. But instead, he's working at Philz judging the shit out of your lululemon $128 pants.

Coffee is good, but overpriced and an awkward experience.
author: Thad J.

description:
THE OG PHILZ!!! Wow who would've known I would end up here! I remember the first time I went to Philz. I was amazed by how jam packed it was and thoroughly impressed by the coffee. Nearly 3 years later and here I am going to the original Philz regularly.

I like this Philz a lot. It's quite spacious and has a total cafe vibe to it. Plenty of couches, chairs, benches, etc. Lots of cool art work, stickers, posters, etc all over the walls. This place has got character and I LUV IT. My go to is usually the philtered soul or the aromatic arabic. The philtered soul is a bit sweeter (those chocolately hazelnut notes ya know) whereas the arabic I go for if I'm feeling INTENSE. Dark roast, earthy flavor. I drink my coffee black so I really taste the differences between the coffees, and honestly you can't go wrong with either. They also have decent breakfast burritos here. It is more expensive for a cup of coffee here than other cafes right down the street BUT the quality!! IT's the quality of the coffee that gets me every time. Haven't had a bad cup yet. Knock on wood. Need coffee right now actually. May be stopping by again later. LOL. PHILZ = LOVE
author: Amy T.

description:
Two years after I've had my last cup of Philz coffee. I don't care that I have to wait in the line for 30 minutes and pay more than double any other place. 

STILL. THE . BEST. COFFEE. EVER. 

And I live in the Seattle are now. Coffee runs through our blood.
author: Nora S.

description:
I got the iced mint mojito because of the rave reviews I read on Yelp. I thought it tasted ok but I couldn't taste any coffee in it. I liked the sprig of fresh mint they added on top but I didn't realize there would be so much mint in the actual drink. I kept getting little bits of mint leaves in my mouth as I drank and I didn't like chewing them. The cup was also packed with tons of ice, taking up the majority of the space. I felt like the drink was pretty heavy because it seemed like cream was the base and not coffee. I would recommend substituting the cream for something a little lighter like almond milk. 

The place had a nice hipstery ambience and the baristas were friendly.
author: Rachel K.

description:
Honest to God, this is the only coffee chain I feel completely comfortable spending $5 on a cup of coffee because Philz's coffee is actually good-- it's great. 
I ordered the mint mojito iced coffee with soy milk. I'm glad to say I thoroughly enjoyed the drink. Just like they describe it, it's minty, sweet and creamy. I would add it's very light and refreshing. 
The 24th Mission St location offers a ton of seating: sofas, and tables of all sizes paired with chairs. Excellent place to set up shop and get some work done or even just to enjoy a book. 
This place gets unbelievably busy so if you're looking for a quiet spot to work, this may not be the spot for you. 
One more thing to note: the service here is wonderful. All of the baristas are friendly and personable. The welcoming vibe they offer is the icing on the cake. Philz, you're doing it right.
author: Nicole A.

description:
DATE OF VISIT: ~April 2015.

Along with Peet's Coffee, Philz is a Bay Area institution. If you're thinking about doing a culinary tour of SF, one of your stops should be this particular branch of Philz Coffee as this is considered to be the very first location. Both Peets and Philz represent the forefront of the second and third wave coffee, respectively. 

1st wave: Focus is on mass-production, though the quality was inferior compared to today's coffee. Think Folger's.
2nd wave: Focus is improving the coffee-drinking experience through higher-quality blends, speciality espresso drinks and the introduction of the modern coffee house. Peet's was the inspiration for Starbucks, which is the quintessential example of a 2nd gen brand.
3rd wave: Focus is on coffee itself as an artisanal product with care taken in each step of production. Philz, along with Blue Bottle is considered to be the forerunners of third wave coffee in the Bay Area.

As the original Philz location it feels quite different from the other Philz scattered across the other parts of the Bay. It has a more home-grown vibe to it whereas the other Philz shops seem to come across as more "manufactured". Of note is the sign that advertises itself as a Philz location - you don't see that familiar Philz sign on the outside. Compared to a lot of other shops where I can get a book or a laptop and get work done provided there's free wifi this place feels more lounge-y. The couches and chairs are more conducive to relaxing and I could see myself attending an open-mic performance here. Compared to the other coffee shop nearby this certainly blends in with the other Mission businesses.

I only came across this place because it was the closest coffee shop next to the house the No1DP and I were staying through Airbnb. I only found out after the fact that this was the original Philz Coffee. Aside from that the significance behind this particular branch was I got through the last few days studying for my big board exam by drinking Philz. 

1. First drink was a Philtered Soul, black. I was (and still am) fairly new to drinking coffee black and Philz along with Peet's are the only brands that I can drink. This is a lighter roast with hints of chocolate. Its inherent sweetness is the reason I can take it black. 
2. The No1DP surprised me on the day of my big exam with a cup of Tantalizing Turkish, a croissant and a t-shirt. As mentioned in my Oakland/College Philz review I fell in love with this drink at first sip because of the cardamom and mint sprig. The croissant was buttery and flaky, a sign of a croissant done right. The shirt was a memento and I treasured it until I tore it due to crashing my ATV. DIdn't get another shirt until more than 6 months later.

Goes without saying that this particular visit to Philz is one of my fondest memories of the Bay Area. Every time I think of Philz it makes me realize how much I miss it up there.
author: Isabella B.

description: You know it's a hippy neighborhood when you can find one of the best coffee in SF. Ordered a Jacobs wonderland - a dark roast with hints of dark chocolate, smokiness and nuts! I definitely needed a large after staying awake since 5am
author: Jin C.

description: So this is by far my favorite Philz coffee the original to be exact I don't know if that has anything to do with it but I'm a little picky about my coffee and Diana makes me the best cup of coffee like ever ever in life she's the best with the foam I love that she's so consistent like I never have to check it is always perfect never has she made me a bad cuppa coffee and I'm pretty picky she is the best she always gets my five stars she always gets it right she never fails me I just love her she's the best so if you ever and Phils on 24th make sure you ask for Diana
author: Jas C.

description:
Huge lines, no air conditioning, and far too little seating. Loud pop music so that will be really hard to have meetings here. Millennial focused--that's the business model. DOES NOT REPLACE PEETS

Great coffee, though.
author: Joseph V.

description:
I come here for "fancy coffee" (more time-consuming and pricey than a quick double shot of espresso). I live a few blocks away and what stated as a once-a-week treat turned into an almost daily routine. Staff, like at all the Philz I've been to, are friendly and sweet. I'm consistently amazed at the patience and warmth they have after dealing with hundreds of people - I'm certainly exhausted after that level of non-stop "what can I get for you". Phil hangs out at this location quite a bit, and is always happy to chat with the locals. 

On a hot day, the Mint Mojito is a can't-miss, but my usual is a New Manhattan or Philharmonic.
author: Tessa M.

description: I love Philz haha and this is the original Philz, so it's a must-see. Not too much seating, and the pay/order line configuration can be confusing, but it has a comfortable, ambient vibe that's probably better for a chat than for studying. My go to drink is Chai or a Mint Mojito!
author: Breanna D.

description: Open on Christmas Eve and Christmas Day? A Christmas miracle! The staff here is always so wonderful - feels like family! I love you Philz family in the Mission!!! You're the greatest of all Philz locations in my opinion :)
author: Rachael S.

description:
Philz, you're magic in a cup
I drink, and I just wanna yell "What's UP!"
I drink happiness and that's no lie
You know what I want to drink before I die
Get me a mint mojito, med cream, med + sweet, and that ain't no lie

I think this place is the original @philzcoffee and you gotta love it.  The baristas are all stars, and they make it fast and good.  The inside is a throwback with style and history.  AND, you sometimes get to say hi to Phil himself!  Me and my friends have seen him multiple times and he knows us as the "alameda boys" because we keep begging him to open up a Philz in Alameda!!!
author: Dennis K.

description:
I recently moved to San Francisco and it just so happens that I live 50 steps away from this Philz Coffee. SO DANGEROUS!

I really love how friendly and welcoming the staff is here. They really go out of their way to ensure your drink tastes perfect, which is one of the main reasons why I keep coming back! My go-to drinks are the Ecstatic Coffee or Mocha Testora. Both drinks taste fantastic especially with Almond Milk or Vanilla Soy Milk!

It's going to be a challenge for me to not come here every day. Wish me luck!
author: MyTien P.

description: really helpful staff, great vibes, and lovely coffee. had their special of the month...philharmonic...with mint on top and it was so delightful. I never have had a black coffee with a sprig of mint on top and it made a positive difference. happy to see this chain growing and staying true to what they do best.
author: Mal C.

description: The original and definitely still the best. If you like good coffee, do not miss this superb institution.
author: Michael A.

description: To be honest this was high on the expectation and did not deliver it for me. Its unique in a way that each coffee cup that you order is made for you. Just like in a bar, each cocktail that you order is specially crafted for you. It takes a lot of effort to do it and I totally appreciate the effort and the enthusiasm of the baristas. Well, sort of baristas. They have a set of roasts and flavor infused coffee on the board, you walk up to the bar and order your coffee. They freshly grind the coffee beans and pour the coffee in front of you. Its guaranteed to be the freshest coffee that you will ever taste. For me what did not pique my interest was the tasty of coffee itself. I had the one with cardamom and mint. Though this might have been a new concept in the US, I have had similar coffee in India in rural villages (I know right!) which have been much more flavorful. Also, $3.5 is a little steep IMO. One other reason why I was not impressed was because there are tons of other restaurants and cafes in the area which serve VERY hearty and bold Nicaraguan/Cuban coffee. Which is unlike anything that you find elsewhere.
author: Kartik P.

description: Friendly staff, great culture and vibe. Friendly people and it's a mix of people on their laptops and headphones in, to small groups of friends gathering to chat. Great natural light, although it can get cold in there... bring a sweater!
author: Avani G.

description:
Buzz buzz buzz!

In a zombie-like state, I made my way to Philz. I felt out of place at the cafe, as everyone was buzzing with energy and I was nearly asleep after having been awake for more than 16 hours overnight for work. A dear friend was briefly in town, and to miss her would not have been an option. We chose Philz as our meeting place.

This particular Philz was a fairly large space but the seating area felt cramped with couches and tables of various sizes almost haphazardly placed. It was a grungy atmosphere that seemed very appropriate for the Mission. Patrons sat with their laptops, typing away. Couples snuggled on couches. The fact that people were in close proximity of each other lended a sense of warmth to the space.

My barista was very knowledgable and helpful and he recommended I try "Red Haze" (off menu), a smooth and bright cup of coffee with strong accents of hazelnut. It tasted rich with the addition of soy milk and no actual cream, giving an added depth and detail to the coffee. I didn't think much about caffeinating as I could easily fall asleep after a cup of coffee, but oh was I wired after my cuppa. After the reunion with my friend, I stayed awake for a good additional 8 hours before exhaustion had finally hit. I definitely would keep Philz coffee away from children!
author: Cici T.

description: Lots of variety on the drip coffee menu. The people who work there are always so friendly and really focused on getting the coffee right.
author: Elijah W.

description:
Absolutely fantastic service and amazing coffee! 

I was in town visiting and had to stop by before I left to the airport and I am so happy I did! The employees here are passionate about what they do. I walked in and was immediately greeted with a smiling face at 6:30 am. She was so friendly and kindly explained the top choices of coffee from there wide variety of coffee selection as well as her favorites. We ordered 4 different coffees, two medium and two dark roast. Each one of them had a very unique and distinct flavor and everyone of them were delicious! It seems hard to go wrong when choosing a coffee here. 

They also have a great selection of pastries! I went with my go to, the chocolate croissant, which they can toast for you and it was delicious and a great snack with your coffee.

While sitting down enjoying my coffee, I began to look around and take notice of the beautiful murals painted all throughout the cafe. Along the ceiling is a depiction of the sky and the columns of the cafe are painted as trees. It definitely made me not want to be on my phone but really notice the small detials in my suroundings and the taste of the delicious coffee. 

Overall, this place offers a great twist on American coffee during a time where lattes are taking over. Its nice to be able to have some deliciously hand brewed coffee with bold flavor served by passionate baristas.
author: Navene S.

description: Great selection on the drip coffee menu. Very very nice cup of handmade coffee. It's a bit on the pricey side but is totally worth it. Friendly staff.
author: Aria G.

description: Great location. Place was buzzing with great energy and productivity of SFers remotely working. Funky vibe and decor very reflective of the mission
author: Lesley T.

description:
A Bay Area staple! This is the perfect place to come if you want to treat yourself to some really good coffee. I really like the Ambrosia blend - a smooth, nutty, medium roast.

This visit I decided to go sweet and tried out their gingersnap iced coffee. So worth it! I asked for half the amount of cream to help offset how much heavier it would be and it was perfect.

Even when it's packed the staff is always really courteous. But pay attention, as it's easy to miss it when they call out your drink.
author: Neda S.

description: Gotta love Philz, it sure captures the essence of San Francisco, with the hippie baristas, to the eccentric coffees offered. It is always a pleasure to have a cup of coffee at Philz, whether it's in Fidi, the mission, or even mountain view.
author: Ross S.

description: Located in the wonderful, gentrified Mission district, this Philz is in a prime location. We got the Mocha Tesora with full sweetness and Mint Mojito. The Tesora was awesome, great chocolatey taste. I've had the mint mojito before at other locations are its usually pretty good, this time was a little watery, more milk taste than coffee, but its still good; really creamy.
author: Larissa L.

description: This coffee shop reminded me of visiting Seattle and Portland area. There was a long line before reaching my barista. They special brew each cup individually and the taste is just brilliant. I loved watching the baristas make each and every customer's coffee from removing and placing new coffee grounds on this coffee maker. They pour hot water over it and produce a fresh cup of coffee each time. I walked in about 10 am and there were quite a line and a few folks enjoying the lounge area. Some folks with their laptops, books and some enjoying their coffee and conversations with friends and strangers.
author: Hailey V.

description: Definitely worth trying. Distinct coffee, has its own feel compared to the major chains. I had the philtered soul, which I thought was great. Included a hint of hazelnut and cocoa.
author: Andy V.

description: Awesome location friendly staff always! Daniel, one of the baristas always make it perfect! Thanks!
author: Hilda H.

description:
Hands down my favorite coffee! 

I try to avoid coffee when I can, but I cannot resist Philz coffee. My two favorite drinks are the Mocha Tesora and the Iced Mint Mojito. That's pretty much all you need to know. Soy and almond milk substitutes are also complimentary. A big plus for the lactose intolerant folks like myself! 

They also offer a bunch of pastry/food items.

Philz, I love you. Thank you for getting me through the workday! For coffee lovers, the original cafe is a must visit.
author: Joanna S.

description:
Philz rocks, great service Great ambiente, awesome Java!! Clean and very pleasant!  I have visited only two so far, PASADENA which kicks butt!! And Encinitas which is very big and nice.. plan to hit up SF soon!!
Keep up the good work Philz!
author: Roger E.

description: Best coffee in San Francisco!! Had to visit every time I come out here... wish they had one in My area
author: Monica J.

description:
All I can say is Philz has one of my favorite coffee stores. I live on the East Coast and every time I'm on the west coast I always make a stop to Philz. The mocha tesora is my favorite. I drink it iced with almond milk. They use Califia Farms almond milk (barista version) which is the best! It is super creamy, chocolatey and satisfying. I suggest getting it half sweet!

The service was great here (as usual). The barista was friendly and crafted my drink exactly the way I wanted. 

This store in particular looks different from the others. In LA the stores are more modern and "clean" looking. This has that "hippie" vibe that matches the Mission area. Looks like a great place to relax for a morning/ afternoon coffee. They have a small selection of pastries/ sandwiches as well. 

Philz is always a great experience. Best brewed coffee store!
author: Natalie K.

description:
I've never experienced decent coffee before on my previous trips to the States. And this may be because as a tourist, often I'm confined to a very restricted tourist realm. This time however, armed with a rental car and some insider tips, I decided to check this place out. And I am so happy to be able to say 'wow, I'm impressed!' 

They had almond milk - 
A huge range of different blends -  
Knowledgeable and friendly service -  
A chilled space - 
Free WiFi - 

I tried the tesora blend myself which is a medium blend. The flavour was delicately nutty, accentuated by the almond milk - with a touch of caramel and butter. Delicious and well made by the barista. 

If you can make your way to a Philz, you won't be disappointed. Service, variety and good coffee is where it's at.
author: Rachel A.

description:
The original Philz coffee.
1.) It's always crowded
2.) Seating is usually limited.
3.) Baristas are usually very nice and accommodating.
4.) Be daring and try something other than the ice mint mojito 

Enjoy and grab a cup to go as you explore the neighborhood!
author: Diane T.

description:
Terrible experience at this place. I came in to grab a coffee and a breakfast sandwich. The staff chuckled like i was some naive child and informed me it doesnt work that way, i had to not order at the register, but must go to a special waiting area at the back of the shop before i could be graced with a barista to hand craft my beverage. Only then may i order my food and pay.

Fast forward they give me coffee and refuse to let me put in cream and sugar. They demand on doing it like Dunkin Donuts. I ask if i can please do it since i know what i like and they do not. They refuse, pour cream in my drink and serve it to me. I am obviously upset and they begrudgingly take the coffee back, pour it down the drain and make a new one. Finally they pass me the cream so i can add it to my own drink like an adult. 

Meanwhile, they never made a ticket for my breakfast sandwich so i am left waiting another 10 minutes for that.

Never returning to this place.
author: Alek C.

description:
Such a cool place. I love the interior decoration of the original Philz Coffee - has a bohemian flair to it, from the homey furniture to the painted walls/ceilings. Great place to sit back and chill with friends or by yourself. Can't go wrong with the mint mojito iced coffee - that's what I get every time. I don't know what they put in there but it is SO addicting. Not too sweet, not too minty. Just right. 

Also, got the chance to meet Phil my first time there. Such a neat and polite fellow who is THE coffee connoisseur.
author: Katherine Z.

description:
All reviews on here about Philz being great and that you have to try the mint mojito are SO RIGHT. The mint mojito is so unique and refreshing that if you like coffee want to visit a cool place in SF and try something new then Philz is your place! 

The environment is great spent a few hours working on stuff while my husband studied. Lots of room to sit and enjoy your awesome coffee! Highly recommend visiting this place :)
author: Christina M.

description:
At Philz right now, since I needed to type this up. Tommy/i just gave me a private tasting of light roast blends--so special, and awesome of them! 

I was looking for beans for a friend of mine who loves light roast coffee. Since I don't know a thing about it besides what tastes good to me, I asked if I might be able to try a little before I buy.

"Anything can happen here," they said with a smile. Which I loved. 

They then described their favorites, and I got to try them--first black, and then with cream. How amazing is that? I decided on buying beans for three of them. Favs:

Ambrosia Coffee of God
Canopy of Heaven
New Manhattan (with a touch of cinnamon) 

5 stars for the baristas.
author: Maria A.

description:
"Tell A friend"

Definitely the way I found out about Philz coffee! 
I absolutely love the coffee, the main location is my favorite 24th and Mission in SF.

The staff is wonderful and they always make me feel welcomed, they remember who I am and remember my favorite drink of choice Large Ambrosia Medium Medium with a scoop of CoCo! 
DELICIOUS! 

I highly recommend you come check this place out, you won't regret it if you are a coffee lover.  
They Have great food and plenty of space if you want to hand out and enjoy your coffee with friends or while doing work on your computer with FREE WIFi
The ambiance is also pretty cool. 

PS you also have to try the mint Mojito! It's legit! 

"TELL A FRIEND"
author: Luis A.

description: You won't find the regular latte, cappuccino, or espresso drinks here but will find a great variety of assorted beans, each with its own distinct characteristic.
author: Kolby R.

description:
Nomz! 

Same as all of the other Philz. Try the ecstatic iced coffee! Or the mint mojito iced coffee. For quality coffee in the Bay Area, you really can't go wrong.
author: Courtney C.

description: Finally made it to the Mothership of Philz Coffee. I live in So City, so since the Westborough location opened there has been no reason to go elsewhere. Of course my coffee was on point. Although it was a Friday and the line was short, the line still moved quickly. Loved the lore of this place and the story behind how Philz came about. My wifes Uncle actually grew up around the corner and knew the place as a grocery store that sold coffee. Although the Mission is also feeling the effects of gentrification, nice to see Philz still kicking to serve all the hipsters whove moved in hahahahaha
author: Coach C.

description: Just a great cup of coffee. Philz is an establishment in SF and it deserves to be. A great selection of different coffee types, each unique. Coffee here is made well and the baristas know what they are doing. I got the Mocha Testora and it was delicious. Smooth from start to finish. Very high quality coffee. Too bad I can only get it in SF...
author: Vincent T.

description: The worst, most over priced coffee in San Francisco. The coffee was bitter because it wasn't made with filtered water. The dairy options didn't include half and half! Wtf! I'd rather make cowboy coffee at home with a used sock. Furthermore, I dislike drinking coffee from paper cups because it isn't green and definitely not suatainable. BTW, all coffee is made by hand, unless you go to a  place where the coffee makers use their feet. Smdh.
author: Gemma S.

description: Way back before Phil retired and expanded throughout the Bay, I lived a block away from the OG spot on 24th.  Until I finally settled on my regular Philharmonic, Phil curated my coffee experience of his menu.  Phil may be retired, I may now live across the country, but Philz is still the best cup of coffee I've had in my many many years love affair with all things coffee related.
author: Lolan S.

description:
How can you possibly have a bad experience at Philz Coffee?!?

Philz is part of the community and I must say that I'm pretty happy that they finally opened one up in Socal. 

When you come to Philz all you need to know is these two words:

---MINT MOJITO---

It's basically the most popular drink that they offer and I can't imagine anyone not ordering it. I've also tried some of their other coffee selections which are pretty damn good, but the mint mojito is just so refreshing that you start to crave it... It's basically an addiction after a while. 

If you are in the area and need a boost of caffeine then I would highly suggest stopping by here for a nice cup of hot or iced coffee. The staff is always friendly and helpful if you aren't sure what to order.
author: Ryan W.

description:
Coffee always taste good. No matter what you choose. Period.
Friendly stuff that cheers you up and trying their best to make every single cup unique. I usually get large Turkish with a little bit of cream and mint  and I never regret it.
author: Ilmia N.

description:
As a late-to-the-game Philz lover from LA, I just had to stop by the original location in SF. This location is ringed with comfy leather couches, has a good amount of work space and everyone is friendly. 

I ordered a decaf mint mojito made with the Sumatra roast... Perfect way to wrap up my workday. I heard the medium roast Tesora is great and promise to get that next time... If I can break this mint mojito addiction?!?!
author: Jill L.

description: Ok ok ok... so what more is there to say besides that I love their coffee. Yes it is more expensive than your normal cup but they really are on to something here! I don't yelp often but people just need to know !
author: Jennifer S.

description: Jerry plugged me with a house coffee, little cream, and sweet.  Very nice taste, usually I order something custom but was impressed with what I received.  Music captured the San Fran vibe nicely, was a smooth urban hip hop mix, kept the vibe upbeat and peaceful.  Crowd was an energetic eclectic mix and the interior colorful.  Not much chill space outside, I think there is a table and chairs on the sidewalk.  City style all the way, folks on the go and the service is pleasant while brisk.
author: Troy T.

description:
I have fond memories of frequenting this O.G. Philz shop before he expanded it all over SF and now making his way around the Bay Area and beyond.  I haven't looked at coffee the same since. 

Seven years ago, I didn't care about the mismatched ugly couches, the ugly centered kitchen table, or the strange meat locker fridge in the back.  The coffee was and still is damn good.  Pure perfection. 

Phil used to make his rounds here in his fedora hat while I savored my Silken Splendor coffee.  #nostalgia
author: Bailey N.

description:
I was happy to try Philz for the first time at their first original location in the mission district. I personally never heard of Philz until recently. A lot of my LA friends have been raving about it because of the Santa Monica location. First off, this neighborhood has so much character and it was cool to see all the locals going about their day and enjoying some great coffee. 

I'm an iced coffee drinker, and since it was my first time I had to try the mint mojito. It was amazing as everybody says it is! So smooth, creamy, and the mint is refreshing. By far one of the best drinks I've had. Now all I have to do is pray for a San Diego location. My girlfriend got the hot chocolate, and that was almost better than my iced coffee. It was also one of the best hot chocolates I've ever had. We enjoyed our drinks, and a pastry and soaked in all the culture and character. Then I needed to do some last minute xmas shopping, so I bought 5 pounds of one of the popular medium roast coffees to gift back in SD. The service of the baristas was top notch, and I'd recommend this place to anybody.
author: Brandon F.

description: My favorite place to grab a cup.The baristas are always so friendly and willing to advise on flavors!! I'm brand new to the city and so glad to have found y'all!
author: Allison B.

description: The Baristas here are friendly, super cool and go out of there way to make your coffee just the way you like it. In my opinion, Philz Coffee serves up the Best coffee in town and in the East Bay ... I really like the location on Van Ness & Turk. The people are great here ... it reminds me of "Cheers" for Coffee. The coffee is amazing ... absolutely blows away Peet's & Starbucks over roasted, very acidic coffee as far as I'm concerned. I enjoy a good cup-o'-joe there when I can, dark roasted are my preference ... "Jacobs Wonderbar" is my fav ... made "sweet & creamy with a mint leaf on top" :-)  Enjoy a coffee and grab a yummy bagel next door at stoners too ... Mediterranean style or lox bagels are my fav (they're owned by the same place). Leave a tip and support these Artists! Enjoy the flow just like me or waaay better!!! All the best, Al B.
author: Al B.

description:
Mint Mojito.

Do get this.

Creamy.

Sweet.

Minty.

Refreshing.

Just simply nomness :)
author: Amy C.

description:
You come here to enjoy quality coffee. Not to be in and out within minutes. If the line doesn't stretch out to the door, you're in luck! The shop has it organized, where four baristas constantly are taking individual orders. Then while they're making your drink/s, which by the way is freshly brewed, you hop on to a next line to pay for your items. 

- Lines may seem long, but they go by quickly in an organized manner. Keep in mind that each coffee is freshly brewed on the spot. Trying it "Phil's Way" ( creamy and sweet appears to be the way to go!)

- The baristas know their craft! You would anticipate the wait to be long since there are several drinks to be made, but the speed and poise of the baristas make the lines dissipate smoothly. 

- You could tell each Barista have a few regulars waiting specifically for their barista be available. They never hesitated to spark a quick and sincere conversation.  Each had their own unique personality without the standard perfunctory you typically get at an establishment. 

SHOUTOUT: I'm not a coffee connoisseur, so I am pretty open minded on how my coffee is prepared. Chelsea invitingly helped me decide on what to get. I'm glad she led me to get heir infamous Iced Coffee Mojito and their Philtered Soul "Phil's Way". They were both delectable and oozing with flavors. If only I lived here, I would definitely continue to request her for her spot on skills and friendly demeanor!

Although there may be lines out the door, one must check this place out. The only downside to coming here is that I will be longing for Philz Coffee once I'm back home in San Diego!
author: Jim G.

description:
Review based only on their mint mojito drink.


Went here for the first time today. Maybe we got lucky coz there was no wait when we arrived. Small and cozy place, the baristas are nice, very attentive and friendly!

My friends I tell you.. the hype is real!!! Tried their mint mojito iced coffee.. and loved it. It was refreshing. The taste of mint went well with the coffee and the sweetness/creaminess was just right. $3 for a small and $5 for a large.

Love how you get your own barista and tell him/her how you want your drink/s to be made. They will call you when your drink is ready and then you'll pay for it. 


I'm glad they opened one in Santa Monica, because I can't wait to try their other drinks.
author: Liz F.

description:
I am so glad that I was yelp-stalking some SF elites' reviews in search for hidden gems to hit up while in SF for a week.  I recall seeing several folks mentioning Philz Coffee and lo and behold, I happened across the corner shop in Mission when I was walking by in search for a boutique nearby.  I only stopped by b/c of the reviews that I saw and SO GLAD I stopped in.  I was uberly impressed by their menu - mixing and matching flavors that I would not necessarily think of going well together - ie. mint mojito iced coffee??  BUT, I loved how they gave the flavors you could expect, if they were sweet, creamy, dark, light, etc...  

I was lucky to come in when the place was not super busy, as some of the reviews indicated lines out the door.  But I did stand back to look at the menu and make my decision prior to jumping in line.  They have 3-4 people working the lines to make the "one cup at a time" per order - and there is a long bench to sit on to wait for them to call your name.  I ended up ordering a ginger snap iced latte and it was DELICIOUS.  I am definitely in agreement with some people who suggest non-coffee drinkers to try Philz - they definitely will have something to your liking.  I ended up buying two bags of coffee to bring home - the Joe's Wonderbar and the Soooo Good.  DELICIOUS - I may be making some online orders in the near future.  :)  Happy drinking.
author: Nancy T.

description:
Nice coffee coffee coffee

Hipster coffee shop in da mission yo. All the staff are so hipster, and yet so friendly--waah? That isn't supposed to happen!

I ordered the mint mojito coffee for kicks, because it sounded interesting and I've never tried it before. Boy was I surprised! I thought the mint leaf they put on top was for decoration only, but I could actually taste the mint in the coffee. Waah? That isn't supposed to happen!

The entire drink tasted very, very smooth, even though I thought it wouldn't be because the name of the coffee drink was so long. Waah? That isn't supposed to happen!

The decor inside needs no intro--you only have to walk in once to realize how cool and chill the atmosphere is. Kind of feels like a campus dorm room.

All in all, a hipster coffee shop that was a pleasant surprise!
author: Henry L.

description: Super cool chick at the register today 8-4-17 ..1:15pm ..I always come in here and she's always really nice
author: Johnny T.

description:
I was being a tourist in this area walking through Balmy Street (http://www.yelp.com/biz/balmy-street-murals-san-francisco?osq=balmy+mural), and Philz happened to be within proximity. But due to my poor time management skills, we only had five minutes to run to this location and grab some coffee before they closed at 8:30pm. Arrival time: 8:31. The staff was cleaning up the place and we assumed we came too late. BUT to our delight, the barista accommodated us and was really nice about it!

I had to try the legendary mint mojito latte. At first sip I was obsessed! It's this creamy java goodness in a cup, crushed with ice and fresh mint leaves. Smooth, light, and super refreshing. We also got a large cup of iced coffee, and our barista was kind enough to throw in a free extra cup since they were about to close up. Thank you for your generosity and enough coffee to last us for two whole days, Barista!

I can't say the coffee here is the most affordable, but the higher price tag definitely comes with the extras - I really enjoyed the fresh mint and quality dairy mixed into my cup of joe. So thrilled about the recently opened Philz location in LA that will allow me to delight in this piece of heaven more often :-)
author: Sara L.

description: I had to write a review because BLUE and LENETTE keep it 100 like a summer day in Kuwait!!! Dopest people that ever hit the kuan on this green earth of ours. They stayed open until 8:10 to make a mint mojito for my friend who has a really bad allergy to not getting a mint mojito. Made it ultra NICE too! God bless Phil and all his children.
author: Hossain A.

description:
The original location, this Philz has very minimal seating (max 12 people), but the baristas are crazy efficient, and the drinks are perfect to sip as you stroll through Mission/Castro/wherever you go.

I generally take my coffee with sweetener, but I got a plain Ecstatic Iced Coffee without anything and WOW. It's zippy, it's refreshing, it's addictive. Perfect way to re-energize after a long day (or, rather...morning).

Philz is a San Francisco institution and an almost mandatory pitstop if you enjoy drinking coffee.
author: Jerry C.

description: For some reason, I've embarked on a Mission of visiting as many Philz locations possible to find my favorite ones. This one in the Mission is not a terrible, but it's not my favorite. I think it has to do with personal preferences in style and the fact that I'm not a very laid-back kind of person. Though the employees still embody the welcoming culture and service that is Philz, I feel dirty sitting in here. The tables, couches, and bathrooms are kinda dingy, but perhaps that's the intended vibe. Though I would not come here to get work done, this is a great place to chill out with friends or read!
author: Stefanie C.

description: Ummm, I didn't even KNOW hot amazing it could be to have somebody put in my sugar and cream level. It was SO incredibly delicious; the pour over coffee was off-the-hook. I can't come here every day because I live in Santa Barbara, so I need to have one of the employees move in with me.  Only solution that's viable.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
My favorite Philz location. In the heart of the Mission so I love to sit outside, soak up the energy, and people and dog watch. 

The first time I came here, I didn't know what the hell I was doing and the Barista kindly gave me 4 different suggestions. Went with Red Haze (a mix of 2 I can't remember right now), and stayed loyal to that coffee for quite some time.

I really like black coffee, but the Tesora is too strong for me without adding light cream. Ether is a nice choice if you want something similar to a French Roast.

Recent discovery- Ecstatic Ice coffee. It's made up of all the leftovers. I get it medium medium when I'm feeling like something sweet, and it kind of reminds me of Dutch Bros.

Their Jalapeno Cheddar bagel here is by far the best bagel I've ever had it in my entire life (I have sampled MANY), and I highly recommend it. Ask for light cream cheese though, as they are very heavy handed.

Free wifi so you can bring your computer and work.
author: Steph D.

description: Super long line but had to wait because I've been wanting to try the mint mojito iced coffee since the big hype about it. Took my order really quick after the line was over and waited about five mins or so for the drink. I got a large mint mojito iced coffee and it was pretty big although it looks smaller than Starbucks venti hot cups. The drink was filled all the way up to the top which makes the drink looks more like my friends brother would say, hashtag worth hahah. The taste to it was a lot more different than what I had expected.  The coffee taste was not strong at all yet mostly I only taste the mint and the coldness of it. Overall the drink was 3.5 stars out of five because of the refreshing taste it had. I would get it again if I wanted something to wake me up and something chilled.
author: Lisa W.

description:
First time in the Mission neighborhood, and since Philz is a decent stroll from the BART station, decided to come here for breakfast.  
My first thoughts on walking in echoed Brandi W.'s: this Philz fits in very well in the Mission neighborhood.  The interior is rough, bold, and eclectic, with murals on the walls and people sprawled on different types of couches all around the room.  The menu itself was something else: every drink had three different taste options next to it, which made decision-making that bit more difficult.  I ended up choosing the creamy chai tea and snagging a baklava on my way to the cashier.  I very much appreciated having the chance to taste the drink before paying.  Due to long lines the ordering and purchasing processes took a while, but overall I was pretty satisfied with my breakfast.
author: Emily Y.

description:
I'm from the east coast, and we don't have Philz here. That being said, I had to fulfill my mouth watering desires for that mint mojito iced coffee after staring at 'dem IG photos for way too long. Without further ado, let's get started!

Not sure how reliable this source is, but for you east coasters...if this is true, OMG my taste buds: http://www.upout.com/blog/washington-dc/philz-coffee-is-coming-to-dc-heres-why-its-a-big-deal

PROS:
*Large space, plenty of seating. The woods accents give a cabin-like feel, it's pretty homey/chill.
*Friendly baristas who are willing to customize your drinks with a smile. My barista asked me to take a sip after he whipped up my delicious concoction to see if it was to my liking, I appreciated that.
*The MINT MOJITO ICED COFFEE. They put plenty of mint leaves in it, LOVE it.
*Affordable and fresh ingredients used. You can really taste the quality of the coffee.
*Long lines, but you don't wait long.The barista makes your drink, and then you head over to the cash register. Everything runs efficiently.

CONS:
*Didn't spot any!

I might have to take a flight back ASAP, I miss you Philz! :(
author: Stella S.

description: popped in on a visit to san fran some time ago. Awesome vibe here and great food/drinks all round.
author: B J.

description:
Best cup of coffee I have ever had.  If this place was in Tampa, or if there exists a place like this in Tampa, someone let me know.....or not because I would either go broke or have a caffeine overdose from drinking so much coffee here.  Everyone likes a different type of cup, and I believe that this place can find everyone's perfect match.  I got lucky and found mine on the first try.  They even taught me a little trick, put cinnamon in the coffee grounds as you brew it.  

Little info... this place has confidential beans.  The workers aren't even allowed to know where the beans come from.  Only a select few people do know.  Maybe the mystery is what made it so good, or maybe it was the fact that they were willing to remake me an entire cup if I didn't like my first.  Either way, this place is top notch.  

If you don't know what to get, do as I did.  Ask the people at the counter.  Tell them what you like and they will find your match.
author: Michael P.

description:
Where do I even begin...this was on top of my list of things to do for my visit to SF. Being from Atlanta we just started getting into the artisanal coffee culture, so I was very excited to try the famous mint mojito iced coffee. 

I'm not a coffee connoisseur but this drink is 5 stars all the way! Right amount of coffee, mint, milk, and sweetness! It's a unique combo with the mint but it works!

My coffee snob friend got a cup of Jacobs Wonderbar and claimed that it was smooth and rich without the bitterness.
I ended up buying a bag of the tesora ($16) since it was recommended for coffee newbs to try it black.

I'm craving one now!
