Also, try to have an idea of what you're going to order bc they can get super busy and you don't want to be "that" person holding up the line :-p
author: D.J. K.

description:
It's quite humbling to visit the original Philz Coffee.  It's not as spectacular as visiting the original Starbucks or anything.  And when you go in it's the same routine like any other Philz you've visited.  Line up, order at the barista, pay for your drink at the cashier, and wait till your barista calls out your drink.  I guess being at the place were it all started does add some allure to the location while you enjoy your coffee there.

A few things I do notice that about the Original Philz:
-The decor is very cozy and feels more like a lounge than a coffee house.
-This place is small and the tables can fill up rather quick
-Drinks seem to taste a little stronger here

I can't believe there was a time when I was intimidated to walk inside.  The experience I gathered from Philz in South San Francisco helped me get a better understanding for how the system went so now that when I go in, I can order my Philtered Soul like a boss!
author: Rodney H.

description:
I have been to many coffee shops (over 20) in San Francisco and this Philz is my favorite one! This is the original Philz where Phil was concocting blends that are now being loved at 21 coffee shops in the Bay Area. 

Philz has lots of different coffees to choose from. My recommendations below: 

Dark Roast-jacobs wonderbar named after Philz son Jacob who is now head of the company. 

Medium roast-Tesora lots of good options here. This is a great starter and was Philz first blend that he took 7 years to perfect!

Light roast-new Manhattan good clean slightly fruity cup

Specialty coffee-iced mint mojito sweet and creamy. One of the best beverages I've ever had. Can't recommend this drink enough. If it's a hot day in the mission try this one out. Even karl the fog is in town this drink won't let you down. 

Phil himself is known to come in the store often and knows a lot of the regulars. 

@management of Philz, step up your pastry game. Not bad but would love to see the attention given to the pastries as the coffee. 

Tremendous coffee and best service at coffee shop in the city. Always a good day when you stop in at Philz.
author: Kevin B.

description:
My friends told me about how great Philz was but I didn't understand until I tried their coffee. 
I got an iced mint mojito, and the thing I notched a it it was the coffee was incredibly smooth. I asked them to half the amount of sweetener and it was perfect for me. The coffee itself was great and the powerful, non-artificial mint flavor makes it even better. 
At the end of the drink, I popped off the lid and realized the bottom had been stuffed with mint leaves lol. But definitely worth!
Please try this coffee shop and support local small businesses.
author: Michael N.

description: I usually come here at least 3 times a week. Love the customer service and the atmosphere here. The baristas really care and pay close attention to how they make your coffee. I always get the mint mojito iced coffee. It's super strong but that's how I like my coffee. The sweetness is a bit more sweet than usual but, it doesn't mask the taste of the coffee at all and works really well with the rest of the ingredients.
author: Kelsey S.

description:
The mint mojito iced coffee is a great start to begin a day in SF! I loved the smell of coffee as you near the store. The shop itself is pretty tiny, so for sure not a place to be lounging around but worth making a trip. We walked over here during a 2 hour brunch wait at a nearby restaurant so a good tip would be to keep this place bookmarked in case you're in the area. 

The coffee is not too sweet like Starbucks yet not too bitter to the point where I rather no drink it. The hint of mint is a unique twist to the traditional morning must-haves. Service is friendly and quick. Even on a busy weekend morning, you can expect to be in and out!
author: Binh T.

description: Would definitely recommend as a place to hang out or study. I've spent more than a couple afternoons working on homework and college essays last semester. I like how personal the employees make the ordering of coffed
author: Gracie C.

description:
I honestly think it could be cleaner here but I don't really care.

Good people watching.

So many laptop people being so SF.

Also, so many Mission people being Mission people.

Many good coffee options but the top is definitely the Mint Mojito.

The top three ways I like coffee are: black, Vietnamese style, and Mint Mojito Iced Coffee.

Once I had the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee at Philz, I stopped ordering anything else.  A lot of the other options are great but if you love mint and coffee, you need to try it together.  So insanely refreshing!

What else to know?

So many people hang out here.  There's a good amount of tables but good luck trying to find something.  It's about luck or timing.
author: Phillip N.

description:
Saturday, 11:30 AM.

Quickie:
+ Drink quality
+ Service
- Hygiene
+ Atmosphere
+ Turnaround

And then...?
I got addicted to Philz at this location. Eccentric, diverse, and inclusive - no wonder it fits in the Mission so well. Shout-out!

**********
Constructive comment:
*Expand food menu
author: Chuck N.

description: I don't know if you realize this but Philz carries Jamaican Blue Mountain which is one of the bombest coffee beans on this planet.
author: Breyan D.

description: Not the best coffee. I got a salad along with my drink. Too much mint. Starbucks is still my favorite.
author: Melissa A.

description:
I didn't think Philz could top every single cup of coffee I've ever had in NYC, Boston and Melbourne, but it did. And it was so amazing that I stopped by here every morning I was in SF. By the third day, I was a bit embarrassed because the barista said "welcome back". Heh.

The mint mojito iced coffee is as delicious and magical as everyone says. I like to get it with cream and sugar. I also tried Jacob's Wonderbar, which is a more chocolate-y type coffee drink (also good!)

Philz Coffee, you have forever spoiled me.
author: Claudia C.

description: This place rocks best coffee is Turkish sweet and creamy. Dont eat the food especially the burrito.
author: drew B.

description: Not worth the wait. I've been coming here since the beginning and they deserve props. But the coffee itself is not on the same level as others. Sometimes you just want a decent cup of joe and waiting 20 minutes feels insane. I don't want to be harsh but, sorry. The attitude and the crowd make me long for a simpler set up.
author: Girlie G.

description:
I heart feels coffee. I actually quit Starbucks because Philz Coffee is better.

Phil made my coffee and that's pretty cool. 

Imagine seeing the Starbucks mermaid making your coffee wouldn't that be cool? Yup nope.

Now that I drink Philz, Starbucks taste yucky and it gives me headaches.

I'm craving Philz Coffee right meow.
author: Shenni C.

description:
Each PHILZ coffee house has it's own uniquness that mimic its community.  This 24th @ the Mission is laid back, "chill" attitude and loving the vibe.  I also love the benches up front and on the side too.  It's a cool place to sip my ETHER or THESORA and savor the moment.  

The staff here is exceptionally helpful and always upbeat and service with a smile.  We are seeing more and more PHILZ creep up in new places and new directions.  The downtown ones are more modern and sleek, but this 24th St. location catches my "PHILZ SOUL!"
author: Edwin R.

description: when I need my coffee done right and the people who work their are always in a positive vibe! Love gping here every M-f  Keep it up!!!
author: Jay A.

description:
As a lover of iced coffee, I seriously can't get enough of the mint mojito iced coffee here. It's freakin' creamy, minty, refreshing, and bursting with coffee flavor. 

Can you please expand to Seattle? Thanks.
author: Jonelle T.

description:
This is the first time I have been to a Philz Coffee. 
YUM YUM YUM.
I ordered the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee, medium sugar w cream. Delicious! I love how they put lots of fresh mint in the drink. Also they did not over ice it which I am thankful for! 
I hope they expand across SoCal and open one in Santa Barbara. I would love to do homework in an atmosphere like this.
author: Ava S.

description:
Mint Mojito Ice Coffee is the perfect alternative to a nap on a hot afternoon. Can't really go wrong here when it comes to coffee. 

The iconic coffee cups have also won my heart. Philz pastries are just ok and expectedly overpriced.
author: Drew M.

description:
This is where it all started. 24th and Folsom. If you're now enjoying your Jacobs Wonderbar, Sooo Goood, Mint Mojito, or Tranquilizing Turkish in Sunnyvale, Sausalito, or Santa Monica - 24th and Folsom, this is where it came from.

Customized blends to perfection, awesome baristas, and a funky store. Even if you only drink coffee every once in a while, this is a MUST in San Francisco.

Not to mention that my most memorable experience at this store was when Mr. Philz himself helped me opening the toilet door (from the outside). Thank you again for that.
author: Sebastian F.

description: Rad spot! Very eclectic vibe, good drinks. Glad to have made it to their first location!!
author: Jennifer M.

description:
I go by Philz when I'm on the 12 Folsom bus so I visited the 1st time and it's as everybody says, "homegrown."  The desks and couches are old, well-worn, retro, not the best like you'd see at Starbux.  Just like their people, homegrown, outspoken, not a bad or corporate vibe anywhere.  Their iced mint mojito is refreshing. 

I came in another time and wanted a different unique type of drink, and because I didn't want to admit I couldn't read their coffee menu above(since I misplaced my eyeglasses for nearsightedness), I got a bit blasé and ordered a horchata flavored iced coffee.  IT WAS NOT ON THE MENU (which I did not find out 'til later) even though I assumed it would be since this philz was in the heart of Latino country on 24th st near Mission St.   He was shocked, but like any great barista, he picked it up and asked me if I liked cinnamon and I said yes!! and he did a great job with it!! 

Their wi-fi is one of the best although the number of outlets is limited to near the couches.  They've got newspapers strewn across their couches if you forgot your laptop or tablet.  They've got outdoor seating, great on a sunny day to chat with a friend.  They're packed in the weekday daytime which doesn't quiet down until afternoon/night although most of the customers are pretty occupied on their laptop or tablet.  Because their shop is small, I would not go in with lots of friends-maybe maximum 3 or 4. Their restroom (which has a number password which you have to ask from the baristas or clerk) is clean but bare and unisex so if you're a woman, bring along your own toiletries and LOTS of it. And remember to lock the door since it doesn't automatically lock once you're inside.   The 12 bus and 48 buses stop on the intersection outside.  Philz is a great place to rest for some quiet time after having eaten/shopped on 24th St.
author: Frugal C.

description:
Lace me up one time with that crack infused Kouign-amann tho bruh.
But when I'm tryna watch my weight, I'll inhale one of those black bean burritos followed by gulping down a mint mojito, extra sweet, extra creamy. Just the way the ladies like my hot chocolate. 
Caught a sad note on my way out of there today unfortunately; mentioning a hike in prices of about .50 per coffee drank. Like, can you bring your price down? - TLOP
author: Ami S.

description:
Yum Yum in the bum bum. Ice Mint Mojito makes me poo so good. 

I love your Palestinian booty, Phil!
author: Ahmed A.

description:
All my friends from the Bay tell me to go try Philz whenever I get a chance to, and yesterday was it. After my first cup, I am a huge fan.
I drink coffee not regularly, but quite often, and I can honestly say that Philz is one of the best places I've had coffee at.

They have a good selection of drinks and they all sounded really good, but I got the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee because that's what all my friends recommended. They also recommended the Mocha Tesora, but I'm a big fan of mint, so that's why I got the Mint Mojito Coffee. The drink was simply amazing, I don't know how else to describe it. The barista that made my drink was super nice and when I told him it was my first time, and had to take a picture of my drink, he laughed and then asked if I was going to Instagram it as well. I did.

It's shops like these that make me wish I lived in the City so I can be a regular, I can't wait til my next time back !
author: Alesia C.

description:
This Philz Coffee location is hipster central. The line wraps inside the store like a snake so I hope you have some patience or have some time to burn. The place is packed with all sorts of interesting personalities including all the gifted baristas behind the counter (the Jack Black twin doppelgänger is a funny dude). This place totally reminds me of a spot that should be located down in LA, Silverlake Junction area in particular. It'll definitely fit in and it'll also do us Angelinos a favor if they ever decide to open one near us. We won't have to trek norte to get some of Phil'z good brew. Not to mention, it would probably give Intelligentsia Coffee a run for their money. 

Each drink is individually crafted to perfection. It seemed to me that each coffee drink required its own brand new filter. I'm sure they're using some "greener" approach to the filters. As you wait patiently in line, the menu will have you drawing blanks due to its extensiveness. Choose between dark, medium, or light roasts. The names alone are catchy: Ambrosia Coffee of God or the Canopy of Heaven just to name a few. You can't go wrong with the mint mojito ice coffee. I think that's their best seller. The mint brings the brew to the next level. For you non-coffee drinkers, they also have teas available.

It was a short visit to the bay, but I hit up Philz Coffee twice and got to sample a few hot and cold drinks from them. Each cup of joe was far from disappointment. With caffeine fixes like this, it's no wonder coffee is one of US's most popular legal drug. Love the baristas and their upbeat attitude. Those guys deserve a round of applause because they do some magical Gandalf stuff behind those counters.
author: Smitcha B.

description: The original Philz location has a more laid back SF from the old days feel to it. More like the college hangout coffee shop than the Tech biz casual the of the other locations. Enjoying jazz and the outdoor forest feel of the potted plants and painted trees. Antique looking tables and mismatched chairs feel well worn with a lot of character and history. For first timers, be sure to get in line at the far end of the bench to put your order in before paying.
author: tomohisa w.

description:
I spoke with one of the workers here since I couldn't get a manager. I like the mint mojito but my drink had so much mint that it looked like they dumped a whole batch of mint into the coffee. It's not a smoothie, it's a coffee and the mint shouldn't fill half the cup.

I'm glad they remade my drink but since the mint clogged up the cup, the coffee spilled all over my white blouse. It was a mess and I was angry when I opened up the cup and pulled clumps and clumps of mint from my drink. I've had this drink many times before and this time the mint was piled on. Today's experience was awful.
author: Jackie H.

description: Iced mojito mint coffee. Rarely do I encounter a coffee so perfect that I don't even need to add sugar! However, it DOES exist at Philz. Besides the fantastic drinks, the atmosphere is chill, with comfy places to settle in all day. A true gem of the Mission!
author: Danielle D.

description:
The original Philz location. I was in the neighborhood and stopped in here for a coffee. Wow. Their selection is almost overwhelming. The roasts are in order from dark to light.

I ordered their darkest roast called Ether, and checked out the scene while waiting. It's a pretty young crowd. Mixture of hipster-ish, and techie looking people.

Coffee was about what I was expecting. Very strong, rich flavor. Kind of pricey at nearly $4 for a small. Took about 10 minutes to make it. I guess, if you know all of this going in, you'll have a great experience.
author: John F.

description:
The original philz. Come to lounge, study, or strike up a conversation. The coffee is phenomenal, but did you really not know that already? 

Some of my favorites are the mint mojito or tesora. But talk to the baristas- they are so nice and will help you choose a drink that you'll love.

A must-try if you're in SF.
author: Quyen V.

description:
This particular review is based on the HORRIBLE and RACIST treatment I received from a white female barista with dreadlocks  at Philz (I know, not necessarily shocking that a white impostafarian transplant in the mission would be racist).  My husband and I stopped in for a cup of coffee before a show and were told to stand behind the line if a very rude and abrupt manner before we were even greeted.  I took notice of the different treatment that a white man entering the coffee shop received shortly after. He actually go a "hello" and a smile. You know, the way a customer should be greeted.  

Rather than take our order, this barista proceeded to have a long social conversation with a "friend" who recognized her, completely ignoring my husband and I standing there, waiting to order a simple cup of coffee. After about FOUR MINUTES of their mind-numbing valley girl conversation and us waiting to be acknowledged, I finally interrupted saying "excuse me, can we place our order" to which she responded "actually can you please wait behind the line like I told you? I am busy with this order and having a conversation with my friend."  At this point, I told her that we did not need to give our business to a place that would employ such a rude (and racist) employee and that she actually doesn't get paid to socialize and ignore customers.  

To this barista, I hope you are reading this-- Your ugly, unkempt impostafarian dreadlocks make you neither "ethnic" nor interesting, and your job does not make you cool. I know you are living the hipster dream as a barista in the mission, but you better recognize what neighborhood you're in and respect the people who have more of a legitimate claim to it that your phony ass does-- and if this is too hard for you to do,  then at the very least, do your freaking job and serve people coffee. I can't imagine it can be that hard.
author: La Mari M.

description:
The Mission Philz was always my favorite spot growing up in San Francisco. It has been a long time since I have been to Philz, so I was sure to riddle this vacation in a caffeine-high induced state brought about by the one and only Phil.

I was sad to see that the original charm my workmates and I enjoyed at this location has been removed. When I worked on an ambulance in SF, there were EMS / Fire Department shirts and memorabilia laden across the walls which have since been removed. There was also a menu on the bar explaining the complexities of flavors in each roast. These have been moved out, though the communal area still looks the same.

What I recommend: 
1) Half-Half mix of the Ambrosia and Anesthesia, order light cream/light sugar and top with 3 hefty mint leaves.
2) Ether with the cardamom 
3) Ecstatic Iced Coffee - with 2-3 mint leaves

Everything here is pretty boss. And no matter what your poison, you will leave a completely re-wired person sure to annoy your friends and family.

Sure, the caffeine lasts only a few hours; but the experience will last a lifetime.
author: Michael W.

description:
I should of wrote a review a while ago but just haven't had the chance until now...Walking in here for the 1st time was a little intimidating...When I saw where the line was or where I thought where it was, was confusion part 1. oh, OK the line is behind the bench by the pretty plant around the atm...got it! 

Ok, let's order my mud!! I got the (supposedly infamous) Iced Mint Mojito. Sigh...It was ok...just ok. I didn't know if I wanted it Medium, how many sugars (waaahh!). I just said order it how it taste best. Yeah, I know we all have different taste buds. My bad..

2nd time I came was better. I knew where to stand in line and where I was going to wind up to pay for my cafe. I ordered the Jacobs Wonderbar, it was AMAZING. Nice, dark smooth and creamy!! Jitters Central (love it) I am ready for the world kind of feeling!!!! I have tried the Dark roasts and love them all. Medium on sugar. BAM

Philz 101
author: Carla F.

description:
Had the Jacobs Wonderbar dark roast coffee. The lady at the counter recommended this one being the most served. It's so good. I liked it a lot! It has a hazelnut flavor and goes down smooth. I'm won over. Will definitely be back for more. 

The crowd was very interesting though. It looked like a scene from a movie. Lots of characters. :)
author: Jules K.

description:
I love how this coffee joint has this home like feel and makes you feel so welcomed. There are a lot of students with laptops occupying the desk, chairs and sofa while the outside benches and mid section to the door are filled with people waiting on their drink(s).

The atmosphere is so relaxed, yes, even more than Starbucks. Lol. From the tables to sofas and decorations.. And the paintings on the wall along with the pictures and writing make this visit for me so personal.

This is my first time here I told the barista, and they opted for me to try the 'Mint Mojito' iced coffee. It's a strong blend to start with, but as you make your way to finish the drink you enjoy it more and more. The mint leaves really gives it that 'zing' of difference. Glad to have visited this local spot while in town.
author: Jerome B.

description:
Same great Philz except at a different location. This location is near my work so if I can get to work early enough, I definitely try to come here and get some Philz. 

I like ecstatic iced coffee OR mint mojito iced coffee. They're my favorites but I can't say there's anything that I didn't like from Philz. 

Philz makes their coffee one cup at a time so it may take a few more minutes (especially if there's a long line), but just be patient with them. It's worth it. 

Coffee is $3, $4, or $5 a cup depending on what kind of coffee you want.
author: Connie Y.

description:
It's sad that it's as good as it used to be. Ordered new Manhattan with almond milk and it tasted like, not nearly as bad as, crap from four barrel or something. Acidic burned over roasted 

What happened to smooth coffee... Do I have to wait for Dunkin coffee to show up in SF now??
author: A O.

description:
First time going to this philz coffee place. Like most philz coffee place, theres usually a line. Waited about 15 - 20 minutes in line to order my drink since they make your coffee fresh. Theres usually three or 4 workers who make your coffee. then waited at another line to pay for coffee but i Didnt have to wait long to get my drink after paying at the cashier (less than 10 minutes). 

I had the mint mojito ice coffee. The person who made my drink ask me if my drink taste right before leaving to be sure its the right taste for me. Kind of gave me a lot of ice but still good service. The drink that i had was sweet, creamy, and minty since they actually put real mint inside.

This place is spacious and hip looking.
author: Julie N.

description:
I've been to two other philz coffee and I love their ice mocha. My friend placed my order for me and they messed up and made it hot. Not a big deal mistakes happen.

They remade my drink and I walked off with it. The more I sipped it the more I realized how watered down my drink was. I just paid $5.50 for the worst iced mocha I ever had. 

My friends mint mojito was also watered down as well. 

Not coming back to this location!
author: Stanley C.

description:
Gosh, you never go wrong w/ Philz. I finally moved close enough so I went over to this Philz location. Service was great, people were friendly, and the location is large inside- would totally go back!

Philz always has great coffee!!
author: Sophie P.

description:
Best Philz coffee store I have ever been.  My favorite drink I order here are Mojito by Reina/Reyna and Red Velvet with sprinkled cinnamon by Rachel . Both of these gals put their hearts in creating such an exquisite delicious coffee I have ever tasted. Smooth and no bitter aftertaste. Perfect!

David Bacho
Coffeologist
CJBCT
author: David B.

description: What can I say that hasn't been said already?  If you're looking to try something other than their mojito iced coffee, try their ecstatic iced coffee! It won't disappoint. P.S. Don't be afraid to ask them to make something a little less or more sweet after you've had your first sip.
author: Dione C.

description:
Okay, I didn't actually stop at Philz today because they are remodling, but I did go on Saturday and had such an awesome experience, yet again. I got a fist-bump from one of the baristos who has the best, most genuine laugh ever and I met Phil himself who shook my hand with the dignity I deserve. 

I checked in today because, a) I didn't have my phone with me on Saturday to check in, and b) I saw Phil doing his own renovations and cleaning this morning on my walk to Bart. I love that he's either commited enough, or is a cheapskate (just like your's truly) and refuses to hire someone else to do it. Props!!
author: Crystal C.

description:
I love Philz! Mint mojito to go please!

This location is in the mission, on 24th and Folsom. 

They have a pretty good amount of seating inside, and just benches outside. 

The line can be a bit confusing, as it is on the opposite end to order. The staff was friendly, and they do listen to your customized drinks. 

In and out in less than ten minutes compared to other city locations!
author: Nika K.

description:
Came here after my friend insisted I try the Mint Mojito Ice Coffee here.  He actually took me across town to try this place.

My understanding is that this is the original location of Philz.  The place is definitely hipsterish.  You can sit around and wait on ghetto-benches when they make their feel-good coffee.

As for the coffee?  Wow this is good.  I enjoyed it quite a bit.  Nice and bitter, but also with that delicious mint.  Beautiful.

Definitely will be coming back in the future.
author: Edward L.

description:
One of the places I miss most since I left SF is Philz. I love coffee. I just can't function without caffeine in my system so you have to imagine how much I like Philz. 

I love the Ambriosa, Ether, and Soooo Good! During sunny days, I like getting their Mint Mojito iced coffee. Sometimes I'll ask for extra mint because it's one of my favorite herbs and it just makes the drink for me even more enjoyable!
author: Claudine M.

description:
With Philz coffee, I'm pretty much expecting a great experience every time: this location is no exception.

The coffee is amazing, of course, and the physical location is great as well: it has a very earth/urban vibe with murals painted on walls, etc. Phil himself frequents this location: maybe because it was the very first Philz location. There's usually enough seating for one person, and lots of outlets too - however it's tough to find a spot for two people, especially during high traffic times.

Surprisingly, I've found that in general there's not very much line at all, at any time of the day when I've visited. In general, no complaints about this place, and I'm sure to take someone here first if they're visiting the Bay Area and have never experienced Philz.
author: Noah G.

description:
This review is for the mobile truck that is parked on Sansome and Pine streets.

Was doing work at the crack of dawn at the Mandarin Oriental and spied through the corner of my eye their mobile truck. Fortunately, there was no wait and got my Tesora as if I was getting it at one of their many brick and mortar locations.

Barista and cashier were great and engaging with not just with me but with everyone who stopped by to order a drink or pastry. Keep in mind, the choices of coffee drinks are not as extensive as if your were to go to one of their retail locations.

Fruit pastry was fresh and flaky with nice slices of fruit on the top.

By the time I was leaving the hotel, they were 15 deep with folks waiting to order.
author: Richard H.

description:
Interesting concept for a coffee shop...sort of complicated but in a really simple way, I guess more complex than complicated, but I definitely felt confused the entire time I was there (and just everyday in general). 

I came here on a Saturday morning when I was here visiting from out-of-town and there was a pretty long line but things were moving quickly. The menu confused the hell out of me so I stopped trying to understand it and just waited until it was my turn, hoping the barista would be patient with me. 

The set-up is just one long line and then there are 2-3 baristas at their own little station and whenever one of them is open they will call "next in line!" and then you go up to their little spot to discuss your coffee. When it was my turn I told my barista babe that it was my first time there and asked if there was something close to a vanilla latte because I had a hard time comprehending their menu, her response was surprising...I was expecting her to be agitated at my ignorance but instead she was excited to pop my Philz cherry and help me find something I would like. I still don't know if they have lattes here...I think they just have tons of different types of coffee and then add your prefereance of milk/sweetener.

She went over a few flavor profiles and eventually we went with something chocolate/hazelnut which isn't something I would normally go for, but she convinced me I would like it. The names of the drinks here were a little odd, so forgive me for not remembering what it was, but I ordered it with milk and STEVIA! Extra points for having Stevia...I back that. 

Anyway, so after you order you find your way to the register...kinda weird because it is not structured at all...they just kind of trust you'll go pay for your drink like a good citizen, but no one is really waiting for you at the register. Then you wait for your barista to call you for your drink...mine took about 10 minutes and when I went to grab it she made me try it first to make sure I liked it. I had her add another Stevia and then it was perfect.

If I lived in SF I think I would definitely be a regular at Philz once I could figure out what the hell the menu is all about. They put a lot of care and art into making your coffee perfect and I left feeling like I had a custom-made, hand-crafted cup of coffee, and that's pretty special.
author: Ashley K.

description:
I'm not a big coffee drinker, but I am quite addicted to Philz Coffee. This location definitely has that artsy/hipster vibe going on (alas, we are in the Mission district). The baristas are all cheerful and knowledge about their products.

- Mint Mojito: cause duh! I always get it half sweet.
- Ecstatic: this is some bomb drank!

You can decide if you want more/regular/less sugar and cream. After they make the drink for you, you can adjust it to be sweeter or creamier.

Tons of seating so a lot of people are here reading, studying, or doing work. They even have park benches outside so you can enjoy your coffee and the neighborhood!
author: Christine S.

description:
I'm not a big coffee drinker but man oh man... the mint mojito drink here is AMAZING. I didn't really think coffee would go well with "mint mojito" but the drink was light, not too sweet, and had the best flavor. I really loved this drink!

What's great about Philz Coffee is how they prepare your drinks. Before you enter the cashier, there is a line up of baristas who calls over each customer and makes their drinks specially for him or her. My girlfriend and I felt so special having our own barista and also seeing how well crafted our drinks were being made!

Ugh. Just so good. Just go there now. If I lived in SF, I would be here almost every day.
author: Felicia L.

description:
Heard this is Phil's main location where he usually hangs out! I just had to see him in person! 

On a Monday morning, I finally was able to spot him at this location. I was basically fan girl-ing inside my head while being half asleep. I wanted to approach him, but he was speaking to someone at the moment. Boo! There's always next time! 

Anyhoo, my favorite at Philz is philtered soul with milk and sugar! Love love the hazelnut. They make it the same to me at any of the locations. 

I would drink Philz on a day to day basis, but it's burning a hole in my wallet. I still spoil myself with Philz coffee at least once a week!
author: Kathleen U.

description:
Awesome baristas! They were grooving and singing along to usher while i was waiting on line. You walk up to the first available barista and order your drink to your liking and then pay at the counter after it's done. The cashier here was also super sweet, she complimented 

For my first philz experience (EVER!) I decided to try the famous mint mojito iced with the recommended sweet + creaminess, I left it up to the barista cause I figured they know their stuff better than I do. It was a little too sweet for my liking and I wasn't a huge fan of the physical leaves being sucked up by my straw even though I did really like the mint flavor mixed with coffee. It's great that they brew hot coffee and then ice it, so you get the authentic coffee taste.

I will come back to a Philz location if I'm in the area and want a treat, can't afford to make it a regular habit though! :)
author: Hana S.

description:
Clearly I don't need to tell any of you how great a cup of Philz is.  The THOUSANDS+ reviews and counting confirm the hand-crafted love and impeccable flavor that's inside every cup.  Some of my favorites?  Tesora, Mocha Tesora, Jacob's Wonderbar, and Silken Splendor.  Fun fact: did you know that Tesora means Treasure in Italian?  I'm such a fan of this smooth, low-acid coffee that I only make Philz at home- but as anyone will tell you, it's just not the same.  

Okay enough about the coffee- I'm here to share my experience and admiration for this business and how owner Phil Jaber has inspired me to be a better person.  Uh WHAT?  Yes, you read that right.  Phil is quite simply, a really, really cool human being.  Here's why.....

On a sweltering October day, with temperatures reaching nearly 100-degrees, my friend and I decided to get some Philz.  (Okay, I actually insisted on it and she was just trapped in my car along for the ride).  I pulled Yelp up to try to find the nearest Philz as I was driving through the Mission and knew that I had to be close to one.  I stopped at a stoplight and looked down at Yelp.  What's that you say?  I'm verrrrry close to one?  I looked up again and saw the original 24th/Folsom cafe to my immediate left, embraced by a pearlescent haze. (Cue: sound of the Heavens). This was meant to be!

I drove past the stoplight and found a parking spot right around the corner.   Yes, in the Mission.  On a Saturday.  Parking karma!  Ka-Ching!  The stars were clearly lining up for Philz today!  As we stepped out of the car, I pointed out a used sharps bio-bag strewn on the sidewalk to my horrified friend.  Eh.....well we ARE in the Mission.  Nothing shocking there.

I was excitedly bragging to my friend that I had met THE Phil the last time I was at this location.  He was standing underneath a poster bearing his image and I was so star-struck that I was suddenly too shy to ask for a photo and autograph.  (Let's just call this first-time groupie stage fright).

We walked inside the store and noticed a HUGE mess.  Chairs sitting on tables, people mopping wet floors, and NOBODY making coffee.  HUH?  What happened to the epic Philz day we were having?  Not wanting to give up, I poked my head in and asked, "obviously you guys are closed - does anyone know where the nearest Philz is?"

A tall and slender hipster strode over, carrying a pink pastry box and wearing a friendly smile.  "Sorry, we're remodeling right now but there's one on Douglass- you'll have to drive there or take a bus.  Want a pastry to take with you?"  My eyes widened.  "Yes thank you!"  Soon, I was wearing the same smile as I turned to walk out.  And at that very moment, the heavens parted and my eyes met a very familiar face.  (Cue: the sound of Heavens again).  It was THE Phil.  In the flesh.  Leaning against a parking meter.  No big deal, just another hot Autumn day.

"Ohmigod!  That's Phil!" I practically screamed.  I was chewing on my pastry at the same time.  Pastry crumbs dotted my lips.  "Are you girls enjoying that?  Where are you from?" the Legend spoke.  "I'm from the Peninsula?" I screeched.  "Oh, we're opening one in San Mateo on B Street in a couple of weeks," he said.  All 3 of us continued to chat and his friend took a photo of us (see below).

The following day, I was procrastinating about work (it was Sunday 'mkay?) and looked up Phil and his story.  Reading this article nearly brought me to tears:  http://savorgood.com/2014/02/27/phil-jaber-philz-coffee/

Phil tells his story of living a very simple immigrant's life in the Bay Area, helping his father run a grocery store in the Sunset.  This is where he spent building his business chops observing customers and their habits.  Market research without a Wharton MBA.  All the while, he would work on blending coffee at the store.  His big break wouldn't happen for another 25 years.

Reading this as a fellow immigrant who minded her parents' store starting at the age of 9 was inspirational, humbling, and most of all, deeply personal.  Phil's attitude about treating people with humanity and grace touched me in a very profound way.  Someday, when I grow up, I want to do something with my life that follows the Philz motto, "We Exist to Better People's Day".  That's what I call real success.
author: Cin P.

description:
As someone who lives in Socal, i didn't feel special walking into a Philz coffee store anymore since we have one in Santa Monica now.

Honestly, this place is pure hype.  The one drink that everyone gets is mediocre at best.  Its not worth the price premium at all.  Yes, i'm talking about the mint mojito coffee.  Unless you guys are getting a secret bag of cocaine along with your orders, i don't understand the hype.  I'd go to Starbucks any day all day. 

the interior look was kinda grungy... i don't know if all philz are similar?

apparently this is the first philz coffee location!  kinda cool i guess.
author: Jeff K.

description:
Who knew decaf could taste so good?! The Decaf Sumatra with the creamy undertone is rich, luscious and subtly sweet - no sugar, cream or other additives needed. I'm sensitive to caffeine therefore shy away from the regular fare, but decaf tends to be bland, diluted, or simply underwhelming. Here though, Philz does it right. 

What's more, they carry vegan chocolate chip cookies and vegan donuts for the lactose-intolerant folks like myself. The vibrant, friendly staff round out the perfect coffee shop experience.
author: Amy Z.

description:
Maybe the best coffee I've had and terrific service!

Wish they did call in and pickup though!
author: Jeremy S.

description:
Oooooooooooohhhhhh SNAP!!

Guess who made a cup of coffee for this guy on Father's Day?

Yup, it was the one and only brimmed-hat-wearing icon himself!!!

It was super early on a Sunday morning and I was taking a lady friend to SFO, dropped in for a cup and there he was. he dropped four funny ass jokes on me in the matter of 3 minutes. The bad news, just as the convo got good, the gal I was picking up called to say "Hey buddy. I'm standing on the corner of 24th & Mission" and in that moment, I straight up cold shouldered our boy! left him at the coffee altar and ran for the hills. I couldn't have this lovely woman from out of town standing on the corner. I mean, the way she said it and the chosen words were enough to make me crumble. 

Such is life. Presumably I will meet Rihanna some day soon and when I'm about to handle business and get the digits, my homie will call in a panic b/c his Raidas gave up another TD to visiting rival San Diego!! 

Phil, you are a class act my brotha. Thanks for keepin it real in an era where keepin it real has become pure slang.
author: Hector G.

description:
I had no idea we stumbled into the original Philz Coffee shop when we were in the city last weekend. We parked down the street right on Lucky St, that way we were about a block and 1/2 away from Humphry Slocombe (one of my stops for the SF Food Crawl), but since the SBBF had to stay clean he wanted coffee so we walked over to Philz first before lining up at Humphry's.

I didn't wanna overdo the dairy consumption in my body, plus I'm not a coffee drinker really. Caffeine makes me uber sleepy. So I got myself a small cup of their green tea.

The boys both ordered a mocha, one got it hot the other got it over ice. The SBBF Brad C. said his hot mocha was the best tasting coffee mocha he'd ever drank. So the hype of the amazing flavor of Philz Coffee isn't really hyped up after all. :)

My green tea was super delicious as well. They added some mint leaves to it and it totally changed my perspective on green tea. I already drink about 2-3 cups of the regular bagged green tea each day, but this green tea sure was something special! One of the baristas was kind enough to put some ice cubes in my green tea for me, that way I could gulp it down faster. 

Our experience here was definitely an A+ rated one. Next time we see a Philz, we'll be sure to stop in and maybe I'll try their hot chocolate. :P
author: Michelle V.

description: Always enjoy coming to the main Philz location! My go-to drink is the Iced Gingersnap!
author: Jules C.

description: My husband and I tried the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee and the Ginger Snap Iced Coffee. I personally wasn't a fan of the mint mojito iced coffee... it was too minty for me and I didn't like having that flavor mixed with my coffee. I generally like mint chocolate chip ... but mint with coffee...not really my thing. My husband loved it though! I definitely liked the ginger snap iced coffee a lot better. I love gingery cinnamony flavors and I liked how the drink was pretty mild and not too sweet. There was a kick of spice towards the end though where all the sediment was. Yum! Definitely a must-try if you're visiting SF. They have several locations.
author: Diana I.

description: Ordered a large iced mint mojito  ($5) and it is one of the best mojitos I've ever gotten. The barista  (believe his name was jeff) made a badass, creamy cup of coffee. I took one sip and I was in love haha. Took some restraint not to order another on the spot. Either the ones I've been to were meh or this guy is awesome. I'll give it to him:D *thumbs up*
author: Eva L.

description:
This polarizing coffee roaster fits into its own separate category in the SF coffee conversation.
Phil Jaber is a very smart business man. He's created something truly unique. 

Often in my coffee conversations with people, I'm confronted with the comment "Philz is better coffee than Blue Bottle," with a look of determination, ready to fight. My response is, "That's like comparing Mitchell's Ice Cream to Tartine Bakery. They're both local and they're both good, but they're doing something completely different from each other. We can have room in our hearts for both."

Positive:
-No espresso! Philz successfully broke away from the Starbucks model of lattes and cappucinos! They don't get nearly enough credit for this amazing feat. 
-The whole business is based on fresh pour-over coffee: mostly mysterious alchemic blends from light to medium to dark, including multiple decaf options.
-This concept of this place isn't to educate or to create connoisseurship. It's simply focused on making really delicious coffee. I think this is a huge part of the appeal to so many people who are put off by the snobbery of exclusivity of conventional modern third wave coffee roasters. No attention is paid to regions/altitudes/farms here. Sometimes people need a break from that. 
-So many different blends to try. People get into customizations and make personal connections to specific menu items. 

Negatives:
-I've bought the beans and made the coffee at home. It doesn't taste the same. In fact it's sort of mediocre. 
-A big part of the appeal of Philz coffee is related to the use of manufacturing cream, which, though delicious, is insanely high in saturated fat. You're basically drinking a hot milkshake. That's one of the reasons it's not everyday coffee for me. However, this is probably part of why it doesn't seem like a rip-off at $4/cup. 
-some of the trademark blends which use the mysterious powder (cardamom?), have kind of a hotdoggy aftertaste. 

Phil is a businessman, so something gives me the feeling that this brand is trying to follow Ike's Sandwiches and head into something like a Krispy Kreme Donut or In-n-out Burger explosive expansion. That would be hilarious. I'm not concerned about the quality going down because they don't exactly use delicate single origin beans.
author: RK W.

description:
This cafe is located near 24th mission st. Though it was weekday afternoon, it was pretty crowded. 
As every yelp people advised, I ordered Mint Mojito Coffee. Nice combination! I loved it!
If you like chocolate mint ice cream, you should definitely order this sweet drink!
And they have free wi-fi and free power charge, so lots of people opening their laptop in the shop. This atmosphere makes me more concentrate on the tasks, that's another reason I go this place.
author: Rika N.

description:
I love their coffee beans! I live in Abu Dhabi, & it's nearly impossible to find quality beans here. I like making cold brew in a french press & having iced coffee ready to go. The best coffees I've found for cold brew are Ethiopian.

I got some Ethiopian Yirgacheffe, & I totally mispronounced it. I got a little snark about that, but not too much. Thanks Philz barista guy for minimizing the snark.

I bought an ample supply & brought it back with me in my luggage. It's almost gone. I'm off to NYC next, so I am hoping I can find beans as good as Philz in NYC.
author: Julia T.

description:
The original Philz Coffee. Not much to say other than thank you thank you thank you thank you for introducing me to how coffee should be made and help hating Starbucks even more. 

9 out of 10 visits i will get the mint iced mojito, its just that damn good but recently i have ventured into trying the gingersnap coffee which is a great hot drink (made cold), as well as their dark roast coffee. This location is a few blocks from the BART station and open til 8 pm in the weekdays i believe.
author: Daanyaal K.

description:
Ahh, the infamous Philz Coffee. I travelled to the bay area for the first time with my boyfriend and had to try this place out.

As expected with anywhere in Mission, this place was definitely hipster. It was packed and would be confusing if it wasn't for the signage that directed traffic. I found this very different, but you order with the barista first (they even let you taste your drink for any adjustments!) and then pay. The cashier asks you what you ordered in order to charge you so I guess they have a great trust in customers...People back home would definitely take advantage of that.

A little background story - my boyfriend is NOT a coffee drinker. He never has been and always makes a face when I trick him into drinking coffee. However, when he tried that Mint Mojito Iced Coffee, he decided that he could definitely become a coffee drinker someday. It's that good. I was surprised as well at how well the flavors blended together.

I got the Philtered Soul, which is a medium roast with hazelnut, cocoa, and syrup (?) notes. It was recommended by the barista who took my order (a very apathetic fellow) and tasted exactly as described. However, when he said "cream and regular sweetness ok?" I said yes without thinking and ended up with a beverage that was slightly too creamy and sweet for me. If I ever end up here again, I'll definitely get less sweet and ask for a milk substitute.

I wish we had Philz Coffee at home.
author: Pim Y.

description:
Philz makes me wish I liked coffee. The drinks smell warm and inviting, and everyone raves about this place.

But nope, I don't like coffee. Every time I taste it, I am confirmed of my opinion. I don't even like anything remotely coffee flavored (i.e. tiramisu). On the plus side, I save money because I don't drink it. 

So instead, I get tea. Last time I got a cup of Istanbul tea- a combination of black tea, green tea, cardamon, and anise. Unique flavor I enjoyed. I'll get it again.
author: Joanna L.

description:
Time changes and apparently attitudes too. My most recent visits to the Philz on the embarcadero and the one in the mission have been great. The staff is extremely friendly and clearly cares. There's a hipster feel at all Philz but hey that's the charm. 

As for the coffee it is still spot on and delicious. Philz is good and that is the truth.
author: Joseph M.

description:
I swear not be easy with 5 star ratings. I swear not to be easy with 5 star ratings. 

The mint mojito here changed my life!!! I don't think it's really coffee but that they put coca leaves and other addictives into it. Laurie and I bought a Chemex kit to make a copy of it, but even with fresh mint it is absolutely not the same.

Come after noon to reduce the line time. Unless you like line time.
author: Tatiana G.

description: Had Philz Coffee for the first time today and loved it! I had the mint mojito iced coffee and the flavor was amazing. I got it with no sugar and light on the cream. There were several baristas handling each persons coffee. I didn't have to wait too long. I'll be back for sure!
author: Alan O.

description:
always so pleasant is the staff whenever i visit.  this has got to be that other happiest place on earth.  and it damn sure is when you walk out with a MINT MOJITO!  people, please do yourself a favor and have one if you haven't already.  you will thank me later... repeatedly!!!  

a friend recently asked me to have one for her during my trip up north.  i was looking forward to my MOCHA TESORA, which i did have on two out of my three visits last week.  a Mint Mojito iced coffee... i thought, "hmm that doesn't sound or seem like a particularly good combo... but a lot of people are raving about it.  i guess i'll try one, but i will miss my mocha... or should i get both??" hmmm and even more speculation enters my mind.  with a deep breath and lots of doubt i reluctantly let the words "Mint Mojito" escape my lips as the barista takes my order.

the line was out the door on this sunny day in the Mission.  it took about 25 minutes before i got my coffee, but it was well worth the wait.  and when i did get it....  all it took was one sip to convert me.  wow, i had been seriously missing out.  order one today folks, you won't regret!!!  my only regret was i didn't order two!
author: Angela A M.

description: It's my first time in the Philz on Folsom,  Wow what a great open room with windows and light and all the community tables that encourage actual talking.  The coffee is awesome but the barista's friendly and kind smiles make this room feel special! Love it!
author: Chris T.

description:
On a recent five day trip in San Francisco, we stayed a block away from this Philz location and came every single morning to try their coffees. So many options! Light, medium, dark, iced, with mint or without. It was fun just looking at their comprehensive menu! 

The set up is definitely confusing with the line starting in the back of the shop. Also unfortunately we found some of the baristas to be extremely pretentious. I actually overheard two LOUDLY talking to one another as they worked about how stupid some past customers have been, laughing and shaking their heads. Really? In front of other customers? How about you just wait until the work day is over to act that rudely...

Anyway, the coffee itself was pretty excellent and kept us coming back. It's hot water and coffee in a single filter for every cup. While here we tried the ginger snap iced coffee (Christmas in a cup), tesora, ambrosia, philharmonic, and philtered soul (favorite). Definitely check out Philz if you are a coffee lover!
author: Sol C.

description:
What an amazing thing it is to have a barista just for you! The coffee is some of the best I've had (next to Barefoot) and is prepared individually for you through percolation. I highly recommend that you try it but be prepared for a crowded and noisy environment. 

PS The people watching here is great ;).
author: Dani C.

description:
Being from LA, I wasn't aware that I was about to get my socks knocked off when I first entered Philz Coffee. 

I was overwhelmed by the number of options, and the level of depth in the flavor description. I ended up picking the Philtered Soul, owing to my love of hazelnut, and it was AMAZING! It was so good, I ended up going thrice in the three days I was there. I also tried the Tesora, which was great too! The baristas were super friendly and will help you if you're baffled. They also ask you to try your drink and offer to change it to your liking. Loved the service! 

Left SF with a heavy heart. Thankfully Philz Coffee is in Santa Monica as well, will probably head over soon!
author: Shweta M.

description:
The mocha tesora was good and the overall vibe at this Philz was authentic. But, I'm coming from DC and stopped here because I heard this was the best coffee in SF. I have to say that I would put a few DC coffeeshops ahead of this one easily, because they're bigger, and they draw in more people who want to socialize. People here seem to want to just grab the coffee and go, but I feel like they miss out on the expeience of the coffeeshop. Makes me wonder what the people of SF are up to & where they're all rushing to go.

tldr; good, but not as good as DC.
author: Claude G.

description:
Of all the Philz, this is without a doubt my favorite location. 

Located on a boppin' corner in the Mission district,  Philz will catch your eye with an undeniable sense of quality and comfort. Each cup of coffee is made to order and I've never had a barista or baristabro whom I didn't want to hug for their mad brewing skillz and kindness.

My go-to for a regular cup of premium joe is the Jacob's Wonderbar. It's perfectly balanced and I taste zero acidity - only notes of earthy sweetness!

The mocha tesora is out of this world if you're craving something sweet... But not too sweet. Ya dig?

I know I would spend a large majority of my life here if I lived in SF.

PS- there's a vintage looking piano in the middle of the shop.
author: Sarah M.

description:
This is the original Philz. It just got a slight remodel on the counters so Phil himself can be seen every so often. It's not as nice as some of the other Philz locations but it is part of the Mission and blends in perfectly. 

It's very hot inside so I usually get my coffee and sit outside to people watch or go somewhere else. 

MINT MOJITO ICED COFFEE
this is the most popular coffee drink and also my favorite. They have real fresh mint and served in a regular hot cup, so you don't have any condensation. Stick a straw in it and your good to go. The coffee is smooth, light, and refreshing. 

Chairs and furniture are sparse since it's always packed. The church pew is for people waiting for their drink and is a great idea.
author: Debby L.

description:
ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS PLACE!!! 

I got the mint mojito latte and it's by far my most favorite drink. Honestly I'm not a big coffee person but this drink was both refreshing and tasty. Not too sweet, not over powered by coffee, and had a hint of mint. It was just right. 

I will definitely be ordering this again.
author: Alexa T.

description:
Mission location earned the title OG. You got grit, character and down home quality. No matter what your successes has been you've stayed true and grounded. 

Spotted Phil himself just hanging. Love that guy. Down to earth. Just like his brew. I can tell. He is loved by all.  Been to many Philz locations I've got to say, the Original Gangsta has got the most personality. Often imitated never duplicated.
author: Michelle B.

description: Let's see...so my first Philz experience was at the Marina from the Philz truck. Then I went to the San Mateo location and finally to the original location in the mission district. News flash. They're all amazing. I can't write anything that probably hasn't been written already so let's just say that when you're looking for a coffee place or just something to do, don't be surprised if you think "hey, wonder if Philz is open?" FYI most are open till 8ish on weekdays and sometimes on weekends.
author: Joshua F.

description:
Mint Mojito Coffee. The end.

If you're visiting the Bay area, you must try it. It's sweet, creamy and quite heavy but deliciously flavored with fresh mint inside the drink. So refreshing on a nice warm day! I'm from Seattle so I haven't tried anything else, but next time I be looking forward to try some standard coffee.
author: Tina Y.

description:
The coffee is so damn good you'll drop the F bomb !
Tony S. Is the only reason I drink coffee .
Him alone can make all the difference to your day !
author: Michael Y.

description:
Snooty staff and only OK coffee.

I had been to Philz before for tea and thought it was an OK, local cafe to grab a drink. However, the last time I went my experience was not pleasant. I wanted an iced latte, and when I ordered that, the guy behind the bar asked me, have you been here before? Yes, I had been there before. He then got all snooty and explained that they only serve drip coffee. Wouldn't it have been easier to just say they don't have espresso? Finally he confirmed they do serve iced coffee. When my coffee was ready, the first thing that came to my mind after I took a sip was, bitter.  A guy I was dating went in there by himself to buy something and got the same kind of snooty treatment from the guys behind the counter. That's quite a bit of attitude coming from someone who works at a coffee shop.
author: Rebecca J.

description:
Great coffee selection! There's a little cup o' joe waiting for everyone! I generally get its famous mint mojito (it's best with cream and sweetener). The service has always been friendly. This last time I went, I got the almond croissant and they burned the first one. The one I ended up getting was a little extra toasted but still tasty. One guy in the kitchen came out and checked on the second to make sure it wasn't too burnt. I appreciated the gesture. 

It gets crowded quick so don't be surprised. (The bathroom at this location doesn't lock properly...)
author: Sola L.

description:
Our son has been talking about Philz since he moved to the city. Although some of our favorite spots are located within a couple blocks of this venerated coffee house, I'd never stopped into Philz until recently. 

The store, in the "real Mission" on 24th St. would have been right at home on the set of Dirty Harry. The gritty ambiance of the place is old-school, and you'll notice right away that Philz is vastly different from the fad pour-over coffee houses that are popping up all over the city. The funky decor, quick but attentive service ("would you like cream/sugar added to your coffee?"), cool but not trendy location all get brewed up into a congenial cup. It's worth it! 

The down & dirty:
    Brew - 5 - old style, new taste.
    Service - 4 - they're on the ball, add the cream & sugar too!
    Value - 4 - expensive but worth it
    Setting - 5 - If you like the Mission you'll love it. 
    Date worthy - 4. St.Francis Fountain, Balmy St. murals and Napper Tandy are nearby. You won't need the car for hours!
author: John H.

description:
Delicious handmade coffee.  Each cup made individually, but this also leads to long lines.

Limited seating and grungy atmosphere at this location between Potrero Hill and Mission.  Friendly staff.

Try the ecstatic iced coffee - a chilled mix of the last few drops of the day's previous orders.
author: Greg B.

description:
This Philz Coffee shop is busy all around the clock!

With fresh brew used for each coffee ordered up, I simply love the Philz chain.

Entering this spot, you can feel that the surrounding is urban and earthly, entirely - from top to bottom.  There is even the restroom that has colorful graffiti all over it!  The dining tables are very communal, there are side comfy couches and a corner piano.

I was digging the down to earth atmosphere the entire time I was here. 

I am definitely Phil-ling it!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
I am not a coffee person, until I tried Phil Jaber's (Founder of Philz Coffee) Mint Mojito Iced Coffee. One sip and I was sold. The crushed mint along with that fresh coffee is just amazing. The mint brought a truly unique blend to the coffee. Refreshing and not too overwhelming. Once again I am not a coffee person, but this drink really did work to entice my taste buds.

Ambiance: You can't miss it. It's right off of the corner. The place can occupy about 20+ people, it's not too loud so bring your book, hw, or laptop. It's a great place to work or simply conversate.

**Tip: Upsize, it's worth the 50 cents.**
author: Leland S.

description:
Nommmmmmmm. Much coffee. So good. Wow.

Get the mint mojito iced coffee is a good choice for a first try. Wikihow has a pretty comprehensive list "how to" order from Philz. Check it out!
author: Larry F.

description: This review isn't even necessary as Philz already has a clear following but I have to write it. Philz Coffee on 24th & Folsom is the best coffee I've had on the West Coast. Every time I bring someone who hasn't been yet they walk out a believer as well. The pour overs are not like the typically acidic tasting roasts, I don't know what it is- but they get it! They know how to make a full bodied roast! I'm from Sacramento and would only visit this shop about every other month and the barista remembered me ! He would shout out, "Sacramento" ! Now that's service ! My corner starbucks doesn't even get that. I just dig this shop, company, and respect for good roasts.
author: Kerri P.

description: Where do i begin first and foremost i deliver across the street and came across philz coffee shop and i love it very good customer service sufficient staff very friendly good set up store cleanliness was excellent i had the red sea coffee and a hot chocolate ...and both were very good im greatful i came across this cool little shop i will be stopping by more often :)
author: Johnny S.

description: Pretty good coffee with a slight wait. The addition of fresh mint doesn't always work out great though
author: Ariah C.

description:
I already knew that Philz Coffee was good so I had to see for myself. As soon as I arrived, there was a line. Had to wait about 10 minutes to order. 

When I finally ordered, the barista was very welcoming! He was very enthusiastic and was very cool with everyone. 

When he was done with my drink, I went to taste it and it was amazing! The mint mojito ice coffee had that mint flavor with just enough sweetness to it.  Best coffee I've ever had. I left with a satisfied feeling and thanked the barista. 

WILL DEFINITELY come back here.
author: Nick C.

description: I was placing an order for somebody else, and I was chatting up with the beautiful lady who works there and I had told her that this was my first time here and that I had a long day ahead of me. She offered me to try out the coffee for free and it was delicious! It kept me energized all day! I forgot the name and flavor of the kind she gave me, but I will definitely be going back to ask her and to get another one. That coffee was delicious! Now that I'm trying other coffee spots in the Bay Area, I'm starting to feel like the others when they say Starbucks and Peete's are way overrated! Lol!
author: Michael M.

description: The coffee here is some of the best in the bay. It's way better than Starbucks. I don't recommend the chai, but when you come to Philz, you come for coffee, not typically tea. The Tesora is my regular, but this time I tried the Jacobs Wonderbar with hazelnut and it was fantastic! Give it a try. They also have really yummy vegan donuts here. People here are always nice and I typically make a new friend each visit. Enjoy
author: Samantha D.

description:
This place was awesome! I went when it was on the tail end of their morning rush and they had four individual "baristas" of sorts calling people up individually to take there order. 

The server that helped me out was very nice and made sure my coffee was just to my liking before I took off. I had the Mocha Tesora which I got less sweet than they usually make it. It was delicious! The chocolate came through in the perfect way. 

The ambiance of this place was also something uniquely its own from what I've gotten from most coffee shops. It wasn't in anyway snarky or full of itself. I'll be back when I'm in town.
author: Justin A.

description: My first time to be here, a nice place to have fun. Her coffee is really... special.  I haven't had mint taste coffee before.
author: Juno W.

description: Pretty good coffee with a slight wait. The addition of fresh mint doesn't always work out great though
author: Mariam W.

description:
I came here yesterday the first time, I been the SOMA location, Van ness, Golden Gate and South San Francisco.  I think this location is quirky and cool because Phil has his fire fighter Helment on display here and I saw Phil sitting outside talking to 2 police officers! Yes, I resisted the temptation to take a selfie with them in the background in front of the Philz coffee location LOL~! My only complaint is that I ordered my coffee, paid for it and was waiting for like 10 minutes until I finally asked where is my coffee!  The girl who was making my coffee forgot what she was doing while doing other things.  She said I am so sorry, I am such a space case, sorry I forgot about your drink! She gave me a free drink card for next time, which was nice.  

As far as the location its not so far to walk from 24th Mission bart station. I like that there are benches outside so you can sit and chill.  Inside is small and not that much seating.
author: Alix J.

description:
I should really update this review. I've been back a few times, and the service is much better. Elitist barista either quit or was fired. Who knows, but he's GONE. YAY!

There's almost always a line here (seriously came at 6:30AM and there was a line), but it moves pretty quickly. I've gotten more eco-friendly as of late, and it's helped with my cost too! They'll fill UP your coffee mug with coffee AND ONLY CHARGE $3!! Best. Deal. EVER. I've had places only fill up my mug 1/2 way. I mean...given, my mug holds 4 cups of coffee, but still.
author: Lily W.

description:
The first time i heard of Philz was a couple of years ago on my Facebook wall. Everyone was talking about like it was new and all of a sudden it grew like wildfire. I am not a coffee drinker and ever after Philz i probably wont be, but dang that is one tasty drink. 

This review would reflect my first experience at Noe valley and at this location. The method of hand made coffee is interesting, because it must take forever in the morning and you have a million customers. Since im not a coffee drinker i order the mint mojito, which i would expect that people who normally order fraps from Starbucks would gravitate to the mint mojito first. I had it sweet and creamy which apparently is the way to go - i thought the originally said dreamy and creamy lol 

It is a beautifully made drink with the fresh mint on top to garnish. What it taste like are those bottled frap drinks from Starbucks, but creamier, fresh-er, minty-er and way better. I would probably get shot mentioning both names in the same review. 

My only thing with this drink is there a lot of solids in the cup that takes up space, so i wish there was more liquid. When i finished my cup - it had a filter of mint leaves and ice. 

Overall this place meets the hype and i congratulate Phil and his success.
author: Ryan R.

description:
I tried Philz a few years ago and didn't get the hype at the time. Recently, I was in the area looking to try Knead Patisserie, and gave them another go... Helloooooo mint mojito iced coffee!!! Call me a convert, a fanatic, totally obsessed... The dark and rich mocha tesora is another delicious option, but there's something about the refreshing, creamy mint mojito that makes my morning 10x better. 

Tip: Get in line, order, pay, then wait as your own personal barista makes your drink to order. Don't go taking a drink by the same name from a different barista... It's not yours!
author: Pauline D.

description:
Nice independent coffee spot with a unique approach to coffee blends.  They offer 20-30 custom blends and then advise you on which might suit the preferences you share with your individual coffee consultant.

Then you take a seat and they brew you up a cup.  Mine was outstanding and really delivered the flavors mentioned in the blend's description.  I also loved that they do the cream and sugar for you.

Reconsider weating your start-up's hoodie/wind breaker on your outing here or an activist might throw a pie in your face.
author: Patrick S.

description:
Have now visited their location in the Tenderloin and this one, and loved them both for very different reasons. This review of for their flagship store, so I'll stick to that. 

It's a fun, funky, older coffee shop that is obviously well loved and used by the locals. Lining up was confusing (even with signage) because people just stood anywhere while waiting for their drink. So. Look at the sign, and walk behind it to get in line. A barista will wave you to their station, ask you what you want, and make it from scratch (including grinding the coffee beans). Sit on the benches behind you and wait. You'll then be asked to move back forward to taste it, make sure it's perfect, and if it is, move to the cash register to pay for your drink and any other treats you may desire. Sounds easy... Let's just say it was super confusing when I went. 

Other than that, the staff were amazingly helpful, kind, and loved making suggestions that might better my brew. I didn't want to sit inside, it seemed a bit dingy and worn, but there weren't any free seats anyway so it's moot! 

I preferred the Tenderloin location (what can I say, the lineup was much easier to figure out, and it's a huge, new, trendy space). Still loved it here, and will be back.
author: Bonny A.

description:
I was initially planning on trying out a different cafe, but I ended up walking in the wrong direction....so I went to Philz! I wasn't complaining.

Service is quirky but really friendly. I ordered a ice coffee mojito for myself and sat down to write some papers. I love the strange, coziness of the place. I find it easy to get my work done there. If you're the type who can't work in noisier environments, this place might not be for you if you want to study...but it's a great place to get coffee!

I am honestly addicted to the iced coffee mojitos. Soooo good.
author: Sofia R.

description: Priscilla at this location is the coolest! She was really quick and still made an effort to make me feel special and welcomed in the store. She made me my silken splendor with mainly almond milk and a splash of cream perfectly!
author: Mariam D.

description:
Wait, what? i didn't yet review the original!?
YE Fail.

Anyway this place is great - its no corporate -standardized - cookie cutter coffee place. 
This place screams authenticity whether you like it or not.

And you like it. B/C even if you say you dont - you quietly appreciate the realness.

Now i could go into all the handcrafted magic and the uniqueness of all the roasts. But - aint no one got time for that.

I dont care if its cold or hot - get the mojito. 

You're welcome.
author: Oleg H.

description:
I'm not a coffee drinker at all. I can count on one hand how many times I drink coffee within a year, but when a friend recommended I check out Philz while in San Francisco for the weekend, I thought why not? I'm so glad I did! I became hooked and had to come back a second time before I went back home.

I got the mint mojito iced coffee. At $4 for a small cup, it's a little more than what I am used to paying for coffee but it is worth it! We came on a Friday afternoon so there was barely a line. You place your order first, get your drink, then pay. The baristas are all very nice and genuinely look like they're enjoying their job. Each coffee is crafted to perfection and they really take their time to make sure it is yummy. My barista asked me if I wanted it creamy/sweet/or minty. I was clueless so he said they usually make it a mix between creamy and sweet. 

When I got the coffee, it was very creamy with a little hint of coffee. I love that because I don't like it when there's too strong of a coffee taste. It was also very minty with lots of basil leaves in the cup. Now I just wish they would have a Philz in OC. =( I may become a coffee drinker then!
author: Wendy H.

description:
Dear everyone:coffee mojito is not coffee.

Everything in to-go cups.
The coffee maker tried to tell me that while they don't have espresso, what he would make would be pretty much the same, all in a pretentious tone. He proceeded to make a huge 16 ounce filter coffee. Is this guy for real?

Like a Starbucks as far as what they serve (more milk and sugar than coffee) just not a national chain.

Overrated hype, again in SF.
author: Jackie P.

description:
I can't figure out what it is about Philz. I don't drink coffee. I don't live in the Mission. And Philz is never REALLY on my way to where I want to go; but there is something about Philz that always makes others beckon me in...and every single time I'm disappointed. 

Phil sometimes is sitting there with his hat on, talking with people and I want to talk to him directly but this is what Yelp is for, right? Talking behind his back as a service? 

Speaking of service it always is confused. Go there, not there, is this yours, someone ordered that, start over here, not there. Didn't you read the sign? Not that sign, this sign. 

Children seem to be commonly swarming around and sneezing on people or screaming. Parents must think this is the best place get away with filling up before daycare by dragging their monsters into Philz. Where do these super annoying privileged kids come from? Definitely not a chill and not a relaxed spot. You can feel the stress and anxiety, even while standing and waiting for the service to catch up.

Don't understand the obsession with throwing away paper. Watching the bar for a few minutes it's like seeing deforestation in action. Should have called it LandPhilz.

Anyway I'm told the reason to love this place is because someone else with a whole lot of money and no sense or compassion is a fan. Big corporations love this place. Blah blah. There are so many other places that are more chill, care about the environment (nothing fancy, just the basic stuff, yeah) and serve a great cup without confusion. No thanks. 

Nice hat though.
author: Mulberry S.

description: It was my bf's and my first time coming to Philz. When you walk in, you order with the barista first! You pay after you order. My boyfriend and I didn't know so we ordered/paid with the cashier. Later, we saw a sign that says to order with the barista first. I got the mint mojito iced coffee (medium sweet) with soy and my boyfriend got the mocha tesora with soy (lightly sweetened). I must say that the mint mojito was quite disappointing. Barely tasted any coffee and it tasted mainly of mint and water. Maybe I should've asked for it to be sweeter or something, but it just didn't fit my taste. The coffee didn't do anything for me as well. The mocha tesora was meh. I'm going to try it again one day though. Workers are very nice.
author: Jessica L.

description:
DUH! It's Philz! 5 stars goes without saying. 

Pro Tip:: if you like fancy booshie coffee drinks (ex: pumpkin spice whatever, vanilla mocha bean something or another) just tell these coffee pros what you're going for and they will pour you something similar (and probably better). 

Little known fact: CHAI IS OUTSTANDING at Philz. So now you can visit even when you don't want coffee. 

Overall- awesome coffee shop- maybe not the absolute best for a quiet work space. But hey! You can always grab a good cup of coffee at Philz and go across the street and study at Haus  =)
author: Sydney S.

description: The minty and sweet iced Istanbul Treat is the perfect drink for a sunny Sunday afternoon.
author: Amy C.

description:
Great coffee and atmosphere but the service is whats most astounding.

Free Wi-Fi, fast service, economical prices. Couldn't help but tip.
author: Stephen P.

description:
If you like specialty coffees this is the place to go.

This place has so many selections when it comes to coffee. In my opinion probably way too many. When it comes to their regular coffees I never have any idea what to order. One time I decided to give their Jamaican Blue Mountain a try and boy was that a mistake. I was up until 5am shaking on my couch. NEVER AGAIN! I also tried one of their other black coffees and it was just meh. I can safely say that Rituals coffee is much better. BUT when it comes to their specialty drinks they are all delicious especially because I have such a bad sweet tooth. Their Mint Mojito is my favorite, then again it's everyones favorite. I love that they use fresh mint leaves in this one. The people are always helpful and they have the best gluten free cookies at this location which is something I must always get to accompany my coffee. Like I said I have a sweet tooth.
author: Jacqueline C.

description:
This place was recommended on the Times magazine so we decided to go here. Place is hippy inside. :)

Ordered:

- black coffee of the day (I don't remember what it was called) - it was a medium roast, not too strong

- mint mojito iced coffee -- oh so good!!!! Not too creamy, not too sweet! Just the way I like it! 

Highly recommend this place!
author: Nhi R.

description:
This review may seem redundant seeing as San Francisco as a whole has come to a consensus that Philz is a delicious gem of the city. However, that will not stop me from praising this amazing coffee shop. Nay, caffeinated blessing.

I have never prided myself on being a big coffee drinker. I'm just in love with one. My boyfriend and I were exhausted from a long day of running around, exploring, and had mustered the last of our fuel to get to Philz. Boy were we both so glad we did.

We jumped on the iced coffee mojito bandwagon and never looked back. Initially, I wasn't even going to order anything. I just wanted to get a glass of water and go back to our hotel. Then I sipped down the majority of my partner's drink before being forced to face the reality that I'd have to order my own.

I'm a believer. I don't know you, Phil. But we're going to frequent your Santa Monica location when we get home!
author: Gabrielle W.
