description:
I stopped by here for the very first time 3 years ago to pick up some tea when I had morning sickness. The chamomile tea was good... but not life-changing. (One might have to travel to a coffee shop in Holland to obtain such a blend.)

The atmosphere and laid back pseudo-bohemian vibe makes Philz a great coffee shop.
author: Asha S.

description: Philz Coffee is awesome! The only reason I didn't give them 5 stars is that sometimes you have to wait a while to get your coffee since they use the pour over method, and you can't rush that. This time around I opted to try the Tesora (Notes of: Butter, Caramel, Nuts), and it was delicious. The coffee tastes very true to the tasting notes, and I preferred it black with a small splash of soy milk. Note that your barista is the one who puts sugar in for you, so you have to specify how much sugar (or none) that you want when you place your order.
author: Amy D.

description:
I highly recommend the ecstatic ice coffee as the baristas manage to perfectly balance the cream and sugar with the coffee blend. I typically skip sugar in coffee but here they do it just right (and ask you to taste it to verify you like it)

This is also probably the best place in town to get fresh beans as they offer a pound of the month for $14 whereas many competing stores charge more for only a 12 ounce bag.

They continue to raise tons of venture capital funding so hopefully they keep their soul as they expand.
author: Matthew G.

description:
Philz coffee is the best. Philharmonic (add a little cardamon in the filter with the grounds, top it with some fresh mint) is usually what I get. I have tried the mint mojito iced drink as well. It is good, has a ton of sugar (which is part of the drink). Don't think I could get it all the time, but on a hot day it would be amazing.  

I like to grab a pound of the month for $12 so I can make their coffee at home. 

I have never tried to hang out here but it looks like a lot of people do.
author: Alex C.

description:
I'm from the central valley and I've been dying to try this hyped up place. I was visiting family in the city and decided to stop by. I got the fan favorite mint mojito. And wow wow wow. If I had stayed in the store to drink it, I probably would have ordered another one, but unfortunately I took it to go. I got it iced, my mom ordered the same drink but hot. The barista warned us it wouldn't taste the same, and sure enough my mom didn't enjoy it as much as she hoped. But I appreciated the warning. 

However, I did not like the cashier guy. I came on Thursday around 6 pm and there was a female barista and a male cashier. The barista was so friendly and informative and patient (as it was my first time) and I wish I could give her 103910 stars. The guy at the register however was extremely unpleasant. I greeted him with a friendly hello and he replied back with a disgruntled "hi". He told me my total, I gave him my card, he swiped it and have it back and that was it. No "thank you have a good day" "hope to see you again" etc. Literally the only words he spoke to me were "hi" and "$8". I appreciate good customer service and he needs lots of work, hence the lack of a 2 stars.
author: Zeezee M.

description:
Had my first coffee at Philz yesterday, and boy - everyone was right! That coffee is good!!

My friend from work and I both had the 'Philterred Soul' which is a medium roast with Hazelnut hues. Delicious and made perfectly by our barista - I wish I knew her name to  give her a shout out. I mentioned to her that it was our first time there and she immediately recommended and explained the coffees to us. Although it's a completely hipster joint, I didn't feel SHE was pretentious or annoyed by our ignorance. I felt really welcomed - despite all the grouchy and dead faces on all the other 'cool' hipster customers in front of their laptops. Not speaking to each other. (too cool).

It seemed like the entire staff was friendly, and professional. The guy at the register was also super nice and gave us a wonderful and warm smile. IT makes all the difference!!!

Honestly, I prefer Philz to Blue Bottle. There, I said it. 

There is inside and outside seating, great location for people watching, and a bus stop on the corner. Will visit as often as possible - next time I'm definitely getting a bagel!
author: nina B.

description:
This is location I first had my first Philz coffee.  I love this location, it's grunginess and laidback feel.  The downside is dirty bathroom so unless you really have to use the bathroom or don't mind it, don't use it.  
Service is good here and fast.  I like chillen inside or outside to do some people watching.  My sister and her husband, then-fiance did part of their engagement photoshoot session here.  It had character.  Workers were cool about it doing some shoots inside their shop.  
I've tried few of their coffees and I'm a fan.  I usually get lightly sweetened with cream.  I think they have soymilk, but if you can't have cream or soy... I don't know if they'r added other options yet.  Mint mojito iced coffee seems to be better over here especially when the sun  is out.
author: Claire J.

description: The coffee was fantastic (Mint Mojito). I just wish there was an option to do things yourself.  Sometimes I want just the "right" amount of splenda and half&half.  But it's not that big a deal.
author: Shane F.

description: This is the best coffee you will ever taste! This is local, out of this world coffee. Staff is friendly, trained and efficient. Love it when Phil himself is drinking or serving coffee. There is no other coffee that can even compare with it.
author: Marge T.

description:
1st time at Philz and it had to be the original spot!

at 1st it was confusing trying to order but we easily figured it out

barista was really friendly after he made our orders he asked us to try them

we got the tesora and mint mojito

the mint mojito I really minty...he told I did not love it so he offered to make me something else; great customer service!
author: Karla ..

description:
Same Philz flavors, but with a little more attitude. 

This is like the punkier cousin of the Berkeley location. It almost looks as if Philz invaded a dive bar and didn't change any of the decor or furniture. I dig it. It fits with the grungy vibe of the Mission. 

One barista was really sweet and smiley and pleasant, and the Silken Splendor I ordered was tasty. I foolishly told them to leave out the sugar, so it was a lot stronger than I expected. I was too stubborn to go back inside and ask for sweetener. I felt like a badass, sipping on my bold brew at an outdoor table. 

Lots of cute dog-watching is to be had here, as I spotted at least half a dozen adorable pups that I would have loved to kidnap as my own. 

Free wifi is dope, but don't be that guy or girl that orders one drink and sits around on their laptop for three to four hours, especially when other people are looking for a seat. Go to a library or go home, please and thank you. 

Oh, and don't smoke your freaking cigarettes right out front. A couple sat at a table nearby and chain-smoked what looked like Nat Shermans. I wanted to scold them or ask them to move, but the afternoon was too tranquil for confrontation. 

A tiny bee sat on the edge of my cup, wandered around for a seconds. It seemed to drink a shot of my coffee. I watched it, intrigued. After a while, it buzzed off into the afternoon enthusiastically. I guess even the local wildlife needs to get their caffeine fix.
author: Brandi W.

description:
After traveling from NY to visit my friend in SF, I was almost rushed to come to philz after my friend forcefully insisted that I try their mint mojito iced coffee. He claimed it would change my life. A bit extreme, not going to lie, but it was pretty damn close. 

The mint mojito iced coffee was one of the most tasty drinks that I've had in a long time. Perfect balance of mint, coffee, and the mojito-ey taste was blatant as I took the first sip. I ended up buying the large for 50cents extra for the remainder of my trip. Seriously awesome stuff. Def would be looking for this the next time I visit.
author: Sung K.

description: Cup of Soooo Good make my day !! The Baristas are always nice. Love their Coffee!
author: Sam L.

description: If you are looking for local coffee, I would recommend you here. It was great but  a bit strong for me. Anyways, you should try mocha mojito ice coffee.
author: Pinarat S.

description: The customer service is always good here. I don't live in the city no more and I always make a stop back to this spot. I recommend the Mint Mojito or the Philtered Soul. You can't go wrong with these options!
author: Jason E.

description:
I'm strictly reviewing as a NON coffee aficionado. I am not super picky about coffee, particularly because I don't really like coffee, I'm more of a mocha gal with as much chocolate and milk to cover up the coffee flavor.

That being said, Philz has good mochas, I was able to order it with almond milk and the barista had me taste my drink to make sure it tasted right. I wanted it just a little sweeter and she made it perfect. I normally prefer my mochas with whip cream on top, wasn't sure if that was an option, but I also wanted to taste the drink itself without the sweetness of cream.

Overall I had a good experience, this was a pretty busy location but the wait wasn't too long. Will definitely try again!
author: Denise C.

description:
My friend recommended I go here for the Iced Mint Mojito Coffee during my recent trip to SF and I am so happy I did! It
 was simply divine!! Refreshing! Wonderful! Miss it already :(
author: Ming T.

description: Came to Philz while we were visiting family in the city. The line was long, but our coffees were worth the wait! I'm obsessed with drinks mixed with fresh herbs so I was in heaven with the Iced Mint Mojito Coffee. It was full of fresh mint, and was creamy and completely refreshing. Philz is officially a must-have when in San Francisco.
author: Hayley H.

description:
THIS PHILZ LOCATION IS THE BEST!!!!! The BARISTAS that make the drinks here are ON POINT! 

I  tried the 4298 Philz location and had to ask the Barista to add sugar to my Gingersnap Iced Coffee FOUR TIMES, but mind you... I asked for it to be really sweet upon ordering (somehow knowing that it would taste the same as the Mission location). 

Nonetheless the Philz on 24th and Mission is AMAZING and they understand how their specialties drinks should taste!

I will ONLY get coffee from this location!
author: Michelle F.

description:
OM NOM NOM SLURP SLURP 

They don't lie when they say that Philz is a definite go-to for coffee in norcal. You haven't lived until you have tried their mint mojito. The coffee tastes so fresh, and the service is amazing.

Steps to greatness:
1) wait in line..and there will be a line
2) wait to be greeted. your personal barista will take your order
3) pay at the register
4) enjoy! 

Don't try their chai. It's not that good, but their mint mojito is AMAZE.
author: Nicole L.

description: Love you, Philz! A bit further from my office than Atlas, Sightglass or Blue Bottle, but by far my favorite. More creative, more unique, and most importantly, more minty. A Philharmonic or Mint Mojito are my favorites, depending on the weather. It is older and has a funkier feeling than other Philz outposts, but it is always friendly and pleasant. Team Philz 4 Life!
author: Maria M.

description: What can I say about Philz coffee - it is in a class by itself. There is coffee and then there is Philz. Of all the over priced, cult coffees around this one is at the top of the food chain and well worth the price of a cup. This is the only place that can roast light, medium and dark coffee beans and do it to perfection. I buy Philz beans for home all the time and this place is the only place (yes, I am a self proclaimed coffee snub!) that can make a pour over better than I can. If you haven't tried it, you should!
author: Julia V.

description: This place is amazing! Super cozy (I'm sitting on the comfiest couch right now as I type). The set up is a bit new to me, you order from the barista at the end and pay down by the register after. Seems to be super effective at moving lines though! I got a large chai medium sweet with almond milk and I'm in love! It's PERFECT! I also got a vegan lemon espresso chocolate chip cookie and a chocolate croissant, both were gone so quickly it's like they didn't even exist! I love this place and will definitely be back!!
author: Makana S.

description: This was the first Philz Coffee I visited, and I was blown away. Not only is the coffee selection amazing (I especially appreciated the tasting-note explanations and how coffees were grouped according to flavors), but the service is what sets Philz apart from other coffee chains. The staff is extremely friendly and, in contrast to Starbucks, which is notorious for creative spelling variations of customers' names, waves at you when your drink is ready. I've only been to two Philz locations so far (the other being in Los Angeles), but each time I was told that if I didn't like the drink, they'd be happy to make me a new one. I've still yet to try Blue Bottle, but given the high quality of the coffee beans here (the coffees are extremely smooth and express a wide range of flavors) and the welcoming service, I can see myself frequenting Philz much more often in the future.
author: Jacqueline K.

description: I had ice mint mojito and it was delicious! I liked the interior and love the location. I highly recommend! :)
author: Ji S.

description:
A limerick for Phil:

There once was an epicure called Phil,
Whose caffeinated concoctions were a thrill.
The lauded Tesora with sprigs of mint,
Could make even snails start to sprint,
Do you dare to ask for a refill?
author: Joanna M.

description:
Do you want fancy leaf and heart designs in your almond-milk cappuccino? Go to Blue Bottle or Sightglass.

Do you want a tall, dark and delicious cup of regular-ass coffee? Philz is your guy.

There's a ton of choices on the menu, which can be a bit intimidating. But they break them down by roast (dark-medium-light; light has the most caffeine) and by flavor profile, which makes it easier to pick one that suits your mood. The baristas are friendly and the atmosphere is down-to-earth. They make each cup by hand so you're going to wait a little longer than you would at Starbucks. Use this time to take a deep breath and consider how nice the weather is.

I've cycled through a few different flavors (varietals? blends?), and landed on Canopy of Heaven. One barista recommended this to me, citing that CoH was the reason they filled out a job application.

$4 for a large seems a bit pricey, but it's well worth it.
author: Andrew R.

description:
Best coffee I've ever sampled. Mint Mojito coffee is sublime.  Ether, for dark drinkers, is also high in quality as well as flavor.  I don't doubt that the other options are any less in quality since each cup is made to order. Line can be long but bear with it... its worth the wait in this hippy décor.

Can't wait to get my next cup!
author: Andy P.

description:
I saw a woman with a cup of Philz then walked by. I decided to stop in. They had two baristas with their own stations. My barista recommended the Tesoro for me. I went black because they put in the cream and sugar for you. 

The space is awesome. It's a den with couches, tables, and benches. You can bring your laptop to do work here. As I was working around Mission, I realized there are tons of little shops like this one, but this is nice and spacious and there are tons of coffee options.
author: Julie L.

description: Philz, what's more can I say? I really love ecstatic ice coffee, with less sugar and cream. In this occasion my barista gave me free chai! He's so nice and make a good coffee too :).
author: Gabriella S.

description: The coffee here is good and the place is cozy. Lots of art and people coming in and out. The mojito (mint leaves in the coffee) is good but i feel the coffee doesn't actually have the taste unless you bite the leaf while drinking.
author: Raquel R.

description: The perfekt stop for an experience, and good coffee. The barristas will recommend to your preference and mood. Well Worre a pitstop herr.
author: Mikkel V.

description: Makes much more sense here than in Palo Alto. Very friendly, very human, with lots of loving customers.
author: Tim S.

description: Delicious. Honestly and ridiculously good. Visiting SF from LA and decided to explore, ended up here and so stoked about it. Because of the myriad of options on the menu, we asked one of the baristas for her opinion. Liz was so helpful and she was super friendly. I wish I had a magical refill button because I just want more Tantalizing Turkish in my life. Worth it.
author: A P.

description: This is what I thought of when I imagined coming to San Francisco! Great coffee shop with an awesome variety of roasts for your coffee. The Barista's are very knowledgable, so don't be afraid to let them make you their favorite coffee. You will not be disappointed. My husband got the mint mojito iced coffee and it was amazing!!!! For a hot option, the Philtered Soul was very good.
author: Amanda K.

description:
Coffee brewed by the cup, while you wait. 

On my last day in San Francisco, we walked by this shop, and I knew I had to try it. Such a cute place, with beautifully painted walls, a large open space, comfy couches, and everything else a neighbourhood coffee shop should encompass. 

I was totally new to this, and was a bit overwhelmed when I saw the vast selection of coffee brews available. The helpful cashier then helped me pick a brew, and even processed my order so I could just line up to order with the barista. 

The ordering system is efficient, there are 4-5 baristas, each with their own station, so you just go up to the next available one. I got a Tesora blend, and asked for cream and honey. Waited for about 10 minutes, and my coffee was ready. I was asked to give it taste and make sure it was ok before I left with it, which I though was very nice of them.

And so I took one sip. Wow. Smooth creamy, and just the perfect sweetness. The flavour of the coffee was warm and soo good.

 I wanted my cup of coffee to last forever.
author: Vincci L.

description:
I had no idea this was the first location that had started it all! So when I went in today I took a good look around to check out the place comparing it to the other locations I've been (Westborough, Sansome Street, Noe Valley) to.

I ordered Philtered Soul - Philz way. It was great! Exactly how I enjoy my caffeine. 

The service was great, super friendly, definitely a chill place to hang out if you want just 'YOU' time and have no one bug you; THROW on some headphones and you are good to go! Especially with the variety of seatings available to choose from to be comfy.
author: Eva H.

description: Coffee, atmosphere and staff are wonderful!!! On vacation and had to come back for a second visit. Would love to try more of their coffees! Comfortable chairs and couched for plopping down with a good book. Love this place!
author: Wendy C.

description:
OMG this is what coffee is supposed to taste like. Listen to the yelp reviews and get the iced mint mojito.

Philz please come down to Los Angeles!!
author: Jennie K.

description:
Stepping into Philz in SF was a little like entering a different type of territory or environment -- felt *VERY* Berkeley to me, and that's not a bad thing! Very busy, but cozy, liberal, suave, kinda jazzy-hip-hop. Many seats midday, post haircut, but all were taken -- they get good business!

I ordered an Iced Mint Mojito Coffee! They had all sorts of creative offerings for flavors, and this cup was actually served with several mint leaves in the top. Amusing, enjoyable and very affordable.

This was the first Philz location that ever came into existence, I believe, so I'm glad their reach has expanded much farther now throughout the peninsula with new spots popping up. Folks need to know there's more to coffee than "just" Starbucks or Peet's -- residents of SF sure do, but outside the City's borders? The training starts now!
author: Garett T.

description:
This was the second time I have been to this location when visiting the bay area and I have found in both time the customer service and the product to be spot on excellent.The person Emily was upbeat,friendly,never made me feel rushed and really took the time to make sure my order was to my liking,and it was.
Great Job Emily
author: Fred S.

description:
I love coffee. Coffee loves me. Together, we can do wonderful things. The fog is lifted from my brain, I know not to wash my hair with lotion, and I actually understand what people are saying to me.

I love drinking the stuff, but I don't know much about what goes into making a great cup of coffee. I honestly don't know much about anything until you put that cup in my hand.

Thank god for Philz and their handmade coffee. 

I walked in there one hot afternoon and the barista recommended the Ecstatic Iced Coffee and it was perfect in every way. I love iced coffee to begin with, because I don't have to wait for it to cool down before I inhale the whole thing. But the coffee itself, which was a blend of four different coffee beans, was delicious and strong without being too acidic.  And to make it even more refreshing, there was a little sprig of mint in it. Nice touch.

There's no way they're gonna get your coffee wrong since you can taste it in front of your barista and have them adjust it until you're happy.

Leave all the coffee magic to Philz. And you just focus on making sure your shoelaces are tied.
author: Racquel N.

description:
The health/cleanliness score of 88 may be optimistic. However, the atmosphere is in keeping with the nature of the neighborhood and it is clear from the patron's wardrobe the locals call this place "home". Sitting on a busy corner at 24th street the cafe is at hipster ground zero.  The staff is friendly and helpful and coffee is made fresh to order. 

I felt like I was in one of those tucked away corners in Brooklyn or the Lower East Side. A rare occurrence for me in this city that is California's orange to New York state's apple. 

Given the alternative, cookie cutter chains with their over priced food and shameless merchandising, I felt like I had found a slice of coffee paradise - paradise in the "real" world with all of its grubby reality and unrepentant hypocrisies.  

Unfortunately the only way to improve their health score may be through a gut renovation - the layers of grime on the floors, walls and ceilings seemed to have been collecting there since the Carter administration.  The staff fit in so well one might wonder if they were literally born for this role.  Carrying with them an aura of hipster laissez faire they might profit from a thorough scrub down and trip to the laundry mat - they should have no problem collecting quarters from the always full tip jar. 

Sip the coffee, absorb the atmosphere and ignore some of the details surrounding you. Welcome to coffee paradise.
author: Anthony H.

description: There isn't another business I've checked into more than the Philz on 24th (being a block away from home only adds to my bad behavior...hah). The coffee at Philz is great, and the employees always seem to be having a good time, that generates an overall good vibe. Being a regular, I seem to have my go-to barista. That bring me to Tony S.--on a warm day he makes a killer ice coffee, and at other times he helps me experiment with what typically happens to be the first beverage of my day. Thanks Tony, and Philz :)
author: Vivek N.

description: It's pricy, but it's delicious. I loved the Tesora coffee (it's a nutty buttery drink). Absolutely delicious. I wasn't in love with the mint mojito iced coffee (is that a sin?). I tried because of multiple recommendations and great reviews but I definitely enjoyed the Tesora better! It's a unique drink though and worth a try. I also liked that the barista was willing to make the drink just right and made sure to check with us before handing us the drinks. Will be back!
author: Anita O.

description:
Not your ordinary coffee shop.  Flag down a barista, make your order, and proceed to the cash register to pay.  I messed up that process (went to the cash register to make an order.)

Iced mint mojito coffee- doesn't that sound divinely refreshing?  I forked over $4- a real fourbucks experience- for a small cup.  But as a Dunkin' Donuts gal, I'd probably enjoy a version of a synthetic shamrock coffee more.  At this point, you may choose to continue reading my review or not, now that you know my 'standards.'  ;-)  

The drink was prepared lovingly with real mint leaves.  I was allowed to adjust sweetness when the barista asked if it tasted right.  It did, more or less!  But perhaps I found the price too painful for a coffee I did not absolutely love.      

Great hipster vibe, though!
author: Miran C.

description:
This is my favorite Philz location. Sure there may not be a lot of seats and it takes a good minute to get to the Mission from the Sunset, but I love it here. It was my first Philz experience so this place holds a special place in my heart. 

My favorites = iced mint mojito and the Philharmonic. 

Plus, I got to meet Phil! That man awesome.
author: Devy E.

description: As a first time customer, I accidentally told the cashier the wrong drink order (since there's a unique way of ordering at Philz vs other cafes), resulting in underpaying for a specialty drink. When I realized my mistake, I went back to the register to pay the difference, and they told me to enjoy my coffee and pay it forward. I'm now a regular!
author: Christine F.

description: There is no better coffee than Philz. Phil took decades perfecting his coffee, and it shows! I come here almost every morning for my Philtered Soul and the service is always excellent. All of the baristas are really friendly and they almost always get my drink just right the first try, and if not I just ask for a dash more cream. Today I met Phil himself and it's so clear how passionate he is about Philz Coffee. I'll never stop coming here! This location can get pretty crowded on the weekends but the staff always keeps the line moving.
author: Lauren A.

description:
I have been to several different coffee shops and haven't encountered one that actually serves up an actual cup of Jamaica Blue Mountain Coffee. Philz Coffee is one of my go to coffee shops for coffee, the servers are friendly and coffee is 100% pure fresh drip. This coffee shop is unique, creamer and sugar is added to your coffee by the person preparing your cup of coffee.

Tried coffee, mocha and latte from other coffee shops?

Looking for a new experience by trying coffee from a different coffee shop, Philz Coffee is your spot. Overall, I enjoyed my first time here at Philz Coffee so I am definitely coming back. I like the fact that Philz is the one coffee shop serving Jamaica Blue Mountain Coffee. I also like how some beverages here at Philz Coffee come with the mint leaf. This is something I don't recall seeing other coffee shops do, so Philz is very unique for this idea.

I am craving for another cup of Jamaica Blue Mountain Coffee as I write this review!

Philz Coffee - thank you for that warm cup of Jamaica Blue Mountain Coffee!
author: Bennett W.

description:
Well I am not into coffee, but my friend thinks that their mint mojito iced coffee is to die for... So we stopped in here while we were running around the mission. 

We walked in and this joint was packed from floor to ceiling with people swag eclectic weird random crap etc. The place was packed. There was a line wrapped around inside and all the chairs/tables were full with some folks standing around out front...

They had about 5-6 coffee jockeys pumping out the brown juice as fast as they could... The crack err caffeine fiends were  all jittery and in dire need of a hit. So I went out front to wait while my friend braved the caffeine fiends to get her cup o minty joe!

everyone seems to love it and they all had these big ear to ear grins as they walked out and/or had their first sips... So yeah better them than me. I just try to get out of the way of these odd zombies...
author: Schel H.

description: Good coffee, but hit and miss customer service. Look, it's expensive coffee, the very least you can do is not treat people like you're a super cool unaffected hip kid and doing them a favor by ringing them up or making a coffee. And when you screw up an order, own it. Don't be all.. Ahhh yea I don't know what happened. Lazy ass hipsters. You'll be an Internet tycoon one day. Until then make the coffee and be nice.
author: Jim M.

description: Really good tasty coffee. After knowing this coffee, I know what the tastiest coffee is.
author: Lizi X.

description:
I've only been to this Philz location twice, but I love it. It's much larger than the Berkeley one, and affords a lot of people watching.

I got there early on a Sunday, so the Mission was still asleep or recovering, and I got through the line in a hot five minutes. The barista was super friendly, the coffee was awesome, and I found a chair to sink into. 

The good: almost everything. Bring a book, but so help you God if you touch the terrarium on the table.

The bad: there is one barista who has a horrendous hiccuping laugh. It was pretty distracting. He seemed lovely, but his laugh did not.
author: Amanda B.

description:
Great service and great coffee.

Went twice on our short trip.  Line moved quickly.  Had the bfast burrito one day and the Phillz bagel sandwich the next.  I liked the bagel better (I loved the fresh veggie and cream cheese combo).  

If you drive you may need to circle for a few minutes to find a spot because the area is pretty parked up.
author: Katie C.

description:
i'm so picky about my coffee - you have no idea!
 i take the average dose of at least 2 cups a day, and since i'm traveling quiet a bit all over the bay area i get to taste the coffee here all around!
so you better hear me out when i'm reviewing here folks, 'cause i know what i'm talking about.
so, o.k. 
philz coffee is for sure one of the best coffee shops here in the bay area.
you can actually "phil" that it was freshly brewed, right on the spot, and that the coffee beans itselfs are fresh and from a good source and quality!
i have drank coffee in rome for a year! so you can
author: Ally F.

description:
This is where I had my first Philz experience, probably in 2005 or 2006, shortly after I moved back to California.  One of my friends in SF suggested meeting here, which is what brought me here.

I had no idea what to get that first time, so I ended up talking to the barista, who helped me pick something out. I really don't remember what it was that I got, but I do remember liking it. 

Otherwise, since then, I tend to get their iced drinks at various locations (more frequently in the south bay), the iced ecstatic & mint mojito.  Like I mentioned above, if you'd like a hot cup of coffee, & you aren't sure what you want (there's not really much description on the menu), let the barista know what you like, & they will help you with recommendations.  

A wide variety of seating:  tables & chairs, & sofas, easy chairs.

Metered & unmetered street parking.  24th St. BART is also several blocks away.

Located on the southwest corner of 24th St. & Folsom.
author: Linda T.

description: Every time I see a Philz coffee I must have me some. It's as good as it gets if you know your gourmet coffee. Call me a coffee snob but I can't just go to any old Starbucks. Philz Coffee all the way.
author: Brian W.

description: I came in for a strong tea to drive up north through the night. The Batista with curly hairs and genuine eyes made me a crazy special  triple steeped mix of black teas and mate that has got my heart pumping out of my chest!!! Literally so yummy and strong and perfect (the tea was great too ;) ) thank you so much Mr. Caffeine!
author: Celia D.

description:
This is the real deal. Love philz. 

I miss the benches outside though. :( used to be the best place to sip your morning cup and ppl watch.
author: Shalaco W.

description: Great coffee from very friendly staff!  As an added bonus we were able to visit with Phil. One of the highlights of our trip to San Francisco!!
author: Steve R.

description:
Oh god I love this Philz, it's in a super convenient area since it's just about three blocks away from bart and only a couple steps away from the 67 bus stop to Bernal Heights which brings me to my house.  I come here whenever I'm in the area and I always have a pleasant experience.  

The baristas are nice to chit chat with when the place isn't so busy and they offer great input on drinks and what you might like/or should try if you're new to the place.

If you're in the mood for something cold I usually get the Iced Ecstatic, with vanilla soy since I'm lactose and also ask for it to be extra sweet.  From time to time I also get the Mint Mojito which is really refreshing.  If there are still buttered croissants I always make sure to grab one of those because they are delicious paired with your coffee especially when toasted, so make sure to ask!  

This place is a must try: great coffee, nice people, awesome service and it isn't pricy.
author: Jorel C.

description:
Great atmosphere and great coffee!!! I like this place. :)

I got the ginger snap iced coffee with the chocolate peanutbutter bar. Yumm, de-lish!
author: B B.

description:
The coffee is great.  The service is overwhelmingly bad.  This is true for every Philz I've been too. 

Even when it's not crowded be prepared for nasty chaotic attitude laden service.  As my friend said, "It's like  (the movie) cocktail but in a bad way".  Meaning while the barista stands completely alone, extravagantly pouring that single brew cup, they will ignore you or yell at you for trying to order. 

Don't you know that it takes all of their brain powers to pour water?

I love the coffee but in a town with so much great coffee I can't be bothered to wade through the bad behavior of their staff to get a cup.
author: Merrill Beth F.

description:
What a pleasure to come and visit the original Philz Coffee! It looks the most hipster than all the other chains. The lounge is spacious and the bathroom gets you delirious! 

FYI I heard investors funded Philz $15mil+ to create more of their chains in other places. Time to expand! CONGRATS!!
author: Ladonna A.

description:
Mint mojito iced coffee = 4.50 (large) = one of the best coffee cups I've had.

I love how the baristas make your cup of coffee based on how you prefer it.
author: Danny N.

description:
Philz has cheap coffee beans that are good for the price point ($12-$16 / lb.). That's why I go there. 

Philz is not the place to go if you're looking for an excellent cup of coffee in the city. Their iced coffee, from what I understood from their cashier, is refrigerated leftover drip coffee that didn't make it into a cup the first time around. 

I haven't lived in the city for long, but Philz seems like the type of place that was cool enough before coffee was cool, and they've been able to make money off of a reputation they built early without having to step up their game in any way. 

Bottom Line: It's worth going once to say you've been, but Ritual is a better option that's not too far away.
author: Marcus C.

description: I love TONY!! Tony and Kitina are the Best Baristas there!! I only go to them because they seem to put that extra love in each cup. Only bad comment I have to say is that their new Philz Bagel is terrible! They use pre-cut cucumbers and tomatoes that taste like plastic so I don't go there for food just COFFEE!!
author: Mila S.

description: Ice mint majito OMG! This place brought me so many wonderful vibes in my life
author: Essi M.

description:
Even though I live in LA and they just opened one in Santa Monica, there is always a different vibe to have your first cup of the famous PHILZ coffee up north : ).

I am an avid coffee drinker so if you really enjoy coffee - especially black, Philz is probably not good for you. Their famous mint mojito iced coffee is supposed to be creamy and very sweet but I asked for less sweet.

The place is a must visit if you have never been - the added mint to the cold coffee is a nice addition. I ate the mint leaf afterwards, haha.

As for the coffee flavour, it is all right - not strong enough - 3 stars from a coffee drinker. But if you are not an avid drinker, I think you may like it more! The cool thing is that the barista literally makes each cup of coffee for you - instead of just pouring it from a pre-brewed pot : ).

Nice/friendly baristas - a must try if you want to experience some SF!
author: Chloe C.

description:
Tony S is THE MAN. I have been coming here since I moved to SF about 4 years ago. The coffee staff are always really cool, but Tony S really takes great care of me when I go there. I always hope I get him when I am in line and I see him there. My pals order creamy and sweet, but I like mine black. I usually end up waiting to drink mine while my friends just sip away. Tony makes sure I get it like I like it - pretty well aerated so that I can drink it! He always checks in and when he is done aerating, there's a nice head of delicious foam on top! I don't live in the neighborhood anymore but I keep coming back and am always super happy I made the trip when Tony S. makes my coffee. Give that man a raise. 
Mad props to all the others at the Mission location. They are the nicest and I make the rounds - I go to Philz on 24th, the Castro, Mission Bay, and even Van Ness and truly, the Mission staff are the best. They make you look good. And hey, that Jacobs Wonderbar is just the best elixir on the planet.
author: Lisa H.

description:
Every cup is AMAZING and the baristas are always in a pleasant mood.  I really enjoy stopping here on my way to work. 5 stars and a Triple like for this place.  This is home.  

Good vibes, good beats, good brews.  

There is a heavy wait time on the weekends, so be patient if you're visiting then.
author: Jorge D.

description:
Mojito Ice coffee is my all time favorite!
Mocha tesora - make sure you keep stirring. ton of choc on the bottom.

Dancing water,
Silken Splendor, yum.

I haven't had one I didn't like yet, but Philz coffee always gives me the coffee boost i need.
author: Erica L.

description:
duh... it's Philz and it's amazingly good coffee. 

Jacobs wonderbar and Tesora are still my favorite blends after years of drinking Philz... 

BTW they'll ship coffee to you if you're missing SF.
author: Melanie M.

description:
OVER HYPED.  

I got the ecstatic or whatever ice coffee.  It came with a mint leaf which was cool but other than that, it tasted like a regular ice coffee.  Maybe if I didn't get my coffee black it would be better but I'm not a fan of dessert coffees loaded with caramel and stuff.

My GF got the iced mint mojito coffee and it was just meh.

Also, the cups get soggy and soft after awhile...
author: Tu T.

description: Omg MINT MOJITO. Best ice coffee ever!!!!
author: Cheryllyn L.

description: Be wary of this location. The workers never pay attention to your food order. Ordered a simple berry Danish and the non attentive cashier have me an apple one instead. I'm sorry I'm pretty patient but if you can't tell the difference between a berry and Apple Danish then youre a dumbfuck and your place of business deserves a one star rating.
author: Nathaniel S.

description:
If you love coffee and mint the coffee mint mojito is the drink for you!

If your like me and don't... well then despite all the props this drink gets, don't bother thinking this is anymore than iced coffee with mint cause it's exactly that.  My mistake.

3 stars for fairness sake and the fact they lent me an iphone charger in my time of need.  Thanks team Philz!
author: Angela Y.

description: Philz, on the higher side when it comes to pricing. However, it is all about the experience. It is really one cup at a time. I really appreciate my morning coffee, made with love and care. I always get the Aromatic Arabic and at home we have the Tesora. Both are Tasty. My favorite is the Tesora, but before work the Aromatic Arabic never disappoints, it is a dark roast that sets you right before starting your day.
author: Elizabeth D.

description:
It's good and bad if you ever visited Philz Coffee. It's good because you will drink the best coffee in San Francisco, interact with the coolest and friendlies baristas and pay only a few bucks. It's also bad because it totally changes what you should expect from coffee and you will be condemned to finding other coffees mediocre for eternity.

I just love the Tantalizing Turkish. Ask for less sugar and cream to get the real flavor. Also don't be discouraged by the long line since the service is super fast and you will not wait more than a few minutes.
author: Gokhan T.

description:
Until recently, I had only been the Philz in SoMa and walked by the Berkeley location a couple times before. This location on 24th feels like a completely different company. It has a small, local coffee shop vibe. Probably because, being Philz' flagship store, that's exactly what it used to be. 

The line goes fast enough here and the staff are very friendly. Philz is still the best selection of roasts you're going to find in one location. Although, I always get the mint mojito iced coffee because it's remarkable. Apparently that's how Philz got famous - this location started putting sprigs of fresh mint in their coffee in 2003 when they first opened and people went crazy for it. I'm about a decade late on this, but today I'm one of them.

On a Sunday at 11am, I was magically able to grab a table to post up with my laptop. I even worked for a couple hours without anyone bothering me. Philz is good for that.
author: K M.

description:
I came into purchase ground beans for a new espresso machine I purchased as a gift. It was only right to send some tasty coffee along with it. 

I purchased a bag of Jacob's Ladder Beans, had them ground to fit the machine type and was on my way. I was really impressed at the flavor of the beans. They were exactly how she described them, a buttery chocolate flavor perfect for a homemade Cappuchino. Mmmm.
author: Rebekah T.

description: Simply the best. I can't decide which to come back for the coffee or the service. 5 stars for both! Thank you philz for getting me through my work shifts
author: Jael L.

description: Oh Phil, you've made a coffee drinker out of me.  Although I'm used to my fancy lattes and oh-so-imperfect cups of the regular weekly 'Bucks stops, Philz is a tasty gulp of fresh air.  The "baristas" serve a mean cup-O-joe and know their beans.  Grab a Philtered-Soul or the iced Mint Mojito and get ride for a coffee journey.
author: Kevin J.

description: I am (almost) speechless. Philz is so good. Unlike any other coffee shop, truly. No espresso here, just pour-over coffee really, and the baristas take care of all the sweetening. I'd like a Philz for every other aspect of life. I'm being really dramatic over here, but honestly I'm simply angry that Philz isn't in Texas.
author: Jason M.

description: Even though it's pricy I love their coffee. It's rich and very strong which has gotten me through some busy days when I've been sleep deprived. Friendly staff and great selection as well.
author: Angela A.

description: Yes, come here and get all coffees.  The line might get kinda long, but that's expected because they make each brew to brew bro!  That's the way you should like your coffee.
author: David L.

description: Philz Coffee You need to come to Orange county! My cousin kept bugging me that she wanted to try out this place. I didn't really pay much attention, until she had a fit and cried her way into getting what she wanted. Let me tell you! I'm so glad she did. We finally got to try out Philz Coffee and their coffee is amazing. I have never tasted anything like it. The Mint Mojito ice Coffee will satisfy any coffee lover. This is the best cofee I've ever had!
author: Crystal N.

description:
I love Philz, I bring everyone here that haven't tried it. 

I also love this location because there are a lot of seating and I come here whenever I have homework or studying to do. Parking can be a pain sometimes. Also came here on a Saturday once, and this place was packed! The line was never-ending for a while. But most days, I love coming here. 

I think I even saw Phil one time... I think?
author: Cara N.

description:
Yes the wait looks like it can be super long sometimes but trust me its worth the wait! Also, the baristas know what they are doing and expedite the line pretty quickly.

I always get the Iced mint mojito, its the best! So refreshing on a hot day also its not too sweet and the mint is a nice refreshing touch. The pastries and food items they have here are always a great treat as well!
author: Christine W.

description:
Everyone's said it all. 

Two words: 

MINT. MOJITO.

Don't forget to get it with cream and sweetened. You won't regret it.
author: Jessica C.

description:
Dear God, where to begin. Imagine three coffee loving women trekking desperately across an unknown city in search of the perfect cup of morning coffee and a donut. Then, imagine they think they've found the spot only to realize what's being sold as coffee is dirty dishwater and the so called donuts are, well, a disaster. 

Now, imagine those same three women still desperate for that perfect cup, having already been disappointed by that earlier experience coming across the heaven of coffee. Well, that was Philz. San Francisco was redeemed. God bless Philz. 

First, the line was 30 deep. The options...unbelievable! I have never seen so many drip options. Between the three of us we had the Tesora, Dancing Waters and the Silken Splendor, if I recall correctly. All three were some of the best coffee we've had. It wasn't just the taste either, it was the whole experience. The coffee experts make each cup individually upon order. They add the cream and sugar, if you like it that way, and from what my friend said, perfectly. I drink it black so as not to take away from the flavor, and this cup definitely didn't need anything in it but my lips. 

We walked out of there happy and satisfied, until we realized we'd never see a Philz again. Now, imagine three grown women crying into their empty coffee cups.
author: Neen S.

description: I'm an outsider/interloper these days but since I had a day in SF and it was a Sunday I had to go to Philz. Still delicious and got the same vibe I remember from years ago.
author: Paul J.

description:
I've been going to this Philz for quite some time now. So you either get a really nice or straight up mean barista. It's 50/50. I praise the really nice baristas. They keep me coming back. As for the rude ones, you should drink some coffee so you can cheer the hell up. Or maybe you can mask your rudeness and fake being nice. You work in customer service, man. I know that the customer isn't always right but I always come to you asking for my coffee with a smile. Y'all need to chill. That table separating us in the coffee shop doesn't follow you everywhere.

As for the coffee, ever since Philz, everything else is trash. Starbucks, trash. Peet's, basura. Blue Bottle, aiiight. Ritual, so-so.
author: Ro R.

description: I like dark black coffee so my favorites are jacob's wunderbar and arabica. Philharmonic is good too. My friend really likes their chai tea. Coffee is perfectly roasted and brewed. Great service. Sometimes can be crowded and noisy.
author: Jacqui C.

description:
Rude baristas this Sunday morning definitely won't be bringing my guests to this location. Calm down. They don't know what they're doing yet, but who cares since they won't come back anymore. 

Coffee is ok
author: M J.

description:
Came here to grab coffee with a friend. As we waited, one of the guys offered us a free Chai Latte to try. It was so good that I ordered one for myself and still paid for the free Latte. It's a great spot with a down to earth vibe. I like supporting local organizations and Philz is one that I like a lot.

Growing up in SF, that spot was a liquor/convenience store. Honestly, I don't know when Philz popped up, but I'm glad it did. 

Try the Chai Latte or Mint Mojito. Or just grab coffee (this isn't Starbucks)!
author: Steve S.

description:
I've tried 2 drinks from here and love both! There are multiple baristas, each with their own coffee making station. My barista had 4 drips going, while making a drink for someone else and also taking my order at the same time. I love the set up. I would totally hang out here if I lived in the area and try all of the drinks. As you walk in the door, you get hit with a beautiful coffee aroma from all the fresh coffee brewing. I just want to breathe this all the time! 

Mint mojito iced coffee - I love this drink! The coffee is great and the mint enhances everything! But I like mint, so you might not like it if mint is not your thing. Just try it! It will be a great experience even if you don't like it. 

Mocha tesora - The coffee was perfect and flavorful, different from other coffee places.  Both the coffee and mocha flavors were distinct but blended together so well in this drink. It's a rich drink but not sweet, just so well made.
author: Theresa D.

description: Came here on my work break. (1.31. 5pm) One of the tall barista guys who was wearing a beanie took my order and kept laughing for, whatever reason..since I placed an order.? He told me: let him know if its sweet enough. I tasted it and it was bitter for hot chocolate. So, I asked him to make it little bit sweeter. He handed it over and kept laughing. Huh? Btw, it was loud enough to humiliate me. I was embarrassed. What is more, I really had no prior experience with this cafe. I do find, though, that this particular cafe has a history of reviews which illustrate racism.
author: Iris C.

description: This location rocks just like every other a Philz Coffee location does. I can here because I was craving so philz Coffee. I like the way the inside looks. I like the old style chairs, tables and couches. I also like the art mural on the wall and the art paintings on the wall. What I would like to see is the two Philz Coffee signs on the outside of the building become the same Philz Coffee sings that are on all the other locations.
author: Isaac H.

description:
My love for Philz overphilz my heart. 

I first tried Philz back in August and, for the past 6 months, I have been dreaming of going back to Philz. Every time someone mentions San Francisco or coffee, I fondly think back to the time when I visited the Philz near Berkeley... yum. The coffee here is AMAZING-- so amazing, in fact, that if I had to choose a last place coffee pit stop before leaving the country, I would choose Philz. Someone needs to seriously convince Mr. Phil to franchise down to sunny LA.

-Iced mint mojito coffee-- yummm!!! Hint of mojito mint with delicious dark coffee. I don't know if this is very strong, but it was delicious. 

-Mocha tesora-- I would say about 3/4 of the cup was REALLY good, and then the last 1/4 of the cup got too sweet because of the mocha that had sedimented on the bottom. I think I'll get the regular Tesora next time. 

-frosted vegan orange donut-- are vegan donuts supposed to be heavier than regular donuts? That's what this donut tasted like; the cake was denser than that of regular donuts but the frosting/glaze made it 10x more delicious. A must try :)

The people at Philz were pretty much misters and hipsters. It's not a big coffee shop, but there are lots of spaces to sit and chat. The bathrooms are decked out in graffiti... so much graffiti, in fact, that you'll feel like you're peeing outside (jkjk).

I'm sure anything that anyone tries from Philz would be amazing, especially their specials #1-10 :) If you come to SF, you have to try Philz!
author: Amy Q.

description: Philz coffee is good taste wise, The coffee tastes fresh and brilliant. I just have an issue with the paper cups/glasses they serve in. They are too clumsy. Either the lid has an issue or the cups, they just don't fit easily and properly. I spilled coffee in my car the other day because of the same thing, and that was quite annoying. Rest would say Philz coffee is the good and the staff is quite welcoming and friendly
author: Kshitija S.

description:
For the longest time, I kept seeing Philz's brown coffee cups everywhere.  Around downtown, by the ballpark, in the Mission...even one time in my dreams.  Everywhere!  Now that I've finally been able to strike them off my "to try" list though, maybe they'll stop stalking me...

After starting off our morning with a trip to Dynamo (and finally scratching them off my "to try" list as well), we made our way down the street to get some Philz.  Since I wasn't familiar with which was "the one" to try (nor their giant menu), my friends suggested I order the Mocha Tesora.  Ahh...I'm so glad my friends have good taste.  The flavor was really rich, with a good mix between coffee and dark chocolate.  It wasn't quite as creamy as I would have liked, but it still had a nice body to it and just the slightest touch of some sweetness to go with the bitterness.

For whatever reason, I thought it was pretty cool how the baristas each had their own stocked stations to make batches of orders at a time.  Although, I guess in a way, it's kind of necessary to keep the lines moving.  The funny thing is, initially I couldn't really figure out why they had a bench there facing towards the baristas rather towards the people in line.  Little did I know, it was actually meant for people to sit and wait while the barista makes each drink before customers take it to the register.  Now that's smarts.  And some good coffee!
author: Mike L.

description:
I LOVE OGPHILZ. 
Philz Coffee on 24th is BY FAR the best Philz  that i've ever gone to (I have frequented the following locations: South City, Noe/Castro, Vanness, Sausalito and Berkeley).  
I come here M-F, thats for sure (sometimes 2-3 times a day) and let me tell you these people and my personalized cup of coffee are an essential part of my day! Its the only location that I can go to and get consistent results of both pleasure and happiness. Everyone is always super friendly and my drinks are always on point.  I love the staff and the atmosphere here. I like that they remember the regulars and can greet me by name (and vice versa), remember my favorite drinks and how I like it made. They go above and beyond to take care of the customers. To me...customer service is what  I truy love about Philz (besides their delicious coffee).

Come here for the ultimate Philz experience...and if you're not sure what you want, don't hesitate to ask around or ask any of the workers for suggestions.

Here are a few of my favorites (no particular order):
Mint Mojito, Ecstatic Iced Coffee, Philtered Soul, Tesora, Mocha Tesora, Jacobs Wonderbar, Green Tea, and lately what I've been getting is an Iced Istanbul Treat.


Shout out to the cool kids and yes...I'm gonna name drop all of my personal favorite "Cup Of Love" makers: Paul, Katina, Lilly, Meg, and  Becca. I love em. They get me through my workdays and also my workouts. I hope they dynamic never changes. I love this place!!
author: Stephanie B.

description:
Good god- what is this tasty concoction I'm drinking. Oh wait- its a real iced mocha made with Philz's magic touch. I was a bit overwhelmed when studying the options and than realized who am I kidding. I order the same damn drink every time- an iced mocha. What luck- its the best iced mocha hands down that I've enjoyed in the city. I rushed home for my husband to give it a try before I gulped it down and he said the same thing- best iced mocha in the city. I'm excited to head back and perhaps be a bit more adventurous with my coffee...

By the way, if you're looking for an espresso fix, looks like you're out of luck. Hand poured coffee is their area of expertise.
author: Ritu K.

description:
The number one thing I miss about living in the bay. Philz please send me an iced mocha!!! 

Seriously, get the iced mocha. It is the best thing ever (I get mine 'medium plus' sweet). :)
author: Emily C.

description: The service here is just wonderful. I love great service. "Please try this and I'll be sure to make sure you like it". I said it was a little on the lighter flavored side and voala! The coffee artisan adds more spices to the perfect gingersnap! Best one I've had so far. Drop by and don't be scared to tell them exactly what you want in your coffee.
author: Marlene T.

description:
philz, philz, philz..

philz i do adore!!! 

I think I've tried everything on their dark roast and medium roast menu! 
My favorites are probably Philtered Soul, Mocha Tesora, and the Ecstatic Iced Coffee!
author: Michelle L.

description: This is Philz OG spot and I love going here every week.  There staff is amazing and Phil himself is always chilling there.
author: Deborah V.

description:
We came to redeem a "groupon" ... unsuccessful because they had run out of gift cards, gives me an excuse to drive back to the city from the burbs and have another amazing cup of Joe. I told Bri we were nubi's and was attentive to explain Philz process ... we were astonished at the friendliness of our barista and realized just why this is Philz 504th review. 

I ordered their decaf- dark french roast with medium cream and sugar. The hubs ordered chai and the lil-bro ordered hot cocoa.  I took a sip, "oh my Gawwd", and Bri was estatic at the delish cup of coffee she had just produced. Bold, just enough sweetness, and eye-opening flavors. The hubs loved his chai -- after ingesting  a few floating leaves and mint, it did spoil his experience a little, but still thoroughly enjoyed his beverage nontheless. I had a sip of  the lil-bro's hot cocoa -- amazing.  Of course I'll be back =p
author: Aga O.

description:
There are coffee shops everywhere, but Philz is my most favorite coffee place ever. You choose a coffee blend, a size, how sweet, and how creamy. While you're just choosing a blend, there are so many variations, and so many blends to choose from.

My favorites are: 

Philharmonic
It's the Best
Philtered Soul
Sooo Good 

Philz, can you open a shop in Alameda please, pretty please???
author: Lani N.

description: Made to order quality coffee that is fragrant with a delightful aftertaste. No matter what you order, it will certainly satisfy. There is almost always a line but trust me, your patience will pay off.
author: Mona W.

description: I met my friend after a long time and we chose to start our day here! The café has character and a relaxing casual vibe. The coffee and snacks were good too.
author: Faryal Z.

description:
Can anyone be more thoughtful in how each cup of coffee is made? This morning I came here to meet my Yelp buddy Kent P for coffee and came away thoroughly impressed. With a wooden sign that says "gateway" by the door, I had no idea what was awaiting me on the other side. I proceeded to get a cup of aromatic Arabic with soy ($3.25) and a mini red velvet cupcake ($1). The red velvet wasn't as good as expected but my drink with a stem of mint was excellent and powerfully aromatic with a full bodied finish. I was awakened by my own amusement from the first sip, and now I'm accompanied by a nice cup of fresh chai ($3) as my fabulous morning was well spent between work, people watching, and chatting with Kent about our common interests in finding great cafes such as this one.

The vibe is friendly and filled with coffee enthusiasts looking for another round of caffeine. Service-wise, the staff is cheerful, knowledgeable, and deliberate with the way each cup is made. They also offer free wifi with plenty of plugs available on the floor and around their eclectic sets of tables and sofas. If there are any limitations to this place, it's the loosely organized line that can be very confusing for those who are waiting to receive their order and those trying to pay. Thanks Kent, for suggesting such a wonderful place to meet. This is such a cool place that I think you'll be seeing me here quite often.
author: Daniel L.

description:
PROUD, BROWN, AND I HAVE ***NEVER*** BEEN RACIALLY PROFILED AT PHILZ!!!!!

The staff is ALWAYS polite, professional, and accommodating.
I find it disgusting that someone would entertain the idea of accusing an exemplary business of racial profiling over a $4 coffee. 

Personally, I don't trust reviews that make hurtful comments about people and are full of poorly-constructed sentences. Phil'z employees provide EXCELLENT SERVICE  in a COMFORTABLE, FRIENDLY ENVIRONMENT.

I cannot emphasize enough the PROFESSIONALISM AND COURTESY I experience as A RETURNING CUSTOMERS at Philz....even when they ask for my ID! Big surprise, the coffee is great. Sometimes I pay with cash, sometimes I pay with card. Employees are allowed, and often required, to request ID when a customer makes a card purchase. 

**IF YOU DON'T WANT SOMEONE TO ASK FOR YOUR ID, PAY WITH CASH**

P.S. Nobody likes a fuccboi on Yelp.
author: Laritza M.

description: Ecstatic Iced Coffee with almond milk med sweet looooove this location the most. You know you go too much when they know your name when you go to pay. Everyone is always so nice and make kick ass coffee!
author: Mandy F.

description:
I am writing as a loyal, passionate Philz customer. I have been frequenting the Berkeley location for years and have never had a bad experience. My experience at this location was very disappointing and uncharacteristic.

My boyfriend and I ordered two drinks: 1 decaf large mint mojito, sweet and creamy and 1 decaf mint mojito with soy and mildly sweet. Sadly, and for an unknown reason, both drinks were watery and lacked flavor. The soy drink, however, was disgusting and tasted more like barely minty luke-warm water. I would have liked to take them back and ask the employee to remake them, but we were on a tight schedule and didn't have time.

I'll still go to my regular Philz and get my mint mojito with normal expectations, but I may not come back to this location. And if I do, I will make sure to taste the drink before I leave!
author: Kelsey S.

description:
How does Philz Coffee differentiate itself from all the other heavy hitters of java? It prides itself on customizing your coffee "one cup at a time." Your personalized cup of coffee is made right in front of your eyes. The beans are freshly ground per cup and individually brewed. The result is a deliciously strong cup of Joe, err Philz rather. If the multitude of coffee options makes your head spin, just pick a drink selection from the big board. 

My first cup here was the Mocha Tesora (#5). If you're a fan of chocolate, this is the drink for you. This dark roast is perfectly mixed with cocoa and topped off with mint leaves. On top of their amazing coffee, their customer service here is excellent. They ask you to take a sip before you leave to make sure everything is to your liking. If not, they're happy to remake your drink. I have to make sure to return to try that iced mint mojito drink one day.
author: Bailey Z.

description: I love this location because the staff members are friendly and theyre quick at making drinks. Personally I like the iced mocha tesora better than the iced mint mojito. If youre a big coffee drinker, this is the place to go!
author: Alyssa C.

description: This place is baller! Really cool vibe and the drinks were delicious! I got the mint mojito iced coffee in a small and wish I would've gotten a large! Highly recommend!
author: Chloe G.

description:
Always worth the $4 for a Tesoro, even if the inside of this place is unbearably humid and out there for me while the bathroom appears to be some kind of LSD inspired work of art.

My advice: grab a coffee that sounds good to your taste, and go sit outside with the hungry birds or just scram outta here all together.
author: Lew A.

description:
The coffee is awesome although I wish they would be a little more organized several times I've had my mint mojito taken since so many people order it. 

Service is pretty quick to correct just wish if it's a popular item maybe use their name rather than call out the item.
author: Vanessa O.

description: It is the old school mission district of SF, suits, shorts hippies, yuppies, everything in between.the original coffee spot. Fun just standing in line people watching. Now where is my Ambrosia. Love this place! You will too!
author: Joseph H.

description:
I love this place! I've studied here a few times and I adore it :). There's wifi so you could just chill and focus on some comfy couches or if you prefer, seats and tables. There are tables and chairs outside as well. Parking is kind of a pain so be aware of that! (Might be the time I usually come at around afternoon)

The coffee: there was a big hype about Philz mint mojito and I understand why. It was definitely a unique taste and they hand drip their coffee. Because I tried this mint mojito coffee before I tried mojito drinks (alcohol), them mojito alcohol drinks will always remind me of Philz coffee. How odd lol! Either way, it's my goto here and I always ask them to make it a little sweeter :). And I reallllllly like the taste. I have tried one of the medium roast drinks, but it was way too strong for me. But I'm still excited to try their other drinks!
author: Mel T.

description:
This is for the Coffee and staff only.

Ok, I had heard all the jokes about Phillz: the time it takes, the pretension, ect.   I laughed, too.  These jokes even kept me from trying it.  

Well, just recently, I opened my mind and decided to try their coffee.  I am so happy I did.  The guy behind the counter greeted me with warmth.  I did not know what I wanted so he asked me a few questions and surprised me.  He made me 'its the best'.  Dude...and it was.  It was just a cup of slow drip coffee but it tasted amazing... much like a creamy cappuccino.  Man, super tasty.  

Anyway, that was that, and it did not really take that long either... a couple minutes.  Well worth it.  

The atmosphere, on the other hand, could use some help.  It is like your grandmothers house, squatted with cousins, in there.  Someone, please drink up some yummy coffee and work some interior design magic on that place.  It didn't matter for me, I got it to go.
author: Francis B.

description: Large Mint Mohito Iced Coffee is the bomb!  I leave it at that.
author: Ronald N.

description: Philz Coffee has a variety of light, medium, and dark roasts. I got the Silken Splendor. It was very good!
author: Emily D.

description:
As good as always, Philz is the best it gets in coffee. Their iced mint mocha is so good that my girlfriend reprimanded me for getting her the Jacob's the second time we went (even though she ultimately enjoyed it).

Decor: Philz has a few seats near the left which are almost always taken and the counter towards the right. You stand in line (forever) and give your order at the first section, pay and then come and pick your coffee back up.

Service: The service is excellent once you acknowledge that they are trying to give everyone the best cup of joe they can and not rushing through the orders. People may not appreciate the line but you should definitely respect it.

Coffee: I've tried the iced mint mocha, the mocha tesora and jacob's. I have to say the mint mocha was my favorite even though I despise mixing chocolate and mint (I don't know how you guys eat that ice cream). It has a slight refreshment kick that you want from coffee without it tasting just like cocoa beans. I highly recommend getting it.

Plus point: It's in the middle of the mission which gives you access to dolores park, great mexican food and funny hobos.
author: Minks M.

description:
This place is worth every sip!  I wish there was a Philz Coffee in Chicago.  My cousin who loves locally in SF introduced me to this place and I'm glad he did.  This place is definitely worth the visit.  

I had the Philtered Soul which was rich and delicious.  I didn't even bother with adding any cream or sugar.  I also had the opportunity to try Silken Splendor which was also delicious.

The menu boards list the coffee selections by types of roasts from Dark to Light.  I usually like Medium to Dark Roasts.  

Just to give an idea of how I chose...At Starbucks, I usually have an Americano.  Philtered Soul was a comparable roast with much more richness and well rounded flavor, ending with a hint of hazelnut.
author: Melissa P.

description:
This was the second Philz I've been to in SF.  The first one blew me away with the mint mojito iced coffee, so I went out of my way to go here with a friend when we were nearby.

The mint mojito was still really good, but the barista put in half a cup (not exaggerating!) of mint leaves! Combined with the volume that the ice took up, there were only a few sips of the drink in my cup left!

All in all, I highly recommend the mint mojito (I'm not even a coffee drinker and I loved it) and hopefully this was just an aberration.
author: Olivia A.

description: The customer service and ambience exceeded my expectations... Not to mention the coffee is amazing! I love how they craft it right in front of you and then make sure it's to update liking.
author: Desiree B.

description:
YES! So. much. coffee.

When I was in college, I was obsessed with the chai lattes from a cute little mom and pop coffee shop.  So much so that I would eagerly anticipate my daily study sessions there because it meant I got to null the pain of reading about the political and economic ramifications. Sadly, during my senior year, they started serving a different kind of chai and I was forced to seek out a different studying beverage.  While my thighs were grateful for the relief, my taste buds were not.  

Since then, have been on a mission to find a a' chai replacement.  Starbucks and Peet's are too bland, Urth Caffe's is too spicy and healthy, and while I do quite enjoy the version at Coffee Bean, it's not quite right.  The whole experience of trying and disliking the various chai lattes across many cities has made me feel like I'm an insomniac Goldilocks -- exhausted, but never able to find that just right bed to lay my blonde head.

This past Sunday, I met up with an.... errr... acquaintance, at Philz Coffee in SF.  I was sort of perplexed by what to order--- there are SO many options and I didn't want to be that girl who tells the barista to "be creative."  I asked him what he was ordering and he enthusiastically responded, "The iced chai latte!"  (Regular, 16 ounces for $3.50)  I raised an eyebrow.  "Is it good?"  He nodded .  "It's sweeter than most, which I like."  Ding ding ding!  Sold!  Plus it made my ordering decision infinitely easier!  

The weirdo-looking counter person (according to the lovely Jennifer J., a regular Philz patron, the non-weirdo-looking counter person is much nicer) gave me a bit of a stink eye when I requested mine with skim milk (they don't automatically make it that way), but I brushed his tudiness aside as soon as I sucked up my first slurp of the perfectly balanced chai latte.  Just like me, it was made with sugar and spice and everything nice -- in proportions that were... drumroll please... just right!  I didn't even mind that there was no place to sit inside because of all the noxious writers taking up tables with thei Macbooks.  Who does that?  I would never be so rude!  (wink wink, chuckle chuckle!)
author: Donna J.

description: Mint Mojito you are my love. First stop right after my flight
author: Angela L.

description:
WOW

Iced Mint Mojito Coffee. Believe that, IT WAS FREAKING GOOD!.

Usually I don't get High on Coffees, but THIS one Got me!.

Is a bit pricey, but flavor is pretty strong, Friendly staff that can help you with flavors and they Explain each of them (if you're interested in listening).

Decor is very Hippy, comfy, that makes you feel like you're in the livingroom but a Bunch of people.  Everyone's in their Notebook.  NO PHONE allow inside, so keep it quiet.

I'm so going to miss you Mr. Mojito Coffee.
author: Helena H.

description: Coffee is delicious! I was able to tell the barista what kind of coffee I usually like and she picked the perfect bean to brew for me.
author: Amanda K.

description:
Oh, Phil, baby that IS. THE. STUFF.

Having met Phil on my latest visit to the Mission outpost of this nectar-of-the-gods vendor, I can't read the above without chuckling. 

Waiting on line, I was peeking at the bean descriptions on the counter when Phil interrupted and said : get the number 2. 

Not seeing a number two, I asked him which one that was, so he pulled out his cell phone to show me a picture of his son holding the graphic novel that someone had written in homage to the blend, which was actually called : Jacobs Wonderbar (dark roast). Someone wrote a book about this coffee. Yeah. It's like that.

I would normally get a mocha or a (light roast) Soooo Good, but um, yeah, when Phil picks out your coffee, you get the one he picks for you. It was jet fuel strong but amazing, as usual, the barista telling me to come back if I wanted something else or if it was too this or not enough that.

Come to NY, Phil! We've already lured Blue Bottle... we will be gentle. Promise.
author: Claire F.

description:
A big cup of hot tesora, just slightly sweetened with sugar and cream, puts me in the best of moods. They'll always add cream and sugar for you as opposed to you doing it yourself. There are supposedly certain secret ingredients and a certain special way to make every cup you order PERFECT. Some claim cardamom and  heavy whipping cream is included on this secret list but i don't care :) it's delicious.  They can put whatever they want in there and i'll leave obliviously happy.

The bathroom looks like it's inside out! You open up the door to a monstrous green interior with graffitied walls. It's a bit funky but it matches the decor of this Philz. Random cushioned couches, hard chairs, old chairs you'd probably find at a library.  It's such a miss match that it actually feels quite comfortable.
author: Samantha L.

description:
What can I say about Philz that hasn't already been said in it's nearly 1000 reviews, not even counting the other locations? Not sure if she's new or not but there's a cute hipster chick that has been serving it up in the a.m. lately. She definitely brings the friendly vibe up a notch. 

The Turkish with soy (which they don't charge extra for - They deserve an extra star for that!) is the way to go for me. The vegan apple scone from Nabalom Bakery is amazing! I keep hearing good things about the iced mint mojito, I may hafta try that soon.
author: John B.

description:
It was my first time here at Philz Coffee and I will definitely never forget my experience here. 

All I knew about Philz Coffee when stepping into the door was that they had a variety of medium and dark roasted coffees, funky names for their specialties, and that each order is delicately hand-made to order.

When it was my turn to order, I wanted an ECSTATIC ICED COFFEE but didn't know if it came out as straight black coffee or whether I had to do the add-ins (cream and sugar) myself. The person who was helping me sensed my confusion and asked whether it was my first time there, which I responded to the affirmative. He then took the time to give me a detailed account of how it works at Philz Coffee. He told me every thing basically comes out black unless the client specifically mentions they would like cream or sugar. He would then add the cream and sugar for me based on the level I would like (low sweet, medium sweet, or highly sweet). I told him medium. Based off of that information, he then told me not to worry and he'll have my order up soon. 

It didn't take too long for my drink to be ready (he had prior orders he had to work on). I think since it was my first time there, he gave me a sweet presentation with my drink (adding mint leaves to the side for garnish). Hehehe. Very sweet. He asked me to taste it to see if I liked it or needed any adjustments. The ECSTATIC ICED COFFEE was perfect. It wasn't too bitter, but had the sweetness I was mainly looking for with the flavor of coffee throughout it all. 

My friend also got an ECSTATIC ICED COFFEE, but when he saw my mint leaf garnish, he popped open his lid and was like, "Heeeey, I didn't get a mint leaf garnish." Hahaha. 

I didn't get his name, but thank you whoever made my first time there memorable and for the mint leaf garnish (gave it a nice personal touch). I tipped a dollar at the front.
author: Diana N.

description:
I love this Philz. It's big inside (and has some outdoor seating) so you don't have to wait so long to get a seat. They also have large tables that are great for doing work (don't count on the wifi tho). The décor is the most unique and involved of any of the Philz I've been to. They have many barista stalls so the wait is pretty short as far as Philz usually goes. The baristas were also snobbier than usual. Go figure.

Of course you've heard of Philz by now, but at the risk of being redundant, let me remind you what Philz is: delicious, special coffee for a good price.
author: Luke K.

description: The OG Philz...so many flavors to choose from. The line here was pretty packed for a Saturday morning but it moved fairly quickly and they had plenty of baristas to accommodate the demand. I can't even remember what kind of coffee I got, but I know it was strong and good and free since my friend bought it. I don't think there's much space here to study, but if you're jonesing for some good caffeine in the morning, I'm guessing this is the place to go if you're in the Mission!
author: Sam L.

description:
I LOVE Philz Coffee.  Concept and drink menu.

While this is not "the best" coffee, I'm very excited for my next trip back when I'm in the Mission.

Baristas are nice and so is their mint mojito iced coffee and their cold (yes!) chocolate.

I like my drinks and I like my options -- here, the nice part is the baristas really do custom make your drink.  Be sure you don't walk away without having tasted since that's the beauty of this concept.
author: Jennifer Y.

description: Who doesn't love Philz? This one is on my way to work, great service, great coffee, what more could I ask for to start my day?
author: Courtney N.

description:
In my opinion the best Philz in the city. Quirky decorations, mismatched couches and a friendly staff that will tell you all about any of the coffees on the list behind the counter. 

A few good one:

Hot: Philzharmonic 
Cold: Mint Mojito Iced Coffee (divine - definitely for the sweet-toothed bunch)
Decaf: Swiss Water Peru

There's a bit of a line if you go on a weekend morning, but otherwise turn around time is pretty quick.
author: Tara K.

description: I already loved Philz before today. I fought going here for a long time bc of my bitterness toward gentrification...but I got over it and fell in love. But today especially I am thankful for this cozy, sweet, delicious spot. After a horrible, long day..I walk in annoyed that I am going to do more work at a coffee shop at 6:30pm and not going home. Defeated, I walk to the counter and say "I want something chocolate and iced."
