Less than five minutes later, the friendly, smiling barista hands me not only the best philz I've had, but the best coffee ever. Iced Mocha Tesora with love....that was the secret ingredient ;)
author: Jennifer C.

description: This Philz gives great quality coffee and quick service and always ensures the taste is just right. It's generally always packed but it goes by quick. Mint mojioto and dancing water are my go tos.
author: mimay M.

description:
Best coffee you'll ever have. Worth the wait people like to complain about (its really like 3 minutes, max). Oh and every month they have a specific blend on sale so I always stock up :) 

Yes the mint mojito is as good as they. And if you feel really fancy try the Jamaican  blue mountain coffee. $120/lb but only 7 bucks for a cup of heaven.
author: Atoosa H.

description:
MINT MOJITO ICED COFFEE. Amazing. Unique. Need I say more?! 

My friend ordered a black coffee of some type, and I'm usually not a fan of black coffee, but Philz was on point. Thank goodness they have a location in SoCal now! They need to open more locations down here! 

The line was a little confusing as a first timer, and because the store was filled with decor, it was hard to see the "start here" signs. However, we didn't have any issues finding seating and were able to enjoy our coffee. I will be back!!
author: Kris T.

description: I love coming here! This is the OG Philz spot and not your typical fancy shmancy chain coffee shop. It looks and feels authentic just like the coffee. They brew each cup which is nice because it tastes always fresh. There's nothing more dissatisfying than drinking burnt coffee that's been sitting in a coffee pot for hours at a time. I actually met Phil here once and he was super nice and friendly. The baristas here are also super friendly and great at making suggestions. I like getting the Red Haze but also like the Mint mojito, Tesora, and Philtered Soul. Everything is here is good, just depends on your preference.
author: Brigitte M.

description: Overpriced and the service is slow. I really don't understand the fascination for Philz coffee. The coffee is not that great either honestly...
author: Sebastien C.

description:
I'll make this short and sweet. The coffee is delicious here. I usually only get one of two things when I go here, the ether or the mint mojito. Both of which do not disappoint, not matter who is making it. 

The only downer is that this place is kinda small. Still, with that being said, this place is amazing.
author: John W.

description:
The best cold coffee that you can get is in Philz Coffee. The ecstatic is simply great to start the morning. This has a great outdoor setting with trees all around. The place is a little loudy with silent music. I do visit this place on the weekends.  
Go Philz!
author: Pratik J.

description:
Try: Tesoro, Soooooo Good

Laid back and delicious, philz is the epidemy of everything to love from san francisco. This one in the mission is my favorite by far. 

The service is ALWAYS impeccable and the coffee always blows my mind. When I had more time, I used to LOVE coming here and working by the windows. This neighborhood typifies the mixture and acceptance of people and cultures from all over and I just love it. 

I love you Philz!!
author: Sue Y.

description:
There are some things that Philz Coffee has that other individual third-wave drip coffee places don't have:

1. Phil. He's nice and peppy. He'll greet you loudly and take your order personally.

2. Spices. They add a pinch of anise to teas and a pinch of cardamon to a couple of their coffee blends.

3. Cream and Sugar. All coffee places have cream and sugar, but no other coffee place will take your cream and sugar order, foam it up, and apply it directly to the coffee before it reaches your hands. This makes all the difference to me and this is what I think makes their coffee so delicious.

4. Sleeveless Cups. Thank you for picking a cup design that has ridges to eliminate coffee cup sleeves waste.

5. Free wifi. Not all places have this and this is important to me.

6. Years of Experience. They have been around for longer than other individual drip coffee shops.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
I now see the light....  Coffee mecca!

Finally got to check out a Philz Coffee spot...  Was glad I did.  Ordered the New Manhattan (velvety smooth), and wifey had the Iced Mint Mojito (refreshing).  Both were great in their own way.  I will be getting my own Iced Mint Mojito next time - YUM!

Service was super friendly.  Was impressed that they treat every cup with TLC, and even ask if you want it a little sweet, medium sweet, or very sweet...  Pretty cool!

I will definitely be checking out Philz whenever I am in the area.  

They need to start opening up more spots in the Peninsula!  I know they will be a hit anywhere they go.
author: Lawrence L.

description: Great atmosphere. VERY good coffee. Starbucks can't compete. Mint mojito, and Ginger iced coffees excellent on warm days. A bit pricey is what keeps it from 5 stars.
author: Scott S.

description: Always a dandy time at Philz Coffee. I'm glad I got to step foot into the original Phil and also try their coffee at this location. Here, you order first, get your drink, and pay after. As always, I ordered a small mint mojito iced coffee. It was creamy and the taste of the mint was light but perceivable. A nice addition during a leisurely stroll through the Mission district!
author: Phoebe C.

description: Nothing beats this coffee. Hands down the BEST. Everyone should try their Mint Mojito at least once-not as weird as it sounds. It's their best drink by far. Also, highly recommend the Ecstatic if you like iced coffee. My only complaint about this place is that there are not enough locations!! They need one in Pleasanton or Walnut Creek.
author: Valerie B.

description:
We recently went here to work from a cafe on a typical sunday Study & Work Sesh.
We drove to the cafe and  were able to find parking easily. The cafe itself has plenty of tables and there are always a few open. One huge added plus is there are ALOT of Plugs. 

The Coffee is amazing: My personal top picks are - 
* Iced Philtered Soul with Cinnamon in the filter
* Mint Mojito
author: Cameron M.

description:
I'm not sure if handmade is necessarily the reason why the coffee here tastes better than most coffee, but it just does! I read somewhere that robots are actually better at making the perfect coffee, and even cooking food, and that made me kind of depressed! 

Is this the first one ever? it looks a lot more down home than most other philz coffee. 

I went here with my friend, and we sat on the sofa for a period of three hours or more? It was weird, I feel like I witnessed a psychological experiment. The cafe was full to the brim, and the employees were playing STAX soul music. 

Then, halfway through the time we were there they switched to top 40 r & B stuff with hits from the 2000's from beyonce, usher and then the newest stuff. It was like comparing night and day. the cafe completely emptied in no time, people had pained look on their faces, and the employees looked as if they were forcing themselves to pretend they enjoyed the music. 

after a series of commercial flops, i'm wondering where the future of top 40 r & B is going. i feel like the industry is freaking the hell out and they are reacting in a lot of bizarre, aggressive ways. maybe it's just that Facebook and new youth trends are changing, and it has nothing to do with them.

this philz is also a place with a lot of pretty people for some reason. because it's the mission?
author: Romy I.

description:
(See pics)

I was next door eating the night before and realized the Philz was right next door. I was so dreaming of it that only a few hours later I had to go back when it's open in the morning.

This location has the colourful accent of Mission, a local love of benches and sofas, a board full of little ads and stacks of cards of neighborhood events.

I love Philz for his love of precision of making the coffee, as art, as passion, as each cup means an experience, an enjoyment for hours and not just caffeine.

On the first time I visited where as supporting an iPhone app Blockboard that promotes and features neighborhood tips and what's happening that you feel more belonged, they offered free coffee. This alone shows it's not just a shop, it's about feeling identified.

This is a place that makes me yearn and dream for notes of joy.
author: T L.

description:
I have always wanted to try the mint mojito iced coffee, and it totally met my expectations. The lady who made my drink was super nice. Before I left with my drink she asked me to taste it in case it wasn't the way I wanted it. But it was super good, but I didn't realize how much mint leaves were in the actual drink. I usually dont like mint leaves so next time, I'm probably going to hold off on the leaves in my drink. 
The shop itself was nice, it could use some AC though. I felt like I was melting.
author: Ashley T.

description:
A friend brought me here...she swore up and down that this was one of the best places to get coffee.  I sort of rolled my eyes when I walked into the place.  It seemed like that stereotypical coffee house where all the mission-hipsters hang out.  The kind of place where everyone takes themselves way too seriously because they somehow know more about coffee and life than the rest of the world.   I mean...coffee is coffee.  Companies like Peet's, Seattle's Best, and Starbucks don't just get big overnight.  They meet the demands of their consumers by mass producing and perfecting a good cup of coffee.  Come on now...what on earth could a place like Philz Coffee do to make coffee taste that much better?  Put crack in it?  

And then I tried their coffee...and I was FLOORED.  Seriously...amazing.  And now I'm a fan.  You have to try their coffee...at least once.  I know, the coffee is sort of expensive and the place can be a little hippy dippy--the furniture is purposely eclectic and and the staff makes you order one cup at a time.  If you don't order one cup at a time, they kind of yell at you (that was my fault I guess).  But look beyond that.  If nothing else, their coffee is completely worth it...down to the last drop.
author: Naseem E.

description:
Philz is where to go for real coffee.  I'm a latte kinda girl that finds amusement in seeing what kind of design the barista can do with froth. There's definitely no foamy fluff at Philz. One gets quality, hand-dripped, super charged rocket fuel with each cup.

I love their original location best.  It's low key and wifi is a bonus.
author: Marleen C.

description:
my sisters had been talking about this place and having tried out Blue Bottle, I didn't think this place is going to match.
Came here about 30 mins before they close.  Parking around the area is such a pain.  Street parking only.
The staff were very nice helpful.
The variety of coffee were interesting.  I'm a big coffee drinker but their options and description got me a bit confused.
Tried out the Anesthesia and it was really good.  My sisters and I loved it. I even brought some home for hubby to try.  He loved it too.
Will have to come back to try other coffee.  Maybe go to Berkeley instead... I hate finding parking.
author: Learnee L.

description: Whoa. No kidding, these people are serious about their coffee. A great selection of dark, medium, and light roasts, as well as specialty drinks! The mint mojito iced coffee is mind blowing and ranks as one of my favorite coffee drinks of all time.
author: Fiona F.

description:
This place respects those who love the environment. If you bring your own reusable cup they pour however big your cup is, but only charge you for a small. I got their mixed blend iced and black; it was very delicious. The staff was friendly and helped me decide if I wanted the "When in Rome" drink (Mint Mojito Iced Coffee) or just the blended roast a much less sugary concoction.

The atmosphere was laid back and it is in one of the best districts of SF (in my humble opinion). There were board games and lots of artwork. The only downfall I found was some of their specialty drinks seemed a little pricey...over $7 for a coffee? My college bank account just can't fathom.
author: Heather R.

description:
I'm lucky I don't live in San Francisco because if I did I would probably give all my money to Philz. This stuff is real coffee for real coffee lovers; the flavors are in-your-face bold. I got a dark Turkish roast that was darker than anything I've ever had before, with an aromatic hint of cardamom...it did more than pick me up, it shot me out of the sky. For $3.25-3.50 per tall, I'd take Philz over a mixed espresso drink any day.

Oh and a tip: don't be awkward like me and stand there when your barista makes your coffee, I don't think it's what the cool kids who frequent this place regularly do (my barista was really nice about my obliviousness). Go up, order, and stand/sit back somewhere until they call out your order...you'll blend in better ;)
author: Clarice W.

description:
I don't usually drink coffee but my brother brought me to this place to finish up for some work. I had the mint mojito coffee and wow, I was amazed by the taste. It's really good and I don't like mint at all but I don't mind the taste at all on the coffee. The vibe in this place is really hip with a very friendly environment specially for pets.
They have enough power outlets and internet speed is good. 
Parking is a hassle and there can be lines on the weekends. 
I would recommend this place to all of my friends. Too bad I don't live here but if I do, I might start drinking coffee. LOL
author: Mike B.

description:
Best coffee in the City. And best Philz of the mini-empire. 

Philz descriptions of each of their coffees is accurate and they have a wide range of options available. The line is long and you should plan a little extra time to get through it, though it's never too much of a wait. Foo is always super slow, so get something that doesn't need to be heated/assembled. 

And Phil himself is great!
author: M B.

description:
I could probably drink the Turkish coffee blend here all day long if that didn't mean obesity, diabetes, and an early RIP. Definitely on the post-meal desserty side than anything that will kick your ass into gear for studying, since I don't usually notice the caffeine kick like a large black chug from the normal coffee shops, but damn, this stuff is tasty. 

Foamy head with a blast of cardamom and mint leaves, you'll be guzzling it all before you hit the books. And then the sugar hits you and you're zzzzz.

I should branch out and try their other coffees. Nice little outside area for studying, though you'll be distracted by little girls trying to kill themselves on roller skates or the usual Castro cruise.
author: Kevin L.

description: When you walk in to this Philz you don't feel like you're being greeted by a clientele base composed entirely of pretentious douche bags. I don't know how they were able to cultivate that vibe. For SF this is a huge accomplishment.
author: Christopher C.

description:
The service is always attentive and friendly, and their Tantalizing Turkish is my favorite. They put a bit of cardamom in the coffee while brewing to give it an exotic kick. Be sure to specify how creamy or sweet you want your coffee, as they mix it in for you unless you request otherwise. 

There is always a bargain LB of coffee by the register for only $12, which is a steal for such good coffee and custom blends.
author: Isaias G.

description:
If you like a chocolatey coffee get the tesora.  This coffee rocks.  We had them add some cream and a touch of sugar.  Perfection.  Bought the beans back to NYC and tried to replicate.  Was difficult because we use an aeropress and I think Philz uses a slow drip of some sort.  Still with the aeropress the coffee was impressive.  Maybe should have thrown it into the french press.  
DO go and go often if you are in SF!!
author: Jane K.

description: I don't normally pay $3 for a small cup of coffee, but when I do, it's at Philz. Upon seeing the wide selection of brews, I assumed the staff would be pretentious. Instead, I was pleasantly surprised by a very friendly man who patiently helped me pick a coffee based on my personal preferences. I stayed to do some work and found the clientele to be nice as well. It's a great place to get an excellent cup of coffee, and I'll definitely be back to try the mojito :)
author: Chia-Fen Y.

description:
I love me some Philz. Especially their Philtered soul and Iced coffee. 

This location is pretty cool. The baristas are all very friendly and cheerful, and sometimes you can even see Phil hanging around on his stool by the door. I even shook his hand once!
author: Vivian H.

description: The Mint Mojito is just heaven!! It's definitely a must have when you're in the city! Fast and friendly service is a maximum plus just LOVE.
author: Roxana V.

description:
I was SO excited to finally try Philz coffee for the first time.

How can I not order their iced mint mojito coffee that EVERYONE talks about?

until.......................

waiter: "sorry we ran out on mint today!. So, no mint mojito cofee today. "

Me: "No way.....! bummer! "

I instead or ordered a regular iced mocha. It was very good and I did not walk away dissapointed! Will definitely come back again

I also ordered a ham and cheeze croissant which is just blah ( too pricey and you almost need a microscope to see your THIN slice of ham)

Overall 4 stars!
author: Diana M.

description:
Concerned.  I've loved Philz for many years, but is it a victim of its own success? 

 Last four iced coffees: really not good, excellent, mediocre, not good.  Today: coffee was too hot and ice completely melted in five minutes, leaving coffee flavored water.  

Philz is too expensive and there's too long of a wait for this kind of inconsistency.  I will go back a couple more times, but if one of those coffees is not at least very good, I'm out.

EDIT: I did have a couple of very good iced coffees recently, whew.  Non-plussed about the remodel, which makes nicer counters for the baristas (yay for the awesome baristas), but the way the furniture has been organized makes the entire cafe feel cramped, yet without any more usable space.
author: Joe B.

description:
Definition of hipster: look no further than this Original Philz on 24th and Folsom in the "up & coming Mission District" (I always have to laugh because I grew up near by and it's still the same to me, same streets just new residents walking them). I honestly love this location. The baristas are always nice and always ask how my drinks taste! They're friendly and don't mind small talk while multitasking making other customers drinks. Lounge area is nice when you can find a seat cause it's always so busy. If you're looking for a quiet place to study, this may or may not work for you. Also, outlets are pretty sparse. 

Now since I'm reviewing the Original Philz location, I'll break down the coffee, as I hadn't on a previous Philz review. My hubs and his classmate were taking about coffee and his classmate works at Peets and describes Philz as the "Louis Vuitton" of coffee because they care way too much about their coffee. That sounds good to me! My favorite cold drink is, of course, the iced mint mojito. You're shocked, right? Tell me you're shocked. I get mine with vanilla soy and a little sweet. Hubs gets his extra sweet with vanilla soy. Occasionally, I'll ask for half cream and half vanilla soy - they're pretty accommodating with that. My favorite hot is the Silken Splendor. Nothing but a little sugar and you're good to go (at least for me. I'm not too big on cream/milk in my regular coffee). But if you're really adventurous, try the Jamaican Blue Mountain. That baby will cost you $10 for a large. Why? Because it's special. No. It really is. These beans are picked only one time a year, so hence the huge price. Guess what? A pound is $120. Did you just have a heart attack? I know, right, but one taste and you'll understand. No cream. No sugar. Just plain. Oh. Epic. Oh. Heaven. Tesora is yum. Mocha tesora is yum too. Itz the best isn't in my book, but it's yum. Ambrosia. Ooh. The ambrosia. So good. There is also a sooooo good. And that's good too. So basically, I just told you my top 4 because all the blends are pretty good. If you're a coffee snob/fanatic, this place is most def for you.
author: Kelly Marie C.

description:
I'm loving philz. The lines can get pretty long on the weekends, but I've been going here for a while now, so at least people recognize me and even sometimes remember my drink! With the volume of people that come in there every day, I'm going to say that's a difficult task. 
I could go here every day and never get sick of it. It's worth the wait in line. Every time.
author: Monica M.

description: So excited that the boyfriend brought me to this coffee shop on our recent trip to San Francisco. The coffee here was exceptional and hands down the BEST Turkish Latte I've ever had. The sweet aromatic spice of cardamom was present but not overpowering. I carefully watched the barista put together the concoction adding mint leaves as his final hurrah and gestured to sip for the final approval in taste. Yes!
author: Brenda Y.

description:
The coffee is good, very strong, and the single brew process allows you to choose from a wide variety of beans and blends. Yet, you taste a lot of the paper filter. Seriously it tastes like cardboard. That's a problem. They need to switch to the wire mesh gold filters. 

Also they need to allow you to put your own sugar and cream. I know exactly how much my coffee needs, and I don't care to explain to the barista, nor trust them to get it right.
author: Brian C.

description: Just up the street from our vacation rental, Philz Coffee was a treat while we lived on Treat Avenue. I loved the dark roast, Ether, my husband the medium, Silken Splendor.  Both were full-flavored and smooth enough to drink black.  Service was quick, the coffee GOOD and hot.
author: Nina G.

description:
The best coffee ever? Not for me but the best part is that they're consistent! I get annoyed when you can have the BEST taste one day, but then can't trust it to taste as good when you bring your friends there. 
Ordered a mint mojito iced coffee, medium cream. I love the fact they ask you how it is after making it, so they can tweak it accordingly. Would recommend!
author: Ashleigh D.

description:
I'm not a coffee drinker but I did enjoy my iced mojito.

Lines I heard were typically long but the service is fast!  

Pleasant smiling people is always a plus!
author: Patricia G.

description: Ima fan of their Ginger Snap Ice Coffee (medium-sweet). Kinda like Starbucks' holiday drank, except it is less artificial sugary and more spice-y: much better.
author: Suji C.

description:
We were walking around on the lookout for good tacos so coffee wasn't even on my radar BUT passing by Philz, the wonderful aroma just drew me in.  Looking at the menu, we were a bit lost...then we sat down on the wooden bench (pew from a church?) and the answers were right there in front of us - description of the coffee offered, about 20 of them listed by light, medium, dark and decaf.  

I wanted to know what is that wonderful scent - hubby said cardemon, I didn't want to believe it...so I asked and the girl behind the counter said she really can't smell/tell anymore but guessing it is the cardemon.  Ok, which one of the coffee has it?   Tantalizing Turkish under dark roast - sounds good to me, a small please ($3.25)!  She asked if we wanted any cream and sugar and I decided a little of both although we normally have black coffee.

The fabulous system here is they grind the beans when you order so it takes some time but well worth the wait.  While waiting, you can study on the other available option and decide on what you may want to try next - we already have about 3 in mind.  The decor is very "Mission" and the ambiance is very friendly, local and relaxed.  

When the drink was ready, she asked if I would like some fresh mint in it - I took a quick sip and said yes.  She picked a couple fresh mint leaves and put it in the coffee - asked if the coffee was ok, enough sugar and cream.  All good - put the cap on and head to pay.  

We were both surprised at how tasty the coffee is, even with the cream and sugar.  As a matter of fact, the cream and sugar enhanced the coffee, sort of brought out the wonderful aroma even more...the mint added a nice taste.  Here's the crazy part - the coffee tasted better and better as the mint flavor deepened and somehow the coffee flavor seem to be bursting.  Wild but true...
author: Gloria H.

description:
Oh Philz, you are a coffee lover's dream! Each hand poured cup is worth the wait and the baristas are always friendly. With all the different varieties, there is something for everyone. Mint Mojito: believe the hype!  When I'm not getting the mint mojito I tend to go with a dark roast.  The Ether will put hair on your chest (in a good way!). 

Since each cup is hand poured, you generally have to wait a bit. It's not for those in a hurry.
author: Bri H.

description: Everything has mint in it?! At first it was really hard to figure out the ordering process (even though there were copious signs) but staff was friendly and it felt acceptable to hang around at the tables/chairs. A SF institution that should not be missed!
author: Amanda F.

description:
This Philz location is deserving of all the five stars people give it. Whenever I have people in town, I bring them here to show them something unique and different from the cookie-cutter coffee corporations they're used to. 

Noteworthy:

Minto Mojito ($5). Really good. If you like your drinks sweet, I'd recommend asking for a little bit of cream and good amount of sugar. If you like coffee (of course you do), do yourself a favor and ask for a blend of Hazelnut coffee and Jacob's Wonderbar. A barista once suggested this and I was pretty damn blown away by how smooth and delicious it was - so try it and see if you feel the same!

I've never experienced the "snooty" vibe some of the reviewers have mentioned. Indeed, the opposite has been true - the baristas don't rush you when you're trying to navigate the menu while asking questions. As I mentioned, they'll ask what you like and make something that suits your taste. 

Overall, a must-try if you're ever in SF/the area.
author: Brandon M.

description:
THIS is pretension, lexicon, superfluous complexity, overpriced, overvalued, idiotically idealogical idiosyncrasy, BUT BY GOD,

THIS is coffee.
author: Liz C.

description: Amazing coffee, friendly service, comfortable seats, varied music, couldn't ask for much more!
author: Matt H.

description:
phil spellz hiz name with a Z.
He was actually very nice to us, and it was our first time there.  Of course, he insisted on making us a coffee, after we had already ordered so we ended up with one extra, and we are not huge coffee drinkerz, in fact I ordered mine half-decaf. Needless to say one ended up in the plant in the corner... Not my fault, I was playing action figure hockey ninjas with my son and we knocked one over.  
It was funny also because we parked in front of a different coffee shop across the street.  I felt like a real jerk.  So, I cleaned their windows when we went back to the car.  

oh yeah, Philz.  Kind of a lot for a cup of coffee.  But, you can get whatever kind of coffee you ever wanted to try, and it's all roasted nearby.  

&&&&&&And, if you didn't know, the banner will tell you they were voted San Francisco's best coffee, and they also informed me they do it "one cup at a time".  As opposed to more than one cup at a time?  I'm confuzed.
Lotz of fun seatz, and paintingz on the wallz add to the experience.  All the staff were very nice, and there is an honor system for paying after you get your beverage, which is a nice touch.  I hope nobody takes advantage of them.  Also, you can buy a newspaper here, or you can just piece one together from the basket in the middle of the room.  

*Note for people who love Firemen: if you love Firefighters, there will always be some to love here.  They absolutely flock to this place.  Philz should sponsor a little league team called "the Firefighters".  It just feels right.
author: Joshua K.

description:
BEST COFFEE EVER!!

My review really doesn't change anything. I'm just echoing what everyone else said. At first, I thought it was a hype and didn't believe how great it was and now I wish I tried this place earlier. 

I dream of their mocha tesora. Just wish there were more locations around the city because none are close enough to where I live (Richmond District).
author: Mimi V.

description: Philz was right down the block from our apartment where we were staying and became our defacto local spot. Super friendly staff and the place has a great neighborhood feel. Every morning I came to Philz made me want to live in that neighborhood. Great place to start your day.
author: Joshua C.

description:
Iced mint (herbal) tea with honey was delicious and refreshing!

-1 star because there was absolutely no air circulation inside... it was very musty and smelled pretty bad
author: Lin L.

description: Love this place and already miss it.  Moved away a week ago.  The coffee is great and the mixed coffees are also great.  My wife lives the staple drink of the mojito medium sweet, which is very refreshing, get still gets you wired.
author: Mathew K.

description: Great coffee, but can you please get better lids? Your lids seem to not fit or go down all the way and I've had them pop off on me several times, causing me to spill coffee on myself.
author: Alan H.

description: The iced mocha tesora is hands down AMAZING, even by Seattle coffee standards.  The employees are interesting to watch and talented at making coffee. I can see why Philz has become as popular as it is. This quickly became a daily staple on my trip to San Francisco!
author: Becca M.

description: They're mint black tea is awesome & everyone is always super friendly. Still trying to find a coffee brew from them that I LOVE though. The search continues.
author: Ashley B.

description: I guess this is the OG one and it's def got some character over their other locations. Anyways i'm a philzvangelist and this one even has outdoor benches. Delightful.
author: Misha T.

description:
This review is based off of 2 drinks, but I will be back in the future to try more!

We got a large Philtered Soul: hazelnut, cocoa, syrup -- for $4 and a large Chai latte also for $4. You can taste the difference in these drinks compared to another run of the mill coffee chain! The quality is great! They can make it sweet, not too sweet, or no sweet to your liking.

If you're a first timer, just make sure to pay attention to the signs for where to stand to place your order with the barista. After the order is placed, walk on over to the cash register to pay. There is no minimum for card. The baristas are all welcoming and easy going :) 

Sad I didn't get to try the Mint Mojito before leaving SF!
author: Maki K.

description:
Went there with high hopes due to friend recommendations and Yelp reviews and was happy with the experience. Mint Mojito Iced Coffee is incredible--they put actual mint leaves on top! Also had Sooo Good--delicious.

It was a bit crowded and quite hot inside, even in November!
author: Peter N.

description:
Best coffee I've had. (Haven't tried Sightglass or Four barrel yet). 

They have an enormous variety for all dark, medium, and light roasts.
Real interesting mixes such as: 

-Turkish (dark) has a touch of cardamom
-Mocha Tesora (specialty) is pretty much for hot chocolate type of people
-Mint Mojito (specialty) is really good
-Jamaican Blue Mountain... don't get it with cream/sugar
author: James H.

description: I love Philz coffee but went there this morning to start my day and there were 4 employees working to open up the store. The gate and door were still closed even though it was after 6:30am. I stood outside until 6:40 while 3 of the employees saw me waiting and no one came to open up the store. I left without the coffee and food I was counting on to start my day and the store hadn't even opened 10 minutes after store hours. Great coffee. Rude way to treat a loyal, neighborhood customer.
author: Jen K.

description: This place was recommended by a friend to me so it was my First time here and OMG I'm in love! Tried their mint mojito iced coffee.. It is so good!! Perfect combination of sweetness, creaminess and minty! Can't wait to go try some more of their other flavors of coffee..
author: Rikki S.

description:
I hardly drink coffee. The reasons: (1) I don't care too much for the taste; (2) I hate how it makes me want to run to the bathroom in the morning; (3) I have a horrible experience of drinking 2 cups of coffee the night before a huge math exam and experiencing major stomach pains the following day. (Never again, free refill or not!) So when I am in need of a caffeine perk, I usually opt for tea, but that doesn't mean I don't appreciate a nice cup of Joe every now and then.

Philz would be one of those places that I would not mind stopping by for coffee every now and then. I've actually been here twice just to try their coffee, and for me, that is saying a lot. The only other reason I would be in a coffee shop is to get my study on. So why would a tea-loving, coffee-no-nothing like me trek all the way to the Mission for a cup of coffee?? Because it tastes GOOD!

On my first visit, I tried the the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee. I wasn't sure what to expect, but boy, was it good! It still tastes like coffee, but without the strong bitterness. It was also just the right amount of sweetness. I was immediately hooked!

The second time I decided to try the Ginger Snap Iced Coffee. I was worried that it would turn out too sweet because someone had mentioned that it tastes like a liquid cookie, which some sweet-toothed people would enjoy, but it's not my preference.  When I went to the counter to take a sip, it actually turned out to be a lot less sweet than I had imagined. It actually could have been a little sweeter for it to be just right. I decided to accept the drink as is, although the barista told me to take a sip and to let him know if there needed to be any adjustments. Perhaps the barista heard my concerns when I spoke aloud to my friend, so I didn't bother. The drink was still tasty, but I would definitely prefer the Mint Mojito between the two. If you like sweet chai, you will probably like this drink. 

I also took a sip of my friend's medium roast Tesora, which had a very nice rich flavor. Makes me want to try their hot coffees next.  

Coffee snob or not, you will not be disappointed. In addition to tasty coffee, is their friendly staff and chill atmosphere. There are several round communal tables and couches on the side. Noise level is not too high. I could hear my friend clearly. However, we were probably the only two people speaking, beside the baristas taking orders, which made me feel like we were talking too loud. Other than that, the only major downside is the $4 price tag for a small iced coffee that prevents me from coming more often.
author: Lily W.

description:
This is everything a neighborhood coffee joint should be. Delicious. Relaxing. Friendly. Philz. 

The coffee is made cup by cup and the effort speaks for itself when you taste the coffee. It makes me a believer in non-espresso coffee beverages. 

Everyone who works there looks like a cool expert coffee bartender and is so nice. They have pastries too including gluten-free options for those with a sensitive tummy. 

Couches, plenty of tables, and outdoor seating for those with pups or are trying to soak in the brisk SF weather. 

Personal Blend preference: Silken Splendor. Nutty, Cocoa. Yummmm
Hunter Pence's preference (according to the Philz twitter account): Philtered Soul 

Bonus: Near AT&T Park to warm you up before a chilly night game. 
Parking: Blergh. Park at the Safeway and validate for $5 and walk across the street.
author: Carmen K.

description:
Best drink: Iced mint mojito, light to medium sweet, a little light on the ice, extra mint. 

I have never attempted to get work done there, lay out is a bit cramped. More conducive to grabbing your coffee and walking around the Mission or sit outside and people watch (especially during Street Sundays).
author: John V.

description: Actually i always buy a cup of mint mojoto at the food truck if there are less than 5 people in front of me
author: Chang L.

description:
I'm not a huge coffee drinker but Phil's was really good.
i am a huge fan of the iced mint mojito coffee! SO yummy!
the philtered soul is also good.
author: Clara C.

description: Philz coffee is awesome! The baristas are pretty cool here and can help you find what type of coffee flavor your are looking for since the menu can be a bit overwhelming if you are not familiar with the different roasts that they offer. I would recommend to order any of their coffees that adds a little of mint to it. It adds a touch of more flavor to the coffee.
author: Frances V.

description:
An Ode to Philz...

Philz makes me feel like a little girl.
Philz makes me want to run barefoot over Astroturf.
Philz makes me not shave on a Sunday morning.
Philz makes me laugh at pet funerals.
Philz makes me sing Moldavian folk songs.
Philz makes me look fat.
Philz makes me my very own cup of Mocha Tesora.
Blue Bottle reaches for my cajones, but Philz goes to my heart.

Believe it or not, last weekend was my very first visit to the original Philz. I've been to both Castro locations and the one in Mission Bay many, many, many, many times. The couches may have been taken, and the slacker-vibe kinda thick, but oh for the smooth, rich flavor of a handmade cup of coffee for $3.50.

COFFEE - 5 stars...so smooth I rub it on my...
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...hippie-dippy, man
SERVICE - 4 stars...focus on me....focus on me
TOTAL - 5 stars...just comes down to the brew
author: Ed U.

description:
This place doesn't need my review. We all know how rockin the coffee is, right?
I go here and try a new coffee everytime and still walk out with a LB. of TESORA.
Simply the best.
author: Kirt V.

description:
After going to the one in the Castro last Monday and giving it 3 stars, I decided to visit the original location in the Mission with my bf cuz we are avid coffee drinkers. We had the Terosa (medium sweetness and medium cream - $3.00). It was awesome, especially when it's hot! I could feel the caffeine rushing through my veins. Philz makes one cup at a time and I feel so special!

Venue - This location is a lot bigger than the Castro location. There are 3 barista's and 1 cashier, so there's segregation of duties, thus more efficient. :) There were plenty of seats and ample parking, even on the weekends. Only took us ~15 minz to find parking, pretty good for SF if you ask me.

After picking up our coffee, we went around the corner and had Mexican food. Never knew that Mexican food and coffee mixes but it works.
author: Carrie Y.

description: Best coffee I've ever had. PLEASE TRY THE MOJITO. I LOVE IT. I want it right now, but I live in SoCal.. ): I would fly there for a cup right now if I could..
author: Joan H.

description:
I don't understand how I've lived in Berkeley for four years and never visited a Philz shop until I explored the Mission today!! But it's quite fitting that my FIRST visit was to be the ORIGINAL location. 

Ordered: Small Mint Mojito Iced Coffee. I heard about the rave reviews and just had to try it. Taking some other reviewer's advice, I opted for half-sweetened and cream w/ my drink. It was perfect! I wasn't sickenly overloaded with a sugary aftertaste and the coffee was brewed so well that there was no bitterness or sourness either. The mint added a refreshing touch, although a bit awkward when it got stuck in my teeth. But that may just be me being klutzy with food -__-

Service: I actually had my friend order for me, but she said the barista was nice in explaining to her that the mint will make coffee more bitter because the barista was worried that my drink wouldn't be sweet enough. Good thing I like my coffee to be strong so that wasn't a problem. 

Atmosphere: 11:30 am and this place was PACKED. I wouldn't come here to meet a large group of friends or try to study due to the noise level.

Packaging: Hot and warm drinks come in a paper cup that has a ridge lining (i.e. built-in sleeve). I like how this saves paper! And by not using plastic cups, the ice in my cold drinks don't melt as fast, watering it down.

Price: $4 for a small cup. Sadly this will be the factor as to why I won't be making regular visits (aside from the fact that I don't live in Berkeley or will go out to SF that often anymore). But if I am ever in the vicinity of any Philz location in the Bay Area, it will be a personal goal for me to stop by and treat myself :)

Like many have said before, after my Philz I can't look at Starbucks or Peet's the same way again. *sigh*
author: Bonnie Z.

description:
I typically don't like coffee but Philz Coffee has changed my mind.  After one sip of their delicious mint iced coffee, I am hooked.  It is minty, creamy, sweet and oh so delicious.  A bit pricey @ $4 for a large but it is totally worth it.  

PS.  If you get the Chai, there are chai bits at the bottom, so be careful.
author: Jessica P.

description:
OHHH EMMM GEEE! After hearing all the raves and cravings that people have constantly, I finally understand. They must put crack in this stuff, there's no other way to explain it.

Get the iced coffee mint mojito, I know it sounds weird. Just do it. Stop reading this review, and go directly there. It's more than just an iced coffee, it's more than a drink. It has so many dimensions!

Your first sip is like WHOA. Never had anything like this. There's a coffee taste, then there's the right amount of sweetness (it's more than just simple syrup or sugar), then there's this milky frothy taste, then there's a refreshing mint. 

Like everyone said, service is GREAT. I definitely tasted the love in my drink. I'm hooked (can't compare this to blue bottle, two different types of coffee - different categories).
author: Vanessa K.

description: I am an Addict when it comes to the Iced Mint Mojito.  Delicious and Refreshing.
author: Craig M.

description: Their mint mojito coffee has changed my life. I like it medium sweet and medium creamy. WiFi is free and it's a good place to work too. Philz, I hear you're going to open up shop in DC. Please come to new york city!
author: Kimi D.

description:
Great coffee and even better service!

I had an experience at Philz that highlights why I LOVE this place:

I went in with my 2-yr old and ordered a large cup of Dancing Water and a veggie quiche (which my son LOVES). I decided to hang out in the shop and enjoy my cup of coffee. I placed my coffee on the opposite end of the table from where my son was sitting/standing/yelling/playing/whatever other action a 2-yr old can do on a chair (you'd be surprised). Anyway, as soon as I thought my kid couldn't get himself into any trouble, he removed his hat and flung it at my full cup of coffee. Thankfully no one was burned, but he made a huge mess. I could not run for a towel or napkins because I didn't want to leave my son by himself at the table, so before I was able to grab him I noticed someone was already cleaning up the mess my son made... 

It was Phil. 

He just smiled and said "It's good luck." After we cleaned the mess, he asked me what I was drinking and he went back and made me another cup himself. I apologized and thanked him when he came back to our table, but he just kept letting me know how fortunate I was to have my boy.

I think "Phil'z" personality and his attitude resonates to the way business is done @Philz. The baristas are friendly and very knowledgeable. They are always willing to answer any questions you may have regarding the many flavors they offer. I also can't recall a time a barista did NOT ask me to make sure my cup is the way I like it.
author: Menandro M.

description: I used to not be too into coffee but law school changed that. Now, whenever I am in SF, I try to either make it to this place or blue bottle. Their staff is extremely helpful in picking the perfect blend for your taste buds and mood. Their prices are slightly higher than say a Peet's or the like, thus the two $, but you are getting your coffee brewed personally and it is much better quality. Last time I went my date also had a great experience and the barista walked her through the coffees till she found what she called her "favorite coffee ever." And she drinks A LOT of coffee :)
author: Joseph D.

description:
My all time favorite location (and the original one too) for my all time favorite coffee. The baristas are so knowledgeable and friendly. I used to work nearby and would get coffee for myself and my co-workers, sometimes, who never tried it. When I would tell the barista what they would typically order at Starbucks, they would recommend a drink for me to order for them. Or if I needed something with lots of caffeine to keep me going through the day, they would suggest something to try.

If you want soy, they have original and vanilla. For sweetness you tell them whether you want little, medium or very sweet. After they finish making your drink, they want to make sure it's how you like it so they want you to taste it before you leave. Talk about service, right?!

My go-to and favorite drink is the Mocha Tesora (dark roast). It's a dark chocolate-inspired blend with a mix of cocoa that you only get in-store. I usually get medium roasts, but this is FAN-FREAKING-TASTIC!

I've tried their ice mint mojito and wasn't a fan. The fresh crushed mint in it was too overwhelming for me.

Other blends I've tried that were great: 
Sooo Good (light roast): delivers smoky tones paired with vivacious sweet highlights
Canopy of Heaven (light roast): a signature blend bursting with lively complex flavors and sweet beans from across the globe to produce a delicious caffeinated cup
Philtered Soul (medium roast): burst of chocolate and traces of hazelnut. Great for those with a sweet tooth
Ambrosia Coffee of God (medium roast): has sweet nutty tones w/a subtle finish
Philharmonic (medium roast): warm tones with layers of cardamom that you only get in stores
Hazelnut: a sweet blend with hazelnut tones that are rich and creamy w/a bright finish
Jamaican Blue Mountain: a rare full-bodied blend. I've actually tried this blend from other roasters and the one here isn't as good, unfortunately

If I need a strong cup of joe, I go for either Code 33 (A strong, rich, oily dark roast blend with a full bodied taste. A special blend made for the San Francisco Police Department to keep them alert) or the Greater Alarm (a light roast designed to keep coffee drinkers and firefighters awake and ablaze, it consists of vivid and uplifting tones, paralleled with blazing strength and sweetness).

For those who don't drink coffee (like a few of my former co-workers), they make excellent loose teas as well. I had ordered the green tea w/honey for someone and they absolutely loved it.

The baked goods are really good as well. I suggest the scones and the croissants!

P.S. For those into guys, they often have the cute firefighters dropping into this location so you get nice eye candy while you wait for your drink ;)
author: Kitty K.

description:
I love Philz coffee!!! The Gingersnap iced coffee is everything!  
So far I had their Philtered Soul, Gingersnap of course (all time favorite), and mint mojito. If you're someone that likes your coffee sweet but still strong, try one of those three. I've been wanting to try every single coffee on their menu but every time I do, I end up getting the Gingersnap coffee - it's like Christmas in a cup! 
Something about their coffee that stands out from all the other coffee shops out there. The people who work there are very friendly and always making sure they make your coffee the way you want it, if not they have no problem making it exactly how you want it. I love that! If you're a coffee drinker and you have not tried Philz Coffee, you haven't lived!!!! Try it! You will not be disappointed!
Ooooooh! Almost forgot - IF you go to this Philz Coffee shop on 24th, I recommend you get their "five-O" cookie  (chocolate chip with shredded coconut)  it's mind blowing! Who ever thought of that combination is genius!!!!
author: Stephanie M.

description:
I want to say that I the 1 star is reflective of the service I received by the blonde guy. Normally I get my cups at the Vanessa location but decided to go to this one, since I live 2 blocks away and I needed some beans. 

I was talked down to by this guy when I asked what the $3 and $4 meant since it was before the $16lb. As he explained and pointed at the cups with a smart attitude and then he did a Vanna White as he said "and this is where we brew the coffee and over the is where you pay for what you order and can order coffee beans there"

Very uncalled for, so I will never step into this location ever and maybe the others because I explained to the young lady what happen and she said he might be stressed and had a long day. My reply was "that is still no excuse".

I will say that the coffee is great and I will miss you, but I am only 1 of the thousands of customers they have....
author: A D.

description:
I've had a rough past few months, but one of my absolute happiest moments came when I sat outside of Philz Coffee, in the eclectic and lively Mission district, watching passersby with my insufferable-yet-endearing best friend Robert. 

I had a mocha that was incredibly rich; it hit the spot perfectly. But there was something just so charmingly peaceful about sitting on the bench outside on a warm afternoon, catching a glimpse into the lives of the Hispanic locals and gentrified SF youth alike. Overly sentimental? I've always been a bit of a romantic - but make no qualms about it, Philz is a neighborhood stalwart for all the right reasons. It does that "friendly corner coffee shop" gig better than most I've been to. It's certainly a permanent stop whenever I'm up north again.
author: Eric F.

description:
The First Philz Coffee Location, awesome coffee, ambiance and entertaining baristas !
Try some off the menu blends like,  "greater ether", "red sea", "red yirgacheffe", "red haze"
Iced coffee is an all time hit !
author: Vish E.

description: I visited this location for the first time and the quality and service is great! All their locations stay consistent in providing me the best cup of joe. I ordered the usual, Ecstatic Extra Extra and it was amazing! It was a ten minute walk from where I was visiting and def worth the walk.
author: Tina K.

description: I haven't stopped thinking about this coffee since I first had it last September. So delicious. Ambrosia was a good choice
author: Sierra W.

description:
First time I tried the mint mojito, it was amazing. The flavor was so good. That's the one on Vaness.

Last few times I had it, on 24th st. It was such a disappointment. Over rated for over priced mediocre coffee :/

Maybe it's the location. Staff is still friendly.
author: mui d.

description: Jerks. Rude service, very entitled. I actually felt like my tea had bad energy from them and couldn't drink it.
author: Alyssa R.

description:
I'm obsessed with this place. The Mint Mojito and Ginger Snap iced coffees were phenomenal. Neither were overwhelming/too strong. Both were refreshing and smooth. 

I also really liked the atmosphere. It reminded me of two other great coffee shops: Rebecca's in San Diego and McClain's in Fullerton. It was very casual with a lot of art on the walls. Most people seemed to be on their computers studying. I'll return definitely! (Already been there twice today!)
author: Ashley S.

description: Great coffee! I wished I could drink more of it. The flavors are different and adding mint makes it even much better! Fresh mint :)
author: Lina L.

description:
So I get to be your 890th strong coffee review.  Lets make it clear.. you walk in tired and you walk out super buzzed.   wait three days.. you walk in tired and after yet another cup of joe..you walk out buzzed.   

I can't even get my own home brewed stuff this strong, no matter how hard i try.   

Recommendation... purchase their beans right at the store!!!! then take it home and brew away.
author: Tito Y.

description: Never had I understood why people love coffee till I had my first cup at Philz.  Excellent coffee; energetic vibe.  My favorite?  Jacob's Wonderbar with cream and sugar (medium).
author: Jyotshna K.

description:
Love the coffee here!  My favorite is the mint mojito iced coffee made sweet and creamy (which is many people's favorite).  

The atmosphere of this place is really cool.  The people who serve you are super laid back -- you order first and then go pay.  Also when they finish making the coffee, they tell you to try it and see if the sweetness level/taste is to your liking.  They have comfortable couches and free wi-fi, so you can hang out for long periods of time.  When I was jobless, I spent a few afternoons here and it was nice.
author: Carrie L.

description:
Who isn't charmed by Phil instantly upon being engaged as a customer by him?
I was pulled into his Beam of Charm instantly upon crossing the threshold of the winsome green storefront. What would you like, beautiful lady? He asks, and my response is: I would like Coffee, Phil, please make me your most caramelly coffee you have.
So he immediately proceeds to produce a caramelly cup of libation from the coffea beans, quipping all sorts of charming statements to me and other customers, just charming the eclectic cluster of clientele off their feet, to hover somewhere a couple inches above ground. 
I have been back, but that first visit just hooked me... it was due to equal parts Phil and his Phantastic Coffee.
author: Rainbow U.

description:
With names like Greater Alarm, Silken Splendor, Tesora the unique flavors of each drink pop just as much as the monikers.  You will have folks that will bag that the coffee is $3, but rest assured with each cup slow dripped made to order to your specs of sweetness and add ons it is well worth it.    

The moment you step foot into any Philz you are hit with that awesome nutty buttery coffee grind fragrance in the air.  Walk up pending if the line is long, place your order and in 5 to 8 minutes your cup of joe is ready.  The coffee is usually a nice medium body and can range in flavor from cocoa, berry, cinnamon as each drink has a unique combination creating an awesome experience with every drink.  The only drink I did not care for was the iced mint mojito coffee, reminded me of toothpaste.  The baristas will make your drink for you till you are fully satisfied with the flavor.  

Dancing Water is one of my favorites as well as Philtered Soul.  To visitors, skip the Green mermaid and get you some Philz.
author: Grubnoisseur Y.

description: Love everything on the menu, but prefer Mocha Tesora. Great coffee for those who enjoy the deep strong bitter taste without the sourness. The place is very unique with lovely community feel. Something I hope they continue to keep as there are many development that took away the characters of the city. Also amazed at how the quality is maintained even with their expansion into many different locations. Please keep the good coffee going!
author: J Y.

description:
Pros: 
coffee
barista set-up
free wi-fi

Cons:
terrible, slow, spotty, wi-fi

Overall, I'm sticking by a three-star rating because of the wireless situation.  I needed to get some work done, and when I find myself loading a page, reading a news article, clicking a link, reading another article to wait out the loading time, then that is not good.
author: Andrew J.

description:
We decided to check out Philz on New Year's Day. I ordered a large Tesora with cream and sugar. It was a perfect blend, smooth, not too sweet or bitter. 

My wife ordered a large iced coffee mint mojito: minty, just what you'd envision a coffee mint mojito to taste like; I couldn't envision it before I tried it, but once I did it was like, yep, that's an iced coffee mint mojito.
author: Danna C.

description: I usually come to this Philz since I work in the neighborhood. All the barista's are sweet, super friendly and they always make my drink just the way I like it. I usually order the iced mint mojito with decaf coffee (I get shaky) and I ask for it to be "sweet and creamy". I've also tried the mocha tesora  and the ecstatic iced coffee which are both really good as well. The Tesora is really deep chocolate-taste and the ecstatic iced coffee is pretty much their bunch of daily drippings from each coffee they make-combined. This location has a good amount of seats with a cozy feel to it. The manager Max is a sweetheart!
author: Laura T.

description: So my first trip to Philz. Had to go to the original. The Barista asked my roast pref med suggested the Tesora and I got stevia and soy.  Hahahha happy happy joy joy. Its perfect temp to drink imidiately as I'm heat temp sensitive- am I the only one?!
author: Scott D.

description: Amazing amazing chai!  Lovely spicing was a party in my mouth, as were the fresh mint leaves. If you love coffee, tea and ritual, do yourself a favor and have a cup at Philz!
author: N L.

description:
Fantastic blends of coffee here! I think the names are funny and the staff here keep things lively. They manage to stay friendly, even with the waves of customers that flow in!

I love black coffee and Philz offers a great variety and fair price - indeed everything is handmade for you. The method they use for drip isn't exactly "perfectionist" but I love the blends to care. Those breakfast burritos are really good too...
author: David T.

description:
love their mint mojito iced coffee.
nice and friendly baristas as well.
author: Heejin L.

description:
been here one time and I love the place. 

it has a great aesthetic, and the people that are working there fit the location and aesthetic perfectly. 

the employees knew what they were talking about and they recommended the perfect blend for taste.
author: Antoine M.

description:
Dear Phil:
 Thank you for making me happy in the morning, afternoon, and whenever I want some good coffee. I've been house sitting for a friend and he has Philz Jacobs wonderbar beans! I've been making coffee everyday and getting no sleep! I was craving me some Philz at 8pm last night and had me some, didn't sleep until 4am. I woke up this morning and had another cup. Watch out this stuff is like crack!
author: Karen T.

description: I just can't get enough of that mint mojito iced coffee! So refreshing and perfect for a hot summer day. It's so addicting i can't get myself to order anything else on the menu!
author: Gina N.

description:
While waiting for a table at Mr. Pollo on a Friday night, we strolled in here to get a nice warm beverage before going out to brave the cold San Francisco night. I had never been to any Philz Coffee, but my friend suggested it since he had been here before with his coffee connoisseur friends.

Walking in, this place was quintessential Berkeley -- there was an eclectic mix of furniture and decorations that made it fun and quirky. We sat down at the bench facing the menu that's posted along the counter. I'm not a big coffee drinker (in fact I just recently weaned myself off of my morning cup of joe), so I decided to choose a mild decaf coffee. For those who want real coffee, there's tons of options, but for decaf coffee, there were three. This was lucky for me because I'm always so indecisive. I narrowed it down by reading the descriptions and chose the Decaf Sumatra.

When we went, there were several people filling up the majority of the seats, but there was no line to order. We ordered at the counter being manned by two warm and friendly employees. When I placed my order, she asked if I wanted cream and sugar and I asked for only a little bit. I didn't really watch it being made since I was busy catching up with my friend, but once I took a sip, I knew they did a job well done! It was amazing! Probably one of the best coffees I've had. Usually, I like to control how much cream and sugar (or more so what KIND of cream and sugar) I add to my coffee, but I guess when you leave it to the experts, you know you'll be guaranteed a tasty cup. I paid $3 for my small, which is comparable to other coffee shops. 

The other nice thing is they will make it to your liking -- my friend wanted a little more sugar, so they added it to his cup without any problems at all.

We tried to find a place to sit inside rather than standing out in the cold, but people were spread out all over the place, so we couldn't find a couple seats together.

Overall, this place has amazing coffee and a friendly staff. I can see the attraction of this place. It seems like it would be a nice place to sit down and relax or do some work if there were actually open seats. If I were needing a cup of coffee and were in the area, I would definitely come here again!
author: Leana L.

description:
Dear Phil,

I love your coffee and the Turkish Delight.  Every person needs to try a few blends until they find the ones for them -- Phils has 5 star coffee.

I'm setting this review to 3 stars and will come back and change it to 5 stars if the 1 star tomatoes are replaced or if tomatoes are removed as an option on bagels.

The Philz bagel somes with a weird, mealy, light pink fleshy thing on it.  I've been told that it is a tomato, but that is not a tomato.  There are numerous places to buy fine tomatoes (Early Girls, heirloom varieties, etc).  The tomato served tastes like it was picked early, bought at Costco, sliced a couple of days ago, and refrigerated.

Phil, stop buying crappy tomatoes and then refrigerating them.  Send a barista down the block and pick up fresh tomatoes every other day and you will be fine.... or just don't offer tomatoes at all -- the pink gross ones can ruin not only the bagel but the accompanying beverage.

Search the web for: "Refrigeration is the enemy of the tomato as it nullifies flavor and turns the flesh mealy"
author: Rudy R.

description: Never a disappointing cup of coffee. Great vibes, great music. Currently the baristas are less friendly than a year ago, with the exception of a couple of baristas of course. The lines can be long/confusing.
author: Sabrina J.

description:
A mechanic knocked an alternator wire loose during a 60,000 mile check up on my Honda. My car died the next day while driving to work at 6:30am. I called the shop, they called a tow truck and he called me, saying it would be an hour. Not ideal.

I wandered down Folsom, leaving my car on the side of Cesar Chavez, in search of anything resembling caffeine. I found it. 

In what was a pain-in-the-ass situation, waiting for a tow truck to pick me up just in time to hit rush hour traffic down 101 and three hours late to work, I stumbled upon something great. I'd almost like to write the mechanic and thank him, as I go to Philz several times a week now.

If you haven't been, don't wait for your car to break down on Cesar Chavez. Just go. You'll be glad.
author: Michael C.

description:
This is hands down the best coffee I've ever had. If you can handle the long line. 

One of the friendly baristas will ask you what you'd like and then brew it by hand right in front of you. 

Then you realize why you waited so long for a cup. Smooth, delicious, brewed at just the right temperature to achieve taste perfection. 

They even asked if I wanted my chocolate croissant heated!

Plenty if seating as well and free wifi. Big tables give this place a warm and communal atmosphere.
author: Chris J.

description:
Hmm...not clued into this place till today!?. Costs more than a buck from what I'm used to (Pete's) but it's drip, somewhat  personally made to order, a very flavorful and nicely caffeinated coffee.  I tried the tesora, a medium blend since a friend warned that their coffees were very strong, and that did me just fine. I think I can go stronger, but that was a very satisfying blend. 

i'll definitely be back to try more. Interestingly their cups are made of something unearthly that don't need corrugated cardboard protection. They just work.
author: Henry Y.

description:
This is not a place for studying... It is so crowded and the open doors made it a freezer!!!!

:( The only good thing was the good service.. everyone was friendly!

And sadly, the coffee wasn't as wowing as people said.. Adding sugar and cream.. just made the coffee too sweet.... Soooo good was just ok, smooth but really really light in flavor.

Also, the WiFi kept logging me off every 10 to 15 minutes :(:(:( Really inconvenient if you're in the middle of researching for something. AND, even if you have your own network, this place is a WiFi blackhole?! you can't get your own network..?!

The Sambusas were decent though, a good start for the morning. Ample amount of minced beef!!! And crispy outside :)
author: Ka L.

description:
So incredibly awesome!!!!!! My PIC recommended we go here and it was so good! The wait wasn't very long and I ordered the decaf mocha tesora! They got it out in a reasonable amount of time I was concerned about a long wait bc of the line but it wasn't long at all! It seriously was the best coffee I had ever had and I don't usually even care for coffee! I am
Very sensitive to caffeine and so a good decaf is truly hard to find! Their coffee did not dissapoint!
author: L H.

description:
ONE OF THE BEST PLACES TO GET COFFEE IN SAN FRANCISCO! 

I'm pretty picky when it comes to coffee, so to give Philz Coffee 5 stars is pretty huge. My friend brought me to Philz for the first time, and introduced me to Philtered Soul. It has a little hint of chocolate, and is nicely balanced. Philz Coffee has their own "lingo" when it comes to ordering, which they will be happy to introduce you to if it's your first time there. I usually get medium/medium (medium sweetness, medium cream) and every time, its perfectly done. They mix it all for you and tell you to taste it before walking away from the counter. If you need any adjustments, they are more than happy to fix it, or make you a fresh cup. 

What makes this place special is that they brew each cup of coffee when you order. You can even watch them make your cup if you want since they do it right behind the counter. 

My other favorite coffee, which is very popular, is the Mint Mojito! It's an iced, sweet coffee so if you don't want it too sweet let them know. Philz Coffee never disappoints!
author: Jennifer R.

description:
This is one of those very rare cases where you must believe the hype!!
The mojito is to die for.
author: Tricia G.

description: I am a coffee connoisseur  and when I say this is the best coffee I've ever had--that means something!  Such a unique concept and flavors.  The names are creative and fun although I will admit it confuses the newbies, but once you get the hang of it-- its fun.  Just look at the descriptions next to the names.  The lighter roast have more caffeine than the darker.  Also, do try the iced coffees.  My favorite is the gingersnap sweat and creamy.  Oh yes, that reminds me when you order, you need to specify how you want the cream and sugar.  My usual is the greater alarm and I use to get it light light, but now I'm getting the new manhattan light cream and light to medium sugar.  Those are my favorites, but there are so many other wonderful flavors.  This location is a little bigger than the other ones in SF and has a sort of hipster vibe going on.  Follow the instruction of the line and you will be fine.  You will be hooked!
author: Megan M.

description:
I'm not even sure where to begin...

The coffee is the most thought out, meticulous, and tasty I have ever tried.

I was a Blue Bottle/FourBarrel/FarmTable/Sightglass guy for a very long time. One day I tried Philz and I was a little skeptical of everything going on, so I didn't try it for a year later. A year later friends of mine said let's pop in to 24th st and grab an Ecstatic Iced Coffee. Tony made me the best coffee of my life, hands down. That dude get's it perfect EVERY SINGLE TIME! So that is my Sunday, Monday routine when I am in that part of town.

With my commute to Marin everyday, I would back track down Van Ness to go get my bagel from everyone's favorite East Bay reppin' bagel maker, Zach (Shalom, my brother) and with my love of the Giants, during baseball season, I will return full time to Van Ness to catch up... The baristas there are fantastic, but I am drawing a blank on my regular dudes name. Wears cool glasses, 20's, thinner, had longer hair for a while now short... Damn.... He and Austin hold down that busy line and make great coffee with  a smile, which I find a rarity in the city full of overly cocky baristas :)

Sausalito is the new spot as it's right on my way to work. Craig, Charlie, Ray, and the girls are bringing great coffee to Marin. About time. Now just to start bagel service there!

Start my Ecstatic Iced, cream and sugar, SWEET, because I am on my way guys!
author: David K.

description: This is the hands down winner of hipsters run amok. Whether the coffee is worth the extra dollar over PEETS is irrelevant. From the snarky baristas to the condescending cashiers, it's hardly super fun to wait 10-15 minutes for a barely above average cup of coffee, unless you're amused watching unemployed hipsters (oops wannabe entrepreneurs) checking their FB pages. Heaven forbid you'd like to add a touch more milk to your coffee.  That's a big No/No, as is a latte or cap.  Perhaps there was a secret handshake I missed?
author: David L.

description:
Derrrricious. Seriously.

I've tried almost all of their coffee and I haven't had one that I disliked. My favorite is probably Jacobs or Julies. But if you're looking for something sweeter, go for the gingersnap. If you want something more refreshing, get their iced mint mojito. They have something for everybody.

Aside from the amaaaazing coffee, the staff there is super friendly and willing to help with those of you who can't decide what you want. There's also plenty of seating at this location, but often times I can't find a seat. But no worries, that's just a testament to how awesome Philz is.
author: Vicky W.

description:
Their iced mint mojito coffees are divine. They put fresh mint leaves inside too! (Before you put the mint leaves in the coffee, slap them -- it opens up the mint oils for more flavor.)

If you are lucky, you can find the owner, Phil, people watching on the bench outside. Really nice guy, in fact everyone who works there is awesome. Friend I was with mentioned they were moving from area and lady at counter gave em 1/2 price for a pound of coffee and a free drink along with well wishes. How nice was that?!?!!

Free small coffee when you buy a pound of coffee. 1x a month they have a particular coffee on sale for $12.00!
author: Meaza S.

description:
I haven't had Philz Coffee in awhile and I was excited to enjoy a "Mint Mojito". 

There was a street fair going on (this past weekend) with a lot of different vendors and there was still a line. If you haven't had the pleasure of trying Philz Coffee, I highly recommend grabbing a cup! 

My first cup after a long break was just as good as my very first!
author: Kristina S.

description:
I cannot express how much I love Phil's coffee. 

There are so many roasts to choose from. My personal favorite is Philtered Soul.. Mostly because I like hazelnut and that works for me. If you're unsure of which roast to get.. ask! The staff is always friendly and willing to help you out.

It is also nice to be able to choose specifically how sweet or not sweet your drink is. 

I always go out of my way for Philz.
author: Kathleen A.

description: I LOVE PHILZ. The mocha tesora or iced mint mojito are my go to drinks. The entire staff is SO friendly and always seems to be having a lot of fun while making your drinks/working. Also, the owner Phil is normally hanging out somewhere in the shop, so make sure to say hi. Took one star off because it can be really hard to find a seat but the drinks and customer service are great. Worth the long wait!
author: Sarah M.

description: LA foodie native here coming for the mint mojito and the hype truly didn't disappoint. Now I'm not a coffee person AT ALL but there's just something about the cool, sweet, and refreshing taste of a cup of their famous mint mojito iced coffee. I've converted. I'll only drink coffee if it's a cup if philz mint mojito. That is all.
author: Kimberly P.

description: Jesus Christ I want to come here all the time. Philz, come to my hood, by Lake Merritt, you'll make lots of money (mostly from me, likely) and would have an avid following of coffee-lovers in the East Bay. The Philharmonic with cream and sugar and mind was a godsend, and really, i enjoyed every sip. Oh, and Philz, thanks for not being as stiff as those at Blue Bottle (even though i like them too)... I just want somewhere to sit next time. Lots of people watching to be done here.
author: Vittorio L.

description:
Must be HEAVEN! When you're looking for a cup of decently priced caffeinated beverage that actually wake you up, COME HERE! They take cash and card, plus they have delicious goodies (although they are a little overpriced). I always get the Ecstatic iced coffee and omg ^_^ Best I've ever had!

Staff is great, they're a bit hipster but they actually have great customer service.
author: Nancy R.

description:
Ok, I'm now a believer! Showing me why they're voted the best coffee in SF! 
I tried Philz 'mocha' tesora with medium sweetness and it was quite spectacular. I'm not much of a coffee drinker, but this place could convert me. Totally a hipster spot with the hippie-like baristas, but they're super friendly and the coffee is cheap (compared to those chain spots I shall not name).
The selection can be a bit daunting because of the vast array of flavors possible, but I'm sure I'd be impressed by at least a few of the awesomely-named coffees!
author: Aaron Y.

description:
Since my first review of Philz, I've been back many times and each time I've tried a different blend of coffee. Initially, I was put off by the fact that they use full cream (I'm a black coffee kind of gal) but after giving it a try, I can see that the cream adds a depth of silkiness to the coffee which takes the coffee experience to a whole new level. 

My favorite is Ambrosia Coffee of the Gods if I want something hot but if I'm in the mood for something cold then I'll have the mint mojito iced coffee.   

Philz is my ultimate favorite coffee shop. $4 for a cup of coffee every day will put a huge hole in my wallet so I make it my weekend treat.
author: Cyndi G.

description:
What can I say that hasn't already been said? 
Hands down the very best coffee (no espresso here). I drink Tisora at home AND at Philz any time I get the chance.
I LOVE Philz!!!
author: Deniz U.

description:
A few weeks ago, BFF & I met the man, the mystery, the legend himself. We had but a brief interaction, but had we more time to chit-chat, I would've said:

Mr. Philz, may I call you that? Thank you for making a damn great cuppa coffee. You're the only roaster I know with the balls to charge $10 for a cuppa coffee, but we will gladly pay it, for your Jamaica Blue Mountain is smooth...almost as smooth as you, Sir.
author: Fancypants X.

description:
I'm always running late. It seems that even on during commute hours on weekdays, the pace of both the clientele and staff is that of a presidential holiday.

So I regret ordering that Tantalizing Turkish coffee in an instance when I wish, for once, I could have drip coffee. Why take my order when the barista is still working on three other drinks? Do you see me tapping my foot? And what's going on with the pace at the pastries? How did you forget which pastry I wanted when I just bemoaned, "Ginger scone. Hurry, please."

I'll come here when I'm retired.
author: Peter H.

description:
Stopped by this afternoon for a coffee. Checkout guy and baristas were both friendly and competent to help out this clueless first time customer. They have you line up behind a line that's well away from the front door, so if you are initially gobsmacked by the menu, you have to be gently verbally guided to line up in the appropriate place, which they do in a way that doesn't make you feel at all dim. Or not too much anyway.

Anyhow, that sorted, the barista taking my order was very kind and recommended some coffees based on my partially articulated desires and based on what I'd ordered at the Berkeley Philz. Given I'd ordered a mocha there, she suggested a Jacob's Wonderbar here. She also suggested medium cream, medium sugar but seemed gratified that I chose just medium cream, no sugar.

And it was a good choice and energizing but not too jittery. The chocolate notes on that coffee were just right and it didn't really need sugar.

Very good service, very good coffee.

The only weird part was that about 80% - 90% of the seats inside the shop were filled and of them it seemed like all or almost all of the customers had at least one Apple product, mostly laptops and iPads as well as iPhones. Given that I'd only brought my iPhone I felt conspicuously out of place. I know this is just the demographics of the clientele but it was really kind of eerie.
author: Malcolm G.

description:
The thing about Philz is that this caffeine wimp can participate in the trendy frenzy for handcrafted coffee without ruining my whole day. While other coffee-snob hangouts ignore the decaf option altogether, Philz always stocks at least 3 just-as-good-as-the-real-stuff decaf options. And that's worth a lot to me. 

Besides, I've been coming to Philz since way before it was cool, since before it was a coffee palace. Heck, I used to buy cigarettes, beer, and bulghur in bulk from Phil.

He rolled his eyes at me when I pointed this out to him the other day during a not-so-rare in-house sighting. "I'm the only business owner in San Francisco ever to give up my liquor license!" he brags. "And Lotto too!" he shouts. "We don't need that anymore."

Phil is a legend on 24th Street and in the San Francisco small business community. This shop's where it all started. It's a great place to hang out, one of my favorite writing spots in the city, and the only place where I can get a cup of coffee that truly suits me.
author: Kristy L.

description: The original Philz coffee, one cup at a time!! Always enjoying Philz coffee for the taste, service and a pick me up when all I want is to be sleeping.  The philttered soul is always my go to with medium to light sugar and creamer. Just the right amount. I will leave you with the words of Farris Buellar, " if you have the means, I highly recommend picking on up"
author: Sean B.

description:
I only have one question - HOW CAN COFFEE BE THIS GOOD?

Philz has really mastered the art of making your coffee experience, however you take your coffee - simply and utterly delicious. Every. Single. Time.

Sometimes I find myself sipping the coffee and looking at my friend saying "how do they do it?"

Granted I only get their drip coffee, not espresso - but I assure you, it is amazing.
