Their iced coffee tastes like ice cream and I always get nonfat milk! What the what?!

If you haven't tried this place, you are missing out on a coffee slice of heaven - check it out!
author: Lauren B.

description: An absolute must for any coffee lover! The coffees are unique and there's probably something that you haven't tried before. Very worth the journey to any location, but I love the atmosphere of this location in particular.
author: Shiva R.

description:
My usual go-to Philz and it never seems to disappoint. In part there are many things that I love about this place.

1.) There's seating, which makes for a great place when you need to leave the house and get some work done. And also wifi that doesn't suck!
2.) The coffee. Do I need to say more?
3.) The people. Really nice, and really good at making recommendations.
4.) Parking. Okay, I understand, it's the mission, Parking is bit of pain. But there's actually a decent amount of non-metered parking around so no complaints here.
5.) Plus, after a work session I love to go to the taco bar down a bit, and finish off with some Humphrey's!

Oh btw, my drinks of choice? Ecstatic Iced, Jacob's, Mint Mojito, Mocha Testora, and Gingersnap. Delishhhh
author: Jessica H.

description:
I'm a sucker for great logos, and Philz's is no exception. But this isn't a review of good branding. 

Philz has some pretty great coffee and a helpful selection ranging from light to dark roast blends. The New Manhattan (light roast) and Ambrosia (medium roast) are some of my favorites.
author: Adena B.

description:
Philz has a wonderfully-eclectic atmosphere and several million types of coffee ready to brew. I've only been once (so far) but the place has tons of character and is oozing with re-visitability.

For my first coffee, I tried a large "It's the best" (a medium roast) with cream and sugar, and it was excellent. Tasted like it had a hint of chocolate.
author: Nick S.

description:
I love coffee, and this is one of the best coffees I've had in the City and probably in general.  

Philz is one of those places where the coffee is as smooth and maybe even as rich as lattes everywhere else.  It's so good it's almost addictive.  They are not brewed in a big pot and just poured out; each coffee is made individually so it will take some time.   But so worth it! So far I stick with the Tesora and the Philzharmonic, always light cream and light/no sugar.  And that's all you really want to put in this coffee....not so much that you can't taste the amazingness that is Philz coffee...I just wish that I live closer to one!
author: Bonnie S.

description:
Ok, so the organization of the line is a bit odd and when it's busy it can be annoying...However, the coffee makes up for the all the fuss of ordering.  The variety of flavors offers something for every coffee connoisseur. I tend to stick to the light roast, namely sooo good more so for the caffeine content.  I recommend sampling multiple different coffees since they all have different flavors and it's fun experimenting and trying all the wonderful options. I have yet to find another coffee house as diverse as Philz!
I try to go here once a week to study but it does get quite busy, I think there should be two Philz in the University area, he he.  If you have not already been here I wonder, where the heck have you been?!!  Get here now and try it for yourself.  Keep in mind they add the cream and sugar for you, so if you are super controlling learn to relent a little...I did!
author: Molly M.

description:
I heard a lot about this place and I enjoyed my cup of coffee . It is busy for sure and service could probably be better and more organized.
They should have some samples so people can make a good decision...too many choices.
author: Todd J.

description: Good service. Genuinely curious to improve my coffee experience. I also like that they offer cardamom.
author: nathalie n.

description:
"I can't believe it's not caffeinated" - Kathy S, Yelper who is now addicted to decaf coffee (go figure) all thanks to Phil"z" 

Yes, Philz is FULL of unshowered smelly hipsters who hog the 1 bathroom for 10 minutes. Yes, it's dirty and crowded and the ambiance is kinda like a laundromat with plants and lots of windows and tables and magazines. 

But these kids sure know how to brew a cup of joe. I had the Swiss decaf.
author: Kathy S.

description:
Iced Mint Mojito Coffee = The single best coffee I've ever had in my life. 

There's really nothing else to say
author: Jocelyn L.

description:
Phil is the Heisenberg of coffee. 

If you're familiar with the show Breaking Bad, then you know what I'm talking about. I say this without ever having met Phil. I've just had the product. And it is *crazy* good. It will ruin you for mediocre coffee forever. I went once, and now it's my new route to work.

The staff are great in that they really, actually care that every cup of coffee is *exceptional*. Yes, every cup. How do they do it? No idea. They also seem to really enjoy their jobs, which is always pleasant to experience.

The spot itself is a great place to have a sip, chat, do work, read...Philz also understands what so many other coffee shops in the Mission have strangely not: it's fun to have couches as well as tables, and even benches outside.

But the best and most important thing, as it should be, is the coffee.

Do it.
author: J B.

description:
"Ruby, ruby, ruby, RUBY!!!" - Kaiser Chiefs

Balaban runs on Philz Coffee.

#fact
author: Lauren B.

description:
My partner and I have been a regular here over the past 4.5 years (to the point where are mugs and coffee choices are well known).  We also buy the beans to regularly make coffee at home.  I have tried almost all of their roasts and have really liked almost all of them.  My hands down favorite (if you are in to dark roasts)  is the Jacob's.  I get is almost every time unless I am looking to lighten it up a bit.  For medium roasts,  I love It's the best and also Philtered Soul.  My partner loves to get a Red Sea/Julie's Mix (sometimes called a Ruby).

The staff has always been great.  Tony is one of our personal favorites in the morning.  He has our coffee down so well I sometimes forget what I order when I go to someone different!  Also,  the great thing about this location is that you often get to see Phil and chat with him some.

Over the years we have helped turn on our fair share of locals and also visitors to Philz coffee.

Also try a vegan doughnut while there!  Trust me they are really good!
author: Jax B.

description:
Philz! I'd heard from all my friends in the area that this is the SF gold standard so was excited to try it out when I visited a couple of weeks ago. I was adventurous and had the mint mojito, iced, and was a little thrown by how sweet it was but maybe this is because I get it with soy milk. Definitely a nice change for a hot summer day. I later tried one of their house brews with my usual soy and it was great. I definitely see why so many residents defend this place to the death.

Oh, the berry donuts at the counter are good too :)
author: Lauren C.

description:
The place has a very personal feel -- like a much loved sweater. The decor felt to me like hippy-jungle-revolution. The baristas are suuuper warm, good people. They take pride in their work and it shows. It was one of the most delicious cups I've ever had. I ordered the small (which is more like medium-sized) for $3.25. The coffee is super black and rich, smooth and chocolatey. Just like I like it.

I went there on a weekday afternoon. There were plenty of other wi-fi users, but there was still a comfy space for me at a large table that I shared with others. I like the spirit of the place. The only negative was that someone there had really bad body odor, which seemed to increase in intensity during the time that I was there.

Still, five stars, and I will be back.
author: Heidi H.

description:
Had their Mojito Ice Coffee and Baklava.. Delicious! 

This place definitely has a N. Ca hippy vibe to it.
author: Pauline N.

description: love me some philz coffee! :) enough said, (written)
author: Liz D.

description:
THE ORIGINAL PHILZ, 
I have no choice but to give Philz five starts. I love their Turkish coffee. Have not had the guts to try anything else but from what I have heard. Everything is good but I am still insisting on My Turkish. This location is my favorite by far from a design stands point. Ghetto is good for that neighborhood otherwise it would look out of place. Their coffee tastes the same at all locations which is great. I sometimes decide to drive more than 20 miles to grab a large Turkish with a Warm Big Oat bar. My day will be complete at that point.
author: Shadi K.

description:
Amazing coffee, and plenty of variety! This place is just a short walk from my field office, so I come here once in a while when I feel like splurging on coffee. Throughout college I kept hearing about how great Philz was but I never bothered to go out of my way just to get a cup, plus I was too used to going to Starbucks. I'm glad I decided to branch out and give this place a try.

My favorite thing about this place is the large selection of flavors. Each time I come here, I always try something different. My favorites are New Manhattan and Dancing Water.

This particular store has a great atmosphere as well. Considering how loud this area can get, it seems like a great place to just sit down and chat with friends, or to get some work done.

While I'm not a fan of blowing $4 on something as trivial as coffee, this place definitely gives you something for your money. If you're gonna spend that much on coffee, do yourself a favor and ditch Starbucks and give Philz a try.
author: Allen C.

description: I've been to other Philz locations as well, and what I'm always happy about is the consistent high level of quality of their products. I typically go for the Mint Mojito iced coffee, which I think is one of the more unique products (and delicious). However, I've had a number of the other products which are also good. Definitely check it out sometime when you get the chance.
author: Brent W.

description: Amazing atmosphere and delicious coffee! Try anything with mint! I had a health nut cookie that was pretty good too. Wifi is a great addition to do some work.
author: Philippe M.

description:
My first time at this Philz Coffee location and just like the other Philz Coffee locations, the coffee is just as good!!!  

Not only does the coffee here give me the caffeine intake I need....it's yummy!!!!  I have always heard about the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee, but have never tried it.  Let's just say......I love, love, loved it!  Will definitely order it again when I'm near a Philz.  

The service from the barista is just as great as the coffee!  My barista made my coffee just right, but made sure I tried it to make sure it was sweet enough.  Service at it's best!
author: Caroline A.

description:
Great Coffee but bad location.
I love the coffee here but the location, to my opinion, is not somewhere I want to be. 

I got a large Mocha and shared it with a friend. The large is pretty big and very sharable. Most coffee houses use chocolate syrup with coffee. But at Philz, they use real coco beans to make it. I love the texture and the taste is perfect. 

The pastry is pretty large for the price. I got the cheese danish and chocolate chip croissant and it tasted good but I wish it was less sweet. I love sweet things but not overly sweet. I hope this helps.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
If heaven was a code name for coffee and you could put it into a cup of amazing, wondrous deliciousness, it would be Philz. 

My absolute favorite thing here is the Tantalizing Turkish Coffee with the mint for those cold San Francisco days, or the Mint Mojito Ice Coffee for when you need to cool down. They hand-make every cup one-at-a-time, and you can taste the difference. After drinking Philz, the brewed coffee (or even Starbucks) never tastes the same. 

You do have to wait in long lines sometimes if its a busy hour, since they hand-make everything one by one but I have never had to wait too long.

The cafe itself has a very casual, chill vibe. Lots of people working on their laptops, meeting up with people or playing games. They have big comfy cozy couches that are randomly thrown around the place. It is definitely more of a hippy decor - which kind of goes with their whole vibe.

All I can say is, after writing this review, I am thirsty for some Philz Coffee!
author: Sarah D.

description: If I could give them ten stars I would! I have had many cups of coffee from many places including Italy. I will say in all my travels, Phillz can make a cup of coffee taste more like a cup of heaven! My personal favorite Canopy of Heaven. One first sip and the smoothness that touched my lips and hit my pallet had the perfect combination of sugar to cream ratio. I closed my eyes and drifted into a bliss of happiness that is hard to even describe as I am writing this review now. Beside the Canopy of Heaven, the Silk and Splendor has the perfect name for it. Upon my first taste before I even knew its name, I said I can't believe how silky its texture is. Well, my friend and coworker who surprised me with it said that's exactly what it's called. Silk and splendor! Wow! Was all I could say! Be prepared for your mind to be blown away! A must for all coffee lovers!!
author: Jeanine C.

description:
Love x nine million.

I forgot how much I missed Philz until I was standing in the mission again for the first time in several years sharing my favorite Bay Area coffee with my favorite person. She loved it (though it's pretty intense for first-timers) and I had a nostalgic trek down memory lane from when I used to spend a lot of time there in college.

Also, Mocha Tesora. They make every cup singularly brewed with mint, whatever milk you want, and some sort of rad chocolate something. The perfect start to a road-trip southward -- since you'll be up for days.
author: Jenny K.

description:
I tried to Mocha Tesora and it was pretty good. I would recommend getting this. Any drink here seems like it would be tasty and worthwhile though.

The seating area seemed like a mess--tables and chairs everywhere (not that that's a bad thing). That might be a fire hazard or something. Another hazard is people plugging in their laptops into the plug outlets on the pillars in the middle of the room. I wasn't surprised when I saw someone trip on a laptop power cord. I wonder how often it happens a day. The furniture is random and looks old and antique. For example, there was this leather looking chair that was all ripped up. I didn't want to sit there because who knows what parasites call it home. I also remember seeing a chess board and pieces on one table.

I probably wouldn't want to hang around inside for a while, but I would come back for a drink.
author: Marlon T.

description: coffee made right under your nose and soul music blasting through the speakers, what better way to start the day! Instant mood boost with a great athmosphere to hang around for a while or just grab a coffee on your way
author: Bruno L.

description:
Warning! Place is always packed. It's not unusual for the line to go out the door! But other than the long line, this Philz is something special. The interior has so much art on the walls that you can't see the original wall anymore. The baristas are loud, happy, and so cheerful. Coffee is amazing per usual.

P.S. Check the bathroom. All the graffiti and tags from the years add up some good reads. Pretty funny stuff.
author: Joshua S.

description: Jacob's Wonderbar is my favorite, go-to blend.  Love it!  Not only is it delicious, it's a noticeably better buzz...  makes me happy.  This is a great place to hang out, read, study, surf internets, meet people too.  Friendly folks, comfy furniture too.  Five Stars.
author: Bobby G.

description:
I went to Philz on the recommendation of a friend, and he didn't steer me wrong! I got a small Turkish. Great cardamom flavor and the mint was a nice finish. 

Ordering was a little confusing, there's a "Pay Here" sign but no "Order Here" sign. The menu is huge, so I took some time to look it over and figured out the ordering process. All the employees were very friendly. 

Great stop for a different twist on your morning coffee!
author: Katie B.

description: I'm kicking myself for not finding Philz until the last day staying in San Fran at the hotel RIGHT down the street!!  Ignorance is NOT bliss when you MISS 5 days of Philz coffee!  This place is amazing! This coffee is amazing. The barista, Helen, is amazing!!  Why do I live in Philadelphia? I left my heart...in San Francisco...at Philz!  So if you happen to stay at the Hyatt Regency on Embarcadero, don't bother going to the SB's visible across the street...walk around to your left down the side of the hotel and find coffee heaven!!
author: Michelle K.

description:
My wife and I stumbled upon Philz about a year ago while looking for knead Patisserie. It's pretty much ruined coffee for me! I no longer go out for coffee I hunt for Philz! Luckily they're starting to pop up all over the bay area. The quality at every store is always the same. the costumer service is great. you're almost guaranteed to wait in a line no matter what time of day you go but it's WORTH it! Every cup is hand made in a unique pour over process, believe the hype it's the best cup of coffee you will ever have!

Favorites: 1.Tesora w/light cream 2. Mint mojito 3. Tesora Mocha
author: Seth G.

description: Delicious coffee. Mojito iced coffee hit the spot. Great study spot if you like random music (90s and slow jams) and good company. Free wifi and fun atmosphere. People watching jem
author: Lisa K.

description: Hipster coffee? yep...but is it still good? yes.  I love that they have a variety of options and plenty to try.  Blue bottle still rocks my boat for effectiveness and how strong their coffee is.  3 stars but if you're in mission, I RECOMMEND!
author: Vince L.

description: A different spin on coffee!  Not your average coffee shop.  The caffeine content is good and provides a nice kick lol. The reason I didn't give 5 star was because there is no espresso type drinks and I still feel Pete ' s coffee is better
author: Justin Ryan B.

description:
Hellooo Hipsta,

This is not no Starbucks, no no no. None of that here. Philz is ALL THAT. Way too good to have the typical generics, while very modest, and a friend to coffee lovers everywhere! There is drip coffee and friendly servers. This is where all the cool kids get their coffee.

There is a menu of a huge variety of drinks. If you're into bold coffee and rich dark chocolate, the Mocha Tessora is what you want. So creamy, and if it's not sweet enough for you, they will gladly add a little bit more of that sugar for you! If that's not so much your style, no worries! There is a board below the area you order that gives you a breakdown of the different blends of coffee you may be curious to learn about. You know, so you can act like you know :) Some of the drinks come with a mint leaf which is supposed to give them a little bit of extra oomph and that zing power.

This is a casual and cool kick it spot. Some people are lost away in their laptops and others reading newspapers. Walk in, and you may find yourself lost in a drink that you will not regret. This place is cute, not in the adorable sense, but more in a sense that nobody really gives a duck what your socioeconomic status is or that you're on a business run- so take that snobby attitude somewhere else. k?
author: Maiden D.

description: While visiting San Francisco and biking over the Golden Gate Bridge, we seen a food truck for Philz Coffee and decided to stop and check out the menu.  I got the most recommended which was the Iced Coffee Mojito with mint.  Wow this was delicious!  I have never tired something so different and yet good!!  I am not much of a fan for espresso or all of those fancy coffee drinks, but this I must was was good!  On my last day visiting SF, we stopped again at Philz before heading to the airport.
author: Vicky C.

description: The cash register lady is a bitch.  The staff isn't very friendly.  Its ok to smile A holes.
author: Fatty A.

description:
Philz coffee + Philz bagel = morning orgasm 

They have the most flavorful coffee anywhere! Mmm, Philz coffee... The staff at this place is super nice and efficient, and the large space and eclectic crowd makes for great people watching.
author: Vicente G.

description:
I'm a big coffee fan, and this is my favorite coffee shop.  The coffee itself is delicious.  The employees are always friendly and cheery.  They make the coffee exactly how you want it (and make you taste it to make sure it's just right before walking away).
My favorite hot coffee is the Julie's; my favorite iced is the Mint Mojito.  I have frequented most of the Philz in The Bay Area; this location is my favorite.  They play great music, have an upbeat atmosphere, and provide plenty of comfortable seating.  I love coming here to sit and read a book on a day off from work for a few hours.
The location in Daly City is literally 2 blocks from my apartment, but if I want to sit and read I'll come to this location instead.
Highly recommend.  Thank you.
author: Brandon W.

description:
I've never been particularly enamored with Philz having tried it a couple times in the city and also at the Berkeley location. However, today I was in the area and decided to give it another go and luckily, I can now say "Yay! I'm a fan." 

I got the tesora with light sugar and light cream. I love that the baristas ask you to taste your coffee before you pay to make sure it is just to your liking.

Unfortunately, while the service at Philz was on the quick despite the fact they brew each cup individually, finding parking was a nightmare. Not only is parking limited on a regular basis (this is San Francisco, after all) there was construction up and down 24th as well as Folsom PLUS it was street sweeping day on one side of street. 

Don't let the parking situation deter your from a great cup o' joe!
author: Annaliese D.

description:
Now let me premise this by saying I am not a coffee drinker. I'd take a hot cocoa over it any day. That being said I ordered the Mint  iced-coffee, which was actually pretty refreshing. I did have to wait awhile because some hipster ordered multiple drinks, but the staff was very friendly and attentive. 

Also, props to whoever was playing the music because it was particularly on point when I visited.
author: Justin R.

description: The original Philz coffee. Usually wander in on weekend mornings to get coffee and sometimes breakfast. Always top notch. And if you get lucky, Phil will be there and maybe make you a cup of coffee.
author: Ryan P.

description:
i loooove philz! but make sure to tell them how sweet u want it and how much cream u want. I usually drink my coffee black tho, i always tell them how much creamer and sweetener i want, and they always make it perfect :)
My personal favorite blends are: for light, i like soo good and dancing water, for medium, tesora and ambrosia, and for the dark roast tantilizing turkish and ether. 
the ice coffee mojito is good too. I would get that on a warm day.
author: Toni Rose M.

description:
Ok. I"m seriously behind the times as this was my first time at Philz.
The line was long but I waited diligently anyway. Don't order a regular coffee- They make them in blends. You choose if you want a light, medium or dark roast and then choose a blend underneath your choice. THe baristas brew it right there. You pay and then wait for a bit for your coffee.
The coffee was truly delish. I would stand in line for coffee here again!
author: Dbs B.

description:
I'm not a coffee drinker.  Not because I don't like coffee, but because I gave up coffee a few years ago.  

If there were a Philz in So Cal I think I would probably pick up the habit of drinking coffee on a daily basis again.  Mmmhmm, the Iced Coffee Mint Mojito is absolutely refreshing and delicious, and it still maintains that strong coffee taste that coffee lovers generally appreciates.  If you're a big fan of mint like I am, then get that.  I promise you won't regret it.  Wished I could have one now.
author: Linda T.

description:
Funny thing is that I was never a coffee fan before I tried Philz Coffee.  Everything changed after I met Philz.  Philz became the love of my life.  I didn't know what to do.  I would walk to Philz at least twice a week from work and back just to get it.  I didn't care if I wasted 45 mins slacking off from work.  I just couldn't get away from having a cup.  No no.  A small cup of Philz just wouldn't do it.  I always need the largest one available.    My favorites would be Silken Splendor and Ambrosia.  I'm not sure what's in them and if I didn't know better, I'd say crack.  In fact, Philz is my crack in a cup.

Philz staff is also very friendly and will always ask you to try your coffee before they let you go off. They will make sure you love your coffee or else they would make you another. Great customer service.  Blue Bottle coffee is just not good enough once you try Philz.

Philz coffee is a must try if you haven't been to one yet.
author: Shirley T.

description:
You want something delicious and refreshing? Order the mint mojito iced coffee! Perfect!
Thanks to the barista who recommended it to us...hope you liked the snicker doodles!
author: steve t.

description: Fantastic service at 24th and Mission location. Love this place, and my Tesora was really good coffee.
author: Maryann H.

description:
I've been putting off writing a review for Philz because I can't express in words how utterly amazing the coffee is.  When a sip of it hits your lips... it's all over.  Thanks to Philz, I have become a Grade A coffee snob.

Don't know what kind of coffee you're feeling like?  Describe to one of the employees what flavors you're looking for and they'll steer you in the right direction.  Already know what you want and compulsively order it every day?  Don't even bother telling them - they remember you and they already know.

My favorite?  The mint mojito iced coffee.  I'll drink it in the blazing September heat or on a foggy, rainy, cold day.  I love everything about it, from the sweetness of the blend to the muck of mint sprigs in the bottom of the cup.  Yes, it is one mind-blowing mouthgasm.

I heart you big time, Philz!
author: Christy L.

description: Of course I had to come here when visiting San Francisco for Outside Lands! I absolutely love the mint mojito coffee that everyone raves about. It really is delicious, creamy, thick, and minty! It is also very sweet, so get an extra espresso shot to make it stronger if you want!
author: Mondi L.

description: GO HERE!! You will love the coffee and ambience at this location...and for those who rated this place 1 Star...The Coffee Mafia is coming after you!
author: Carlos G.

description:
Large lightly sweet hot chocolate! Yum! 

I'm not a huge coffee drinker so this hot chocolate always hits the spot. Not only is the quality of the beverage incredibly but the service is ridiculously amazing. The staff here is genuinely nice, attentive, and always makes sure that your drink tastes perfect. Love it here and can not understand why everyone always raves about Philz.
author: Grace C.

description:
Parking around here sucks. But that didn't stop me from coming in for an iced mint mojito today. Kept telling myself I should try something new but I just couldn't stray.

Anyways, the cashier caught me derping pretty hard. I handed my credit card over to pay for the drink and he handed it back and I put my wallet away and stood there for a good awkward 20 seconds. Then he spoke up and was like can I get you anything else? I was waiting for a receipt that was never going to come haha Guess it was a good thing I came in for coffee.
author: Sarah L.

description:
Probably the best coffee I've ever had. It's addictive. Cool atmosphere. Nice to work on my computer or phone and meet new people. Baristas are real personable and friendly. The one guy is especially nice and laughs real loud, kinda sounds like a goat, lol :P 

The coffee is so good, the place is always full, but they move you through fast. Only downsides are that it is really warm inside and loud, both because so many people are always here. But don't let that stop you from coming. And once you've had the coffee, it won't ;)
author: Jordan G.

description:
Now that I've moved back to LA/OC area, I've ordered Phil's beans online and once when I was visiting the City again. 

Definitely worth the shipping for great quality beans (my whole luggage smelled like coffee) and you save $$$ by making it French press style at home!
author: Kenny L.

description: Philz is so good! Amazing tea and coffee all customized special for you. There is just something so wonderful about Philz! I gave 4 stars instead of 5 because they do so much of their coffee/tea prep with boiling water in plastic. If I'm going to die of cancer I want it to be more worthwhile than that.
author: City W.

description: Best Philz. Classic rock, lots of seating, tons of interesting people and of course great coffee.
author: Will D.

description:
UPDATE:

- Philz has been proactive in contacting me about the internet issue  (cudos)
- I am leaving my review at 4 stars until I am able to verify the internet.  (am out of country)
- Will update up or down, based on what I find!



========================
Great coffee -- consistently crapping internet.


1/3 of the place works from their laptop...  

I cannot count the number of times I have wasted an hour showing up trying to work, only to leave my coffee to buy another somewhere else.

If they advertise internet -- it should have internet.

(By the way "Cafe La Bohe'me" at 24th and mission has decent coffee and solid internet.)
author: Dan O.

description:
Phillhormonic coffee with cardamom, cinnamon, plum and mint was absolutely scrumptious. Oh and best cinnamon roll ever too. 

The wait is quite long though. I only do this on the weekends.
author: Chris H.

description: This is the original philz as I was told by an employee. I actually like the service at this location better than the other ones I have been to. They acknowledge you once you get in line, so you're not just standing there clueless if they actually saw you or not. As usual, I ordered the mint mojito which I am totally in love with. I love how it doesn't taste all the minty, but yet has a hint of it within the coffee. Definitely will come here again.
author: Jeanette L.

description: Love the individualized attention at the coffee bar. Tried their iced mint mojito coffee and iced gingersnap coffee both with cream and sweetening). Both were amazing and refreshing. I want to go back to try other drinks. I hear their coffee beans are awesome!
author: Lisa P.

description: Love everything about this place, its legendary 'beginnings' status, great vibe, nice cultural neighborhood/location, and great coffee. We went here after eating at Wise Sons. We have a couple of favorites, the new manhattan and mint mojito. Thank goodness for this place!
author: Cindy S.

description:
I'm a big fan of Philz.

I love their selections of coffee and the mint additions is so good and refreshing.
Charming location and always something to look while waiting. I don't mind the lines and waiting, it's worth it!

The staff here are pretty friendly.
I've only had one bad experience with a staff member. 
I asked the cashier politely if my order was placed and she gave me a chilling glare and said "IT'S COMING UP OK?" I looked at her in awe for those awkward seconds of time as she continued to throw daggers through her eyes at me ...and I thought to myself... wow she needs a cup of coffee.
author: Jesse K.

description:
I came here today and tried the Tesora and the So Good! 

I preferred the Tesora because it tasted stronger than the So Good, but they're both very delicious. It doesn't overwhelm you with creaminess or sugary sweetness, but it also doesn't have the bitter taste of strong coffee. It's one of the best coffee places I've ever been to! 

If you're a coffee fan, or even if you're not, you should definitely come check this place out. The coffee is so strong, that I'm still wide awake after 6 hours. :)
author: Jeanette S.

description:
The service on Sunday morning was horrible. The coffee was good of course, but every time that I look a sip was a bitter reminder of the rude staff.

I think the staff was annoyed that there was a line at 630am right when they were opening. First off I noticed an ATM near the counter and asked if they were cash only, and was told "No we're not.. step back I'll call you over when I'm ready". And was made to awkwardly look around for a minute or two. Very unfriendly. Then there was a man who was sitting on the bench waiting to be called over and he was reprimanded. "Sir have we helped you yet? You're just sitting there. Always come over and order if we haven't gotten to you." 

The complex set of coffee ordering etiquette at this particular store is atrocious. Do you want us to approach you or not? 

Too bad because this store has a cool DIY feel. I have a feeling that I'd enjoy these baristas in another setting like a punk rock show or something, but please be nice to me when I need caffeine and I'm about to start a 12hr shift at the hospital.
author: Christina B.

description:
I love Philz drip coffee!  This location seems to be one of the most busy which can make it more of a stressful experience than it should be at times, especially if you don't already know the menu well or have a signature drink. 

The staff at Philz is great and if you are overwhelmed just tell them what you like generally and they will whip up something awesome for you based on your preference! This location takes cards too! :) 

I love the variety of spiced and  flavorful coffees here! As everyone says the iced mint mojito is great, but I would only order it on a really warm day. I just love the aroma and cozy essence of hot coffee. The mojito is perfectly refreshing on a warm day though. 

Pumpkin cookie with cream cheese frosting! The pastries in general here look fresher and better than those at the one in the Castro. OMG definitely an upgrade from red velvet! I love anything pumpkin, but paired with cream cheese, this is just too good!
author: Angela K.

description:
Philz Coffee is hands down my favorite coffee shop in San Francisco. I only wish they had a few more locations closer to outer San Francisco and Daly city.

Their Tesora "Mocha" is amazingly delicious iced. I love the presentation of the drink and the taste.

Last time I came here, I was with my father, who wanted a decaf. I asked the cashier to recommend a good decaf coffee and he said to try the Decaf Organic Swiss Water Peru. Their made it just the way my dad ordered and he was raving how good it tasted once he tried it.

Philz really does know how to make amazing coffee "one cup at a time."
author: Karina A.

description:
I went to Philz during La Cocina's San Francisco Street Food Festival and it was super crowded. I skipped the Vietnamese Coffee and Ritual Coffee booth to get some Philz. The line was out the door. 

It tasted great, but it was missing the usual froth from the cream on top. A little disappointing, but I would go back and Mission & 24th Philz again.
author: Janice T.

description:
I love the iced mojito coffee (extra sweet), which is bad because I'm hesitant to try anything else!

I like this location because it's more laid back and the decorations are amazing. The service is fast and friendly, the coffee is amazing, and the environment is great.

I'll try to experiment with the other items on the menu though
author: Chris T.

description: Philz just is. It's an entire different species of coffee. I have never experienced the amount of productivity and hyperactivity I get from a cup at this place anywhere else. Philz, thank you for the coffee crack.
author: Lucy F.

description:
There are a slew of good coffee choices in the Mission, but Philz Coffee offers a great cup without too much pretense and cost.  Philz is one of the few brew-by-cup shops that offers Splenda, Stevia, and gosh darn, large sized beverages, which is a welcome alternative to the hipster coffee communes that only offer agave syrup, turbinado sugar in granules so large they couldn't dissolve in an acid bath, and water-cooler sized cups.  

The Iced Coffee Mint Mojito is magic.  I usually steer clear of iced concoctions with names longer than two words, but the freshly muddled mint hits the spot.  

Five stars is within reach, and perhaps after a few more trips and flavorful cups of joe, consistency will give Philz Coffee a top mark.
author: Vin J.

description: Mint mojito all the way! I like my coffee like my man: strong and sweet. This can either carry you throughout the day or serve as a delicious treat after a long one. Don't be afraid to let the barista know how you like it. Even if you don't know, they're sure to draw up a concoction thatl take you on an adventure!
author: Eric C.

description: Great coffee,great employees in a great neighborhood no matter what the uppity say about the Mission.Also a great place to have some coffee and get some work done....or people watch !
author: Carlos G.

description:
We were picking up a Craig's List furniture purchase in the Mission but the seller was running an hour late. But she suggested that we wait at Philz.  What a place!!! The coffee menu is extensive, if not a little exhausting, but the coffee is amazing. Before I was able to leave the counter, I had met Phil and he had provided me with two additional coffees to try, in addition to the one I ordered. The best one had a generous portion of ground cardamom seed, a flavor that I am familiar with from Swedish pastry but apparently is Middle Eastern in origin. 

Anyway, I got more than a caffeine high from that trip. I now understand how a place seling coffee for more than Starbucks can stay in business. The old Bohemian interior and the hand-made coffee--no coffee urns here--is vintage SF. Everyone should try it at least once; I'll bet many will return.
author: Exfarmer G.

description:
Philz is great.  Perfect for a true coffee lover.  

They brew the coffee fresh for each cup.  You can really get into the flavor profiles and the selection is HUGE.  Not recommended if you don't really like brewed coffee or tea.

The staff is really cool and give great recommendations.
author: Chad J.

description: Friendly Service - Nice Menu - a bit pricey but different feel & nice atmosphere.  Ordered an Istanbul Cream Tea with Mint Leaves! Their menu was quite extensive & their coffee's looked really lovely. I'd like to try them sometime. What I liked about Philz Coffee was how happy every customer seemed with their Drinks. Everyone seemed pleasantly surprised and left with a bit of spark in their eye which a nice change of pace from the likes of Starbucks & Peet's. Philz seems more like a place you want to have coffee and sit down with someone and have a nice conversation or read a book or do some writing. It feels more about taking time out to enjoy every sip and not rush in and out. Their pastries are self serve and in a case of their own which was great too! I love that they have fresh mints and herbs and ingredients and I can't wait to try more beverages from their menu!
author: Julian I.

description:
AT FOLSOM. 

We read "mission" and parked on "mission" and had to walk down to Folsom.

The place was very "hipster" but the coffee was good. I had the Iced Coffee Mint Mojito and the BF got the Ecstatic Iced Coffee. They were both very tasty and the caffeine was very effective as i've had coffees that didn't phase me.

I would like to try their hot drinks next time.
author: J-nine I.

description:
The Philz the Chai tastes AWESOME

Only thing I'm pissed about is that I came because I saw "free wifi", but wifi can be only connected if you connect via Facebook! What a f*cking intrusion! Guess what? I don't have a f*cking Facebook! Thankfully I have 4G to write a review...
author: Philippe R.

description:
Iced mint mojito, get it. That's all you need to know. 

And the other coffee are pretty good too! Absolutely delicious. And the baristas really really nice :) I think short simple sentences summed up this review.
author: Harriet W.

description:
I made a point in stopping here after having a "premium" coffee experience at The Outside Lands Festival a few weeks ago. The guy "Greg" made an excellent decaf for me, letting me smell the special roast he thought I'd like and explaining in detail how "Philz" makes their coffees. 
So seeing a Philz Coffee near the Food Cart Festival where we had just been and ready for a coffee and a place to rest our weary feet, I new this would be perfect!
And I was correct!
And not only was the gal who made us delicious coffee's super friendly but I think the guy at the register (owner?) asked us how everything was and really made sure our visit was a good one. We kicked back on a leather couch and met up with a nice Aussie gal we had met at the festival and rested our weary bones and enjoyed some freshly brewed cup of joe. A wide range of eclectic  music swirled in the back round of Sinatra to Indian style, just low enough to chat and give off a really nice vibe. Perfect way to end a great day.
author: Susan D.

description:
I had 3 hours to wander around the Mission while in town for work. The giant vinyl sign touting their local awards honestly put me off. Felt cheesy and I didn't trust it, somehow, on my first walk past. Too many ginormous signs often means a desparate restaurant, in my experience. But on my second walk past I noticed how PACKED it was, both inside and out, at 11am on a Monday. And so I wandered inside. 

From Seattle, I've a high level of exposure to a variety of coffee houses. The vibe here is among the best. Quirky and comfortable. Giant chalkboards listing many many types of coffees. But just the Philz blend names, no real descriptions. I was planning to just wander up and randomly choose one, trying to look all cool and confident, ya know? (No out-of-town vibe/tourist designation desired). I'd only been looking at the board for about 10 seconds when one of the coffee employees called me over. (Not sure if barista would apply, as it's non-espresso). His name was Tony and he's fantastic! Super friendly and funny, he put me right at ease, immediately questioning me about what types of coffee I enjoy (and listing several possible types, in case I wouldn't know what to say). I confessed my love for DARK roasts. He told me ETHER was the way to go then. He also gave me a Fist-Bump when I declined cream and sugar. *laughs* I love the idea of Philz, brewing each cup for the customer, and then they do that fantastic long pouring back and forth (that I've really only seen done on the streets of Malaysia) which creates a fantastic bit of froth. It was a lovely cup of coffee.  While waiting for my cup to brew, I got to overhear the interactions with other customers. This let me know that there's a large variety of sweeteners (honey, agave, sugar, etc) and different milks and creams available, too. 

They do have a very INTERESTING bathroom. Some might say it's a public restroom at it's fullest potential, as every square inch is covered in graffiti. I thought it was fun, but could see that it might upset some of the more conservative/older patrons. Still, it was relatively clean, just crazy busy with writing EVERYWHERE.
author: Tracy M.

description:
Damn you Philz Coffee!!! 

I used to be able to tolerate average coffee but after trying Philz Philharmonic, sweet sweet, all other coffee just tastes like crap!

Seriously, if you're a coffee lover this place will blow your mind. 

Staff is super up beat and friendly, interior decor is pretty rad too.
author: Katie W.

description: My first time here. I'm a total noob when it comes to coffee; I'm more of a tea lover. The barista that helped me was totally helpful when she saw how confused I look when I was trying to order. She explained to me the different roasts and their flavored. I went with the medium roast Tesora and was happy. The lovely barista even asked how it tasted to see if I wanted to add anything else. Excellent service and vibe!
author: Nicole C.

description:
You can't beat "one cup at a time!" I mostly always go with the Turkish, but you really can't go wrong.

The wait gets a little long if there is more than 6 people in front of you. Additionally it is always enjoyable to catch Phil himself behind the bar.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Nice cafe to work in; fast wifi, non-distracting music, big tables, etc.

However, the Chai tea is the worst I've ever had.  The spices were not mixed very well, and they quickly congealed into a thick, slimy surface layer.  Even after spooning that off, the tea itself is rather bitter with a dry aftertaste.

If I come back, I'll definitely get a green tea instead.  Hopefully that's better...
author: Michael D.

description:
Coffee and mint rocks my socks and freakin' blew my mind the first time I had it!  I love trying out new coffees, and this place is THE coffee place for me.  I just can't explain it, but it seriously felt like I never had coffee before until Philz.  I've been to a few Philz around the city, but this is my favorite one.  Employees are interactive and fun, and the area is just one of my major sweet spots I love to be in and get groceries from.  

So sad my boyfriend moved in with me in the Sunset!  He used to live two blocks down and I'd stay over just to have Philz first thing in the morning!  ;D  Haha! But, I make enough excuses to get some Philz whenever I'm in radius of one.   

Recommendations:  The Turkish, Ambrosia, the Iced Mojito Coffee, and anything else with mint in it!!!!!!!!!
author: Nadia D.

description: On the quality of coffee they completely surpass anyone in the coffee industry, but lack of solidified processes can really get them in a hard place. I love this coffee and I go to this Philz frequently. THEY PICK AND CHOOSE WHO TO ASK FOR ID. I like to be relaxed on Sunday's so I send my BF to get my coffee with my card. Starbucks has a policy anything over 10$ they ask for ID so you'd figure that to be the same case. For some reason when my BF was there to buy me a small Tesora they asked for his ID. This is a 3-4 dollar purchase, the lady wouldn't hear anything he had to say and I know this because he called me while he was there (probably because he was in his urban weekend gear instead of his weekly professional look). I GO THERE ALL THE TIME WITH HIS CARD AND HE DOES WITH MY CARD FOR A SMALL PURCHASE AND NO ONE EVER ASKS FOR AN ID (Usually dressed in professional attire because we both work in corporate America). They need to solidify their process for checking ID because the waters can get muddied fast with this subject. I won't say it's racial profiling because I don't know that for sure, but for some reason the day my BF doesn't look like a young professional going into this place he gets carded. What does that lead you to think? Please Philz employees don't judge a book by it's cover. Thank goodness the manager Rebecca heard what I had to say and states she would address the issue to make sure there is a uniform way this ID situation will be handled in the future. I really hope this changes because it'd be sad to have to stop drinking this yummy coffee due to them racial profiling people. I won't support that...
author: Stephanie C.

description:
I can't even explain how excited I am to come back here! But next time, I'm gonna have to do a little research before I just step into Philz and expect to get a quick cup of coffee.

This place is like a coffee shop on 'roids. SO many different options to choose from, but so little time to collect your thoughts before being summoned to the next available barista. It's quite intimidating if you've never done the song and dance previously. I must have screwed up every possible step in the ordering process:

-Stood in the wrong line off the bat
-Cut like, 10 people when I finally saw the actual line
-Tried to pay the lady to made my drink, when there's a dedicated register to hand over the cizzash
-Only had my credit card for a $2 drink (yes, that makes me the annoying coffee-buyer guy who pays for everything with a credit card, and I'm willing to shoulder the humiliation).

The reason it's not higher than a 3-star is because I only tried the house coffee. I was too flustered to attempt a more elaborate order, in fear I'd fuck up again. It was pretty damn good, but I know their other offerings will bump that shits up to a 4 or 5 star experience in no time.

I have my eye on that mojito coffee drink. Yum! I was looking at a pretty cool apartment about 4 blocks away from this place.... and had I chose to rent it, I know I'd be a Philz customer nearly every single day.
author: Ruggy J.

description: Philz coffee is incredible. Simply not to be missed if you are at all a coffee lover. The selection of blends is unsurpassed.
author: Tarun N.

description:
I'm a Seattleite, and I love coffee.

That being said, I'm not usually one for coffee with lots of bells and whistles, too much cream & sugar, or strange additional ingredients. This place is my only exception. I've had a couple different types of Philz since moving here 6 months ago, and the key is 'light' cream and sugar (unless you want instant diabetus... they have a heavy pouring-hand).

I've taken friends and coworkers form out of town here, and it never gets old watching their faces melt off after their first minty sip of coffee.

Go. Now. Shhhhhh.... just go.
author: Will J.

description:
I love how the place looks like a jungle. it's very earthy feel.

The iced mint mojito is so good and I'm not a big fan of coffee. It is more of a milky mint flavor than actual coffee taste. They do tend to put too much ice, but I think that's how it is for most places.
author: Dorris W.

description: Incorrect closing time. On here it says they close at 8:30 on Friday but they actually close at 7:30.
author: Matt S.

description:
I finally gave in to temptation and splurged on a cup of coffee at Philz. I'd like to think that it was part of my Coffee Education.

You see, last summer I moonlighted as a barista at one of those super high-end, quasi-hipster coffee shops in Oakland where we brewed individual cups of Blue Bottle coffee as well as our own house-made micro roast. This experience is a great conversation starter and it also really impresses my hipster friends. So I figure if I'm going to use it as a tool to impress bearded, bespectacled men on bicycles, I'd better know what I'm talking about, right?

It was my last day of work today and I'm nearing the end of my summer in the Bay Area, so today was the perfect opportunity to try Philz. I brought in my own mug (to maximize cost-efficiency) and told the barista I'd never been before, but that I generally liked dark roasted coffee. She recommended the Jacobs. I ordered it medium-sweet, with cream, at the recommendation of all you Yelpers.

I have to say that the first sip blew me away! Perfect sweetness and creaminess where the coffee goes down smoothly without tasting overly sweet like coffee ice cream. The froth on top is also perfect. Not sure how they get that froth with drip coffee- they probably pour it from one cup to another. 

However, the remaining sips, while still great, weren't quite as amazing. It did have some acidity that wasn't tamed by the cream, and it wasn't worth the 10 minute wait and $3.25. I'd still rank it far above Blue Bottle and Ritual, but I think Philz will remain a once-in-a-while treat while I happen to be in the Mission area rather something I'll venture out for. What can I say, maybe I'm just a sucker for (relative) mediocrity - I do love my Peet's for being faster, cheaper and fairly delicious (Did I just lose all my Yelp credibility for saying that?!)

I must add, however, that as I walked out of Philz with my commuter mug in hand, casually sipping as I walked, I did receive compliments from complete (creepy) strangers such as "Your hair is beautiful! Never cut it!" and "You glow like an angel!" 

Hmm, perhaps there really IS some magic in a cup of Philz that you can't get anywhere else.
author: Katherine H.

description: Best coffee!! Love Phil'z!! I generally get the alarm but everything is good here. Their Coffee is really smooth and you don't get that acidic aftertaste like other coffees.
author: Michelle K.

description: Was given a container of his coffee for the holiidays.  I loved the flavor so much that I haven't been buying my Starbuck beans.  I love this place - not too commerical and the crew are very friendly.  It's my new find and if you're a coffee lover - you need to give this place and his beans a try!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
I'm not exaggerating, their coffee is AMAZING. I've had a lot of coffee as I bet you have.  I don't usually find coffee to be particularly tasty or exhilarating, but more of a necessity for my sub-average daily functioning.

Philz is like a city version of Cole Coffee.  They hand make each cup of coffee, but by contrast, my beloved Cole Coffee single brewed cup process looks stodgy and boring. You gotta see how they do it at Philz.  It borders on performance art.
author: Jason M.

description:
I love your coffee and most of your servers are great, but why don't you have "for here" mugs instead of only paper ones?

The 24th street location is my favorite, a funky, cool, bohemian sitting area with interesting people and i love the trees on 24th street.

I also want to know more about the plant "Experiment" in the giant sealed jar!!!
author: Adrian L.

description:
I would like to nominate Philz Coffee as the best coffee house for people who don't drink coffee. Nobody takes me seriously when I say Philz is the best because I don't drink coffee, but I think the lack of options for non-coffee drinkers is a legitimate concern.

Every other coffee shop in San Francisco charges me $2-3 for a cup of hot water and a tea bag. I could have bought a whole box of tea at Safeway for the same price. So dumb.

Philz's mint tea actually makes me excited to drink tea. I finally got a taste of the superiority complex that most coffee drinkers have. Sometimes I even get to say things like, "my tea is much sweeter than usual today" and act like the barista has committed a serious offense for being unable to consistently replicate the preferred ratio of honey to tea. 

In the same vein, I have to say that the asian guy who makes the Philz bagels is awesome! Sometimes I get wary when someone else is behind the counter. I mean, there's been times when the cucumbers kind of slide out of the bagel if they're cut too chunky or there's way too much cream cheese and it gets everywhere. Not with the asian guy though. He's a pro.
author: Sabrina M.

description: Absolutely delicious. This is the real deal coffee house. This was my first time here but the different combinations of the beans left me lost; luckily their very polite and educated staff asked me how I liked my coffee, and the type of roast or taste I was looking for. These baristas pay attention to every detail. The gentlemen even offered to make me a completely new blend if I didn't like what he recommended. Whenever I'm in the area you guys have won my patronage.
author: Arash S.

description:
For a first timer, the choices can be overwhelming. Easily overcome by taking the time to read the descriptive coffee menu.

If you like your coffee strong, muddy, and harsh (I was that guy back in the 90s), then go get yourself a burnt cup of dark roast at Peet's or Starbucks. If you want something more mellow and refined, than definitely check out Philz.

My favorite is their ice coffee. Smooth, not at all acidic. Easy on the stomach.

Staff is super friendly, though the ordering process can be a bit confusing for noobs.
author: J K.

description:
While walking around the Mission on Sat. morning, I decided to stop in here for coffee. 

I just started drinking coffee again, so I've been excited to try new places. This one sounded good, I'd never had coffee brewed "one cup at a time." 

The ordering, waiting and paying system is confusing, (and not just to me, others were flummoxed as well.) 

Service was friendly, and I enjoyed my coffee. 

I'd return:)
author: Amanda G.

description:
I lived in Seattle for four years.  I don't really know coffee that well to hold a conversation about it, but I know a good cup of coffee.  This place will boggle your mind, because it definitely blew my mind.

This is not somewhere to go when you are in a rush and need a caffeine fix.  This is a place you go because you want to appreciate a seriously awesome cup of coffee goodness brewed just for you personally.  

My experience here was so great!  The man making our coffee drinks (I wish I remembered his name) was very chatty and friendly, talking all about how he was making our drinks.  He definitely added to the experience.

Iced mint mojito coffee.  Do it.  It will change your life.
author: Amanda M.

description:
Tesora and Canopy of Heaven are my favorites. 

GREAT & BEST COFFEE SERVICE of all time.......

I would go here on my way home from SFAI, it was always an amazing gift. Also a great place to do homework, socialize, or read a good book.
author: Rae R.

description: Happened to be walking around the Mission Murals and stumbled across the original Philz location! This area of the mission is such a crazy assortment of things rich and poor, hipster and un-hipster, that Philz fits right in. The whole place has interesting art painted and drawn all over the walls and ceilings, matching the clientele sitting at the tables and lounging in the couches. My first drink here was the Tesora with milk added (they don't do lattes.. but they will add milk to your coffee for you). The coffee connoisseurs working behind the counters create your coffee confection for you.. which means you can't add the milk or sugar yourself. Luckily, they are coffee sages and made us the perfect latte.. er I mean coffee with milk. (seriously! they get offended if you try to order a latte here! )
author: Henry W.

description:
I love how laid-back and loving and completely un-pretentious Philz Coffee is. 

The baristas are ridiculously nice, there are various comfy chairs and random chess boards, and people lounge around. It's very relaxed and makes me feel all warm and fuzzy inside, with a newfound appreciation for life. 

Not to mention the huge assortment of coffee, Light, Medium, and Dark Roasts, and delicious pastries/bagels. They let you taste each cup and make sure it's perfect for you. 

Why go anywhere else?
author: Connie C.

description:
By far, THE BEST coffee in SF!! Enough said... But really though, if you love a great cup of joe with out all the preservatives; if you love a deep taste that you can say  "aawwhhhh" at the end of each sip, then you MUST try a cup from Phillz coffee!! Man, I sound like I work for them! Haha!!! 

I heard about this place a couple of years ago from a co-worker who swore by this coffee as being the best he had ever had. I paid him no mind and thought he was just over exaggerating. Now look at me!!! Ha!!! I actually didn't try this coffee until about a couple of months ago. I don't know why I waited so damn long! Now, I can't stop and I don't think I ever will!!! ... They have lots of different blends but my favorite as of now is the Tesora, which is the house blend... The service here is great with a cool urban, laid back environment! I once waited about 15 minutes on a Sat.morning for a cup. That's how busy it can get and that's how good it is!! If you try this coffee, you will be a believer too!!
author: Cesar N.

description: Everytime I come to S.F. I wll always get my PHILZ Coffee :) The The staff is so nice, outgoing and always make my cup the way I like it! They are the best REAL coffee out here in the BAY.. Period.
author: Alyce S.

description: great coffee, and even better customer service
author: Long C.

description:
Julie's Ultimate was ultimately the best cup of black coffee I have EVER had. After the first sip I actually took a moment to contemplate the flavors and unconscionably swished it around in my mouth like a nice glass of Barolo. 

Wow...I don't think I've ever done that before. The best espresso I've ever had was in Rome, but I will come back here to see if they can challenge it. Game on Philz. Game on.

Free WIFI, super nice baristas(os)?, comfy couches and non-pretentious up the wazoo. Boo-yah!
author: Shira O.

description: Mint mojito iced coffee is hands down my fav but if you're looking for a good brew... such as one that may taste like nutella, get half red sea (secret blend not on the menu) and half hazelnut. YOU CAN THANK ME LATER.
author: Min S.

description: If you are truly looking for the Philz coffee experience, and you should be, the one on 24th street in the Mission is the place to be. Incredible coffee, handmade to your taste, and a extremely cool vibe this is a trek I make at least once a week.
author: Cory B.

description:
My first cup of Philz was from this location and it changed my life! I had the tesora and it was SO flavorful and really strong. It opened my eyes, or should I say taste buds to how wonderful drip coffee can be. Their variety of coffee beans all have their own distinct notes. Some taste nutty, while others have a floral or chocolate flavor. Their coffee is fresh brewed and to be enjoyed like fine wine.

I've tried almost everything on the menu and my favorites are the tesora, mocha tesora, philtered soul. I also love the ginersnap, but it taste better iced so I can never order it when it's cold. If it's your first time, it can be a bit overwhelming. Look for their menu board for descriptions or ask the baristas for a recommendation. Then let them know if you want light or medium cream and sugar because they add it in for you.
author: Alice J.

description:
Been in San Francisco for a month and my wife keeps saying how good their coffee is, so I tried it and I was hooked. It IS one of the best coffee for me. 

I tried a Julie's ultimate dark roast blend and it was very good, I will try a lighter roast blend next time.

Definitelly recommended
author: Iman F.

description: I understand that Philz is the best place to get coffee in the bay area.  At least I have been told this.  I don't know if I just don't have a palate as distinguished as others, but I don't love it here.  I love to go to small places with friendly staff.  I found the staff to be a bit judgmental and rude.  It is true that the coffee is good.  But the ticket price doesn't match what you are receiving.
author: Jennifer L.

description: The mint mojito is to dieee for. The other kinds of coffee I tried are also really good, quality coffee too.
author: Lucy X.

description: I started coming here when it became a Federal Express Locker space, and am continuing even after the Lockers went away.  The coffee is good, the service is outstanding - the staff is very welcoming.  (As I was waiting to freshen up one day, I did overhear a new staff member being trained on how to deal with customers - to be attentive, to appear to be caring - and though it is part of the training - it is very effective - the staff makes Philz a great place to be.
author: Wolf B.

description:
This I promise to you my friends, if you come to Phil's you will not leave thirsty. You will not leave wanting. No. This does not happen after Phil's. You leave excited. Tou leave empowered! By the benefits of caffeine... 

Yes. You are going to go to Phil's and you are going to request Tesoro. Never Tesora. No offense to you Tesora but you are not well rounded and that is the way i enjoy all my coffee best.
author: Esteban F.

description:
What really makes this place is the employees. They are so nice, friendly, pleasant, informed, professional, and passionate about what they do. They seem to enjoy their jobs, which is refreshing. I always ask questions and learn something new about coffee. These folks really know what they're doing.

And every cup of coffee is sublime. So delicious. 

Always a GREAT experience. Thank you, Philz.
author: Joyce G.

description:
Fellow yelper and Guatemalan Heat  Cesar N.  doesn't like to classify himself as a foodie even though he really is. He always makes fun of me for talking about food 24/7, but when he discovered this place a few months ago he developed quite an expensive coffee habit here. ...And.he.cant.stop.talking.about.it.

So when I was finally in SF with him during the morning, he took me here. We were greeted by friendly staff, and the shop has that "urban coffee shop" feel to it. I could see myself hanging out here if I lived nearby.

I was so overwhelmed by all the choices they had, so I went the pre-women's rights route and let my man order for me. I think he ordered the Tesora blend with a tinge of sweetness. And YUM! Had the power of crack but doesn't make you as jittery, and it had this very sweet flavor to it. 

I like this spot. But minus 1 star for the time it takes to get a cup of coffee. It must have taken almost 5 minutes for 2 cups of coffee because they hand grind the beans right before they brew your coffee. I appreciate the love that goes into it but I wish the process was faster. Give yourself some extra time, don't come here in a rush, and this cup of coffee will be the best part of waking up. ;)
author: Stacy S.

description:
Blue Bottle - YOU ARE DEAD to me. 

Philz, let me count the ways I love you . . . 

Your utter lack of pretension,

Your rough and tough mission location,

Your Turkish Coffee,

and the iced mint mojito. 

Thank you Philz -

You are a beacon of light in a city filled with coffee to precious to drnk. 

I love you.
author: Deidre H.

description:
Philz, I love you forever. Every time I want to get an iced coffee drink, I wish I lived in the Bay Area and had a Philz near me! Glad I got to experience this Philz with David C. after we walked around the Mission District and explored the Balmy Street Murals. Apparently our coffee was served by Phil and we didn't know it til afterwards! 

The whole trip in SF, we got the Ecstatic at the suggestion of the first barista in the Palo Alto location. Not sure if I want to try anything else, it's the best coffee drink. Also love that their employees are awesome and explain everything! Can't wait to visit SF again and get some Philz.
author: Esther L.

description: To be completely honest, I view premium coffee as premium coffee. Starbucks, etc... all good. However, the Turkish at Philz blew me away. Strong thumbs up!!!
author: Michael S.

description:
Best Coffee I've ever had. Might not be saying much. 

Thing is though, they make each coffee 1 cup at a time so it might not come out tasting exactly like the last time you had it. It's still good but I feel like the first 2 times I   came here it tasted better. But they do ask you if it is to your liking when you pick it up from the counter. I'm just not that picky. 

Really this place should be no secret now. I'm just reviewing it to put on my list of reviews around campus.
author: Henry C.

description:
Ahhhh Philz..... I commonly refuse to drink coffee unless it's from Philz; and if I do drink other coffee, I slowly sip my mediocre cup of joe while I reminisce about the extremely satisfying times I had with Philz. How I wish you had a location closer to the Sunset. Honestly, though, it's worth the traveling. This is my favorite location out of the three in SF because they never get my coffee order wrong, they are super down to earth and friendly, and they somehow know how I like my cream and sugar without ever asking me. They're mind readers over here, I swear. 

Service: Pretty much covered in the sentences above. Wait is not too long, but it's worth it anyway!

Seating: Outside benches, which are always taken. Plenty of randomly put together tables, chairs, and sofas inside to place your fanny. Great for groups or for the individuals who prefer solidarity. I would live here if it were closer.

Parking: I always find parking, weekday or weekend. There's metered and free street parking. 

Prices: I actually never paid attention. It shouldn't matter at Philz. You'll probably spend $4-$5 depending on the size.

Bathrooms: They have them, but I've never been inside. 

Food: Looks good. They everything from bagels to donuts. I think I've only had a croissant here, that was just ok. 

Coffee: SO many choices!!! I am slowly starting to break out of my Philz coffee shell and try new blends. My choices so far:

-Aromatic Arabic: My absolute favorite!! Try it with mint!

-Jacob's Wonderbar: Second choice. Just as good, but not as smooth as the Arabic.

-Tantalizing Turkish: My boyfriend's pick. Similar to the Arabic, but a little too bitter for me. Also great with mint!

-Silken Splendor: My new favorite!! I've tried their other medium blends and don't enjoy them too much, but Silken Splendor is pretty amazing. The name says it all! Silky and absolutely splendid! 

I stay away from the light roasts. I just don't think they would be strong enough for me. I have tried the Ambrosia and Tesora from the medium blends and don't like them very much. I think it all depends on your own taste, so I would suggest to try anything at Philz! You will not be disappointed!
author: Lauren D.

description:
perfection. in a word. A cup of philz coffee elicits one word in my mind...no, in the deepest recesses of my soul: perfection!

This location is funky, gritty, a little dirty, but friendly, fast and the coffee is...well you know, Perfect!
author: Nilu r.

description:
Philz is my favorite coffee shop. I almost always get a sweet and creamy mint mojito iced tea. If you haven't tried it yet, it is heavenly.

This location is easily accessible from BART and has seating for sitting and enjoying your coffee or a pastry.
author: Arun V.

description:
I love the free internet.  I hate that my stomach always hurts after I drink this coffee... but I know I will keep going back. I'm convinced one of the blends will make me a true believer soon.

Some of the staff is nice and helpful. Other staff are typical rude coffee snobs and expect you to understand the extensive menu, even if you are new to Philz.  Hopefully you get one of the nice people while you are still exploring the menu.
author: Autumn B.

description:
Definitely try the mint mojito.  I've had mint coffee before, with mint extract, but I've never had mint coffee with actual mint leaves.  And they use SO MUCH mint that it relieves a bit of the $5 sticker shock.  I usually drink coffee black, so only had light soy milk with it, and it was like a treat.

Their black coffees are pretty good too.
author: E O.

description:
First cup of Philz ever.. Mint Mojito Iced Coffee
First impression? Creamy foamy head from a drip coffee? Hellz yea, I'm a girl who loves creamy head. 
First taste? Silky, damn it was smooth, so incredibly creamy and coated the tongue a bit, great bold taste, very bold in fact and tasted the way coffee should always taste.

Trying not to fangirl too hard here, but I'm in love with the coffee! Since my first visit a week ago, I've gone many times to the Berkeley location and everything I've had has been so good!  I get my coffee iced usually, the coffee is fantastic hot, it's even better iced.  I'm trying not to wax poetic all over yelp and say what everyone has been saying over n over again about Philz.  So I did it on my blog instead! (http://fatgirleuphoria.wordpress.com/2011/07/22/coffee-epiphany/  shameless plug.. I know!) 

If you haven't tried it, do so, it really is THAT good.
author: Brendalynn K.

description:
After coming here for five years on 24th street, since before we even lived here and could come often, we had a less than stellar experience. The service was fantastic, even down to the choice of plain or vanilla soy, but the usual strong, potent green tea, which usually knocks socks off with a taste of cardemom was missing the usual oomph. This was the second time this has happened.

I also thought the new cups were smaller as well, but they're 16 ounces right on the money. I could've sworn the old ones were bigger, but I'll keep my yelphole shut on this point. Must have been the weak tea that made the cup seem smaller and I was able to swig it down.

I know this is mainly a coffee place, but sadly we can' t head over for tea the way we used to like it. :  (
author: Dave S.

description: I'm disappointed to write this review, but I really didn't have a good experience at Philz.  I just moved back to my old neighborhood and was excited to have Philz right down the street again, but alas, it is not the friendly place I remember.  The girl making my coffee quite literally ignored me when I thanked her, then barked "yeah" when I thanked her again. It was weird. The cashier made a joke to her cohort about calling animal control on my dog who was tied up outside and I was standing right there. Maybe I just caught the staff on a bad day, but they left the impression that they think they're so smart and cool that their customers don't notice when they're being snide and dismissive. Sad face. Oh well, at least Philz isn't the only good coffee on the street anymore. And I went to the one in the Castro afterwards and had a great experience.
author: Leslie H.

description: I wish this place wasn't all the way in the mission! The mint mojito...YUM. The coffee here is great, the people that work here are super friendly. This isn't Starbucks and you won't get your coffee quickly but it sure will taste good! Please open more locations!
author: Clarice C.

description: Thank you to Foodspotting for introducing me to Philz's Mint Mojito Iced Coffee.  I am not a coffee drinker but I will gladly have a (large) cup of this iced coffee any day.  But don't expect it to be quick.  Each cup of Philz coffee is brewed to order but well worth the wait.
author: Rose A.

description:
I am loyal.

I was told once that coffee nowadays is an experience...not just a picker upper...you know in the morning...to get you going...that is why its too bothersome for me to listen to the special orders...i was just in puerto vallarta a week ago and you can just imagine the long line at starbucks...and you know why its because of this dimwits ordering their...lattes with sugar free sh*t with a touch of vanilla and a sprinkle of cinnamon with soymilk and it goes on and on...its bad enough that the baristas try hard enough to catch up with the instructions not to mention the language translation...c'mon coffee is coffee...yes you can make it tailor made for you but bottom line it is coffee.

that is why i like rahmi...yes at cafe venice...he steams all the milk/cream that you put in your coffee and you dont have to pay extra...call it misto...latte...what have you...and he makes it in small batches...i understand that philz makes it one cup at a time which is really awesome but not when you are in a rush.

i was just there today because cholo needs caffeine at yes 6pm, he actually instructed me to go to rahmi's but i told him that he is alreayd close by now...so this is the closest coffee shop that i can go to that i know is open.

my experience here reminded me of the M&L Deli, when the Nazi sandwich lady yelled at me because I dont know how to order...and it was my first time...dont get me wrong the Barista at Philz was kind enough to  ask me if I have been there before...and I said No...I just ordered a Latte and she said she will make something similar to it.

Cholo didnt like the coffee which I think just for the caffeine of it is good...he said Jackie at Rahmi's taste a lot better.

I would definitely go back to Philz. if I have the luxury of time, maybe I can bring my laptop and just kick it there...but like I said ...I am loyal...to Rahmi's coffee at Cafe Venice...also on 24th.
author: Malou C.

description:
Café, café...¡qué rico es el café!

Five + stars for the coffee and because it looks like Phil, the mastermind behind this business, is a great guy.  Two things I loved about the funky decor of this place: a couple of posters of other businesses in Mission, where collaboration between said businesses and this coffee house was proudly displayed. "Buy a computer at the computer shop down the street, we buy you a cup of coffee"; the second one was an advertisement for a "highly-caffeinated" carpenter--or plumber--hang on the wall as well.  The "good neighbor" attitude is what makes Mission such a wonderful place. Mr. Phil seems to be on it.

Both Mr. B and I truly enjoyed our hand-dripped cups of coffee very much.  I did as much or even a little bit more than the coffee from Seattle. 

At this point, and after all the praises, you should be wondering why the three stars.  The service was atrocious.  The woman working there on Friday February 4th at 6:30pm might have an angel hand for coffee but has NO clue on how to treat customers.  

When I first came and said "Hi!" she startled. I profusely apologized even though I suspect what I wasn't what had her jump.  Then I ordered an Americano and a latte.  She said, curtly, they don't do "watered-down" coffee and that "you can go across the street for those drinks, because our coffee shop works in a different way".  I can understand that, but don't you send me somewhere else! 

(Of course I shut my mouth and didn't say that).  

I asked her if I could do something similar and she said she'd give me a regular and a decaf.  Then she pointed out I needed to tell her if I wanted cream and sugar.  I was a little bit confused and ordered milk for my drink.

Then another customer came in and ordered a bag of ungrounded beans. She was a very nice and polite girl and I heard her order THAT.  Almost immediately, the barista threw the beans in the grinder, and the customer said "no, no, ungrounded" in a NICE way. The barista got defensive and said "I heard ground" and kept insisting on that. 

Well, you heard wrong.  The other customer and I exchanged puzzled looks.

After that, I get called for my drinks and ask where was the sugar.  She barely contained her annoyance. She said "I told you we do the sugar BEHIND the counter" in such a patronizing way, at this point I just wanted to leave. I asked for one small spoon of sugar and she dumped an equivalente to a quarter cup in my coffee. Yes, she made my coffee too sweet.  Jeez. 

Still, we loved the coffee. But in a city where we have had pretty great service, this is no bueno.  I would love to go back, but I really don't want to feel like Jerry Seinfeld and the soup Nazi when nicely asking for what is to me one of the most delightful pleasures in life.  

Which they do pretty well.
author: Valentina V.

description: Awesome coffee with quick and good service. Nice vibes too. Would definitely recommend. The staff are extremely helpful, knowledgable and welcoming and the pastries are killer. Check it out!
author: Carson M.

description:
Favorite place to get coffee in the Mission, hands down!

SO many coffee options! Amazing atmosphere with mix & match furniture that gives it a fun kitschy non-coffee shop chain vibe.

Best part: random sightings of Philz himself!
author: Daniela G.

description:
