Philz Coffee puts any other coffee to shame.  If you're in SF and you're going out of your way for any other coffee, then shame on you!

This specific location in Mission was incredibly crowded on a Saturday morning.  It was crowded enough and kept me waiting in line long enough to almost make me frustrated and want to leave... but I didn't.  *end rant*

I'm not from SF but a local friend told me that Philz Coffee has some pretty darn good coffee.  I was a bit confused with all their creatively named coffees and I totally missed their chalkboard with definitions.  I ordered whatever their latte equivalent is.  

It's nice that my coffee came with a fresh mint leaf.  It's also nice that Philz motto is "one cup at a time."  Every cup is a fresh cup of brewed coffee!

Most important to me... Philz Coffee is the first coffee I've had in a long time where I felt like it actually did what it's supposed to do: WAKE ME UP!  I know it left some of my friends pretty wired and finicky (he got a medium roast).  But my coffee was the perfect strength to wake me up on a Saturday morning.
author: Tran T.

description: I've been hearing about Philz for quite a while now but I'm not one who needs a coffee fix everyday so I had not tried this place. Last week I was handed a gift card for Philz. I looked up the location nearest me and headed over there yesterday to try out the coffee. After looking at the menu which I had studied  on line before going, I decided to get a bag of beans to grind and make coffee at home.  I just poured the first cup of the Turkish blend, added a pinch of cardamom ( they do this at the store, I read ), a splash of half and half and it is one of the best cups of coffee I've had in a long time. It's pricey but well worth a great cup of caffeine. I'm in heaven. Gotta go finish my coffee.
author: Cindy J.

description: I love philZ coffee. I love this location. This is going to be a short review because I am absolutely in love with philZ coffee wherever I have it, whenever I have it. It's the best!!!
author: Ryan C.

description:
There's a lot of hype surrounding this place and I just went there for the first time yesterday. I have to say, the coffee was actually pretty good. I guess I'm not too surprised but it's nice to know it lives up to its name.  Just like any good bean shop that takes its coffee seriously, first-timers will need to educate themselves on the voodoo of the shop before they can be accepted into the family. It's easy enough since the staff is friendly and willing to answer any questions you may have. 

P.S... Ink work and black jeans recommended. 
Ok... I'm on my way back for another cup. :)
author: Jeff H.

description:
I can't imagine going here for the first time when it's busy or first thing in the morning when I'm still half-asleep. There were like 2 other people ordering coffee when we went and if I hadn't been able to immediately ask the guy at the register "so how does this work?" I probably would have panicked and left. The line seems a little backwards, the ordering process is different than at most other coffee shops and there are so many brews to choose from at Philz it's like looking over a huge menu and then just picking something because you get tired of reading. 

We were both pleased with the brews we chose. Primarily because the guy helping us was perhaps the cheeriest enthusiastic person I've ever met. after the brew was complete, he effortlessly tossed the coffee from cup to cup to give it a good mix and froth on top. In the past when I've bought Philz beans in the store I've found the coffee to be too oily, but that's not the case on the brews I've tried here so far. 

All-in-all - a good cuppa joe after a slightly intense experience if you've never been in before. A big sign with instructions for newbies would be helpful. 

Oh, and the Mint tea is bad-ass...
author: Emily C.

description:
While yelping for the nearest Starbucks from my client's office, the closest one was a 2 mile walk... Being the lazy person I am, that's 1.9 miles too far!! So I figured I would just get coffee from wherever was closest, and that's when I found Philz Coffee down the street.. 

Walked into a cozy coffee shop where the line was literally out the door, so I thought to myself, if a place is crowded, it SHOULD be pretty decent., my rule of thumb. To my surprise, the menu was pretty unique with catchy names that caught my attention. My typical morning drink is the run-of-the-mill White Chocolate Mocha, but I had to try one of their specialty mochas. I can't exactly recall the name cause it's been months since I've been here, but it was really good! 

What I loved most about the place was the fact that the staff was super friendly and really pleasant and fun to talk to. They really make you feel welcomed and take their time to make the drink the way YOU like it. I enjoyed my experience at Philz and the coffee as well. I'm glad that there wasn't a Starbucks nearby, else I would have never found this place! :)
author: Phuoc L.

description: A great place to go to get your morning coffee hit! These guys know their coffee and the staff were also really friendly.
author: Susan K.

description:
Close the freakin door! Its 40 degrees outside. Do you really think people will not come in if the door is closed? This is not L.A. Its winter folks, and your customers are freezing their asses off and their hands are too numb to even use the WIFI. (the WIFI connection sucks by the way and constantly boots you off)  People are looking for a WARM place to be when they come in during the winter. We should not have to wear a scarf, hat, and gloves while we sip our crappy, bitter, coffee inside your dump. 

The service is still the worst and the odd looking cashier Michael was  extremely rude and he was handling money and preparing food without washing his hands. Disgusting. 

I hate this place so much but I feel trapped in coming here when my car needs work.  The lines are always so long at it takes everyone at least 15 minutes to get one simple cup of coffee. I do not know how anyone can possibly give this place good reviews. Its THEE worst. 

Oh and ..... close the damn door!!!!!
author: Lisa J.

description:
$3 for a small black coffee? 

i could almost try to justify it if it even tasted good. maybe i didn't get the best of the 26 different grinds available but i won't be going back to try another. i couldn't make it through 1/8th of the cup before i poured it out and went to the coffee shop near my work and bought another (for just $1.75).

i don't like that yelp requires at least one star, but in this case i would give it to them just because the people were so nice... even at 6:30am.
author: danielle m.

description:
I know this place has its own mystique and flavor, so i'll try not to let those things taint my review.

Service: Non-existent, really.  The staff just sort of stared at me until i ordered at the wrong place (the register, next to the door).  The person making my coffee didn't even make eye contact throughout the entire experience.  They got a dollar tip anyway.

Coffee: Clean enough taste, though it seemed slightly sweetened?  I like my coffee cowboy black.  It certainly wasn't bitter, but there was nothing remarkable about the Peru Light.

Atmosphere: This i kinda liked.  It reminds me of the way coffee shops used to be.  However, everyone was so absorbed on the intarwebnets that they couldn't be bothered to move their feet out of the aisles.  I've come to expect this almost everywhere i go, though.

I dunno.  The coffee is simply okay, the waitstaff are stoned out of their gourds, and the barflow is more awkward than a bunch of waitstaff stoned out of their gourds.

I'd try it again!
author: FUPS F.

description:
You know this place is the Bees Knees when you're in LA... you open the door of your car to get out and you see a Philz coffee cup laying in the gutter... instead of picking it up and then cursing SFians... I quickly got my phone out and checked Yelp to see where the Philz in LA was located to get a quick fix. 

There is no Philz in LA. booooooooo-hisssssssss
However - it just goes to show that Philz has gotten into my head - I literally triple checked that there wasn't a Philz more than once that day. I can't even see a cup without my whole being needing some of that tasty sweet nectar that is Philz.

Favorite "flavor"...just go get yourself one of their iced coffees. Hot day, cold day, rain day, snow day (?)... it don't matter... it's the kinda thing that ends up haunting your dreams.

SIDE NOTE: Dear Mr. Philz Owner - please put one of your establishments closer to my house so that I can single handedly keep you in business by coming and getting some of your amazingness on the daily. Thanks!
author: Katy A.

description:
I just have to do an update after having their iced coffee for the first time.  I don't know why I thought that it would be any less amazing than the hot, but they surprised me with excellence once again!! I just ordered an iced coffee with regular soy... it was the best iced coffee I have ever had. Seriously.

Best part was that unlike other iced coffees, during and after the ice had melted it was still strong and not bitter at all.  Magic I tell you!
author: Laura P.

description: I gave 4 stars to the location on van ness simply because it would be unfair to review the coffee any lower despite the lack of barista skills (specific to that location). But here, no matter which coffee I choose, whatever way its made, its always perfect. Always the perfect amount of cream and sugar, no ingredient overwhelms one another especially the rich taste of the coffee. When I ask for iced, the baristas here always take the time to cool down the coffee before adding ice. I've chosen mostly the medium roasts and each one tastes pretty awesome - you're pretty much safe with any blend though. I usually have my coffee with medium cream and sugar but there's a "philz way." Will definitely try that next time!
author: Jamie Y.

description: I'm not a huge coffee drinker, but when I do decide to grab a cup, Philz is one of my go-to places. On my most recent visit here I just wanted some black coffee to wake me up from a late night. Ended up getting the Turkish which was very good. My other favorites include their chai, ginger snap iced coffee, and the mint mojito. This original Phil'z location has an awesome vibe with lots of cool wall art. Service was excellent, just like at any other Philz I've been too.
author: Kevin N.

description: I have been to Ritual, Four Barrel, Sight Glass, Blue Bottle, Dutch Bros, which I would give all five stars but Phillz is my favorite! The coffee is amazing!! It's really unbelievable. Long lines on the weekends about 30 min. But so worth it! Also the baristas are very nice. You can also play chess here and other games which can be fun with your cup of coffee. Ambrosia is my favorite but I have only tried the chocolate one and the Turkish coffee.
author: Emily C.

description:
Soooooooooooooooo goooooooooooooood. Like, so good. Like holy smokes good. No but really, and in all seriousness, Philz kills it.
Mikey is great!
If you remember to go to the back and order with the barista first then you can get out of here fast enough. Everyone is super efficient and friendly. This location is busy n still cozy. I actually love the communal table setup, probably because it reminds me of my grandparents house. I also love how they froth up your drink right before they serve it to you... it's entertaining and tasty. The divey bathroom is interesting to say the least.
These are my favorite drinks:
Mint mojito
Tantalizing turkish
So good
Mocha tesora
author: Amy W.

description:
This is one of my favorite places in the city. Everyone who works here is awesome.
The coffee is almost always great, and when it isn't they really will remake it for you (and I'm not talkin' begrudingly either, they do not mind).
The burritos are a little small, but there's a taqueria on every corner as an alternative.
author: Lauren U.

description: I bow down to Philz Coffee and the Bestie for knowing his sf coffee and bringing me here! Such. good. Coffee! There are no words to even describe.  Had a medium brew, light on the cream...liquid gold. when in sf, it's a must go.
author: Annette M.

description:
Philz has completely ruined me. I used to be happy with a regular grande coffee from Starbucks. I used to pay $2, $2.50 max for a cup of coffee. I used to be ignorant and happy. But now that I know how incredibly delicious coffee can be, now that I know its true potential, there's no going back to the naive bliss I once had.

Now if I don't start every single morning with Philz coffee I'm a bitter, angry person. It sounds arrogant, but it's honestly become difficult to drink anything else. It's just too. damn. good.

With 19 different brews, you're sure to find one that is perfectly tailored to you. My drink of choice? The silken splendor with plain soy milk. It doesn't just warm my body in the morning, it warms my heart and my soul.

But be warned: this place is pretty funky. Some would call the interior eclectic, others would call it a mess, but either way it's not one of those sleek, hip spots that have been taking over the city. No no, it's way more poor, dirty hipster, which I don't mean as a, insult. 

Also, because this place is sorta a big deal and each cup is made to order, you may run into a bit of a wait. The baristas are fast, but give yourself at least 5-10 minutes.

Finally, despite my love of their sweet, hot brews, their pastries are pretty terrible. They look tempting behind the glass, but it's just an illusion - you're best off finding sustenance elsewhere. Luckily, the best patisserie in the city, Knead, is right next door and open early. 

An almond twist + a pomme + a fresh cup of Silken Splendor = morning perfection.
author: Kelsey E.

description: Who knew that mint would go so well with coffee?! I am a fan of you, Mint Mojito, I am! Although it is a bit pricey ($4), I suppose it is worth it. The baristas are all very helpful and accommodating as well. After making my drink, the barista asked me to try it first and if I wanted anything changed or added, she could fix it for me right then. I thought that was really nice of her!
author: Polly H.

description:
I've been to Philz before but this time it just missed the mark. Keep in mind that I walked about a mile in the rain to get here so maybe my expectations were very high.

With that said, I love strong, deep, dark coffee that can stand up to soy milk; this coffee however, was weak and bland. I'm not sure what went wrong... maybe I'm used to my good ol' Peet's coffee that can scrape the tar off any surface!

I remember it to be better.
author: Yeimy R.

description:
If caffeine is your drug of choice, then Philz is your dealer. However, unlike most drug dealers who are generally unsavory, dangerous characters, the atmosphere at Philz is friendly and inviting. 

The coffee at Philz is possibly the most individualized cup of coffe you'll ever have. Me? I'm a large Ether with medium sugar and just a drop of cream. Check it out and find the cup of Philz that warms your soul.
author: Zachary S.

description:
Absolute heaven in cup.  I can't think of a better cup of coffee in SF, frothy, flavorful, fun, freakin awesome deliciousness.  Each cup is brewed to order, they've got an awesome variety, and the atmosphere is chill and inviting.  

I live in Philly at the moment and have actual cravings for Philz.
author: Anna J.

description: Perfect coffee, great staff who are both friendly and professional: they take this coffee stuff SERIOUSLY at Phil'z.
author: Joel S.

description:
I'm not a big coffee drinker - I like it but caffeine does strange things to me.  The coffee I did try (I can't remember the blend) was very smooth and rich.  However, as expected the place was overrun by hipsters in front and behind the counter.  The disgust at my lack of coffee knowledge was dripping off the barristas' faces.  Ugh.  This place is great for people who like their coffee with enough room for a generous splash of attitude.  

However, the cinnamon twist here is amazing.  Wait a moment and get it toasted.
author: Monica L.

description: Mint mojito coffee is so flavorful. I got it hot so the mint flavor comes out even stronger. It's bitter in the first sip but after ten seconds it feels so sweet in the mouth. Feels good :)
author: Ashley C.

description: Philz has good coffee, don't get me wrong. I like the inclusion of fresh mint in their specialty drinks. However the system for ordering coffee reminds me of waiting at the DMV. In the future I will stick to sight glass when traveling to the bay.
author: Megann J.

description:
This place is awesome. It is such a unique take of coffee that I have never seen before. I come from LA which is home to like the capitol of fast food coffee chains. I am so used to Starbucks coffee that this place forever changed my out look on coffee.

First of all the ambiance in this place is amazing. Full of hipsters, college students, business people, and families. They have an extensive menu of different coffees and teas. The employees are very helpful in finding out which coffee is perfect for you.

I ordered a green tea with milk and honey. It was probably one of the best green teas I have ever had. It was so good I can't even explain the taste. The temperature was perfect and it was just so good. It think its because instead of sitting in a brew pot the whole day and getting a burnt flavor. They brew your individual cup of coffee or tea right in front of you.

This place is amazing and I really hope they decide to open one out here in LA or the OC cause we or at least I need a break from Starbucks.
author: Ryan H.

description:
I stumbled in here at 6:45 this morning a very, very hungover panda.

The great Phil himself poured my cup of tea, having just perfected his blend--and Ashley and I were the first to try it out! It. Is. WONDERFUL. Hasn't cleared my hangover just yet, but then again I only had one cup. 

What I also love was their richly diverse blend of coffees, and then everything is made individually right in front of you. You can't get any fresher, or better, than that. 

Breakfast this morning -- Cup of tea and baklava (which was, well, fucking unbelievable). I'll be back here, for definitely. 

Shokran!
author: Jaime L.

description:
When I'm a good girl, I get the Turkish. It's a treat. 
When I'm a bad girl, I get one anyway. I'm greedy and I deserve it.
author: Stumbalina b.

description:
There is some crazy stuff going on at Philz Coffee, and all I can say is try to prepare yourself!   They have a *LOT* of different blends to choose from (detailed also at http://www.philzcoffee.com/Online-Store) and it's a little bit daunting at first.  They'll make the perfect cup of coffee for you, but that also means that they will add the sugar/milk for you.

Just go with it, and take your time reading through all your options!  I got the Tesora.  It was a delicious medium-bodied coffee, and one of their most popular according to my friend.

That said, I feel like I really need to go back and take some time to contemplate my next "cup of love" from Philz Coffee.  They've got a lot of options on all ends of the spectrum from dark to light roasts.
author: David W.

description: This is the original Philz location. Because of that I'm giving them 5 stars! Looks kinda rundown but the consistency of the coffee and the good service is the same as all other location.
author: J C.

description:
Soy Mint Mojito Iced Coffee. Large. My favorite drink from Philz. Love how minty and fresh the coffee tastes. NOMS. Not to mention the fact that their baristas are nice and they don't charge extra for soy. Loves that, especially if you're a lactose intolerant kid like myself you really come to appreciate the extra dollars and cents you save from that!

FYI: The layout of this store was kind of confusing to me, especially since it's so different from the other stores. And since it was so early in the morning and I obviously hadn't had my coffee yet. I think I got confused and might have cut a whole bunch of people in line. Sorry about that! I wasn't awake nor aware of what I was doing.
author: Constance C.

description:
Iced mint mojito coffee?  Philz "mocha"?  

I don't drink coffee..... but I'll drink the 2 above drinks from here.  It's so delicious.... if you can go visit philz, GO!.  I unfortunately only travel to the bay once a month or so and thats the only time i can have this coffee goodness!~
author: Tim B.

description:
I just had a Turkish Coffee here on my way to work this morning. Never been in here before .....

Quite an expierence. Nice vibe. Great coffee. Methinks I'm gonna become a regular.
author: Kevin M.

description: Honestly, I'm not that sure the coffee is the highlight, rather it's the people. The family that owns the place is super friendly, they talk to everyone and know everyone. This is a Mission gem and I hope it lives forever. Good people, good coffee.
author: Jeremy S.

description: I'm not much of a coffee drinker but I love their mint mojito! Best coffee I've ever had!!! I defintely will always drop by when I am visiting my sister in SF. Also should try the mocha tesora and the jamaican blue mountain. Yum. Craving one right now.
author: Debbie P.

description: First time there while traveling in sf. Best coffee ever and had the best barista ever. Tony is the best! Will be going back every day I'm here.
author: Joe O.

description: Thank you for existing in my life. I love coffee and I love good coffee even more. It's interesting how you describe your blends, and they're on point! Yum! So many options for everything, it's great!
author: Chloe C.

description:
I came after finishing a full breakfast 30 min before, got a medium roast coffee and cranberry rosemary loaf (to eat for later).  And by "later" I mean I couldn't wait until later ofcourse), it went so perfectly with the coffee.

I think they put crack in my coffee. And baked it into the loaf. And then I think they topped it with some more crack. 

That's the only explanation.
author: Jess C.

description: Lives up to the hype, the coffee is good. The only problem is the baristas have to remember a  lot of drinks and can mess up an order every now and then, not their fault, but maybe there should be a better system that doesn't require them to remember multiple drinks at a time. Minus one star to Phil for not having a better system for your employees.
author: Jorge C.

description:
Hands down the best tasting coffee in the city. I've tried the over-hyped Blue Bottle,Four Barrel, and Ritual and Philz Coffee surpases them all on every level. 

The coffee is out of tho world. The Turkish is amazing to say the least. As mentioned by others The Mint Mojito is a-must, definitely delicious and one of a kind. The Instanbul treat is another flavorful gem for when I'm surprisingly not in the mood for coffee. This is coffee for all of you tired of generic, bland, over syruped or overpriced ''coffee''.

The staff is friendly and I love the unpretencious vibe of the place. 

The only negative is the place tends to get pretty crowded on weekends and the line is usually out the door, I guess that's the price you pay for some truly awesome coffee:(
author: Els H.

description:
Philz is a neighborhood jewel.  Good bagels (the house special Philz Bagel is a favorite of mine), good pastries, and of course, decent coffee.  

Wikipedia says that "baristas" make espresso-based drinks.   I don't think they make those at Philz, so i'm not sure what to call those folks, but I can describe them: they are, without fail, awesome.  They know the hell out of their coffee, they can make recommendations on the vaguest of preferences, they can craft a cup of coffee to any exacting specifications, and they always have a smile on their face and maybe a little joke to share.  I love those guys.
author: Oliver N.

description: Coffee is God like... Amazing atmosphere... However their prices have Skyrocketed. They are charging $5.00 for a large Mocha now... That's almost a dollar raise from less than a year ago! They are starting to scare devoted fans away.
author: Saul G.

description: I still think about this coffee at least every other day. My husband and I vacationed for a couple nights in San Fran and stayed around the block from Philz. It was a perfect wonderful delicious cup of perfect coffee. I know some others have said staff was rude but I didn't feel like that at all. Even though we were outsiders they helped guide us and everyone was very kind. Lots of hipsters and neck beards but duh, why else would we stay in the Mission district! Wish they'd come to my area, people would LOVE it!
author: Emily W.

description: I am a coffee lover and will take every and any opportunity to get my hands on a cup.  However, I do believe that most coffee is just average and rarely do I stumble upon a cup that blows my socks off.  Aside from my experience with Intelligentsia in Venice, CA, Philz Coffee has delivered above and beyond my expectations.  I was greeted by a lovely barista who analyzed my coffee personality and we agreed on the Dancing Waters with medium cream and sugar.  Once my lips tasted these magical waters, I was in heaven.  In fact, i loved it so much that I came back the next day and got the same thing.  My friend loved her hot chocolate also.  I wished that I lived near Philz so that I can be a regular :(
author: Monica G.

description:
SOME DAMN GOOD COFFEE......and i don't even like coffee!!

I am now addicted and have been a regular. 
Great service. Great atmosphere. Love the neighborhood.

The Mocha Tesora, Philharmonic, and Philtered Soul are some of my faves.

Go enjoy a good cuppa joe!
author: Sam C.

description:
I'm not a coffee aficionado by any means.  "Would you like some come coffee w/that cream?"  That's the kind of coffee drinker I am.  

BUT. Regardless of how light the bean I drink, or how much cream I dilute a dark roast with, I still drink a lot of it.

I told Diane, my barista- that I was a first timer.  "Awesome, welcome!" she said.  I told her how I drink my cream.  She gave me two recommendations, and in the end, I was awarded with a large, medium roast Anesthesia To The Upside, with sweet hints of caramel and nuttiness.  I had to give it back to her 3 times so she could add more sugar (they use brown sugar)..but I didn't feel embarrassed at all.  Only because she kept saying "now don't hesitate to let me know if you want it more sweet, I want your drink to be perfect".  

Way, way, back in the day- I used to be a barista myself.  I worked at Starbucks for a good substantial time.  How we concocted drinks there is nothing like Philz, and the knowledge base the employees have at Philz is worlds away from Starbucks.  I don't even want to compare the 2 coffee houses..they're incomparable.

If you get Diane, you'll be taken care of.  When I'm in the neighborhood of any Philz location, I'll be sure to stop by.  There are many other drinks to be discovered, and Hitarho-fied.
author: Rho T.

description:
Philz fan 4 Lyfe. Wdupppp. I'm so happy they have Philz in Palo Alto now because it's more accessible for me! I"ve tried several of the many different brews they have available. The coffee is ground fresh and made right there for you, giving you the freshest cup possible. Love it! 

I usually like my coffee black or with just a splash of milk, but sometimes you're in the mood for something a little light and sweet, right? If it's one of those days for you, you can opt to add their special cream and a little sugar to transform your already tasty cup of joe into a delightfully smooth and creamy confection. They also garnish their drinks with a little sprig of mint. Love!

My favorites so far are the Tesora blend and the iced coffee, but I will definitely be trying out the others!
author: Euna K.

description:
Coffee at its finest. I was introduced to Philz by a guy who loves coffee as much as I do and tasted my first Tesora earlier this summer. LOVE at first sip. Bold full-bodied flavors, strong aroma, and a mint sprig for that extra touch of awesomeness on top of brewing each cup individually. (I loved the mint addition so much that I now have a wildly growing mint plant in my kitchen solely for my morning cups of coffee. Toss in a few leaves, pour in my fresh brew, and run out the door!)

I visited Philz again just recently and grabbed a Philtered Soul (just cream and mint, no sugar) to meander the city with and a few pounds to take back to LA. My suitcase smelled divine when I opened it this morning, and I'm bummed that Philz only resides in the Bay Area, but perhaps it's better that way. An extra incentive to come home and try all the amazing blends.

Bonuses: absolutely adore the eclectic artwork, cozy mismatched furniture, and chill but chatty baristas! Barista from Portland, thanks for being so darn friendly! And good luck to the barista kicking off his band's tour today!
author: Michelle C.

description:
This is my favorite place in the city. Great atmosphere, couches to chill in, communal tables to work. Baristas are cool/friendly and the coffee is amazing.

Also the people watching is A+ Mission.
author: Phillip W.

description:
Philz' secret ingredient must be CRACK! I pretty much go here everyday.  I tough out the looooong lines on the weekends and stop by after work during the week to get my Philz fix!  In fact, I'm drinking a Philz Coffee right now!

My favorites:
- Philharmonic - Tastes of coffee and spice and all things nice!  Good with a mint leaf or 2!
- Ambrosia - Coffee of the Gods.
- Ether - Rich, Dark and smokey.  
- Ginger Snap - Not on the menu... Just get one!
author: Chris S.

description:
Sadly, I have nothing like this here at home. 
I was lucky enough to venture into this place a couple times over a bad ass weekend in SF. 
I really liked watching make the coffee right in front of you. The counters have the filters built in, so once you pick a coffee they poor the hot water and you get an awesome cup of coffee that had me buzzing for hours. 
So many different choices I was a bit overwhelmed.
author: Noel J.

description: completely addicted to the mocha tesora with light vanilla soy and medium sweet. bring your own cup for savings.  be prepared to wait awhile during peak hours but the line moves fast. philz baristas are always friendly and accomodating.
author: Coco J.

description:
Philz isn't perfect, but I'm still giving it 5 stars because not much in life is without a flaw. Seattle coffee snob is in love and wants to try every roast on the extensive menu. Delicious turkish coffee with cardamom and mint and the tasty, not-too-sweet mocha blend are my favorites so far, but there's always room for more.

To truly achieve Yelp's "Woohoo! As good as it gets!" they'd need to re-organize the counter/line/menu situation. When it's crowded, it's difficult to get in and out of the place, difficult to see the menu and the pastries, and it ends up making the wait a lot longer for everyone since some people aren't ready to order until they've looked at the menu. 

http://www.quora.com/Philz-Coffee has some interesting information about the place...
author: Kimberley D.

description: I used to think Philz was great.  And I guess it is if that's what you want - a big, sweet beverage made with heavy whipping cream.  When you get out and drink coffee Ritual, Four Barrel, Sightglass even Blue Bottle - you realize Philz is hiding inferior beans and roasting behind a wall of sugar and dairy.  The proprietary blends are a semi-illusion.  I bet Phil is making bank.  Still, the staff are wonderful and the location on 24th has great community flavor.  But why go and drink that coffee?
author: Eric S.

description: I wrote a less-than-stellar review of Philz just after Christmas.  It wasn't about the coffee - it was about a condescending barrista.  Since then, I received an apology from Philz, which was awfully nice, and made me rethink the whole thing.  There may have been a crap barrista working one day, but it doesn't reflect on Philz' customer service, and the coffee is AMAZING.
author: Julie F.

description:
Long time fan, first time reviewer! I've been to all the Philz (well, not San Jo..not yet) but all the rest...and I must confess a certain fondness and loyalty to the 24th/Folsom locale...it's where it all started you know!! 

Anyway, I have long been "hooked on" Philz coffees... Jacob's Wonderbar blend...and then MochaTresora...which led to my intro to Aromatic Arabic and Tantalizing Turkish obsessions!!   Unlike some other coffee chains...Philz coffee beans/blends are AWESOME even if you buy them by the pound and whip up coffee at home. they aren't just rolling out fancied up "coffee drinks"...it's the REAL DEAL! Deep, rich, intense...a true coffee aficionado's Mecca!! 

Most recently though...with SF finally having some borderline pleasant, dare I say downright sunny weather...I've stumbled upon a new fave at Philz....THE MINT MOJITO ICED COFFEE!!! Run...don't walk...to the nearest Philz and try one!!!  It's EVERYTHING an iced coffee drink should be and more!!!   Stopped in the other day and Phil J, the bossman, was in the house and whipped one up for me!! (Kinda like Bill Gates coming over and helping you set up your computer! But hell...Bill couldn't make a coffee drink that makes your toes curl!!!) Just go get one...escape your ordinary daily "grind" and taste for yourself!!
author: Karen S.

description: I had a delicious cup of Philz coffee at a friend's house and was hooked ever since.  I heard of Philz of course but never had their coffee before and was pleasantly surprised.  I just brought a second bag of Philtered Soulz whole bean and are trying their many different blends at the stores.
author: Stanley T.

description: LOVE in a cup. Absolutely delightful. And the baristas were all so friendly! When I got my iced mint mojito, it felt very personal. They were nice enough to make it a little sweeter, and less mintier. It was divine
author: Leah C.

description:
The best coffee ever. Anywhere. And if you don't agree, you can suck it. 
Cardamom? Mint? In your coffee?? Yes, please. I think I've arrived in heaven. 

They make each cup by hand to order and even add the cream and sugar for you. 
Super velvety and rich. Philz made me love coffee again, plus it's owned by a local small businessman. 

The cafe appearance at this location leaves much to be desired, but hey this review is just for the amazingly tantalizing coffee. Go to Philz!
author: Jennifer J.

description: What's the hoopla about this Ice mint mojito coffee?  It doesn't taste like coffee, taste more like ice foam with mint leaves that's not even minty.  This is an overpriced pretentious drink.  Next time, I'll just order plain old coffee.
author: Grace L.

description: That mint mojito iced coffee... Nothing else quite like it.
author: Brittany L.

description: FIRST IMPRESSION LAST!! my first time here and i'm one of the happy costumer! philz coffee brewed a very unique COFFEE i ordered  Iced mint mojito and it's sooo GOOD!!! im coming back try to more!!
author: Ruzzet P.

description: Love the atmosphere here, and the fact that everything is customized the way you want it!  I've tried a few of the flavors here (Tesora, Dancing Water, Philtered Soul) and they are ALL GOOD.  Delicious in fact.
author: Amy K.

description: Classic coffee shop. No blended drinks or anything fancy. Straight up coffee brew.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Philz Coffee has excellent customer service and the unique quality of adding mints to any cup of coffee is a great way to switch up the average cup of joe.  

I like that they are almost like a hole in the wall.  They don't stand out like other chain coffee shops!  The coffee is high quality and really gives you a nice start to your day!

An absolute must!
author: Stephanie L.

description:
After a scrumptious meal at Beretta, we decided to walk to Philz Coffee because we needed the exercise and some coffee to stave off our imminent food coma. 

I was a bit irked because we just stood there and between the 3 people behind the counter, 2 ignored us while one was chatting away in a personal conversation with the person in front of us.  We didn't know who was going to take our order so we went to the girl at the register who told us to order first with the guy...who was still chatting with the other patron.  Umm...okay?  Finally they wrapped up and we placed our orders and went back to cashier girl to pay.  Kind of roundabout if you ask me but whatevs.  

At this point, I thought to myself "This better be good coffee".  After waiting a while, we finally got our iced mojito and mocha tesora.

"OOH!" was my first impression, which then ultimately turned into thinking that the mojito was "just okaaayyyy" after a few more sips...even though the taste was at first refreshing, after a while, accidentally slurping up big chunks of whole mint leaves was kind of annoying.  Perhaps I wasn't too enamored with it because it was a bit cold outside that day and I probably would've been better off with a warm drink.

On the other hand, the mocha tesora hit the spot perfectly.  It's blend of dark chocolate and coffee which makes for a really beautifully bold, rich and smooth drink.  It puts Starbuck's mochas to shame.  Really.  

I'm a fan.
author: Laura S.

description: Better than Starbucks! The baristas can concoct excellent drinks to suit any taste!  It's great having someone concocting a unique coffee mixture just for you.  My cousin ordered the 'Tesora' but felt it was too earthy and not to her liking, she took it to the barista and he remixed it for her with a tad more cream and sugar . . . and 'voila' perfect drink!  My go to drink is the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee.  Sugar and caffeine high at the same time!
author: Carlo S.

description: The iced mint mojito will change your life!!! Delish but be prepared for it to be a super sweet drink.
author: KB A.

description: I would always come to this place! AMAZING coffee, AMAZING friendly staff, and never been given a bad cup of coffee. You're missin out if you haven't been here yet... Just don't expect any espresso drinks. It's straight coffee... with a few special touches...But it's THAT good...so who needs a fancy frappuccino?
author: Courtney M.

description: I risked missing my flight this morning for an iced Mint Mojito coffee. That's how much I came to love it. Got here right at 8 am when they opened on New Year's Day and there was already a line up. I like how each cup is made individually when you order, and it seems like a comfy neighbourhood hang out, unlike some other pretentious artisan coffee joints. A barista helped me mix and grind the blend used for the Mojito so I could bring a bag home and enjoy it all the way in Canada :) :) Thank you wonderful staff at the Mission location, you made my last day in San Fran memorable! Now I'm kind of ashamed my go-to coffee was Starbucks... But that's in the past now.
author: LL Cool J.

description:
Sure, this Philz location is a little grungier, but it matches the neighborhood.  It is nestled amidst plenty of bakery options or even burrito selections.  Like other Philz locations, the baristas are helpful and offer suggestions to newer customers and the coffee is great.

Got my first mocha tesora here, and will definitely be back for more!
author: Andrew M.

description:
This place serves up incredible coffee. That being said, it's coffee for a certain type of person. If you are uptight and specific about your cream and sugar needs, it might be better to go somewhere else that gives you room to do it yourself. The baristas are going to put your cream and sugar in there for you, so you'll have to specify how you like it. If it's your first time and you don't have any dietary issues, just suck it up and order your coffee the Philz way--with full-on heavy cream and sugar. The coffee is very, very strong and your drink will taste better with the added milky sweetness. 

By itself, the coffee can be a shock to the system. If you're not sure what kind of roast you like, stick with a medium (Tesora, Dancing Water) or just ask your barista for a recommendation. They are the most well-rounded blends on the menu. Lighter ones (Canopy of Heaven, Greater Alarm) have wayyyyy more caffeine, while the darker roasts (Turkish, Ether) are intense, bold and more bitter in flavor.

Tip #1: Don't get angry with your baristas if they start blabbing on about how the coffee is handcrafted in a way that will "blow your mind." You came to this hipster joint in the first place, and you asked for it. If you're nice to them, they will do whatever it takes to give you the best drink ever. 

My choice drinks: Mocha Tesora, Dancing Water, Philharmonic, Mint Mojito, Philz Hot Chocolate (tell them to add cinnamon!)

I don't recommend the Philz Chai. It's a lot more bitter than the usual flavor of chai tea and the spices don't mix in very well, so you get a nasty residue on the bottom, which is gross. Unless you're into that sort of thing.

Tip #2: If you bring your own mug, no matter the size, you will be charged for a small beverage. Also, avoid the bathroom if you can.
author: Rachel F.

description: I hear you Blake "My God". I was a bit overwhelmed as this was my first visit to Philz. The ambrosia coffee of the gods sounded interesting and I asked my personal barista what she thought. She agreed it was a good place to start. No steamed milk here, but she would whip the cream and add the sugar for me. As I picked up my drink she said to wait and try it to see if I liked it. Really? You care that much?  my god, heaven in sf.
author: Susangela M.

description:
Coffee is good!!! Although I would appreciate it more if a small cup of coffee is not 3.25! I know it's hand crafted and it's in San Francisco, but still ;p
Staff were friendly accept the one who served me seemed to be annoyed when I said I didn't know exactly what I wanted and all I knew was that I needed a dark roast.
The atmosphere there fits well into the neighborhood. I love the paintings on the wall, they are very "mission"!
author: Mel C.

description:
I love the laid-back yet gourmet feel here.  My drink of choice is the Silken Splendor with vanilla soy milk and light sugar.  The coffee is definitely stronger than Starbuck's so a small usually gives me the jitters if I drink it too quickly.

They really take extra care into making each and every cup of coffee.  I really appreciate that the baristas always have me taste my cup to see if I like it or want them to change something.  That's client service at its finest!
author: Jen Y.

description:
Best coffee in the city.... maybe in California too.  Yes, as far as I have tasted, its the best in California.  And please don't compare it to Blue Bottle.  They are so much more pretentious than Philz.

If I could, I would live in there and drink coffee all day.  But, a) they don't have a shower  b) I'd probably die.  Otherwise, I'd do it.  Maybe not.  But, I love the coffee either way.
author: J L.

description: I happened to mosey into this sweet location in the Misson and didn't want to leave, not because I almost got stuck in their bathroom (the lock is rickety... It was almost embarrassing, ladies you've been warned.) I was advised to try the Estatic, which is an amalgamation of all their drips with a tad of cream, sugar and ice, and I believe my mouth actually had an orgasm. I'm not kidding. Involuntary moaning. I now crave one daily and unfortunately don't have access as I'm working downtown (cough, cough Phil), and don't live in the general area of this little coffee gem. I will be back though, possibly tomorrow. Oh and they have wifi, which is rad and totally unhipster of them, thanks for that. Phil knows his shiz, and I'm a fan of it. Cheers!
author: Danielle L.

description:
Goodbye Starbucks. I have lived in the city for 2 yrs., and I have finally discovered Philz Coffee. I would jump in front of a MUNI bus for this coffee. The menu of the different types of beans available is huge. It would take at least a month of hardcore coffee drinking to get through the whole menu.
I really don't know how to explain it, but the coffee is well made kinda like your Grandma baking you a cake with love. There are no frapps or double whipped just straight coffee with cream or sugar of course making it the drink that has lasted for thousands of years.

I believe this is the first store in San Francisco due to the eclectic decorations, and location in the Mission area. The store although is slightly hidden so, you have to be a local to find it! The store is also by far the largest i have seen, but sadly did take a while to get my coffee which isn't a deal breaker in my book. The staff is always friendly at Philz, and willing to wait as you stare at the massive board. While you wait there is a TV on loop of new articles, and twitter feeds which is cool. If your a coffee drinker you need to stop at this store at least once.

If your looking for a cool local coffee shop that's not a cliché this is the place to be.
author: Nathan M.

description: I am a true believer in Philz coffee. Go there, wait in line. Get your coffee with cream and sugar "philz way" and see what you think. Don't get all particular about what you think you want or like, this is a recipe.
author: Luke H.

description: Starting with the positives, the Ether is amazing. Love it. But here's what I dislike-- they are totally in control. You have to wait to get your coffee, and then you aren't even allowed to put your own milk in it. Like they don't trust you or something. That's really annoying. I guess some people like the whole Philz attitude, but it's definitely not for me. I would rather get a bag of the Ether and make it at home for myself and add my own cream and not wait in line or like an hour for someone to make it for me.
author: Elizabeth R.

description:
Oh Philz, how I miss you.  Best coffee on the planet.  

I so wish you would come to Austin, you would really fit in, and I would get my fix!
author: Néia H.

description:
best coffee, best atmosphere, best owners, excellent staff, comfortable environ.  free wifi and power.  I am really going to miss Philz when I move to New York in May.  I will need to have them teach me to make my cup of Jacobs or Julie's Philz Way so I can order it online and try to make it myself.  

Philz Killz :)
author: dave b.

description:
I've Started spending my mornings at Philz, drinking coffee and enjoying free Wi-Fi.  This place is very cozy, but not in a crowded way, and the staff is very cool, and they take great care in their coffee... they always get it right.

Havent had a bad experience or bad cup of coffee here, and I ALWAYS bring my out of towners to check this place out...
author: Kevin O.

description:
Every morning, I wake up, go to my kitchen, make myself a personal hand-dripped cup of coffee, and it tastes just as good as Philz. I buy good grinds; nothing special; like Peet's or something.
This probably costs me like 50 cents. And I don't have to wait in a line that wraps around the block.
I don't know, I feel like the boy in the Emperor's New Clothes or something. Everyone raves about Philz, and I just don't see the charm of their *good* cup of coffee that costs almost 4 dollars. Am I missing something? I'm definitely willing to pay money for food, but I guess I feel that as a matter of principle a good cup of coffee in society should be around $2. Let's keep that reasonable folks. 

Furthermore the fact that I can't put my own cream and sugar in it is not helpful and kind of annoying:  "Um, I would like 2 teaspoons of sugar but not too full, kind of medium sized teaspoons. But, um, then again, can I see the size of the cup?...Oh, maybe 1 and a half teaspoons....um.. I'm sorry, a tad bit more actually this stuff's pretty strong...(all the while thinking to myself: "Oh f*** it! can I just put it in myself!!!?")
author: Ricardo C.

description:
Rude, rude, rude.

Let's be honest. I've been to Philz many times, but it wasn't until my last visit that I decided I wouldn't go back. 

The coffee is okay (really strong), and is priced in the moderate-to-cheap range, and I'm giving them one (1) star for the day-old pastries that sell for $1 (instead of buying a new one for $3.50). 

However, I have to say that some of the rudest people -- customers and workers-- are at Philz. 

You know what, it IS confusing to go in there. Another reviewer commented on the lack of line and the propensity for people to cut in front of you while you're standing around trying to figure out where to go.  And the decorations are tired, beat-up and just sad. 

The short-haired girl who works the bagel and pastry section is very abrupt and has had an attitude every time I've been there.  I have to bow and smile and say please and thank you to her just so she's not a complete bitch--- as if I should be thanking her for popping a bagel into a toaster and spreading a little cream cheese on it. Jeez. Like it's some huge chore. 

The girl working the register had the audacity, when I was going to pay, to ask me "do you KNOW about our espresso?" when I ordered one.  She also rather snottily asked if I had ever been to Philz, and if I knew about the "process". (Blerg)

And the workers facilitate a bad-tempered clientele. People hog couches and don't let you sit on them (even when it's only one person sitting down); the other customers are really grabby when it comes to claiming space on tables. 

Their "family style" sitting area would be nice if the other customers weren't so territorial about marking their space. Sometimes I feel like the pushy ones are about ready to pee on a chair just to make sure it's "theirs". 

Philz should make a policy that says "There are no reserved seats unless someone is physically sitting in them."  Just putting down your bag and disappearing for fifteen minutes shouldn't be okay.

But they probably won't change, considering the main clientele is hipstery Mission folk who view Philz as "their" local hangout. It's no wonder they were so rude to my mom, she's not in their "age range". 

I'm actually surprised that nobody has filed a complaint against them for agism or racism in hiring, considering that 90% of the employees are white young females, and the other 10% are white young men.

Bottom line: there are better, nicer places to spend your money. Go somewhere less crowded, less cramped, and with less attitude.
author: Lala B.

description:
As a passerby of this wonderful coffee shop on a work related weekly basis, I have enjoyed many of the assortment of coffee and teas that Phil has been brewing up for years. Phil has over thirty years in the biz and has six locations and growing. Philz keeps his beans mix a secret and does most of it himself to make sure his shops are putting out a perfect product.

My favorite at the moment is the Instanbul Treat, consisting of black tea, light cream, sugar and and a sprig of fresh mint.

Thanks Phil for your always inspiring conversation and wonderful caffeine treats. See you soon!
author: Dave S.

description:
My first trip to Philz I walked in and was amazed at the hustle and bustle that it attracted at 10:30 on a Monday morning. There were so many different types of people: hipsters in their skinny jeans, a group of firemen on their morning break and the quintessential techie running his office from a coffee shop.

I walked up to the bar and asked for a caramel mocha. The girl behind the counter laughed, in an endearing way, and asked if it was my first time. I admitted that it was and she went on to explain to me the way they do Turkish coffee drip, blah blah blah. I ended up getting a large mocha, which was $3.50 (much cheaper than Peets or Starbucks) and the girl, Ryan, had me taste it to make sure I liked it before she gave it to me.

So definitely a gold star for lovely staff, who refer to you as love, honey and darling, and gold star for super chill atmosphere and another gold star for the delicious coffee that was served at the perfect temperature - warm and drinkable right away.

They also have free Wi-fi that you don't need a password for.
author: Casey S.

description:
Out of all the Philz's that I've been to, this one is my favorite.  It's like an international hipster hang out.  Granted, the Mission is undergoing some serious gentrification, but this is the only Philz where you can engage in some conversations in espanol with totally random strangers.  I've met so many interesting people (who initiate conversations about the textbooks (ha!) I have my nose in) who have been really cool and positive influences in my random days.

Their Istanbul tea is the bomb, and sometimes they even have random treats like sambusas (which go really well with tea btw) for sale.  I enjoy the free wifi and comfy chairs, and how the place overall encourages  communication and the creation of community via the shared tables.  Thank you for being an awesome break/study spot for me to be able to chill in, in between my hours at la clinica and seeing patients.
author: Megha S.

description:
This place is freakin' awesome. Great people.
Philharmonic all the way baby.
author: Austin R.

description:
Hello. I love you. Won't you tell me your name.  

I'm hooked.  I can't drink any other coffee besides Philz.

Initially, I was a little peeved out with this location as I didn't get such welcoming and nice vibes.  Yet, I needed to find my new regular coffee shop and it was either going to be this one near work, or the one on Van Ness near home.  

So I did a test run for a few weeks and alternated between the two.  While I like them both, this one takes the lead.  It's more spacious, has that funky vibe I like and diverse crowd.  Now, perhaps because they've seen me more often, are always welcoming and I'm feeling the good vibez.  

A cup of Philz coffee is made just right and tastes like heaven.  It also gives me a good buzz all day long.  Nothing like a Philz buzz.
author: Michele O.

description: This is a twice a year excursion for us from the hinterlands of Northern California.  For the first time, Joral (not sure of the spelling) made me a cup of coffee that literally made me cry it was so good, a blend that he, and only he, appears to know.  Even if you aren't lucky enough to get him as your barista (he should be required to post his work hours on line), you'll be enchanted with every cup no matter what you try.  Never a disappointment, always magic in every blend, and the service never fails to be impeccable.
author: Heather A.

description: I've only been here once and I want to go back! I had a mocha and it was like liquid  speed or something. I was wired for the rest of the day while at work, yet found myself to be much more efficient than usual and I'm thanking the coffee for that. It was crazy. I wish we had one of these up here in Sonoma County, I would ditch Starbucks in a heart beat.
author: Licia L.

description: Great coffee and extremely friendly service.  The service bit is huge, because it's a full-service experience, and as a newbie I essentially had to fess up that I wasn't sure how to order.  The barista was helpful, super outgoing and cheerful, and made it clear that she really wanted me to love my coffee- which I did.
author: Melanie R.

description:
Philz Iced Coffee is just perfect when I am in the mood.  I have not been entirely satisfied with some of the other blends I have ordered, but I LOVE the excellent customer service!  The man said if I didn't like my drink he'd make me another of my choosing when I was unsure about trying something new, and that's exactly what he did!
For sure on the Pricey Side, but a good treat!
OHHHhhhh and I asked several Philz workers what type of cream they use, and I was told that it is a "secret"??  Does anyone know if that is true?
author: Mrs. Dawn H.

description: I love the mint mojito. I'm from out of town, so i don't go often but I must say that its always consistent.  The service is always great and the mint mojito is always delish!
author: Alyssa A.

description: I don't even drink coffee, and this place was awesome, friendly, tasty, and fast for service even when packed with a line out the door.
author: Philip B.

description: Philz is a great cup of coffee!  If you are willing to spend $3 for starbucks burnt coffee, bring your cash here and you will get great coffee and great service!  Although parking is a little difficult, they make your coffee to taste and each cup individually!
author: Andrea G.

description:
My introduction to Philz came right here. It's a small, cramped shop filled with hippies, basically a San Francisco stereotype come to life. No matter, I wanted some coffee. I put in my order for one of their dark roasts, and waited. And waited, and waited. Ten minutes later, my individually hand-brewed cup was ready to taste.

Dear God.

It is so good.

It's not even coffee anymore. It's like heavenly caffeine-infused nectar dripped into a cup as a sign from above that I am loved.

Thank you, Philz, for showing me what coffee can be. Also, damn you, Philz, for making it impossible for me to truly love the shit I brew at home.
author: Amy B.

description: coffee is great as usual . Location is fantastic. Got some character, a great place for community building. Very inviting, too. All the spots seem to encourage meeting people rather than stay glued in to your computer screen.
author: Gautam K.

description: It's great to finally discover this Philz Coffee location since this is the one closest to my workplace and, therefore, the most convenient, especially when on my way to or from some tasks outside the office.  I especially very much liked it the first time I visited here and was served by a cute young Asian lady that morning. =)  I think I only saw her once since then, and it was in the afternoon and she was on her way off from work. Too bad I haven't seen her since (mayve I'm missing her schedule). ;)
author: H K.

description:
Ok fine.  So the majority of the roasted beans are blends, which is what Phil is known for.  Ok fine.  So the weird names for each of their drinks tell you nothing about the growing region or varietal of the coffee used.  Ok fine.  They put mint and spices in some of their concoctions.

Despite it all, this place makes a damn good filter coffee.  Single serving brews on a manual drip, which are now ubiquitous around boutique coffee shops, are executed to perfection at Philz.  

This is not the place to go for espresso.  Just be warned.

Also... really friendly baristas at a snobby hipster coffee locale?  You don't say! This is quite a change from the tattooed butch women at Blue Bottle who rock the Justin Bieber hair cut and always glare at me with angry eyes as they make my (granted--excellent) macchiato.  You  never leave Philz feeling like a beaten puppy.
author: Gail S.

description:
I'm kind of a snob when it comes to coffee, after living in Italy for 4 months. This might possibly be the best coffee I've had in America. SO GOOD. I've heard about this place from friends, but this is my first time here. In fact, I'm writing this review using the free wifi in Philz Coffee right now. (Always a plus when there is free wifi and outlets for laptops.)

Being a newbie, the barrista helped me pick a blend that would suit my palate. There are tons of beans available -- a nice range from dark to light roasts. They brew each cup of coffee individually per order, so the flavors are nice and rich. They adjust your coffee for cream and sugar based on preference. The barrista had me taste it to make sure I liked it, before I went to pay. I also bought a chocolate croissant and it's like chocolate overload. This place is also extremely reasonably priced -- you'll definitely pay less than Starbucks (if you can even call that coffee). 

If I lived in the Mission, I'd be coming here all the time.
author: Charlene W.

description:
fave fave fave fave fave.

recently discovered the iced mint mojito with more coffee less cream. mmm.
author: Alvin D.

description:
Philz does coffee right.  Even as it spreads and turns into a chain, Philz still maintains it's high standards of brew.  I generally drink my coffee black, but Philz makes the sweet stuff good.  

Bring your own mug to Philz and get charged a small.
author: Eeway H.

description:
Mojito ice coffee...YUM!! Love that vibe in this raid back shop. Kinda out of the way but that makes the place gem.

I'm already getting itchy from not having that coffee in the morning!!
author: Tom I.

description:
Phill'er up, Philz! 

This was one of my favorite cafes in the City! Love love the iced coffee here. 

You've philled me up with your Philz goodness, baby.
author: Mika D.

description:
DRINK:
1.) Silken Splendor = Shoot, I believe this was the one they recommended and I so loved. I was looking for something chocolaty and sweet. And this tootally hit the spot.

SERVICE:
When I visited this Phillz, the workers here were ESPECIALLY helpful in describing and recommending something. (In comparison to the one in San Jose and SOMA) Order and pickup from counter.

ATMOSPHERE;
Smaller, cozier. Well, it is the Mission. Free wifi, I believe. See few on their laptops.
author: Angela L.

description:
I was going to say I am addicted to Philz, but the plain truth is I am addicted to coffee just like you are, but I've finally found coffee Nirvana right here in the Mission after more than twelve years of nobody telling me about this place. Damned good thing I decided to look at the internet one morning to determine who would open early so I could go get something the round out my long night.

Facing a blackboard full of unfamiliar coffee names was intimidating at first but a very nice barista offered to help me decide what to drink. I told her I like coffee you must eat with a fork, and she rewarded me with a cup of "Ether" with cream, served hot enough to be warming but not so mouth-scaldingly hot that I had to wait an hour for it to cool off before I could drink it without crying in pain. But better than that, it was almost indescribably rich and smooth and it gave me enough energy to stay up another six hours. This was the best cup of coffee I had ever had. Ever. 

I've been back a sufficient number of times since that I've completely lost count. It is a six-big-Mission-block walk to Philz from my house, but given what awaits at the end of the trek my feet fly me there in anticipation and then float away effortlessly after the recharge, all of me blissfully happy.

I don't know how I lived without Philz all those years before I knew they existed. And I don't know why everyone in the Mission doesn't immediately say "Philz!" when asked where to get a good cup of coffee. Ritual isn't even close with their machine-made boiling cups of bitterness. Save your delicate oral tissues and go to Philz, where the baristas stand behind hand-made wooden filter holders and pour pleasingly hot water by hand into whichever custom blend they have expertly recommended for you. It'll be worth whatever effort it takes to get to the "other" side of Mission Street.
author: Erik S.

description:
Wowa-wewa!

I've had drip, one-cup-at-a-time coffees, but this was something else.  Not only is the menu of coffee being brewed as diverse as a restaurant's, but the baristas have some kind of ancient art kung-fu-cream-and-sugar training where my "regular" amount was literally perfect.  And I don't even normally put ANY sugar in my coffee!  You can go light, you can go heavy, however you want your cream and sugar they have some kind of E.S.P. to get it perfect. 

The coffees themselves are varied to taste, with plenty of light, dark and medium options, as well as some special blends and a couple of decafs.   I had the ambrosia.. yum!

The line situation was a bit odd for a few people to handle (myself included). It doesn't start with the register, you have to walk around the benchesin the middle of the room to the far end of the counter.  There, baristas will holler out for when they have an opening at their one-cup-a-time dripping station.   No mechanical brewing here! My barista even had a wrist brace from her intensive water pouring.  After you order (your coffee, then how you would like it sweetened/creamed) you can side-step down to check out the vegan pastries and other offerings (and they all looked good) - or you could go next door afterwards and have a toothsome (love that word! I imagine my tooth filling up with something, not just my mouth) baked good like a meat-filled pie or creme-brulee tart (another review...)

Only downside to this amazing establishment? The decor reminded me, slightly, of a nasty college-era brouse with shabby furniture, pillaried rugs, weird hanging indoor spider plants *yuck* and basically a lot of 70's brown and yellow.  

Personally, I'd come for the coffee, leave because of the room, but some really were really digging the relaxed vibe and board games.  If I didn't think I was going to pull an moldy banana peel out from between the couch cushions I might agree.
author: Allison H.

description:
A couple of weeks ago, there was a SF Street Food Fair that brought me to 24th and Folsom. We wanted to grab a cup of coffee, so we trekked to the nearest coffee shop. How about this place, Philz? ok, sure.

My friend and I went in and let the barista know we were noobs. She suggested Jacob's Wonderbra blend since we liked dark roast (and yes to cream/sugar). One sip later of the smooth and rich coffee, we were both hooked and couldn't stop raving about "what a find" !!

I would have never tried Philz had it not been conveniently located by the SF Street Food Fair... and that would have been a shame.
author: Eva L.

description: Best coffee in San Francisco if you ask me. The Phil Harmonic is my go-to-cup. Great atmosphere and even better coffee. You can't beat it!
author: Ryan H.

description:
EEEwwwwww this place is so dirty.  Dirty couches, dirty floor and very dirty bathroom.  I feel like I'm going to catch something.  My friend told me "Pam, don't touch that, you might get sick".

I had a chai latte and in fairness it was the best chai I had ever had and at a very reasonable price.  But sad to say, I won't be coming back to this place.
author: Pam S.

description: If it is your 1st time at Philz get an iced mint mojito! #yumz
author: Jessica G.

description: I was there with friends last week. They have great services and serve the best coffee in the town!! I will definitely to try their every coffee on menu!
author: Chlloe C.

description:
Philz is quite an experience. The ordering process is odd in a 'hey, this isn't how cafés work!' way, but also in a 'this is how all cafés should do ordering!' way.

I usually get an iced mint mojito coffee, which is absolutely perfect, amazing, epic, and delicious. Add a vegan donut (I wish they always had these in stock) and I couldn't be happier.

Philz isn't the place you want to sit around though. While they do have tables, they're often full, the place is too hot, noisy, and crowded to sit down, and it's really more of an order and leave sort of place anyway. You can totally consume your donut and coffee before reaching the BART.
author: Tony G.

description: thank you Philz once again for correcting that disturbing situation where your barista was not as filtered as your coffee!
author: Tee D.

description: ok i totally get the hype of Philz now... not only is the staff at Mission super awesome and friendly but the coffee is good. I think its much better than Blue Bottle honestly. The lady that helped me was super patient and helped me make a decision. I got the Ecstatic Iced Coffee black. She was like try it first before adding anything. My friend got the Mint Mojito. OK OMG i know why there are like a bazillion reviews for that drink. it was delicious a bit sweet for my taste to drink an entire cup on my own but holy cow it was DELICIOUS. such a nice blend of mint which you can totally taste and sweetness...
author: Tao Tao W.

description: I've had coffee here a few times because my sister likes it. I just order a regular brew, not their concoctions, which I don't care for. I am not impressed. Their baristas don't know anything about coffee, even though they are supposedly trained. I asked if their coffee was fair-trade and the lady said, yes, all their coffee was fair trade. Turned out none of their blends are organic or fair trade - and she just doesn't know what fair-trade is (what rock has she been hiding under?) and lies. The next time I came in, there was a sign that said "text us your suggestions", so I texted them "please switch to fair-trade coffee, especially since you are a growing company". That was a year ago and nothing has changed. This place is all gimmick and no substance.
author: Unfriendly V.

description: Mint tea is made with fresh mint leaves, not tea bags or loose tea! Why don't they have mint tea like this in more places?
author: Amy D.

description: I ordered the mint mojito iced coffee. It was tasty, but there was way too much raw mint in it and not enough coffee.  Atmosphere was a little bit to try hard for me. You're not in Portland. Stop pretending like it.
author: Owen J.

description: People aren't lying. This is absolutely great coffee. For once, believe the hype.
author: Jesse C.

description: Drink the Excellerator Coffee and SLAM IT! GET HIGH! Best unique coffee drinks in town.
author: Miles G.

description:
Philz! Why have I not been coming here until this year? I feel like a dodo brain. Yes I love Blue Bottle and have been loyal to them for so long. Yes the ambiance of BBC is more appealing to me. The vibe I get from Philz just from walking outside reminds me of the sort of coffee shop in Friends. It looks very 90's and hippie ish. Perhaps that was the turn off for me that the interior was so unappealing. So what?! Why did I not come in here sooner and believe the hype!!! The interior might not be the best but their coffee certainly is.

Philz is the best way to wake up in the morning. My favorite for when you  didn't get a good nites sleep or need a pick me up is  the greater alarm. (fFrst one I tried not realizing til later that it's named after firefighters to keep them awake. it did just that to me and cracked me out for a good 6 hours straight and was awesome) For just a great cup of coffee ambrosia of god. For more savory: Jacob's Wonderbar or Tesora. I love that they put cream and sugar in the coffee for you. I hate the clusterfuck of a line that isn't caused by the Philz staff but is from the customers who are clueless. For a good wakeup and pick me up Philz is the spot. I love that they're individually dripped and prepared for you and love that most of the beans are cheaper than BBC. I also like that they accept cards and aren't cash only.
author: Kristy H.

description: Philz is awesome. Gigantic menu of all sorts of coffees organized by roast and flavor, super friendly baristas, and really chill atmosphere. AND the coffee is INCREDIBLE. I would definitely come back the next time I'm in the city
author: Fassio E.

description:
What they say is true....Philz coffee is all that and a bag of chips. I had the Iced Mint Mojito Coffee and my whole body felt invigorated. Life doesn't get any better riding around in my bicycle on a radiant day, stopping into Philz, then acting as  a walking billboard as I stroll down 24th street to buy some produce. That's the life of a SF native. At $4.50 though, it's a once in awhile treat for me. I still turn to blue bottle more frequently to be cost effective. 

You can always tell who has never been to this location, they are usually the people looking like deer in headlights not knowing where to go. Cashier first? They just stand there and delay everything. Do us all a favor, order your drink from one of the 3 baristas then go pay for your drink. This is not a fast food joint so don't expect to be in and out in 20 seconds. They treat the coffee with respect and put love into it so just chill out people!
author: Leslie L.

description:
I don't know what they put in these coffee, but dude... I am so addicted. 

JACOB is definitely my top favorite thus far. Estatic ice coffee is so fragrance as well and everything else is also good.  Although I have to admit, I'm just not a big fan of the Mocha Tesora & Soooo Good. 


I do think its a bit pricey tho, but definitely worth it! Just can't afford it every single day.
author: Anna W.

description:
ABSOLUTELY AMAZING.

I'm not a coffee drinker. Coffee is definitely not in my regular regime. Whenever I go to Starbucks, it's a soy hot chocolate or Chai tea latte for me. I had had a sip of Clara's iced coffee before, and remembered how incredibly awesome it was, so I was happy to come here with a couple of friends after church one Sunday to grab a cup of Joe.

Since I don't drink coffee, I don't bother myself with the latest news of coffee shops or remember who does what with which philosophy or whatever. But I immediately noticed that they brewed each cup individually, which, I think, is the key to their success. I don't know much about coffee, but that was a HECKA good cup of coffee. It was just so fresh, and you could taste the flavor of each bean in every sip you take. I've never been able to actually TASTE what coffee is supposed to taste like until that day. Even with ice and tons of cream, it was absolutely perfect: mellow, slightly bitter, rich and earthy. 

I tried my friends' coffee, too. One was called Soooo Good, and it was indeed SOOOO GOOD. I forgot what the other one was, but it was absolutely excellent.

This coffee has made me into a coffee lover. Now I can absolutely understand why people drink this stuff everyday (beside the fact that it helps them wake up in the morning). I now understand why people wait 30 minutes in the drive thru of a Starbucks every morning. If there was a Philz coffee next to my work, I'd be drinking that stuff twice a day! Philz, just take my paycheck!
author: Becky K.

description: fun atmostphere!! The turkish blend is delicious and the staff here is stellar. Thanks Philz!
author: M C.

description: The hype about Philz is totally true.  I ordered an iced coffee on a beautiful spring day, and it was delicious.  The sprig of mint was a nice touch that totally complemented the drink -- a great combo.  I lived in Austin for 5 years, and the environment of this place very much reminded me of my former beloved city.
author: Mel G.

description: It's all about service. Yes, Philz has outrageously good coffee, but the care they take in creating your beverage is what makes each visit reliably wonderful.
author: Shoshi S.

description: One of my go to spots when I am visiting SF I love their {MINT MOJITO ICE COFFEE} so delicious. I've also tried the {ICED GINGER SNAP} but I am definitely sticking with my {MINT MOJITO} next time!
author: Jennifer C.

description:
There is a definite vibe at Philz, those who love it frequent it religiously, they know their drinks and know the drill. And trust me, there is a drill. 

On first take, Philz can seem a bit daunting, with a menu of blend selections as there is almost no variety in how the drip cups are prepared. It seems that you are learning a new language when trying to ask for a simple cup of drip coffee. Well, there's your first mistake, this is no simple cup o' Joe. 

Each cup is lovingly ground only once it's ordered. The baristas knock out up to seven cups of fresh hand-crafted cups at a time. Don't take it likely, it's a task - I used to be one of them, I know. 

I'm not a drip gal, love my espresso, but I do love this drip. It's crazy potent, strong as sin, intense, and ultimately flavorful. So good, ask for the cream and medium sweet. It'll hit ya just right.
author: Kelly S.

description:
OK, I have to admit that I was on the receiving end of a bit of coffee edumacation. You'd think that after all of my coffee shop reviews that I'd know everything about the subject, alas, there is much for me to learn.

PHILZ! Your blends are flippin' delicious! I didn't know the flavors in coffee could be so nuanced AND so disparate. Dancing Water tastes completely different from Ether which tastes completely different from Greater Alarm, which I'm sure will all taste different from all the rest of your fantastic blends and roasts. I'm hooked!

I usually stick to americanos, so now all I want to do is pull a delicious shot of espresso from your cleverly named concoctions - I don't care if they were meant for shots or not. YEEHAW!

Oh, and BEST BAGELS IN TOWN... Just throwin' that out there.
author: Dan W.

description: Warm, friendly, and tasty! This place has a  wonderful customer service a comfy vibe along with an array of personalities on any given day.
author: Michelle C.

description:
Great, friendly customer service. I got the mint iced tea which came with fresh mint that was pulled from the little pot on the counter. 

They have an interesting system there where you order your drink to the right and on the left side you pay. Seems a bit honor system like especially during rush hours.

We wanted to gab however the seats upstairs where everyone was sitting was like a library! hahaha
author: Victoria Y.

description:
I'm not really a coffee person, but I was crazy tired from a long weekend SF and my friend told me this place hand brews every cup so I had to come here.

The place is full of hipsters and lots of lounging area.  Unfortunately they were all taken with ppl reading on their ipads & nooks.  Typical  SF joint.

The menu had LOTS of different types of coffee, I had no idea what to get so I got the one said that said "mocha" next to it.  My friend got some ambrosia one but they both equally tasted delicious.  If I was a true coffee drinking I"m sure this place would have been awsome!  If i'm tired and I need a cup of joe i'll drop by again!
author: Alan W.

description: My first and only time there is ordered my usual coffee with 2 shots of espresso but I was left speechless when I was told that they don't have espresso. The barista did offer me their darkest roast and told me that I would love it. SHE WAS RIGHT! I was served a large ether roast with is really dark and bold. I loved it and purchased a bag of beans. They took of the cost of the cup of coffee because when you but a bad if coffee they throw in a free cup. I will be back.
author: Ramin P.

description: This is some damn strong ass coffee!! Not playing around it will hit you if you are not a regular coffee drinker. Very fragrant and has a lot of depth, not starbucks to say the least. Check it out!!
author: Dang L.

description:
The coffee is great, but the service is poor - there are so many other great local and friendly coffee places in SF.  We checked online to see if Philz was open at 6:30 am and we called the day before to confirm - indeed.  When we got there at 6:30 am, there were employees in the store, but the doors were locked, and it was raining outside.  A number of people were waiting.  A young man came from outside and opened the door, but locked it right behind him.  We asked if we could come inside, just to wait, since it was past 6:30 and he said, no, that they were short staffed and also having to spend time to train a new employee.  We counted 5 people inside, and it was pouring rain outside.  We asked if we could just wait inside since they were open, and he said no.
