description: Me and the gf decided to venture out to a new coffee place.  I kept hearing about Phillz Coffee place, so we decided to venture out to Mission to check it out.  I know the price of coffee is a high there, but it's well worth it once in a while for this coffee.  I had the It'z the Best, coffee was made individually.  They add cream and sugar for you, my gf wanted just hot chocolate, they even asked her how sweet she wanted it.  Of course she said VERY sweet.  We both enjoyed our beverages there, it was a good experience.  Coffee was smooooooth.  Everyone should try that place at least once.
author: Peter L.

description: BEST coffee!! The Mocha Tesora is off the chains!! The staff is super friendly. It's nice how they make the coffee right in front of you and won't let you leave without trying it first, to make sure it is to your liking. I make sure to pick up a few bags of coffee for Christmas gifts for my family back home, so they can be jealous of the delicious coffee I get to drink all year long.
author: Tiffany C.

description: I've fallen in love!!!  Best coffee I've ever tried.  Fresh, smooth, & tasty at it's best.  So far I've had  the Tesora, Canopy of Heaven & Mint Mojito (iced) I'm on a mission to try every coffee off of the menu.  You won't miss the fact that they don't have "syurp", trust me you wouldn't miss it.
author: Stacy L.

description: If you have read anything else by me, you know I am a full on coffee snob. Snob Snob Snob.  I reluctantly went to Philz at a friend's insistence.  I will definitely be back.  Truly amazing coffee.
author: Jan D.

description:
Psst...a hint on ordering: Don't be fooled by their fancy shmancy names.  Just ask for a mocha and let the good folks do their job.

(Only catch with the mocha is, it gets a little chalky at the bottom.)
author: Athena ..

description: The flies in the bathroom are gross and the internet has been iffy the past few weeks.
author: John A.

description:
I've been getting coffee here several times a week for a long time now. A few comments:

* The heavy manufacturing cream and gigantic pile of sugar in each cup do nothing but help. Mmmmmmmm.

* I do like some aspects of the owner's style, including his friendliness, humor, and willingness to deal with whoever comes in the door. 

At the same time, my understanding from talking to and observing the folks that work there, not to mention the high employee turnover, is that he's not exactly a good boss. I know several people that have quit because he pays poorly and is tempermental as hell, the kinds of things you don't normally know about a business from simploy patronizing it. 

This might not be a reason to not get coffee here, but it's something consider. Always good to promote good business practices and responsible small business owners.

* The atmosphere? Grungy, but good. Lots of plants in the summer, most for sale and another example of the myriad business dealings the owner seems to get into. If you've got it for sale and he thinks he can make a few dollars off of it, he'll probably let you sell it here.

* One time, a city DPT employee rolled in, waltzed to the fridge to grab a drink, then checked out without paying, saying hello and goodbye to Phil. The deals people strike...

Anyway, I like it, but there's lots of good coffee out there.
author: Ian M.

description: this is only a 4 star review because I have only really been able to find one coffee here I love. say it with me - large Turkish with cream,  medium sweet. one at a time, indeed!
author: Holly C.

description: What can I say about philz well lets just say starbucks and peets lost a customer for sure! yesterday I tried my first coffee from philz and belive me I was blown away not even an I.E.D could have rocked me like philz especially the coffee guy hands down SEMPERFI! you have a customer for life now!
author: Dvs M.

description: Their coffee is what made me start drinking coffee! Its all about the way they make it. the beans are ground right when you order it, then they brew it for you, and even pour it from cup to cup to give it air and foam. The best cup of coffee in town.
author: Tim R.

description: I'm not your everyday coffee drinker, but when I'm craving a cup, Philz is a great place.  The staff are helpful and the service is great.  My favorite is the Filtered Soul blend.
author: Ricky M.

description: Best coffee in the city. Though at time, it all depends on the hands of the barista. I like the ice coffee, tesoro, canopy of heaven and the jacob. Once, Phil was behind the barista, which almost never happens, so I decided to order from him the most expensive coffee in the shop -- Jamaican blue mountain coffee. It is bitter and was disappointing. It was one of the worst coffee I've ever had, and no amount of sugar and cream and ice can do justice to that awesome bitter taste. OMG It was horrible! The coffee bean must be old, or it was just a off day. I do not know, but that cup definitely did not cost $7. Let's just say that I will only stick to the regular familiar taste: iced coffee, tesoro, canopy and jacob.
author: Helen L.

description:
would it be weird to choose a neighborhood to live in solely based on the proximity of philz coffee? 
don't make me answer that question.
philz to me is a decadent destination coffee mecca, not just a caffeine source or place to grab-n-go or hang out or whatever.
i have met phil and he is a demi-god.
their baristas are all friendly, well spoken, disheveled magicians.
any roast with cardamom is a must-sip.

PS to anyone who says philz is too expensive, the craftsmanship and effort that goes into one of their perfectly brewed drip coffees is the same if not more than the tasteless swill you call a starbucks latte so go crawl back under whatever hypocritical rock you came from and don't rain acidic grounds on my rich and smooth bodied parade. hmph.
author: Lisa M.

description: Truly unique coffee experience. They brew each cup one at a time once you "pick out" a barista. They help recommend a blend for you based on your tastes. The dark roast I had was very tasty. The staff is super enthusiastic, which is fun (not quite overdone!). Only suggestion I can make: the pastry selection could use more healthy/low-fat options. They offer soy and fat-free milk, so the pastries should follow suit! :) In all honesty, I will definitely be back.
author: Anne A.

description: My new hangout.  Each cup is made exclusively for you and it is delicious.  ..Ether and Tantalizing Turkish with a hint of cardamon are superb. Also tried the Mocha Tesora which is a dark roast coffee with a bit of chocolate and sugar added.  They ask you how sweet you would like it to be.  On a cold afternoon it hits the spot. Cushy sofas cradle you as you sip. The music makes you want to dance around the room.  Oh, by the way, Rory is not Phil...
author: Bleep S.

description: Okay, I have to say that for the most part, coffee is coffee to me. Is it brown, caffeinated, warm and not too strong/weak? Okay, I'll drink it. That being said, my fiance fancies himself somewhat of a gourmand and always wants to eat *nice* food and drink *nice* coffee and whatnot when he's here. So, we walked by Philz and he practically dragged me in. I had the silken splendor (or some such) and have to say that it was by far, the best cup of joe I've had in awhile! Just sweet enough, but, still nutty and tangy. Not scalding, not cold. A cute dog also licked my hand when we were in there, so plus for that too!
author: Jessica R.

description: Philz is like dessert in a cup.  They mix crazy flavors in with their coffee or tea.  I wouldn't get coffee here every day.  It's more of a novelty drink.
author: Blake S.

description:
i've been hearing about philz forever and ever about how it's the OTHER best coffee place in the city (the other being blue bottle), but until last week i'd never set foot on one. i seemed to never be in proximity to one, but i was FINALLY in the area for an interview, so i stopped in afterward.

i was soooo lost upon first walking in. i stared up at the menu board and said "HUH?!" the girl behind the counter took one look at my confused expression and took charge. she asked me what kind of roast i liked (medium), and suggested the tesoro, and since i had no idea what any of the other brews were, went with that. 

i tend to always get lattes and other frou frou-y beverages at coffee shops, so i wasn't really sure what to expect since all philz serves is drip coffee. but it was DELICIOUS. i love that it's individually customized and they ask you exactly how you like your coffee brewed, and how much cream and sugar you want in it. my tesora was brewed to perfection and i was super pleased.

i still have a soft spot for blue bottle, but you better bet that i'll be coming into philz more often (especially since it's a little bit cheaper!). i am defenitely a fan!
author: Caroline I.

description:
I have spoiled my taste for other coffee. 
This place has the best roving furniture, jungle of greenery, and biosterous owner (between naps on the couch.)
The evesdropping is superb and the folks there are good-natured and cozy.
author: Mer S.

description:
I dream of you, Philz. 

Please help me. Is there anything that even comes close in DC???? I can't live without you!
author: Lena T.

description:
What the heck is with the leaky cups here?? Seriously - every time I order my favorite coffee (Julie's Ultimate) it leaks out the lip.

At first I thought it was me - you know, can't put the lid on right. Then it leaked again - then I thought I picked the wrong lid for the size coffee cup I had (they have black lids and white lids). Then it happened again. So I took to wrapping a napkin around my cup every time - always managing to 'forget' the cups leak on me each time I go -- only remembering the wonderful coffee goodness I'm about to get...

Now I just saw the review about the cups by Cat S. I am relieved to hear it's not just me! 

Bottom line: Philz: you make GREAT coffee. I would visit every day if it were on my way into work. But seriously - invest in some new cups. Next time, I might just bring you my dry cleaning bill.
author: Juls P.

description: I walked in 10 min before close on a Sunday night. I ordered a small mocha dark roast coffee. I payed $3. The people behind the counter were very nice, helpful and I'll def be back.
author: Jessica R.

description: Decent coffee, but I can't figure out what about it makes it so expensive. First, I'll admit off the bat that I tend not to like places where hipsters gather.. why dress like a homeless person and own a smart phone at the same time? This place plays off of this- why look like a shack and charge so much for coffee? I liked the coffee, though I can see how a lot of people wouldn't- it's very strong and contrary to the descriptions of their roasts, it's bitter. To be fair, I may like other Philz locations more since a few of my gripes about this place is the ambiance. However, I wouldn't come back here for slightly above average coffee that costs me an arm and a leg.
author: Michelle P.

description: Simple, Sweet, Satisfactory~ I think that sums it up for people that want to go to coffee shop
author: Liz T.

description:
This is the best coffee that I have ever tasted and now I'm hooked! Each cup is custom made and there are so many different types of coffee.  My favorite is Dancing Waters- they are all good I know because I let my co-worker order the different types and I taste hers. 
My favorite location is the 24th and Folsom, when we stop for coffee it is such a happy and positive experience. The staff is so sweet, I just love Marilyn she is the cashier but to me she is my friend.  As for Phil -ladies watch out he is the sweetest person that you will ever met, so remember when you stop at Phil's be ready to leave your regular coffee joint. 

Philz will take you away from Starbucks or Blue Bottle guaranteed. 

Tip: Bring your own mug and you get a 50 cents discount. This location is dog friendly, so on the way to doggie day care bring in the 4 legged family members. 
 
I just tried the new Van Ness location and the coffee is just as good but I still prefer the 24th St.location since I get to run into Phil and occasionally he makes my coffee- I don't know what he does to it but it is out of this WORLD.
author: Debra V.

description: Love the coffee.  Some of the best I've ever had.  Great people behind the counter.  Phil is a character.  But the coffee...its awesome
author: Poem G.

description: Philz is my favorite place for coffee in the Mission and San Francisco. Canopy of Heaven is like crack-coffee. Yes I've had Ritual, Blue Bottle, etc., etc. but Philz makes my Canopy of Heaven  in a laid back atmosphere where I can chat, read, lounge and actually ENJOY my crack-coffee fix.
author: Lisa K.

description: Blue Bottle it is not. Maybe I just don't get it. $2.50 for a small coffee? And it tastes like...coffee? At least the staff was nice. And they do have a crazy menu of coffees, but it just didn't feel special or taste particularly good to me. I'll try it again. Maybe someone can recommend something good here, but I'm not going to regularly shell out that dough on hit or miss experimentation.
author: Zac H.

description:
Best Coffee Ive ever had.
You can tell how mush time phil put into picking out the beans. 
Every cup is made personally for you. Ive had so many different types of Coffee its insane, and im sure most americans today have had their share of corporate chains, etc. When you try a cup of Philz you will then know what real coffee is So deep and bold, and have you ever noticed that coffee do sent really do it for you in the morning not even an expresso, it just becomes part of your day, i never drink Mountain Dew but i had a sip one day and it was doing more for me than my daily coffee's. 

I suggest the Mocha Tesora, it will keep you going all day. Add a sprig of mint that hey have growing right there and your good to go. The price is amazing i cant even imagine how much some upscale joint would charge for a hand dripped cup of coffee, try having one every day shit i feel like cost rican royalty or something. I also heard he has opened a few other locations so its a phenomenon, i know that they were selling fedora's like philz with the logo in the inside last year so it must be.
I love phil and his amazing coffee. thanks
author: Emily F.

description:
ah
Philz!
They have pink frosted vegan donuts.
I have a secret crush (well not secret anymore) on that cute strawberry blond with the glasses that works there.
Bah they own me pretty much. I live two blocks from here and its an addiction. Prices are fair. Really cool atmosphere not too hipstery . I like that big jar of science experiment on the table.
author: cole s.

description:
I taught down at the bottom of the hill from this place and I stumbled in because I needed coffee.  I had NO idea what to order and this guy ahead of me ordered a Turkish.  I hate looking like I don't know what I'm doing so I ordered that.  My first sip was a punch in the mouth of strong flavor.  But oh man... that small cup of coffee I drank got me through an entire day of teaching first graders.  I normally have to chug a Redbull at about noon, but after drinking this I was set. 

The people are nice, and the coffee is great :)
Oh here's  tip if you are running late like I always was.  After you order your coffee get in line to pay.  By the time you pay your coffee will be ready and you will be set to go.
author: Alicia M.

description:
My favorite coffee is "Tesora" from Philz Coffee...just amazing, and that's all I have to say.
The place well...Mission style...sometimes too messy and messy just how people on the MIssion like it. 
a Bohemian cool place, I don't mind it but some people from other parts would not like to sit there.
author: Geena T.

description:
Brilliantly strong and addictive. 

There is so much to choose from, but I like the dark roast, as they tend to make me less insane after.
author: Adam L.

description: I don't always drink coffee, but when I do, I prefer Philz Coffee. Good morning my friends!
author: Abraham E.

description:
The best coffee in San Francisco for about $3.  I usually get the Arabic, sometimes the Turkish.  I almost always order with soy milk and no sugar.  But you have to at least let them add cream and sugar without further instruction at least once.  It is decadent and rich - just a bit much for me to do everyday.  They have many other drinks I've yet to try.  

Their coffee at their Castro location is just as good - but a different atmosphere.  The original Mission Philz has more random furniture, more room, more people riding bikes.

I think the folks who don't like this coffee or say it tastes strange are just people who have been drinking too much corporate coffee - or maybe they're too used to double caramel lattes with extra foam - or something.
author: Carlos V.

description:
A friend of mine raved about about this place that had great Turkish coffee, and no doubt she was right.
I went from being a coffee drinker to a tea drinker, and now back to coffee once I ordered a small cup of the "Greater Alarm".   In an instant after the first sip of this unique blend my taste bud's were definitely tantalized.  The added mint leaf gives it an added treat after every sip.  You don't feel as though you have that icky "coffee breath" .  

"Here's to you Phil" 
thenerdygirl
author: Nerdy G.

description:
I can always depend on a tasty cup of coffee (Tessora with cream and sugar) without a long wait or a hassle. The employees are also medium to pleasant and Phil is always in a great mood. The decor is not for me (mission/hippie), but I always get it to go. I also haven't had the baked goods, only the coffee.

Worth the trip for a great standard coffee fix in cadillac style.

Disclaimer: I am not a coffee snob, although I have tried and enjoyed coffee all over the city from Ritual to Blue Bottle. I just like a nice warm beverage with caffiene early in the morning.
author: Matt B.

description:
Sheeat, I need a map cuz I always get lost,
On my way to Philz, he's the muthaeffin coffee boss,

Sheeat, it don't matter what kind ya order,
One cup at a time, pour it and I sorta,

Want another one just as soon as I finish, 
Mint leaf in the bottom mmmm, I recommend this,

Philz no joke he even helped my friend out, 
Now thats the kind of joint that I'm talkin about.
author: Johannes H.

description:
Try the vegan donuts! Also, the baristas are very helpful and kind.
Philz is a haven in the ghetto-- a great place to ppl watch, read, chill...
author: Shauna B.

description:
I like Philz because I don't like to fuck around with coffee. No steamed milk, no flavored syrups, no half-caf soy nonsense. Just some coffee, in a cup.  Maybe a little cream and sugar if you're feeling frisky. Unless it's fall and the pumpkin spice latte is back, and then only if your dad is a teacher and is virtually smothered in Starbucks gift cards from co-workers and he gives them all to you and you're like well fuck what am I gonna get? Pumpkin spice latte I guess, but then you make sure to conceal this fact from your friends and when they ask for a sip of your hot beverage you  have to tell them you think you're coming down with something...

But none of this is an issue at Philz. There's just lots and lots of coffee, and when you think about the fact that they brew each cup when you order it, paying a little extra is well worth it.

I like the Philtered Soul.
author: Deborah H.

description: BEST coffee ever!!!! Their Chai and other non coffee options are fabulous too! They focus on local, delicious and creative bakeries even offering vegan and gluten free options. Their first Mission location is so cozy and original. I absolutely love every second I spend in there. I have had some of my best conversations and personal epiphanies in their space.  Thank you Philz, I don't know what I would do without you.
author: Aliza R.

description: Wow, great coffee.  I'm kicking myself for not going here sooner.  I just told the girl at the counter what type of coffee I wanted and she made me the Soooo Good blend.  it's really smooth (once you put a lot of sugar in it) and the mint on top of it is awesome as well.  I like my coffee black and sweet and this is just perfect.  Really cool place and had lots of room to open your laptop up with free wireless as well!   I need to go back more and get more Philz crack coffee!
author: Mitch A.

description: The people there could be a bit nicer, but the coffee is so great. It was my first time there today, and I didn't know that you specified the type of beans when you ordered. The Barista was sort of rude and treated me like an idiot for not knowing.
author: Kelsey C.

description: Exceptional coffee that's made to order. Great service! A little expensive. Small cup of coffee will run you close to $3-$4.
author: crystal e.

description: even though the line is out the door sometimes (like it was this morning), i'll still wait in it.  but only for philz.  those magic coffee creators behind the counter make things move quickly and at the end of it, you get a delicious cup of coffee.
author: Lauren P.

description: Best coffee on the planet.  Philz coffee is so good it's not fair to other coffee.  Beware, if you come here, you will not be able to drink other coffee.  Or at least not enjoy it nearly as much.  It's just too good.  Love Philz.  Great staff too.  I Heart Philz
author: Sean H.

description:
I wish Phil would open a location next to my house so I could have excellent coffee every day. Not only do they brew your cup individually for you, they grind the beans for your cup of coffee. Even Alton Brown would approve.

In addition to the many house blends, the barristas will custom blend coffee for you. (My boyfriend's favorite is a combination of Red Sea and Timor, once recommended by a barrista.) The Philharmonic is yummy right off the shelf. Unlike the coffee at some places, Philz' coffee does not require milk or sugar to make it drinkable, and if it is added it can detract from the coffee. This does mean that the mocha leaves something to be desired, in particular, less mochaness. I'm usually a fan of the mocha but Philz coffee deserves to not be drowned by chocolate.

The barristas add cardamom and fresh mint by default to some blends, so if you don't like these, tell the barrista to leave them out. The people who complained about some strange spice in the coffee mean the cardamom, which is used when making Turkish coffee.

But the real gem at Philz is no surprise-- Blue Mountain. I was having a really bad day once and I went to Philz and had the Blue Mountain-- I was immediately invincible. It is more expensive (I think it was $6, or $1/inch). It is the most exquisite cup of coffee that I have ever had. It can not be described or believed; you'll just have to treat yourself and see.

Another gem is Phil himself. He's adorable. Plus they stock The Onion!
author: Jen L.

description:
The best way to start your day, and end it!
This is the real boost full of antioxidants and yumminess. My favorite, Philtered Soul. ah! :-D I say that I come, from east bay, into the city for coffee, then I stay for work. Enjoy!.
author: Laura F.

description:
When I want real coffee with flavor and I've got the time, this is where I go. Probably one of the funkiest coffee shops this side of the known universe. The lounge area looks like a vintage furniture shop. They even have internet access terminals, like right out of 1997 or something...
I knock off one star because the staff can't seem to get it together enough to deal with the bewildered crowd of Sunday strollers that inevitably descend on the place, unable to make sense out of either the coffee menu or the "one cup at a time" system. They need to hire the soup nazi to deal with crowd control.
author: Warren F.

description: The ambiance is great, the staff is great, the drinks are great and this place makes me wish I lived closer to San Francisco.
author: Samantha M.

description: I love Philz.  It is decorated like a living room.  The coffee is strong and the music is usually good.  I would give it 4 stars because it is crowded sometimes, but I can't.  The coffee is just too good.
author: Teresa K.

description: Philz is pretty incredible. The fact that they can move through that many people and do pour over coffee for every single one of them is to say the least, impressive.
author: Carlie D.

description: I don't understand the raving about this place.  Coffee is mediocre.  Decor and layout leave lots to be desired.  Real pity - with the park across the street they really dropped the ball on the potential for the location.
author: G O.

description: Best tea around.  Get the turkish treat, or turkish delight, I forget the name.  Ask for it the house way, you will not be disappointed.  They have great muffins, and friendly staff too
author: Trevor W.

description:
Writing a positive review for philz feels like throwing a stone into the ocean.  Everything has been said in much more eloquent and clever of fashion YET I feel obliged.  
Since I've moved to the city, I've been totally wrapped up in nutritional healing, detox, etc.  After going on a series of nutritional adventures...I found myself at the dark door of the legendary, bohemian (thanks Random Rick) Philz Coffee.  Although I'm totally skipping the foreplay and heading straight to orgasm, I've never realized that coffee could be so complex and flavorful.  That dark haired, cocky but nice man in the hat has take something that has existed since my early childhood and turned it into art.  Art in my mouth and soul.  Thank you Phil!  
Oh, I took off one star because the place feels sooo dirty and sometimes it creeps me out.  Let in the light!  Ah....I just remembered that you have live music. Alright, that extra star is back on.  Good work. You've got me.
author: Eri J.

description:
Poorly laid out and
Exquisitely overpriced.
Can't help but love it.
author: Alana D.

description: please excuse my curtness, but this location, the original, is just simply superb!  Friendly staff, idyllic neighborhood , unlimited WiFi, savory treats and possibly the best coffee in The City. Yes, it's pricey but oh so worth it. Jacob's Brew.....ahhh! The rest are just imitators, this particular location just serves impeccable, wholesome coffee with a smile. Not enough modifiers in the lexicon the accurately depict the awesomeness of this place.
author: A H.

description: Not only was the coffee great, the barista was exceptionally helpful and eager to make sure the coffee was "just as I liked it." I can't imagine anything better.
author: Peter C.

description: I haven't been to the actual location, but I love their coffee when I buy the whole beans at Whole Foods.  Great brew!
author: Carolyn D.

description:
So good if you have self control. I could probably get coffee there everyday on my way to work... but have to fight the urge to have a $4 cup of coffee 5 days a week. 
The selection is incredible.  It's single serve drip, so it's brewed for you when you order it- so it's not sitting on a hot plate for hours before you get it.
The staff is really upbeat and friendly- even in the morning which I find makes this place even more amazing... and not in the pushy, perky, squeeky get the hell away before i toss the coffee you just made me back at you its too early for this way.
author: Marie M.

description: This is my favorite coffee house in San Francisco.  The varieties of coffee they will make for you at your whim is absolutely stunning.  I prefer the dark roasts.  But sometimes I go for the Mocha Tesora which is almost like a hot cocoa coffee.  The staff are very friendly and will adjust the brew to your desired sweetness and even ask you after the masterpiece is delivered whether it satisfies your tastes!  I've never had to turn a brew back, but it seems to be an option.  I've tried the other locations but prefer this one because they have very luxurious couches.  (I remember when cafes used to strive to be comfortable.  Now many use hard seats to wear out your bum seemingly to keep the customer churn up.)  Here, there are ample slouchy couches, paintings all over the walls and ceiling, tasteful non-intrusive music playing and even plants!  Of course this wonderful ambiance means that the place is almost always crowded.  But that ensures that they thrive and will stay, so I'm happy.  They even give iPhone apps for you to track the coffee blends you've tried and your rating of each one for future reference.
author: Christopher A.

description:
about an hour ago i ordered a large #1(turkish blend) topped with cardamom and mint.

a half hour ago i sunk into a familial yet hypnotic state of conciousness where art made sense, history had no meaning and life as we know it became precious again if only for a mere moment in time.

or perhaps i'm just rambling...  that would make sense as i now feel like i just inhaled some of the highest grade blow known to man.

this shit is powerful.  RAWR!!!
author: Karen K.

description: Best coffee ever.  After they make your fresh brewed cup, they ask you to taste it to make sure it's to your liking.  Might not be the place for your run of the mill Starbucks-er, but the rest of us certainly appreciate it.
author: Laura S.

description:
the problem I generally have with coffee places is that they're all the same. they have a brew, its fresh or not. you like it or not.  but they're not essential. I can make fresh coffee at home with the beans I like, end of story. but this coffee shop is special and I will happily trek out for coffee on its behalf.

its perfect-- options and options of different varieties of brewed coffee that they proceed to freshly brew by the cup. The mocha bean actually has some sort of chocolate in it and tastes of cocoa.

cozy chairs and tables and good natural light.

then I get a vegan blueberry donut and dip. this is a sugar/caffeine lovers dream.
author: Liz S.

description: Yummmmmm! Their coffee is so delicious......I'm a fan of the Arabic Coffee w/ fresh mint :)
author: Aura O.

description:
I walked into Philz today and I had to do a double take.  Did I just walk into my own living room?  The mismatched chairs?  The "I just pulled my furniture off of the street" furniture?  The semblance of a frat house?  Whoa...trip out for a second...have a seat, and try to regain your sense of reality Lauren...this is NOT your living room.

OK...now that I'm back in reality, I guess its time to get what i came for.  I walked up to the counter, and after the barista asked if she could help, I told her id never been there before, so she jumped at the chance to tell me what to get.  I put my coffee order in her hands, and had the Tesora, with added cream and brown sugar.  She then asked if I wanted mint, and I said "Do i have a choice?  I told you to do what you wanted to my drink...so just go ahead and do it!!"  they brew their own coffee, and I don't know how I can say that I like Starbucks as much as I do after coming here.  Its got that personalized, awesome quality, non corporate chain feel to it. Holy shit...this coffee is divine.  Driptastic. Delicate. Detailed. Delectable.  Delicious.  Desquishious.  Lastly...its Dangerous, because I'll be back, to sit in the comfort of my own living room, drinking a fantastic cup of coffee....probably more often than i should.
author: Lauren F.

description: Philz coffee is terrible!  I have no idea what these people are talking about.  I've tried it three times, and every time I couldn't drink more than a couple of sips because it was disgusting.  Seriously, the first two times I thought must be some weird exception because I heard good things about Philz.  But I'm done.  I love coffee and I am willing to spend 2 1/2 bucks a cup if it is really good.  But this coffee is not worth 2 1/2 cents.
author: John D.

description: I had to bump them up to five full stars because of the excellent quality of their product. Yesterday I stopped in for a large coffee but it was one of those days when one cup is not enough. At work I brewed a fresh pot of quality coffee, I won't name the brand. I put my own heavy cream in like they do at Philz and while it was miles above typical office coffee it was crap by comparison.
author: Manny F.

description: I go here everyday. I used to go here somewhat regularly and I was like "oh this place is rather good, I like their mochas oh yah." Now I try their coffee and I am damn surprised by how much I am able to like plain coffee. So then I realized this place may be crowded, but it's worth it. I started doing work in there and I actually find that it's easy to be productive. The soft chairs make me sit still for longer than at other places. The coffee folk are nice too, though some do make their drinks better than others. Either way it's still good. Right now I'm holding myself off from going there yet again today. 1 time a day...1 time a day...I keep telling myself, hopefully I'll listen.
author: Alexandra M.

description: I can't figure out what it is about Philz. I don't drink coffee. I don't live in the Mission. And Philz is never REALLY on my way to where I want to go; but there is something about Philz that always beckons me in. The  much loved "Phil" and his family seem to have created such a loving and warm environment in this coffee gem of a place, that it's easy to see why people love to wander into Philz and hang around. Quickly becoming regulars - and taking their coffee regular - with a sprinkle of organic sugar. The outside of Philz is adorned with plants and benches, and almost stands out as an oasis - among the other shops near it. And they really do mean it - with their 'simple - understood , yet understated' mantra of welcoming everyone and anyone inside their place - a tough act to achieve in the Mission. And the coffee----- I swear I don't drink coffee -  - but when I've decided that I need a quick  caffeine pick-me up - Philz rocks.. Each cup brewed fresh and with a refreshing bout of great conversation. And it really is perfect. Fresh, sweet, and strong. The way coffee was meant to be drunk. The waking up cheesy 'Folgers' kind of coffee. The - ''if it was a perfect world' and those  Folgers' coffee drinking, overly dramatic  love-birds stopped playing games and really ended up together'  kind.
author: Jessica T.

description: Great coffee. Bit crowded but good environment for getting work done.
author: V R.

description: I am a serious coffee drinker and this is seriously amazing coffee. Let the pretty girls make it for you and once you get too jittery and need to come down from the cream and sugar and cardamom, get a sambusa.  The original is certainly the best.
author: Maria D.

description: It was Day Of The Dead and we loved our coffee to death. Freshly ground bitter strong (was Ambrosia sweet) Coffee God. My. This is real.
author: M Y.

description: It has been over 3 hours since I drank a cup from Philz and my heart is still beating really fast. Wow... what a great cup of coffee. Bought myself a bag of beans and am ready to continue fueling my coffee addiction. Woooohoooooo!!!!
author: Teresa Y.

description: Being a virgin coffee drinker, I needed a delicate touch to make my first coffee experience memorable . That happened at Philz... I thought the presentation, taste, and happy staff at philz really made it happen for me. I had a coffee that was served w/ heavy cream and mint leaves, seemed like I was on food-tv. It was pretty freaking good, and I highly recommend it if you want your heart to race in the morning!
author: Michael S.

description:
Sometimes Phil walks in and throws free soy bars at all the customers and it distracts me from my chess game.

That's the only negative thing I could think of to say. Other than that it's perfect. Just don't order a latte you idiot.
author: Will O.

description:
i happened to be in the neighborhood on sat afternoon and saw philz on the corner.  i had read all about it on yelp before but had never been.  i was w/ a friend who has been drinking philz coffee for ages, so i insisted that we stop by.  each cup is made to order w/ TLC.  i ordered the ice coffee and was asked whether i wanted it sweet, medium, or not too sweet.  then i was asked if i wanted cream, and i think they only use half and half here (you can ask for soy as well).  they top it all off w/ some mint leaves, and i swear, the coffee is like crack.  one sip, and you will keep wanting to go back for more.  my friend had the iced mocha tesora, and it was sooo good.  

the counter service is VERY friendly and helpful.

update 7/15:  i came here again the other morning and got the jacobs wonderbar, which was really good.  it's a dark roast w/ a hint of chocolate.  i didn't add sugar this time, and they actually have nonfat milk too.  they ran out of mint leaves that morning tho.  :(
author: Helen T.

description: I'm not a coffee drink (the honey is, which is why we went) but the chai tea was divine!! Probably the best I've ever had. So if you're heading to Philz and there are non-coffee drinkers, tell them not to worry, they have delicious tea too. I also love the funky vibe but agree with another yelper, what's up with all the macheads? We were surrounded by them. Oh well....
author: Jenn E.

description:
I am a tree and coffee is my sun.  I am a fish and coffee is the ocean.  I am Macaroni and coffee is Cheese.

Philz Coffee is bewilderingly delicious.  Try the dark, dark roast Ether with sugar.  Don't ruin the gaping black maw of your coffee cup with milk.  Let it taunt you with its taste and caffeine for the long drive in traffic to LA.
author: Aaron W.

description:
LOVED IT! 
loved the music, loved the vibe, loved the slow- i dont care attitude. loved the we dont have a line we just ask whos next, dont complain, we are just making you the most perfect cup of coffee kinda paitence of the workers and the crowd, loved the dishelved counters and chairs the old computers and the experiment plant. loved the food the scone and the sambosa loved the church pew, but most of all i LOVED THE DELICIOUS HALF TON OF CHOCOLATE in my mocha- my friend describe it as - you know that chunk of chocolate at the bottom of a drumstick that you just cant wait to get to? that is what my whole cup tastes like....
what did i have to say about my mocha?
"i want to make love to mine...and then cuddle with my mint leaves at the end." 

yah...its really that good.
author: laurie g.

description:
Oh, my home away from home.  I am a sadly predictable regular who is a cowboy in the laptop rodeo here on the weekends.  There's a funky, comfy vibe with cool folks behind the counter who sling the best coffee in the city.  I'm pretty sure it's responsible for at least one-half of a grade point and any graduate school acceptances I might receive next year.

Stay gold, Ponyboy.  Stay gold.
author: James N.

description: The latte was too strong for my tastebuds... And I drank it after having the best ice cream ever.  I liked looking at the motley crue of characters/hipsters.
author: Anu Y.

description: Never tasted coffee like this.  The drip coffee has way more flavor then espresso.  Watch  out it is supper strong, not for the light weight.  I drank a small and was so buzzed I ran two stop signs, got out of the car and had the unbearable urge to defecate.  Being in SF there were no public restrooms.
author: Ryan S.

description: Really nice guy, really nice place.  Love the coffee, love the mint, very friendly vibe.
author: Laurel B.

description: Deserving of all the accolades, stars, high-fives, great yelp reviews, etc.  This coffee is THE best I've ever had. No burnt beans, no strong aftertaste, no coffee breath, no need to go anywhere else. It's all right here. The ambrosia coffee (lightly sweetened) was uuuuunbelievably rich AND porcelain-smooth and may yet be my new vice. I don't have many--i'm pretty boring like that. The place itself is very laidback-chic and conducive to hanging around for your next fix, er--cup.
author: Chris C.

description: amazing place to stay, chill, drink good coffee. one of my favourite places in town.
author: Joe G.

description:
not impressed.  my friend was instructed to "sip his coffee like fine wine" and on my turn i asked about the coffees (seeing as phiz fave or steve's pick" wasn't the best description in the world) and i was told "coffee is like gas it's the same everywhere you go".  pretty much telling me, "all we do here are blends, b/c we're too cheap to invest in good quality coffee that shines in its own light".  phil gave me on of his own, which wasn't bad, but wasn't AMAZING.  to me just another hipsters paradise, wait san francisco hipster paradise. 

sf hipsters all congregate in the same places, which pretty much nullifies being a hipster.  i would avoid it, and get a quality cup at tartine or the coffee and tea leaf.  and some advice to phil coffee is NOT like gas, but even so, i put 92 in my tank.
author: Kate R.

description: Ok.  I'm no coffee aficionado...  but Philz coffee is like liquid crack.   I almost punched a random hipster when I saw I was about to pay $3 for a small cup of coffee... but after the first sip I was seriously contemplating how my junk would look in skinny jeans.   This stuff is beyond coffee.
author: Scott W.

description: For my first time ever, I ordered Philz' famous house blend (with cream and sugar- medium sweet) and with just one sip... I did a "mmm mmm." Yup this is very good coffee. Though $3 for a large is a bit pricey for the average coffee drinker, Philz is worth a visit for your taste buds. Voted the best by SF Weekly. But you can judge for yourself.
author: Leroid D.

description: Mocha Tesora is my favorite drink. ever. It's rich and creamy and has just the right amount of chocolate flavor.
author: Josie A.

description: I can't understand what anyone who loves coffee doesn't love about this place.  I am forced to assume that perhaps they didn't indicate their preferences for darker or lighter roasts or stronger or weaker coffees.  Or maybe they don't realize there's mint in it and that throws them off.  I guess I'm just baffled that someone who enjoys coffee wouldn't love Philz.  I've never found Phil himself to be creepy, either - he just asks me a lot, "How do you like our coffee?"  To which I always respond, "I love it!"  Philz makes the best mocha I've ever had.  Start your day off with this coffee and nothing else will be this good all day long.
author: Eclipse T.

description: VEGAN DONUTS! Enough said. These are the same donuts that other places around town carry. I'm not a fan of coffee AT ALL. I kind of hate coffee. Knowing that, their coffee was decent. The coffee menu was kind of confusing for someone who just orders lattes. Nice atmosphere. I'll be back here soon.
author: Philip R.

description:
just revel in the experience; the atmosphere, the knowledgeable staff, people watching, the Fedora story, and lets not forget the god damn coffee
they prepare each cup individually and mix in milk/ sugar if you want it
i had the 'coffee off the gods' and while it was a bit 'mellow/ smooth' for me, it was really tasty and i felt the kick after 20 mins
not been to the one in Castro, but this place is great
author: david s.

description: I'm from NYC where the coffee is great, and I can honestly say Philz was one of the best cups of coffee I have ever had.  My wife had the Turkish and I had the Arabic.  I couldn't believe how great it was.  I dig the vibe, and Phil was there (I'm not sure if he always is or not) and is super friendly to his customers.  He makes a pleasant experience for all.  I will visit Philz everytime I go back to San Fran.
author: Kurtis P.

description:
The drip coffee at this cafe taste fresh and is super aromatic. Felt like I was being rushed out of the cafe by the employees but it was overall a good experience 
 They tend to place a lot of cream and sugar in the coffee so if that's not your thing be sure to mention it.
author: Whitney K.

description:
some guy brought me here on the morning after a date and it made me want to have his babies for showing me this joint. phil is so nice, sometimes he gives me free baklava. i swear everytime i am here there is different furniture, firemen chilling outside and oh did i mention good ass coffee? my life is a quest to find the perfect chocolate croissant and coffee. the pair- tartine. but for just the killer coffee- philz is it. they will walk you through the crazy menu..i dig the mocha tesora and the phil so good. try em all, mix it up. i find new faves all the time.

i am ok that i didnt stay with the guy, b.c he gave me philz. good stuff.
author: kelly M.

description: Wow. She put mint leaves in my cup of ambrosia blend. Delicious. Believe the hype y'all. Just wish they had some sandwiches or something savory to snack on.
author: Farah S.

description: Let's bike to Philz and get an Arabian or Turkish with mint and cardamom, play some chess, listen to the piano & bass duo tinkle some Thelonious, and buy a $5 plant from the nice man. Look, it's that guy with the little green parrots! That little girl has the cutest pink and orange dress with pink polka-dot tights! There goes sketchy Phil flirting in his fedora. Oh, my knees are shaking from that crazy coffee. So good but I'll be on the fritz for the rest o' the day...
author: Katrina D.

description: best coffee in the city, hands down. as good as it gets. a bit overwhelming your first time, but the folks there are nice (most of the time) and extremely knowledgeable, let them know how you like to drink your coffee and they'll take it from there.
author: Laxme G.

description: I do not have enough tattoos to frequent Philz.  Nor do I have cool enough hair.  Or a dog.  But this is not going to stop me.  Holy Mother of God, that is some good effing coffee.  Also:  THEY HAVE SEATS.  So you can sit and enjoy your delicious cup of liquid love.  You can even play chess!  I'm going to start looking into tattoos...
author: Samantha W.

description: Hands down the best coffee ever.  I never order off their menu--instead I give the employees a (jokingly) hard time and ask them to give me the coffee I describe to them.  For the most part, people know their stuff super well there, and I always get top-notch customized service with a laid back attitude.  I love this place--if only they were in the East Bay!
author: James D.

description: Look, I'm not a big coffee connoisseur - I can't tell a coffee bean from a kidney bean - but this coffee is damn good! It has body and ain't "dirty water" as the Europeans call our American coffee. And they have a new location over in Mission-Dolores.
author: Peter S.

description:
honestly...i don't go to philz enough...i used to go there a lot when it was gateway liquors, just getting off the ground as a coffee shop.  

i remember i was trying to quit smoking (that one day) and after having my first sip of philz coffee, i had to buy a pack of cigarettes and smoke...it's like sex and i just want more...

oh yeeeesssss!

i don't normally go for cream (and sugar), but if you're lucky enough to have phil make it for you, let him have his way (with your coffee).
author: shannon s.

description:
Despite living within walking distance, I usually just walked right past this place, but one day i was seeking out a different sort of coffee place and read the sign about coffee being made one cup at a time. So I thought why not? I believe I had the turkish blend with cream and sugar and I liked it. Plus that small cup kept me going all night (had some project that was due the next day). I liked that the coffee had cardamom and mint, at first it didn't seem that those two aromatics would go but they did. I guess with Philz coffee, the reactions are really mixed up, so it really is a matter of preference. But I personally prefer philz to ritual coffee roasters, it's laid back, and inviting. Good thing to note, for those of you that like to control the amount of cream and sugar, you could just order it black. Phil has a condiment counter with cream and sugar, right by two already made, ready to go coffee filled thermoses. And if you're into soy you could also get your coffee with soy milk instead.

*******UPDATE*******
So I come to Philz after not having his coffee for months (I was on a tight budget which meant i could not afford Philz)  and I ordered my usual stand by, the turkish brew. The employees were not the usual faces I remember seeing, but they were just as nice. But I have to say the coffee didn't taste the way I remembered it did, I am still recovering from the aftertaste. This made me wonder if the experience of Philz coffee is dependent on who is working the counter that day. I won't dock off a star for this experience because it's still a pleasant neighborhood store and I don't think that this is likely to happen everytime I go there.
author: X marks the spot ..

description: Not only can Phil serve you up a fresh steamy cup-o-joe with a freshly plucked mint leaf, he is also more than happy to provide advice and council on a myriad of subjects.  From love advice to ego boosting (mmmhmmm, Phil thinks I'm pretty, and that's enough for me), to where to get the best  hookah tobacco (Phil 'knows a guy').  Waiting for my bff to get off the clock the night me and my bf broke up, just counting the seconds until I could drink my sorrows away, Phil, upon hearing that we were gonna spend loads of cash on booze, insisted that we let him buy us a bottle and we could hash it out, right then an there.  Awww, Phil, I love that you don't discourage my drinking, you just discourage the spending of money on drinking.
author: Emily X.

description: this is the best coffee in sf, makes all other chain coffee places taste like sh!t
author: L L.

description: Did I mention earlier that Phil is the man? Well he is, and I just learned today that he is opening a new Philz at Cedar and Shattuck in Berkeley.
author: Nick H.

description: Well, consider me a convert.  I had a cup of their "ether," and it certainly made a positive impression on me.  Philz isn't cheap, but if you want to treat yourself to a nice, quality cup o' Joe, then look no further.  Warning: their dark roasts are strong!
author: Anthony T.

description:
If you love creamy, sugary coffee, Philz will be your go-to.  The coffee itself has interesting spiced blends and whatnot, but I tried it without sugar one time, with soy instead of cream another time, and it falls pretty average.  The cream is the secret.  And I hate to break it to a lot of people, but cream isn't coffee.  Minus one star.  

I guess what I haven't said is yes, the coffee (with cream and sugar) is the jam.
author: Arlo J.

description:
yes, it's very expensive. $3 for a cup of coffee? $2.50 for tea? how could it possibly be worth it?

well, it is. i can't explain it to you, you must go and try for yourself. 

tell phil its your first time, and he'll give you a show (mission location only)

try the: tesora, mocha tesora, turkish coffee (not for the faint of heart!), turkish tea, black tea with cardamom, cranberry rosemary bread.
author: Suzanne S.

description: By FAR, without a doubt, THE BEST COFFEE in the Bay Area and maybe all of the U.S. Not gonna lie, I have lived all over and have tried a million cafes and different kinds of coffee. Blue Bottle, Ritual, Peet's, Coffee Bean etc.Not one place compares to Philz... I am forever hooked on the Soooooo Good...it is my opium :)
author: Rabia K.

description:
I confess that I'm a coffee aficando, and Philz Coffee definitely passed the taste.  It's not a surprise that this neighborhood coffee shop is packed with unemployed hipsters.  It's in a trendy area and definitely hipster haven.  

The service is excellent and the Jacob is inarguably a hit.  The coffee is a bit overpriced at $3.00 and the shop is far from the BART station, but I think it's worth trying if you're in the area.
author: R C.

description: A colleague from work brought me here and.. WOW.. drinking coffee will never be the same! I've watched the brewmasters at Peets stir the hot water and coffee grounds while dozing off in their typically LONG lines in the morning and never thought about taking the same process and applying to an individual cup. If you've got the time (avg brew takes about 7 minutes) it's well worth the wait!
author: Paul H.

description: I didn't even like coffee prior to coming here; more of an espresso person.  But this coffee is amazing.  Every blend I've tried has been great but each in it's own special way.
author: Sandra W.

description: the first time I had Philz, I hated it.  I hate mint.  I hate mint-presumptions.  my friends kept telling me how great it was so I went back b/c I live 2 blocks away.  and yeah, it is really great.  I'm sorry I made a Philzsucks-presumption.  I guess we're square.
author: aleks k.

description:
This is one of my occasional Pre-SFGH work treats...some afternoons I really need a kick to tolerate the vast challenges and craze at General.  Phliz is a blend (no pun intended) of personalities....bubblies, hermits, familiar neighborhood peeps....
The coffee is fantastic, but the board could be overwhelming if you have no clue what to get or what the hell they all are....just ask..the servers here are really nice and excellent at their job.  If you a research kind of person, look at their website for the deets on the blends
They do the cream and sugar, so give them your requests, they're very good at following what your needs are, so don't stress.
I've been enjoying the Philharmonic with a little sugar and vanilla soy.  Medium roasted and great spice essence of cardamom. 
Takes some time to drip, so for those in a frantic rush, don't be, some of the finest things in life take some time, relax and enjoy the experience
author: ERICA E.

description: Ok, so I've been going to the location in Mt. View regularly and they deserve a better rating.  Workers are socially competent and vaguely entertaining, coffee is spectacular, and the store itself is clean and hipster-free.  5 stars for the Mt. View location.
author: Riya K.

description: Plain and simple, the best coffee I've had in the city. Be warned, though, the coffee AND the experience are highly addicting. Once you've had the heavy cream, brown sugar, and touch of mint, it's tough to go back to the boring old Peet's or Starbuck's. The staff is wonderful - generous with recommendations (e.g. almond croissant) and their 'secret' blends. The only thing holding me back from stopping there every morning on my way to work is the calorie intake from the cream!
author: Susan L.

description: Back in the day you had to ask Phil to come out and make you a cup of coffee, when he was a health food store.  Business wasn't so good, but the coffee was stellar, and he was chock full of anecdotal wisdom and advice.  Now, motherfucker is diversified!  Rad.
author: Nick D.

description: $3 for an effing small cup of effing coffee!!!?!! wtf. that ish is like crack mang. cant quit it. just cant. great service
author: Jessica M.

description: I've been coming to philz for a couple years now and still love it.  Not only is the coffee unique and delicious, but the staff are always so friendly and helpful. I've never been greeted by anything but a smile from the person making my coffee.  This store in particular has a great atmosphere.  The only problem is that sometimes it's a little hard to find a place to sit because it's so popular.
author: Jonathan G.

description:
i have such happy fond warm fuzzy feelings about  philz.  jacob made me the most fantastic iced hot chocolate last weekend.  it was so good!!!!!!

i dig the coffee too.  i generally dislike starbucks coffee.  it's too acidic for my tender belly.  philz has coffee specialists who can help you match a coffee to your taste and tummy.

i love the mint tea with cream and honey.  i love the art.  i love that they participate in MAPP.  i love the music.  i love phil and the entire crew at philz.  they make my weekend (and sometimes my weekday).

UPDATE:  The service is pretty inconsistent.  If it's the old timers, then you're in great hands.  Steer clear of the newbies.  They're not properly trained and it gets frustrating when you have your heart set on Philz goodness and get something else instead.
author: Melissa Y.

description: Phil sees coffee as religion and it shows in the cups that he and his staff hand pour every day. Best cup I've had in San francisco hands-down.
author: Bman B.

description: Why, you might ask, What is the only thing more reviving than the yelp stick and the answer is: Philz coffee.  And Phil, is real a person, an awesome man, and the food boy, nevr asked for his name, I forgot, oh so sweet, and my bagel special, so good, his mom's...and the coffee IS TO DIE FOR.  If you have not experienced this yet than you are missing out.  Dogs can come right on in...WOO HOO...so cute charming and perfect, perfect holiday gift would be some coffee, a bag of that coffee..yummy:)
author: Tamara M.

description:
i'm very picky when it comes to a cup of coffee. i've been to many coffee shops in the city and so far philz coffee is the best in my book. it is a great place to get a nice, strong cup of coffee. if one pour isn't strong enough for you, then ask them to double pour it. that's how i drink my coffee (tesora or philhamonic double pour) philz has 25+ blends so i'm sure you can find the one you like. the place can get busy in the morning, but it's worth the wait. the staff are friendly.

tip: if you bring your own mug, they will charge you for a small instead of large.
author: oranuj k.

description: Unique coffees, very tasty and strong. Totally friendly people working there, and none of that foofy starbucks shyt. I'm a fan !!
author: Dave S.

description: Wow, that was super yummy!  #4 with cream & sugar met my desire for a latte.
author: Megan G.

description: The tasty spiced sweet coffee here will probably never rise to the Pantheon of uber chic gourmet Ritual or Blue, but it's hard not to love coming here.  I like the endearing menu and all of the choices, even though I've still only made it through three or four of the options (I'm stuck on the Jacob's Wonderbar right now).   The day I found out the 18th St.  store closed was one of my darkest.
author: Brandon B.

description:
Phil'z has got me drinking brewed coffee again - that's how good it is.  This place brings coffee to a new level.  Great blends and a staff that will help you find the right one to suit your tastebuds.

This place is the real, "community in a cup" ;  meet great people, eclectic music (miss the live music on the weekends), regulars and fun baristas that know how to brew the perfect cup.
author: Peter R.

description: Forget about the coffee and try the Chai tea!  The best chai you will ever have.  Philz green tea is great too!
author: stephanie ..

description: Wow. I looooove the mojito, and the cute and friendly staff. No 'tude, just taste!  My new found place to go for a treat and a pick-me up, always in the largest size available, please!
author: Ms. Q.

description: Only the best coffee I've ever had in my mouth. Philz is a good way to start, end or middle a day.
author: Constance C.

description: How does this place not have a 5 Star rating every time? Crack with mint and friendly people to make it for you...what more do you want?
author: Josh C.

description: Philz is one of the main reasons I get up in the morning.  Sometimes it's the only reason.  Luckily I live nearby so I don't have to travel far for my coffee needs - even if I did, I would still go out of my way for Philz.  Phil is sweet and has huge plants with tiny lights, couches, paintings and curtains all over the place.  Sometimes there's a guy who plays the piano or a group of people who do some kind of jazz thing, I think.  It's homey, lived in, comfortable.  That's the other reason I come here - I can comfortably watch the world go by, smoke and have a cup of coffee at the same time.
author: Pirate M.

description: The world's best coffee.  My secret order (not for the pregnant, breastfeeding, feeble-minded, or faint of heart):  half Sumatra Light, half Peru Light, sugar, extra cream, cardamom, and no mint.
author: Adam Z.

description: THIS PLACE IS AWESOME THE COFFEE IS SO EFFING GOOD!!!! Now, I normally do not drink coffee, but a friend of mine told me to check it out. They brew their coffee on the spot right when it is ordered and its in a pour over form. I had the Canopy of Heaven, the flavor was smooth there was no acidic after taste. They even put in cream and sugar if you want it and they add the right amount so it doesn't over power the coffee. I love this place and I'll be checking out their Van Ness store more often since I live out there. Rather than busing across town. That first cup on 24th is definitely worth it :D
author: Christopher T.

description: I was never a fan of drip coffee until yesterday.
author: Another U.

description: Gourmet coffee without the pretentiousness.  I absolutely love their Mocha Tesora!
author: Keika L.

description:
I used to manage an espresso bar ages ago, and we roasted our own beans. I consider myself fairly expert in all matters java. And I have had coffee all over the city, all the time. So it is not lightly that I say Philz is some of the very best. Fresh beans and people who know what to do with them. Assuming a place is using premium-grade arabica beans, the flavor mainly comes down to roasting, blending, and preparation. Beans should be roasted the week you drink them - ideally within a few days of roasting. As soon as beans are roasted, they start to lose flavor, plain and simple. This is why Starbucks sucks (coffee trucked in from who-knows-where, roasted who-knows-when, prepared by clueless barristas on automatic machines.) It's why Pete's is fairly acceptable (yes they are a chain, but a local chain that delivers fresh beans several times a week - and the barristas tend to know their craft and product.)
So any way - Philz: the fresh mint was a nice touch - though they should ask. If you don't like mint, it's going to permeate the flavor. I ordered a cappuccino the first time. Their steamer was broken - so I got a latte. Excellent lat, but you would think a coffee place would have a backup steaming solution, no? The second trip I had two of their brewed variatals - yummy! By the way, the cup-at-a-time is not a gimmick. That's the ideal way to prepare coffee - it also starts to lose flavor as soon as it's brewed. If you're not serving a lot at once - it does suffer slightly being kept in a thermos warmer. This is why experts will usually use a press-pot or simply mix some boiling water with grounds for professional tastings. They had some Mexican pastries on offer: good almond croissant-type things. Unfortunately, they were not in a case, but just open on a counter . . . including open to flies. Make sure to grab one from the bottom box. So these little things spare me from the 5-star rating.
Philz is cheaper and has about 500% less hipster attitude than somewhere like Ritual. A great choice for coffee in the Mission. Grab a latte from Philz on Saturday morning, then walk down the street to Taqueria Puerto Vallerarta for some sidewalk tacos. Heaven! And a perfect SF brunch for about $7 instead of $17.
author: David C.

description: I heart you Philz. The way I wake up dreaming of you and feel the need to scramble out of bed and take the half hour walk to finally reach you just so that I can moan ecstaticy after taking my first sip. mmm.. I am salivating just writing about it. Ok ok. I had to have my moment but seriously if that doesn't have you wanting to go get their coffee right now then I simply don't know what will. Besides the coffee, service is friendly and excellent, you can buy a fedora if you find your in the need, you can cozy up on a couch with a book or challenge someone to chess. How I love thee Philz. You are one of the reasons I can now never leave San Francisco.
author: Eryn L.

description: As if this place needed to be rated more...I'll throw my two cents in. My first time in the mission I stumbled upon this place. Love the ambiance. The different flavored coffee beans to choose from blew my mind. The freshest, tastiest mocha that my lips have ever touched. At first sip I felt guilty...like I was committing a carnal sin it was soo gooood...
author: Stevonne R.

description: My first time was recently, at Outside Lands, and I was immediately hooked.  Amazing.  I mean, they do it all to order.  If they could get away with it, I think they would grow, harvest & roast the beans to order.  As it is, they grind & brew after you ask for it.  Oh, and they do it up for you...if you want cream, sugar, whatever, tell 'em, they have a special touch.  The mint is next level.  You might think you don't want it, but you do.  Don't be in a rush if you're stopping here, coffee like this takes time.  Starbucks this is not.  And that is a very, very good thing.
author: Emily T.

description: Best place to get a black tea!! And coffee of course. This place is always packed and everyone working there is supper nice
author: Lizeth M.

description: I love this place! Come here all the time, vegan donuts from  Peoples donut, and a decaf sumatra. Word.
author: Brian S.

description: Delicious coffee...worth the price-y-ness. The mocha one is like dessert. And Phil is cool. He even let me use the cash register to make my own change because I was late for work and the place was hoppin'.
author: Alissa R.

description: If you don't know about this great little coffe house you are missing out on some fantastic neighborhood joe.  Situated a little out of the way, but worth the four blocks off of mission or so.  A large assortment of of brews to choose from and friendly service to boot.
author: brian m.

description: ambience convivial, pastries decent, service adequate, chai terrible, bathroom revolting.
author: Madeline W.

description: Not a huge fan of hipster grunge-chic, but the coffee drinks are both unique and top quality. A pinch of cardamom in the Philharmonic transforms a great cup.
author: Crissy G.

description: If I'm not at work or gym, I'm there!  Not only do I love their coffee, I love the atmosphere, the friendliness of all their staff.  To top that off, they're dog-friendly!
author: Helen C.

description: I must admit, at first I was dubious whether or not Philz coffee would truly be as good as everyone seemed to think.  I finally wandered in to shell out the $3.00 for a large cup of Ambrosia.  The guy behind the counter asked if I wanted milk and sugar ...and to top it off some fresh mint.  I tried the whole shebang...and quite frankly...was wowed.  What a fantastic cup of coffee.  I will definitely be back and I recommend that everyone try it.
author: Steve B.

description:
Imagine standing alone at a party, you have a plastic cup half full of an overly sweet mixed drink. Your not happy with it, but sipping it because you don't want to look like your just standing there alone, doing nothing. Then an amazingly attractive girl comes out of nowhere and starts talking to you, being super friendly and genuine and all around super cool. Struck with awe and confusion as your brain falls out of the back of your head and your mouth fills with marbles as you attempt to drum up a response while trying to figure out what the hell is going on. 

This is what it is like getting coffee at Phil'z. I remember being so utterly flabbergasted that the person behind the counter wasn't a.) treating me like a pain in the ass, or b.) completing immersed in work gossip and your run of the mill behind the counter social scene. I was hypnotized by their friendliness, 'yeah, mint leaves sound good. Whatever you say... yeah I like chai. Der duh babble babble' 

Even if the coffee tasted like butt I would still come back to this place based on the cool people and atmosphere alone. My friend correctly described it as 'much like a furniture store', cluttered like grand ma's house if it were in Cuba. As luck would have it, the coffee does not taste like butt, it's great. They do this magic little thing behind the counter when they ad the cream and sugar for you, some have speculated that they add crack or MSG, I think they probably pumped a few shots of unadulterated happy in my coffee.
author: Truckee L.

description: I needed to kill an hour in the Mission last night so I decided to study at Philz. I was excited to try a place that it seemed you either love or hate so I was a little disappointed that I felt neither...I liked it. Good coffee, a little burnt tasting. Friendly staff. I like the atmosphere overall with the comfy couches. The set-up was a bit weird with couches/chairs all around the edge in some big circle. It was kinda eerie;  if I wasn't studying I would feel weird sitting there staring at the person across from me.
author: Lilly O.

description: Great place. It has a wide selection of coffee flavors and the ones I've tasted are awesome. If you are in the area you have to check this place out.
author: David J.

description: I miss coffee.  I miss Philz coffee.  I don't know how he fits so much deliciousness in one cup.
author: Coco D.

description: Philz isn't coffee like Blue Bottle or Ritual. Don't go expecting a little espresso. It's all about manufacturer's cream, mint, and secret ingredients. I'm pretty sure Philz is in a "drug-free zone", which makes it all the more surprising that it's allowed to continue operating. If you can, get Phil to make your coffee; he's the real secret ingredient.
author: Blaine C.

description: Not everyone can run a business by whim. But Phil certainly didn't do any marketing studies to find that a hand-poured coffee shop should also sell bulk foods, potted plants, beer/wine to go, and incorporate a falafel stand that tends to rove around the store (or even out to the sidewalk). This morning there was live music (for that matter, the staff usually has excellent taste in what they play). But I'm really there for the coffee (which does vary quite a bit between roasts, so ask which one will meet your tastes). Free wifi is representative of the encouragment to stick around a while. Where Blue Bottle masters the craft, Philz masters the art.
author: Rick C.

description: Really, really good coffee.... make it fresh when you order it.  Didn't try it sweetened so not sure what that is like.   I went to the one on 18th and Sanchez and the decor there is very thrift store like and not comfy at all.... recommend just getting a cup and going.
author: Annabel G.

description:
everyone who works at phil's seems happy, smiling, even at 7:30am.  phil is a nice guy who is always at one of the two shops with a welcoming smile - if not too welcoming...

the coffee is good. the turkish is like a treat, not for everyday b.c. of all the cream and sugar and deliciousness.   they also have cheaper self-serve coffee on your left as you walk in - more "every day" joe.  but again, i defer to ritual and faye's video.
author: Erika Y.

description: Getting coffee from here is a treat, but I get it to go. Too many people hanging out in front (especially on weekends) and not an inviting place to pass a few hours. The experience of watching the brewers prepare your coffee and the distinctive taste makes Philz a S.F. gem.
author: Chris S.

description:
freaking amazing.  by chance, i stopped here before my first day of work just because it happened to be on 24th and on the way to the freeway. i dont usually put sugar in my coffee, but LET THEM DO IT.  just say sugar and cream and let them work their magic.  i know it sounds dumb, but the way they mix everything together is magical.  types i have tried:

-wonderbar (amazing)
-so good (it really is)
-turkish (amazing)
-some mocha thing (amazing)

worth the $3.50.  you might get halted by barista conversation so dont be in a hurry, but thats nbg.
author: Robert S.

description:
I wish I would have known about this place earlier! They have amazing coffee. They pour it it and out of the flask and cup so that the flavors are strong and the temperature is perfect for immediate drinking and enjoying. 
I recommend the Tantalizing Turkish. So unusual, but soo good. I think it is a cardamon and minty flavor, not sure, but it is addictive. 
The employees are fast and super nice. They make sure to pick you something good if you are overwhelmed by the extensive menu, and they always great you with a smile or a 'hello.' After you get your coffee, there are many great couches to sit on, and outdoor sitting if.
.. if you prefer people watching.
author: Alexandra a.

description:
coffee my ass, they are serving liquid crack!  try the mocha -they add a mint leaf on top.  no bland coffee here for sure.  not for those who like something milder -you'll leave with the shakes especially if you go on and off coffee.  

it's good to see a good old local non-chain coffee place (though i noticed there's a new one on 18th that i havent checked out yet).   this location seems to attract bird owners.  customers seem to be as 'colorful' as the birds and one is likely to have a conversation with one of them as they are with one of the birds.
author: X X.

description: Cash register broke as I showed up, but it was promptly taken care of. Great coffee with a nice garnish added to it.  It's a very unique flavor
author: Benjamin D.

description: Considering how many great reviews this place got, i figured it would be packed! That being said, there was plenty of room to grab a table and outlet. Not much to say which hasn't been said, but if I lived closer it would be my go-to work place.
author: Matt W.

description: I used to work as a barista, so I drink a lot of coffee.  I usually drink my coffee black, but at Philz I have them add cream because then it tastes like something unearthly.  I somehow forget how amazing the coffee tastes and always utter a small gasp after my first sip of a new cup.  The coffee is strong, so be warned, but then you just get to savor it for longer because you take smaller sips.  I haven't tried the bakery yet, but there is a good variety and it is tempting.  Just go, drink amazing coffee and relax on the garage sale furniture.
author: Jody S.

description: I have down graded my review as they have recently become anti-dog and do not allow dogs in their shop. They claim that it is a health issue but I checked and the SF health department says it is not them and is likely a Philz policy. I bring my dog everywhere including Safeway and other coffee shops like Starbucks and they have no issues.
author: Brian K.

description: Most flavorful coffee I ever had. Some of the most hospitable and caring employees of any place. Outdoor seating to watch the world twirl by as you enjoy your tasty beverage. Oh yes, place your order with a barista behind the counter first. A lot of people lingering in that area have ordered and are just waiting for their delicious drink.
author: Dmitriy S.

description: I'd say that you can believe the hype about the best coffee in town. Actually, my favorite drink on the menu is the mint tea. The place is kind of a mess, though, with uncomfortable chairs or beaten down old couches. Maybe that's part of the charm (like the storage room/restroom with twinkly lights). Anyway, plan to spend some time on your beverage, because this is coffee/tea to savor, not to chug before getting on the bus or BART.
author: Jere K.

description: I've had some of the greatest cups of coffee here.  The staff is really nice and helpful.  The philharmonic is always a favorite as well as the wonderbar.  I recommend ordering a small coffee because lately the large coffees seem to be watered down and cold.  At a place that makes one cup at a time you can't expect it to be consistent every time.  If you have a chance, chat it up with Phil.  He's a kooky guy usually taking a mid-day nap on the couch after tweaking out from two cups earlier in the morning.
author: Jordan S.

description: I don't care if the cups leak. I don't care if it's noisy. I love Phil. I love everyone who works there. I love that I run into Faye while I'm there and start crying. I cannot live without my Mocha Tesora. Many a day there's been no more compelling reason to wake up in the morning. Love.
author: sven r.

description:
If you love coffee, like I do, your first cup of Philz will be close to a religious experience. 
i've been to many hipster coffee bars that brew by the cup, so I expected the coffee at Philz to be good. What I didn't expect was for the coffee to taste like coffee smells. Even if you don't like coffee, you probably like the smell of it; there are few better smells in the world - I'd put it up there with grass and sun-dried laundry. Until Philz, I'd never had a cup of coffee that fully delivered on its olfactory tease. 
Phil himself is a good reason to go. A compact, intense man with a mustache and natty fedora, Phil will sometimes ignore your order and decide which of the many baffling choices on his menu you SHOULD have. I don't know how he does it, but he's never wrong. The first time I went, he fixed me in his Valentino-like gaze and nodded, then made me something called a Tesora, which is a rich, lightly sweetened, insanely good cup of coffee. A bit of cream, just the right amount, spanks the coffee back from the edge of roastiness, making the whole affair slide down your throat like velvet. A mint leaf perched saucily at the top, like the feather in Phil's fedora, is all that stops you from tossing the whole thing back in a shot. It would take Evelyn Waugh or Nabokov to adequately describe this stuff, so I'll leave off and just say, go try it yourself.
author: Sarah B.

description: I heard about philz from the owner of soon to be coffee shop, Remedy, in the East Bay. Since it's only a walk down the hill from my house (either Castro, or Mission location), I made my way to the Mission location and found myself in a friendly, cozy, corner coffee shop. The line may take a few minutes, both to figure out where the end is, and what coffee blend to choose, but your single brewed cup is well worth the wait. I don't have a favorite blend yet, but the baristas don't ever mind suggesting their favorite or helping you pick something you're sure to like. To be honest, it is a bit pricey, but bring in your own cup (any size) and you only have to pay the price of a small. If you're really on a budget, but can't resist a pastry, look for their day old selection.
author: Leya C.

description:
i had heard amazing things about philz, so finally, after a work-related meeting on a saturday, i made all efforts to get here.

the space is large and comfy, especially in comparison to my favorites (blue bottle and cole), which was a nice surprise.  the baristas were helpful and kind; too bad the same can't be said of the hipsters who seem to reside here!

all in all, the experience was a five star one, but the coffee just didn't win me over the way blue bottle and cole did.  i'm not saying it wasn't good, because it was definitely above par.  that said, i have only been here once, and i hope to come back to try more of their offerings!
author: Jill k.

description: This is some damn fine coffee, no argument about it.  There is a ton of different blends to choose from and they make it "A cup at a time" from whichever one you want.  At $2.50 for a small cup it sure ain't cheap, but it's oh so tasty!
