author: Dan G.

description:
***now serving FAIR TRADE blend***

is this an iced coffee or a mint julep?  is this someone's basement, a convenience store, or a coffeehouse?

all of the above, amigos.  they brew the coffee one cup at a time, and you can choose your beans.  you know that, right?  the only dilemma philz presents is that you want to go back, but you know you can't unless you have the time and mood for a ridiculous (oh, yes) cup of coffee.  i honestly can't say it's suited for daily consumption.  o' mundane bean...

it's not the best place to lounge around though (due to the musky basement vibe).  saturday mornings on the sidewalk philsopher's bench are nice.

UPDATE: i asked for a cup of something earthy, non-acidic, and they poured me "ambrosia".  divine.  just remember to toss the mint leaf before if soaks too long in your coffee and makes it taste like fresh-brewed mouthwash
author: Kris P.

description: Best coffee I've ever had.  Smart, quippy baristas a huge plus.  10 minute wait for a cup of Joe?  Not always convienient.  Would like the atmoshpere to be a little more creative.  But honestly, I savor every drop of the brew they serve me...  Besides, where else do you get "secret spices" and mint leaves in your joe?
author: Jesse Lu S.

description: Gimme more gimme more gimme more! I reserve Philz coffee for weekends, preferably before gardening, but after consuming a stack of pancakes. Drinking a cup of turkish joe removes all reminders of a week's worth of gnarly office coffee from my brain, allowing me to remember that I started drinking coffee because it tastes goooood, not just to wake me up. Plus, the $5 plant I bought at Philz looks nice on my dresser.
author: Lauren G.

description: My experience drinking a cup of this coffee is always orgasmic.  It's like liquid cocaine. They brew the coffee cup by cup and you can certainly taste the difference.  I can be fairly picky over the measurements of my additions but they somehow seem to get it just right when they add my cream and sugar.  There are so many varieties to choose from but I usually get Tesora.  The Castro location is equally great.
author: Glenda D.

description: My favorite coffee place in the city. I'm convinced that Phil is putting more than just coffee in his brew though. I drink this stuff and my hair curls. But seriously, this is a funks authentic spot and I highly recommend it. They make wonderful teas as well.
author: Roland S.

description:
Though this  lynch-pin of inner Mission life (known to the locals as Philz) has taken a decidedly hippy turn of late, it is still home to one of, if not THE, preeminent cups of Joe this side of Prunedale.  Listen, before you start your rant, I realize the beans are inferior to those heavenly micro-roasted delectation's of Blue Bottle, but please understand--at Philz, the game is all about preparation.  More specifically, it's about careful preparation wed to a fantastic variety of options which should suit even the most finicky Java drinkers.  After selecting one of approximately 30 bean varieties, the counter person will grind just enough for a single cup.  The grounds are poured into a Turkish filter where boiling water is then added (you may also request Turkish spices to be mixed with the grounds before steeping).  Four long minutes later, the coffee is ready to be accessorized.  Whether or not you usually take cream in your coffee, at Philz it is of paramount importance to ask for the "special cream" which, though ostensibly a secret, consists of heavy whipping cream that has been slightly seasoned.  Seasoned with what, you ask?  I've no idea--it's a secret.  Other options include a fresh sprig of mint, soy or rice milk, honey, raw sugar, etc.  With coffee in hand, you are now free to experience all the coziness Philz has to offer--be it hunkering down in a comfy couch and peeking out from behind a copy of Gravity's Rainbow or perhaps a game of chess with a socialist is more your thing.

Philz Coffee--where coffee dreams come true (if, like me,  you have such dreams).
author: Justin T.

description: Yeah, Phil makes a knockout cup of coffee but watch out! He's a charmer and is prone to  early morning flirtation. Bring a buffer with you if its more than you can take before your first cup of coffee in the morning, ladies. Try his chai, its to *die* for.
author: Lauren G.

description: This is not coffee, it is crack. Best coffee in San Francisco. Extremely habit-forming.
author: Bonnie B.

description:
philz get 4 cause the guy whose picture was everywhere(my guess was phil) gave me free baklava. coffee selection was good and i like the concept of individualized coffee.

what i didn't like was the dude who didn't really listen to me. had the whole its "my first time here" discussion asked me what i liked. told him full bodied coffee's generally an african( i even mentiond an ethiopian yirgacheffe) or an indo-pacific. gave me the house blend that was really not that full bodied and too acidic for my tastes. i may be a bit of a snob in the fact that i have spent the previous 5 years of my life working in the coffee business, but if you are going to ask me what i like try to get close. on the plus he did offer to make me another cup of something else, but i hate to waste things.

also the individual brewing thing on paper seems great, but honestly individually brewing coffee with a filter takes away a lot of body and imparts some of the paper flavor to a cup. filters are really only good for large quantities of coffee. the best method for small amounts is a press pot or any method that does not require filtering. i would love to see that option there. also i would prefer to add my own soy and sugar cause in the end my cup was too sweet even though i asked for just a little sugar in the cup.

i did enjoy the cup and i love the atmosphere. will go back and try to adjust my order the next time.
author: Chris G.

description: There isn't much I can complain about with Philz.  My partner works for a large coffee company and we frequently cheat on it at Philz.  My favorite is the Tesora.  Gets me going for the whole day.  The staff is always cheerful.  It is not the cleanest places but that actually adds to the character that I love about it.  Also, I can take my little Beagle in with me to get my Jo.  This is my fav location out of the 3 in San Francisco (although I will stop in at Castro or Mission Bay if I am in the area.)
author: J J.

description: I went to Philz a couple of weeks ago to see what all the hype was about.  I asked for an Americano.  The counter guy smiled and said "This is your first time here, huh?"  Turns out that they don't have an espresso machine, but do something that looks similar to French pressing.   Whatever the method is, it's at least as good (probably better) than an espresso machine.   Counter guy said they usually start off new customers with Tesoro.  I told him to make the type that he thinks is the best tasting.  He told me he'd make me the Turkish one.  It was wonderful!  He and the cashier were really friendly without being obnoxious.  So refreshing after having been to Ritual Roasters where they always screw up the drinks and have major attitude.  I'm only giving it 4 stars because the decor could be a little nicer (not too much nicer though, since I like the comfy  factor).
author: Cristina G.

description: Although  I am a picky coffee drinker and try to seek out shops that make pourovers, my first cup of Philz was based solely on the Yelp ratings. I carried my own coffee cup  and arrived to see a line that was reaching just outside the door. I almost left after 5 minutes, thinking the line wasn't moving much and I didn't have forty minutes to wait. Long story short, I stayed and was blessed with a wonderful cup of coffee within fifteen minutes. There really is something about this coffee and this place. Although it was crowded, it didn't feel like a roomful of snarky hipsters. The staff was really cool and engaged with the crowd of customers. The coffee was simply stellar. It's difficult for me to put into words how good the coffee was- I don't have coffee language and it feels like trying to have a discussion about great music. Lastly,  I could tell I was standing in a legendary place. Thanks YELP, and thank you, Phil, for having incredibly high standards.
author: Thomas H.

description:
no contest, 
don't even fool yourself, 
this is the place. 
just be warned
if you ask phil to make you something strong, 
it is going to be strong, 
3 sips shook me up 
and I have a major tolerance
from my years 
as a servant of the evil bean.
(good evil not bad evil, you know)
author: saru s.

description: More than 15 different coffees to choose from, they mix your cream n' sugar for you, and fellow customers say nice things like, "Your shoes are very Marie Antoinette". I recommend taking the drink to go, and walking down tree-lined 24th St.
author: Mariah V.

description: Thanks to a recommendation from amiga Bevin, I ordered the ecstatic ice coffee. It was delicious. MM MM GOOD. It totally hit the spot after a casual stroll west on 24th in weird heat that San Frandisco makes. I took a  1 star away because it's ugly inside, and I am shallow.
author: danny e.

description: Great coffee, great employees, and cool and eclectic decor. I am now a Philz fan and won't go anywhere else for coffee. I am not a coffee snob and don't know a lot about coffee, but I really enjoyed the whole "one cup of coffee is brewed at a time". It seems like it is stronger and more flavorful. Will always go back and may try other locations.
author: Zannie S.

description:
There is no better coffee. I swear it is full of crack.
I wish it didn't cost 24786 dollars a cup.
author: Emily D.

description: The only cafe in the city with good Turkish coffee, which alone merits a five-star rating. But what is that bizarre, indescribable yet incredibly strong smell that always seems to overwhelm this place?
author: Jane P.

description:
I'm not really a coffee drinker, but after Philz's aaaaaaawesome awesome iced coffee, now I am. 

Unless, of course, they just ruined all other coffee for me, since it will never, ever match up....

oh well. I'll enjoy it while I can. Try the mint iced coffee (I'm not sure if that's the exact name, but its up on the big board in the bottom righthand corner.)

Enjoy!
author: K S.

description: offers the best selection of coffee in SF -- bar none -- alongside comfortable, yet an eclectic hodgepodge of locals, furniture, and interior decoration.
author: ben r.

description: Philz coffee is a uniquely enjoyable place to get a cup of coffee. The way they make each coffee, to your specifications, with that garnish of mint and friendly conversation, seems to perk up my mood. I like to go and get a a tesora and sit on one of the couches and read my newspaper. It's also fun to sit on the benches and people watch.
author: Cyrelle D.

description: Coffee you can make love to, according to owner Phil Jaber. Phil serves his own special recipe of fresh roasted coffee "one cup at a time" ... and I'm not at all exagerating when I tell you it's the best cup of coffee on earth. It comes with real cream, a dash of secret spice, a touch of fresh mint and a whole lot of love from Phil himself.
author: Katie B.

description:
every other day of the week i take my coffee black with no sugar. i'm serious.

but when someone brought me to philz and the cup was brewed and sweetened and garnished with a mint so lovingly for me, i drank all that sweet stuff down.
then i demanded to be taken back there every day. Phil: I LOVE YOU.
and you didn't even have exact change.
author: Stephanie C.

description: I don't run and I don't drink coffee.  Since trying Philz's iced mint mojito once in Berkeley and finding out that their main branch is a mile or so from where I live, I now run and I drink coffee...their coffee...every day I possibly can!  It has been a running joke among my friends.  Yes, pun intended.  :)
author: April S.

description: Philz is more of an art form than just coffee. One day I will probably dedicate a poem to it - for now this review will suffice. The coffee is hand-made drip coffee - and each cup is a labor of love. The preparation definitely makes a big difference in the quality - I have some experience with an espresso machine at work, and can assert that it's possible to screw up even top notch coffee. Unfortunately, Phil was out of town when I went, so his son had to prepare my coffee (my companion had his coffee prepared by Phil's son's girlfriend, who I don't think put the same loving care into it).  It was still top notch. It's kind of interesting that the coffee shop is in the middle of a liquor store, but it holds up nonetheless. I plan to go back whenever I end up in the sketch part of the mission.
author: Dana L.

description: Strong and Fresh.  Best coffee.  Little pricey ($) for a cup of joe, but as a committed coffee lover, worth the price.  Also worth noting is the live music...pleasant.  A word of caution for the periodic coffee drinkers/starbucks drinkers, Philz coffee may be too strong for ya.
author: Adrian N.

description: All I know is that this Philz has the best coffee ever. Yeah, thats right Ritual and BB. It does have a chaotic, Coffee Nazi, style to the ordering/payment process. But, hey, its so good that it doesn't matter. The other Philz don't quite have the magic this one does, which is fine because I live close to this one now. Yay.
author: Matt C.

description: I never realized I was drinking mediocre coffee until I experienced the best coffee I've ever tasted at Philz Coffee. Philz set the bar HIGH. Starbucks just does not cut it for me anymore. Had a nice long chat with the barista who was a coffee expert - think wine afficionado but with coffee. I CANNOT BELIEVE THE SELECTION HERE. I've only been once but I'll be back SOON!!! Last time I had the Tesora and fell in love. Accompanied by an almond croissant, and I was on cloud 9. Live jazz on a Sunday morning was frosting on the cake- I need to go back and study here sometime. I went to the Mission location and I give it a 5 star amazingness!!!
author: Rebecca L.

description: Love Phillz Coffee! If you want a cup of joe that will keep you zipping all day long, where you won't have to go back for seconds or thirds, this is the place for you. Not only will it keep you going, but all the different flavors of coffees taste great. The only draw back to Phillz at the Folsom and 24th location, is that the decor and ambiance feels messy, scattered and unkempt. But the coffee is so amazing that the environment doesn't matter that much; it's something that can be overlooked. What I do love about this location is that's in the middle of the Mission district, so you can go exploring after you get caffeinated!
author: Valencia D.

description: Hard to say whether or not I love the coffee here - it always had way too much cream for my taste!  Most people are pretty picky about their cream and sugar preferences, myself included - I cannot deal with other people doing the milk for me.  The staff is so friendly and the atmosphere is welcoming, but I've been three times now and keep making the mistaking of telling them to put just a *little* dash of milk.   If I'm paying extra for some fancy blend, I just want to be able to taste it!   Would be five stars but for that issue, which I suppose is mostly my fault . . . I guess I'll just take it black.
author: Natalie S.

description: I am a huge fan of Philz.  If you like strong coffee you MUST try Philz coffee.  Phil recommends milk & sugar and I do too.  My favorite is the Philtered Soul and the t-shirt with the mint leaf :)
author: Ema S.

description: You've never had such tasty and wholesome pastries! So gooooooooooooood!!!!!!!! And they don't use anything artificial in anything...the coffee is really strong, beware
author: Stephanie M.

description: Simply the best coffee in San Francisco. The staff is super friendly and fast. Definetely worth a visit if you are a coffee lover.
author: Hanna A.

description:
Moving from NYC to SF can be a bit of a shock. The Mission has the grit of a familiar neighborhood... and I swear Phil fuels it with his "by the cup" offering. 

Plan a little time for the baristas to work their magic. This is not an eye-contact free swap of money for goods. The crew is either all smiles or quietly dreaming, either way they'll remember your taste. This is what a local place is supposed to feel like, and where most coffee beans dream of landing. And if Phil is there,  he'll greet you as the value customer you are.
author: Todd S.

description: Philz' is delicious, friendly and worth the trip!
author: Colleen C.

description: Truly the epitome of a great coffee shop.  Relaxed environment, Great Staff, and the Best coffee.  I didn't drink coffee for the taste until I went to philz, (it was purely the caffine kick previously)  The Prices are great for the quality of coffee and service you get.  AND their Chai is amazing also.  Can't wait to go back.  Thanks Phil!!!
author: Natalie Q.

description: This place lets non service dogs in! Large dog-pit bull mix. I asked the guy taking the money behind the register, presumably the manager "do you allow non service dogs in here?" He said "sure, why not?" I then said "because it's a health code violation and against the law." He said "I don't know anything about that." The fact is that he does know better. All employees at food establishments must go through training regarding the handling of food and sanitation-especially managers. The Health Dept. routinely visits most coffee shops and restaurants so as to protect the public's health.
author: James C.

description: The best "long" coffee I had in town and even if I don't like sipping for 1 hour (I can't stand waterish coffees) sometimes I stop there to have my cup brewed. I love the junglism ruling inside the store and most of all buying my bag of coffee, then grind it at home and enjoy my homemade espresso. If you're in a rush, don't stop there, it takes time to prepare your coffee...no complaints, they're doing it for you.
author: Dario B.

description: In a city where there's a coffee shop literally on every corner.  it's pretty amazing that Philz is able to offer something unique.   If you don't know what to order just let them make you what they want (really) and unless you are deathly allergic - let them add the milk, sugar and mint. . . it's SO good.  If you're just looking for a new place to try your usual caramel latte or triple mocha frappacino blizzard thing then you might want to head elsewhere but if you like coffee and want a treat - go to Philz.
author: Valerie D.

description: The best coffee in town. Period.  Very friendly service.  Inseparable from its surrounding neighborhood, this place is very definitely part of the Mission, so expect the random homeless, drug addict, and streetwalker interactions depending on when you show up to get your own legal fix with the rest of us. Phil has made a big effort to make the place very friendly -- with internet hookups, "sidewalk seating," and palms -- outside and inside.  Philz is more than great coffee...it's an experience.
author: Eric H.

description: Slow, but for good reasons - it's crowded as fuck, and they brew each drink by hand! They know their product, and they'll make sure to steer you in the right direction and guide you through your options to make sure you leave satisfied. If I lived in the neighborhood, I'd be here on a twice-daily basis.
author: Alex C.

description:
Oh man, this place is great! Went there on my birthday after having an amazing brunch at Sun Rise.  Went in with some friends, asked the barista what her recommendation was for a lighter coffee, and she gave me a perfect cup.  Cream and sugar, magically balanced.
Then I ordered a vegan donut.  Seriously, had I known that I would have NEVER gotten it!!! But I asked what the best one was, and Phil himself gave me his fave.  It was scrumptious and he said I would get my money back if I didn't like it.
My friend proceeded to tell him it was my birthday, so he announced it, sang me the birthday song, and comped my coffee and donut!! He also took away the tip jar as I tried to tip him and he said "I can do whatever I want here..." It was AMAZING!  He was so nice, the coffee was fantastic, and I just about crapped my pants when I realized that the delicious donut I was eating was 100% VEGAN!!!!! Crazy! 
It was one of the major hi lites of my birthday! Philz rocks! GO THERE!
author: Suzanne L.

description:
yep, the coffee here is extraordinary. 

too bad they only have disposable cups. i hate to hate, but imagine all the trash they must generate... c'mon, phil, you can do better than that.
author: jean w.

description:
ohhhhh craaaap that was a good cup of coffee. 

my friend had been talking about this place for awhile, and seeing as i don't live in the bay anymore, i never really paid attention. but on one fateful visit to the mission, i passed by and recognized the name. so i walked on in and asked them for a small cup of whatever they recommended. and damn, it was good. medium roast, full bodied, and STRONG. they freshly grind and brew every single cup, and it sure does make a difference. but at about 3 bucks a cup, it better be that good.
author: Kimmy K.

description: Ambrosia is truly the nectar of the gods.  I'm a believer in the gospel of Philz.  (PS, Ambrosia is one of the many coffee blends that's on offer.  Just to clarify.)
author: Thuy Tien L.

description: Really? I don't get what all the fuss is about. I paid about three bucks for a small coffee. I had an interview for a job later and told the guy I needed something strong. He fixed me something that didn't even taste like coffee (it didn't taste bad, just not like coffee), and there wasn't nearly enough caffeine in it. I had to go somewhere else and get a real coffee. What's the point?
author: Daniel L.

description:
The coffee is better than anything you'll ever get. The people know coffee better than you. They may even be better than you. But they don't show it. Very cool, gracious people and ridiculously good coffee.

I don't live in the area so I will rarely get the opportunity to come here, which sucks. I'd drive the 45 minutes just to come here.
author: Christian B.

description: I thoroughly enjoyed my first cup of Philz coffee! The server was totally sweet and helpful. She provided a great recommendation after recognizing that it was my first time there. The ambiance is also great there. Good tunes and comfy chairs kept me there for a few hours while I dived into a book I had just picked up. I'll definitely be back and can't wait to try some of their other blends.
author: B S.

description:
Fantastic coffee.

Favs: Four Great Horses for regular; Swiss Water for decaf.

Food's a little weak, given the quality of the coffee.
author: Matt F.

description: Honestly, best coffee I have ever had. But be forewarned, the secret is in the cream (in my opinion)! So rich and thick it's fit for a dessert, so if you're dieting or not up for that be sure to ask they cut down or substitute milk for the cream (it is standard).
author: Chris W.

description: Definitely the best cup of coffee I have ever had. Bar none. I usually take mine black with a spot of sugar, but I took my first cup of Philz black (out of respect for Phil himself, who personally blends, grinds and brews each cup) and couldn't believe a cup of coffee could have so many complex, layered flavors. It goes on and on in your mouth and will totally redefine what you think a good cup of coffee is. Peet's will do in a pinch, but Philz is where you go when you need a fix.
author: Maureen G.

description: I was lucky enough to have my first Philz coffee with a friend of mine who truly appreciates a good cup of joe.  Foggy morning, a short game of scrabble, good conversation with a friend I hardly see enough of and incredible coffee with mint.....mmmmm good.
author: Aubrey L.

description:
The first time I wandered into here with my roommate (we're both the zombie-until-our-morning-cup types), we were very confused.  Walking up to the barista, she told him tentatively "Um...I'll have an...Americano?" 

 He smiled at us and told us it was obvious we'd never been there before.  

Damn.  So much for trying to fit in at the local hipster coffee house.  

He then asked us what kinds of coffee we liked and recommended one for us.  Jacob's wonderbar brew.  It was delicious, exactly what we liked.  And the kicker?  It was Jacob himself helping us.  *starstruck*

Even though we didn't want creme or sugar, he forced us to try another coffee with their special creme (his words exactly, I'm not the one trying to make that sound naughty!).  WONDERFUL!!!

I've found now that my favorite coffee is Ambrosia--coffee of the Gods.  I figure its the one that fits me the best.  :)

Oh, and Phil (Jacob's Dad of course)  is the nicest man ever.  I have this great idea in my head of him traveling around the world, looking for the best blends of coffee.  

Interesting things are always ensuing in here too.  Like, a creepy man tipping Jacob with a $100 bill, or people playing their guitar on the couches.  very.  badly. 

Well, hopefully now if it's your first time, you'll pretend you know what you're doing.  Don't ask for an Americano!!!  Ask for a specific blend!!!  And don't forget the special creme.  Yum.
author: Emma H.

description: One cup at a time and well worth the wait.  This was the best cup of coffee I have had in a long time.  I am always hesitant to pay $3 a cup for coffee at Starbucks but if I lived near Phil'z I'd be having it daily.   The fresh mint on top was really the icing on the cake for me.  I'd never expect it to be so good in coffee but it was really the perfect touch to top off an already great cup.
author: Bill B.

description: The Coffee is GREAT and the atmosphere is awesome as it's smack dab in the mission. The staff is friendly and since moving to SF 3 years ago, I've fallen in love with everything about it. Phil is also extremely nice and always makes it a point to say hello. It's one of the last few TRUELY neighborhood places around
author: Troy H.

description:
I first went to Philz to rendezvous with a friend about a year ago. It's one of the more memorable coffee shops in San Francisco. 
It's in a perfect location, the ever vibrant Mission District, just a few blocks from the BART Mission & 24th stop. Thanks to the location there is always sunlight pouring through the windows.
I still remember being awestruck at how good the coffee was back when I first tried it. And since I'm not much of a coffee drinker I opted for mint tea on numerous occasions and to my surprise found it to be the best mint tea (made from fresh mint) I've ever had. The baristas are always very friendly and don't have that condescending attitude I've come to expect from those in the hipster coffee shops I frequented in Minneapolis. The clientele it attracts are likewise cool and interesting (with the exception of the odd street person who stops by and harasses the baristas).
And with free wi-fi, who could ask for more?
author: Wilson S.

description: I heard the buzz about this place. Mainly, from my sister who knows all about what's hip.  But, I got there and was intimidated. Where do I order, stand, pay now or later? The place was mobbed. I felt out of place. Then I heard my self say, "pay now" and the cashier kindly directed me....the wide smiling barrister was so helpful, I settled on a philharmonic with cream and sugar in 20 seconds. 7 minutes later it came. Whoa! It was amazing. So worth it. I feel like a traitor, abandoning my local spot, but, I will be back to  Philz.
author: elena l.

description: The hype is real. Philz is handmade coffee at its best. I recommend the Armbrosia of the God- so far its been my favorite roast. Smooth and sweet.
author: Kika S.

description: awesome atmosphere. delicious coffee. wonderful staff. good tines. affordable prices. bakery items by the register. array of coffees & coffee drinks. barista steve was a pleasure to talk w as he made our coffee. knowledgeable about the bean. i recommend making this a stop in your day.
author: Jamie R.

description: is the BEST coffee in San Francisco... i'm addicted and love the people that work there too!
author: SF Y.

description: Great coffee! Since they make it as soon as you tell them, its always fresh and hot. Plus they always ask if its exactly how you wanted it (more cream or sugar?) The first time i went,  Phil was there, which I thought was really cool. Very friendly staff. They need to work on keeping their food case closed, but...free internet and chill place to get really good coffee.
author: Katie N.

description: Phil is such a GOOD MAN and so nice to talk to. He is fer real, like a local who knows you and greets you like family.  The place is not fancy. The vibe, though is spectacular.  And the coffee is KILLA.  Lip smacking, tongue yumming good.  And hot. And fresh, and all that they five stars say.  It really is that good.
author: Nini M.

description:
Update: Maybe I missed it before, but I was excited to see Philz offering beans by the pound.  What did I do?  Run, or walk, rather, up to Philz to buy a large cup and a pound of beans.  Cheaper for me, and I don't have to leave the house and brave the lines.  Bravo, Philz!

Like the Attic is to Pops, Philz is to Ritual.

Philz is pretty good.  The first time I had it, I told the gal to give me a cup of the "strongest coffee" they had.  It was strong alright:  too much sugar and cream, all for a five-minute wait and $2.50.  The second time I went, I took it black.  I have no idea what kind of roast she used, but it wasn't half bad. Still, though, for $2.50 a cup, not something I try to make a habit of.
author: Chris D.

description:
the best coffee in the world  and mr phil is one heck of a nice guy he lets an old fart like me hang out  and oogle all the cutie pies

maybe i should work there  but alas i would give away the store
author: spiritsf a.

description:
best coffee ive ever had. i'm not particularly snobbish about my coffee (umm... Chelsea W, below?), but i do care enough to find the best cup i can. 

the owners and employees care more about coffee than i could ever think possible... and it shows when you watch them make it, and then when you have a sip.
author: David S.

description: Great set up.  Awesome coffee.  The crowd is sort of hip but tolerable.
author: Matt B.

description: WOW the coffee really is that good. i've always heard yelpers rave about this place and after eating at la palma i stumbled upon this place and decided i had to try it. the regular iced drip coffee (done the philz way with cream and brown sugar) is soo delicious!! i might have to hit up the soma location when i crave amazing coffee bc it's a lot closer!
author: N. M.

description: Coffee at Philz has been the best I have ever had so far. I enjoy walking in ordering my coffee and watching them ground the coffee beans and make my cup of coffee fresh. They also add the sugar and cream (unless you want your coffee black). The cup of coffee is a little pricey, but the attention to every cup of coffee is worth paying extra. The coffee is smooth with no bad after taste. I usually do not order a light roast because I find it to be bitter or overly strong, but at Philz I often times order a light roast off the menu. Now I am more open to trying light roast coffee, but I have found that the best so far is from Philz.
author: Alfredo M.

description: Best coffee I have ever had.  It has a must be tasted to believe aerated texture.  Fantastic and worth the $3.  I was in the mission shortly after having my first Philz in the Civic Center.  Same great coffee and much better, traditional coffee shop atmosphere than the Civic Center Philz.
author: The P.

description:
The coffee really was fantastic, although I can understand why some people didn't like it.  It was a bit odd, but in a good way -- for example it was a bit spicy.

And that Phil, what a character.  Love it.
author: Mike M.

description: a lovely, deft brew, smattering my taste buds like a banshee on a caking terrace. But that name makes me feel like Paul Walker is serving me my god-coff, and that makes me hardened and surly. All that bean finesse, and no smidgeon of effort applied to the title? How about "phylizzez ass pipe"? I'd hack up Bill Paxton for an alteration. Make this known.
author: Christopher J.

description: I love Philz coffee.  However, having said that I can see that it isn't for everyone.  If you get it the "normal" way it has cream, sugar and mint, which is too sweet for me.  I get mine with cream only and it's always great.  So, the coffee is great but that's only the beginning.  I also love the people and the atmosphere in Philz.  You never know if there will be a band or an art  show or if furniture will be totally rearranged.  What you do know is that the people will be interesting and friendly, which is valuable in this city.  So try it out, but don't expect the usual.
author: Keith B.

description: I got to meet Phil and then had some of his absolutely outstanding brew.  I don't remember the details of how it's all prepared but who cares.  A large coffee of any of the styles is sure to satisfy.  I usually shy away from regular coffee because it doesn't taste as good as, say, an americano, but this changed my mind.  So awesome.
author: Steven B.

description:
5 star overall for the service, the coffee, and the setting.
the staff was very helpful, kind, and they are very knowledgeable abut the products their product.
the coffee was outstanding, i work at a cafe and i have never had a coffee with froth. the coffee was delicious it went well with the vegan rum ginger bread i got.
the cafe was very cozy and had a very home-y feel to it.
if you like coffee and you're in this area of San Francisco, you definitely have to stop by.
author: Jeorge J.

description: Philz provided a much needed, good cup of coffee, before my dreaded caffeine- withdrawl headache set in.
author: Carlos C.

description:
what can i say.....

the best coffee in the city, the lowest prices on vegan donuts that i know of...and they give you free mint in your coffee if you so desire.  what is not to like/love/obsess about this place?  sure...a small coffee and a vegan donut will knock the hell out of a five dollar bill, but with phil and his girls doin it up proper like mc hammer, you gotta pay the price, homey.

i wish the tables and chairs were a little bit more orderly inside, but i am usually sitting outside no matter what the weather is and people watching anyways, so i am not going to complain.  i always tell myself i want to try all of the different blends of coffee here, but as soon as i walk up to the counter i automatically yell out my order of a small "greater alarm"...that ish will kick you in the ace, so it would be a good idea not to drink this after doing a bunch of coke or meth...just my opinion though, do what you want.

i will see you there.
author: matt d.

description: If you have not tried Philz Coffee then stop what you are doing and go there RIGHT NOW.  I do not care if they are closed.  Think about it as an opportunity to be their first customer when they re-open.  You have not lived until you have experienced a cup of Joe from Philz.  And with the way of the world these days, you really do not want to regret not trying Philz before the end comes.  So go there now.  Life is too short to waste precious taste buds on awful coffee.
author: Rebecca G.

description:
Oh wow that's a good cup of coffee. Only have been here once, but the mocha tesora was deeeelicious!

Oh I'll be back
author: Karen J.

description: There is a wait for the brew but it's so worth it.  Coffee is smooth and perfect. The mint tea is also sublime.
author: PM o.

description: Delicious,and quite an experience..a litte pricey though.  Then again, the way they make the coffee costs much more than normal.
author: Michael T.

description: Best coffee ever.  Can't vouch for pastries or slightly flaky service.  But coffee is unbeatable.
author: thomas s.

description: Last night we strolled by Philz to get some post-dinner coffees and just as we approached, Phil himself was locking up shop. He quickly opened up  just for us, brewed us our coffees and then hooked us up with free baklava! Phil rocks. We love him.
author: RedSnapper L.

description: Huge variety of beans, and they'll work with you to make it how you like it.    The employees are really nice.  Super comfy lounge area too, with chess and scrabble and tons of random neat stuff!
author: John D.

description: Philz is in it's own category. You can't compare it with any other coffee since it is like no other. The aromas, the flavors and the buzz you get can not be matched by any other. At this cafe the coffee is the focus and everything else takes a back seat.
author: Madeline T.

description: They lost some points for the prices (2.50 for a tea?) and for the internet connection issues, but the atmosphere was comfortable and the baristas were super nice, not to mention dog-friendly. Apparently I'm not the only one who approves, because sometimes it can be hard to find a seat.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
This is a good location. I come here once in a while. 
Phil knows how to run this business and his coffee is good.
author: Vlad A.

description: Ignore the bastardization of the saxon genitive. This is the best coffee I've ever tasted and delightful staff to boot. I love you Philz!
author: John N.

description:
Amazing coffee.

I once saw Phil almost plow over some customers on his way out the door to put a quarter in the meter to prevent a total stranger from getting a parking ticket in front of his joint.

This blew my mind.
author: sean o.

description: OMG, love this place! Ice coffee is my personal addiction, and the version here with something akin to cocaine in the special sweet milk and sugar blend they add is spectacular. Especially weird that I like it because everywhere else I take my coffee black, no sugar. So coffee purists might freak out a little. But they can deal. Phil is often there and always entertaining to talk to. Worth going out of your way for, great little SF place.
author: Liboo K.

description: Forget everything you think you know about coffee as soon as you step inside this interesting cafe. I was completely enchanted by the service and  Phil. Not to mention the coffee served with a fresh mint leaf on top. I had never been to this part of the Mission before and was heading toward Balmy Alley to see the murals. Philz Coffee was a lovely detour...
author: Janet W.

description:
BEST COFFEE EVER!

Hands down, Philz has got me, forever. I love them! 

Finally a place where the price reflects the quality and service, unlike, say, Starbuck$...

I love that the coffee takes a couple minutes (and it's really fast...like 3 min even on a busy day) to make. It's a San Francisco place, ya know? The slow pace, the dripping slow wonderful coffee...

And try the MOCHA! Mocha with all the cream & milky goodness. 
A soy or even low fat mocha is NOT the same...the MOCHA is like a MEAL in itself, it's SO good, with layers of flayva...

the mocha will be your breakfast, your lunch, your everything. 

and the service is awesomely sweet like the sugar! 
LOVE TO LOVE YOU, PHILZ!
author: elena b.

description:
Ahh, another coffee shop to get the addiction started in the morning.
The coffee: there are plenty to choose from. My favs are So Good and Julie's. Good strong coffee, complex, but not over the top.
However, why can you not get a cup that's hot???? I guess that's why they have a microwave, but after spending over $3 for a cup of joe the last thing I want to do is nuke it. They have also made some changes that make me head elsewhere: no longer do they shake the milk, nor are they adding their magical spice to the grounds... anyone else remember this?  Less work, but the price increases?
They do have delicious vegan donuts, but they are too sweet for morning treats, more like a desert.
And don't get me started on the disorganization of ordering/paying/picking up your drink. But on the flip side, it does make it easy to meet new people as you push through and find out where your place in line should be.
author: Maria L.

description: This is my favorite coffee in the world (currently), with lots of cream.  It beats out my other favorite coffee (at McDonalds!  yes folks- I'm the only person in the world who thinks McDonalds coffee is great! but think about it- McDonalds can make any supplier a billionaire so the coffee's gotta compete!)  The only reason Philz gets 4 stars is because of the baked goods selection (I'm more into french pastries)  Whenever I'm in the neighbourhood of a Philz- I get a coffee whether I need one or not!  now that's a business!
author: Monique G.

description: I am a  total Philz freak.  Give me the Ether (dark roast with lots of power).  They put the cream and sugar in for you!  Plus, you can add a sprig of mint which is the bomb.  I also love their iced mint mojito.
author: Mel H.

description:
As someone who has worked at 4 coffee shops and 5 cafes, I love coffee.  This place does single cup drip coffee and it does make a difference.  All of the people behind the counter at this place were amazing servers aside from one mean girl who made me the only bad cup of coffee I have ever had from this place.  I haven't seen her since so good coffee is safe.  They add cream and sugar for you and then ask if it is how you like it.  If you don't speak up it is your own problem.  I think you could probably get a whole new cup of coffee if you were polite about it.  They are all about customer satisfaction, this is rare.  Make sure you get what you want, but be as nice as they are.  Rude people deserve bad coffee.  It only tastes as good as your personality. 

Once when I was there, Phil gave out roast chicken to everyone who happened to be in the cafe at the time.  My kind of place.  It supplemented the coffee I couldn't really afford and the pastry that his son had some how managed to convince me that I really needed.   It's a family affair.   And I'm a sucker.

But seriously, if you love coffee you need to go to this place at least once.
It is part of the gentrification, but the devil is delicious.  Don't shoot the messenger.
author: Molly B.

description: Moved to SF in June from the Pacific Northwest and have been waiting for a great cup of coffee since.  Blue Bottle is good, but didn't make me want to wait in the Ferry Building lines.  Tried Philz for the first time over the weekend and had to go back twice in the same weekend.  Turkish was fantastic, Ether was even better (maybe because it was made by Phil, himself).  I'm generally an espresso drinker, but Philz has me back on the drip.
author: Ryan O.

description:
the first sip--my heart flutters
the 60th sip--my hands shake

i'm like a third grader in love. 

with cream (aka angel milk) n' sugar, its better than cocaine indeed and every sip is like christmas morning. 

nothing better than to sit in a sunpatch in the mission and drink this on a slungover sunday afternoon.
author: jesse s.

description:
i love the coffee but....ARGH!!! those cups! always leaking...

:-(
author: jen w.

description: what's not to like? you pick your coffee of choice and watch it brew right in front of you, one cup at a time! next comes the milk and cream cheese concoction all topped off with a sprig of mint. it's like heaven in a cup. if you could catch a creamy cloud and add caffeine, that is what you have in your hands :)
author: Jenna S.

description: Had my first cup of coffee from Philz last week, and I have been back twice since then!  I am officially addicted to this little slice of heaven!  Paul, the wonderful barista, helped me choose the rich, yummy, and magical "Jacob" that surpassed all of my expectations. This coffee is well worth every penny.    Also, kudos, to the baristas and cashiers who are kind, patient, and oh so friendly!
author: Erin P.

description:
their coffee is SO good. "drip coffee one cup at a time" - the selection can be a little overwhelming for a first-timer like me (i think it took me 10 minutes to figure out what i wanted)
but the baristas are more than happy to offer any advice or answer any questions and offer recommendations based on what you normally drink/like
great spot check it out!
author: D L.

description: i finally got myself into philz capable hands and this coffee lovin boy may never be the same.
author: Jeremy D.

description: it's pure, fresh, strong coffee, just like i like it.  this is not the place for the prissy and the weak!  if that's what you're looking for, go to 7-11, where they serve coffee-flavored water.   you will wait for your exceptionally fresh cuppa coffee as they do it "one at at time."  worth the wait, it's not starbucks!  i used to get double shot depth charges before i discovered this place.  the staff & owner are friendly, cheerful.  i'm glad it's in my neighborhood!
author: Emilio O.

description: Just awful.  We went in because we could smell Turkish coffee, which is what we ordered.  What we got was 2 huge cardboard cups of weak, bitter American coffee.  The barista said it was their own blend of "rich, dark" coffee to which they add a little cardamom.  The cardamom, if any, was undectable.  They are so clueless that they ask if you want milk in your Turkish coffee.  Then - after we got our coffee but before we got to a table, they announced that they were closing in 6 minutes.
author: Carl L.

description: A nice treat for me anytime I go to SF. The coffee is made cup by cup and I usually just get the turkish. It's pricey and certainly not a place I'd go everyday (I'm a Peets type person) but it's fun place to people watch, read a book, mess around on your laptop and generally enjoy the SF ambiance.
author: Monty H.

description: Philz coffee is something I look forward to every weekend.  I live about as far from the Mission as one can and still be in the city limits of SF.  As such, I am only able to make the trip there on weekends.  Every Saturday and Sunday morning (unless I'm terribly hung-over, out of town, or both) I make my way to the corner of 24th and Folsom for a large cup of STRONG coffee.  I prefer the Wunderbar Brew with cream, sugar, and mint but every once in a while I like to change it up.  Whether you're a newcomer or a veteran, you can count on the friendly staff to recommend something great.  If time permits, stick around and play chess, shoot the breeze with a complete stranger, log in to the local Wi-Fi or mill about on the sidewalk out front (people watching can be fun, especially in a district as diverse as the Mission).
author: Ryan M.

description: i lost my philz coffee virginity this morning. i'll be the first to admit i'm not a coffee aficionado. nor do i play one on TV. and, no, i didn't stay at a holiday inn express last night. but it was a good cup of joe and made by the man himself. bold and flavorful and packing a good jolt. whether it's worth the $2-$3 is for you to decide but it's worth trying once. and better than supporting star*ucks.
author: Sig N.

description: I loooooooove coffee. It is the very first thing I think about when I wake up, and I don't even feel like a human until I have had my first sip. And not just any old coffee. I like it dark and thick. Let's put it this way, most of the time I would rather walk around like a zombie then drink the nasty swill they serve at gas stations and Perkins. A friend of mine recently asked me if I had tried Philz. She couldn't believe that a specialty coffee lover such as myself hadn't ventured. I made it a priority. The next weekend on a sunny Saturday the lady and I strapped on our helmets and rode from the panhandle to the 24th street location (nice ride, by the way!). I waited that whole time for this coffee, that is how excited I was. We arrived and already I could tell there was something special going on. The menu is...interesting. Kind of hard to translate it. The guy next to me in line said you can basically tell them what you like and they will make the Philz version. So I say, do you have like, a, iced soy latte (normally I am a plain coffee girl, but it was warm and I was in a special occasion mood). My girlfriend ordered an iced mocha. Our coffee specialist was very nice, no rude attitude there. He did some kind of crazy stuff that involved shaking the coffee up in a milk carton and some other things that I didn't really understand, and voila, 5 minutes later we were holding liquid gold. The coffee was AMAZING. Best latte I have ever had. My gf's mocha was phenomenal. The only beef I had was that they were gone so fast (literally within minutes) and we can't really afford to drop 20 bucks on 4 coffees.
author: Natalie D.

description: Last Saturday morning I walked into philz for the second time ever . I was lucky enough to have phil make our coffee. Phil took time out to explain the difference in coffee to us , he went as far as making a special cup for  my boyfriend . After he educated us on coffee, he then stopped talking business . He talked to us like we were old friends He took time to ask us about who we were, this made our cup of  coffee taste so much more wonderful. Our trip to Philz left us feeling like we had just left a old  friends house.
author: kate w.

description: I love this place - the decor is so shambolic, and the coffee is sooooo good. Great place to hang out for hours on Sunday.
author: William m.

description: Now were talking a good,unique blend of wake-me-up tasting coffee. When I'm in the area and craving a cup, this is the place to go.
author: Tom W.

description: i know this place is known for its coffee, but i'm on a quest to find the bay area's best almond croissant, so when i stumbled across a philz in the mission, i decided to give it a shot. at $2 for an almond croissant which was huge, it was a good deal, but the croissant itself was pretty disappointing. it was flaky, but not buttery. the croissant kind of tasted like a fresher version of the costco kind, which is a decent croissant, but there's not authentic french bakery taste. the almond filling was pretty good, not too sweet; however, it was scant, making up only a very small portion inside the croissant, probably explaining why the croissant itself was only 2 dollars. the almonds on the surface tasted fine, and the croissant surface was decorated nicely with some powdered sugar, a touch i have not yet seen. it was a nice surprise, but the croissant itself wasn't that great. brioche bakery is still the leader by a very far margin.
author: Danny C.

description: I consider myself to be somewhat of a coffee connoisseur so when I say this is the BEST cup of coffee you could possibly buy I sincerely mean it. It may be crowded and take a few extra minutes but it is definitely worth it. I walk about a 1/2 mile and pass at least 10 other coffee shops on my way there knowing that not one of them can compare to Phil'z! If you bring your own cup (any size) you'll only get charged for a small which is a great deal for both customers and the environment. Phil or his son Jacob are there at least 50% of the time and that really helps to hold the quality and service to it's outstanding level. Phil is as friendly and compassionate as his coffee is delicious. Expect this place to be packed every morning of the week but the line goes nice & fast because I think they can "hand-make" 16 or so cups of coffee at a time. Each cup is individually fresh ground and hand tailored for each customer, and comes out perfect everytime! Thank you Phil, you truly are the BEST!
author: Paulette B.

description:
mmmMMMocha Tesora! 

I have never had a bad cup of coffee from Philz. When I lived in Bernal Heights, it was a treat to be able to start my day with a cup of warm goodness as I walked to BART. I love how every drink is made to order, and whatever you get is pretty amazing! Just make sure you get the appropriate caffeine strength bean / size; I have made this mistake a couple of times and have found myself feeling cracky.

The atmosphere is diverse and friendly. I found that when I've taken out of towners there that they felt comfortable, and many enjoyed it enough to ask me to pick up and ship coffee to them.
author: Henry S.

description: i love iced coffee.  i love philz iced coffee!  i also love that you aren't pretentious and too cool like other coffee places.  although, it kinda freaked me out that there was a guy sitting behind and closely "supervising(?)" the person at the cash register?  just sitting there, on a chair, behind the guy at the cash register, watching all the other people work... freaky, right?  i think this is phil or his son?  either way, it made me feel bad for the people that worked there. hmmmm.  i've worked many service jobs and i don't want to contribute to a place where i feel like the workers are being disrespected/ mistreated.... what to do?
author: Emi K.

description: Good coffee, cool place. And LOTS of fluffy arm chairs. Cool music. Great customer service. Need I say more? Honestly the perfect coffee house. I could stay here for hours just chillin'
author: Danielle R.

description: This place is magical! Amazingly delicious. It will boldly change the minds and turn the heads of those who think this drip cup coffee stuff is overpriced, overrated, and unjustifiably trendy. Phil is humble and kind, and baristas very helpful (as the menu can be a bit overwhelming). I take all my visitors to SF here so they can experience and remember the legacy of Phil'z.
author: O and C D.

description: You've probably heard the saying, "Once you go black, you can't go back".  Well the same goes for once you've tried Philz Coffee you can't go back to Four Barrel, Blue Bottle, Ritual, etc...  nothing else compares.
author: Jen L.

description: only one place can hold a candle to philz and that's the blue bottle in hayes v.  philz is so good i can't even drink it right now.
author: Scott C.

description: one cup at a time, huh? i was skeptical at first, but i actually really like this place. there's this "mocha" coffee i've gotten a few times that is really rich and tasty. my only gripe - i wish the coffee was hotter!
author: eve l.

description: the large coffee is about as strong as, say, four normal coffees. you do NOT need a large unless you want to be wildly irritable and full of heart palpitations for a few days. that being said, the coffee is, indeed, exceptional. nothing like a cup brewed individually just for you.
author: Marla W.

description: Tried their Turkish coffee- best I've ever had. The woman who made my coffee was extremely nice, and I watched her make the order for a very demanding homeless guy in front of me- he kept yelling at her to stir faster and she was very kind and had a lot of patience with him. The only negative was the cashier was a bit snippy- when I paid I told her I had already ordered (not sure if she would order me a second cup if I didn't tell her that)- got a sarcastic "most people have" in reply. Oh well- her attitude didn't live up to their reputation but wouldn't have been bad if I hadn't expected perfection from the experience. and the coffee was to die for. seriously.
author: Kerry L.

description: gooood fresh coffee, flavors like chewing the coffee bean itself;   very mission environment
author: Debbie Y.

description:
Just got back from 5 days in SF, stayingwith my cousin on 25th and Shotwell. Upon arriving and needing a cup of coffee, my cous took me around the corner to Philz. As seems to often be the case for newbies,  I was confused and somewhat alarmed. I can't get an iced mocha? No espresso machine? No varietals? I ordered a cup of ultimate iced, and spilled it before really getting to the point.
OK, the next day,  i decided to stop resisting, and and emrace possibility. I walked up to the young man at the drip station, and put myself in his hands- "make me a cup of dark roast that is going to change my life". His face lit up, he told me I was going to be up all night thinking about the coffee he was about to make me, and I watched the magic ensue. no machine, just someone passionate and joyful about what he was doing, going for beans, grinding them, pouring water over them with panache, adding cream, and handing me a cup he was clearly so proud of, so invested in. And yes, my life, at least with respect to how I view my coffee, is changed. And now  i am back in Minneapolis, a bag of beans in hand, and some trial and error in front of me.

And in answer to your question- 1/2 jacob's wonderbar, 1/2 red sea. with cream. Like listening to thunder in the distance while relaxing in a tub of warm chocolate (tortured simile, but great coffee anway). 

Thanks you, kind folks at Philz. 

And btw, to the reviewer who trashed blends, as i used to do, some of the great wines of the world are blends. It is a matter of letting go of the need for contol, and trusting that you are in the hands of someone who knows something you do not.  Peace.
author: MJ G.

description: MMMMMM coffeeeeee.....turkish coffee, arabic coffeeee, coffeee galore...and sambosa's? It can't get any better. The service is great, the coffee is amazing, the ambiance is perfect. My fav spot for a weekend brew. Please dont sell out and multiply...I know there are other locations, but chains just aren't the same.
author: Busta B.

description: philz coffee is interesting. it's pretty strong yet lacks the "giddy up" that i look for. the whole mint thing doesn't work for me though. i love the smell and the taste of coffee. so why ruin it with mint? however, the biggest gripe i have with philz is the price. $2.50 for a cup of coffee? are you kidding me? um, this isn't new york or tokyo. and your coffee is just decent. so philz, you can continue to preach how righteous you are, but i'm sticking with peet's. and yes, i still consider peet's as a local company. it's just much smarter and successful than you. another thing, don't try to be such an elitist. it's a sign of insecurity.
author: frisco j.

description: Listen, I don't even really drink coffee (more of a tea girl) but this place makes me wish that I did. I drank the Ambrosia and had a revelation. If I could I would give it 1 billion stars. Make sure they add the mint leaf.
author: Alisa W.

description: No need to write much here.  On my first time there the guy asked me what I liked.  I told him, he listened and said that he would make me the best cup of coffee I had ever had.  He was right.
author: Owen B.

description:
another enthusiastic thumbs up for philz. i buy my whole beans here, and there is no better source of beans in this city (that i know of?). of course, they can brew a mean cup for you too. i recently tried the iced coffee, and was blown away all over again.

in addition to their fantastic coffee, philz has couches, tables, and fast, free wifi, which makes it a good place to sit down and get some work done.
author: Ben H.

description:
philz is the closest thing to my favorite coffee shop back in d.c......tryst...
comfy couches, lots of space, live music

take credit cards, free wifi, NO FOOD, just sweet things..learned the hard way
author: Kate R.

description: Only been here twice, first time a friend working locally dragged me here on a late sat afternoon. I'm usually done with my coffee intake before then but my friend insisted I try it. Ended up getting the 'Tesora' and by god I was stunned how good it tasted. Haven't had a chance to go back until this morning a good 2 months later, ordered the tesora again and it was still fantastic. Pricy for sure, don't think I would pay that every day but in my mind it is much better than blue bottle, virtual roasters and four barrel. Plus the staff are super friendly compared to the other mission coffee shop wankers.
author: J l.

description:
first off, i wanna say their coffee is hands down some of the best in the city, if not the entire bay area. 

i give philz 4.6/5 stars.

some things worth noting:

THE GOOD:
1) they by default use real brown sugar
2) the coffee is uniquely very tasty. tastes like they roast some batches with herbs/spices
3) cup is very fresh and prepared just for you. a rare thing for drip coffee
4) MANY coffee options, in this case, its a good thing
5) organic coffee option(s), as well as soy, honey, etc
6) the lounging area is spacious, well lit, airy, and comfortable. seating outside as well
7) parking is relatively easy for the mission
8) the baristas are friendly, engaging, and concerned with your satisfaction
9) they take credit cards, even discover!
10) yerba mate is served
11) they play good music
12) computers if you care to surf the web

THE LESS THAN GOOD:
1) be careful when you accept their "cream and sugar?" offer. they tend to add quite a bit of cream
2) the price for a small averages $3, which is quite steep for drip coffee. larges average $3.50, so the price per cup is more economical for the larger size
3) rush times are confusing in regards to "who's in line". there is no system, so you will frequently notice a pack of people standing around the barista booths bunched up. also, the line to pay easily gets mixed with the ordering (bunched) lines. best thing is to just go with the flow
4) to my knowledge no organic cream (dairy)/sugar options
author: Dayman D.

description: point blank - - philz has the best coffee in the city. i drive my out of town friends across the city just to get a cup. he makes it cup by cup, so you get lightly smacked with some bitterness -- the way real coffee should taste. try his mocha. that stuff is goooooodd....
author: monkey l.

description: Strong coffee and Phil is always friendly.  You can also pick up some groceries while there...
author: Jessie H.

description: really really good coffee. all made by hand, one cup at a time. try the turkish, topped off with cream, sugar and a mint leaf. nice and spicy on a cold morning.
author: Jess T.

description: so addicting...philharmonic is one of those you just can't get enough types of things.
author: Mama Jaz C.

description: As someone who works out of a CAR or a coffee shop, I like when I can choose the location of the meeting and make it Philz.  It is a great place to site a chat, and introduce a new person to a new cup of coffee.
author: William W.

description: not only is the coffee extremely good, the ancho chilli breakfast burritos are the best!  so convenient -just heat & eat! yummy ! & I like the black bean ones too, BF likes the bacon burrito - I think they all have them in SF-not sure about EB
author: Melissa D.

description: The iced coffee at Phillz is simply the best, the taste is perfect. I order mine with light cream and sugar got to cut back sometimes, it wakes you up and I actually look forward to getting a cup. I'm a San Francisco native and my hairdresser told me about this place, sad to say I didn't know existed before, so when I come to SF from Oakland atleast 4 times a week I try to stop by ITS DA BOMB!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Athena C.

description: pretty good. they brew the coffee cup by cup. the place is what i imagine someones living room to be like. the idea of couches in a coffee shop is essential. the guy behind the counter plays in a band like every,  good barista/cashier at a coffee shop, should. the coffee is pretty legit also. as i said brewed cup to cup. but i think it is a bit strong. i would give it another star if Ritual somehow closed down. but i dig the vibe here.
author: jeff e.

description: i'm addicted. i admit it. not only to their amazing coffee and the charming boys behind the counter but to their vegan donuts as well. i suggest experimentation on the types of coffee, i've been around the block and back a few times now and still haven't quite decided which one i love the most. i just wish they opened earlier on the weekends, my 7AM shift in the presido is making me thirst !
author: Lydia H.

description: 5 for the coffee...1 for hang out.  i think they did that on purpose though.  they figured out that you don't have to get free intersnet or tables or chairs or cinder blocks or any of that other stuff to sell one cup of coffee and watch someone drink and sit there for hours reading a book.  Better to just sell the coffee and get em outta there.  unfortunately this creates quite a dilemma for a dudeler like me.  i love philz, but i also read. hmmm...
author: chreesh b.

description: I've lived in the area for almost 4 years and only now discovered Philz.  I'm sad that I didn't find it sooner!  Hands-down this place makes the best coffee I've ever had in my life.  Yes, its a little pricey, but worth every penny.
author: Christina D.

description: The workers really do spend most of their shift telling customers how great the products they're selling are -- but they're not lying. It's stuffy, the couches are really, really broken in, and the first cup/herbed cream/mint leaf almost turned me off to the whole idea. But give it two cups -- the first sip of your second changes everything.
author: Nicole M.

description: good coffee in a hip yet laid back atmosphere.  My advice is to not clog the toilet.
author: pauline e.

description: We arrived around 11 ish and there was 2-3 people in front of us.  I ordered a small iced coffee mint mojito and was recommend a #4 (Jacon's Wonderbar Brew).  I got a friendly barista and told her that it was my first time and I asked her for recommendation.  I told her I wanted strong coffee with cream and sugar.  I asked how she would prepare the cream.  She said they shake the cream.  It's true. They actually shake the cream in the its container.  The coffee was somewhat strong but it was not hot like I would like.  I'm not use to having someone add the sugar for me.  If your coffee is not sweet enough to your liking, they would add more sugar for you.  I did not received a jolt of high like I wanted.  Overall, I am a bit disappointing with the coffee but I don't mind returning to try something else.  My friend think the iced coffee mint mojito is different, but she tasted too much of the mint.
author: lovefoods S.

description: ohhhh god. so i've decided that i have terrible food and drink memory, but philz is the best coffee i've had in recent memory. i don't know if it's because they grind the beans and make your coffee by the cup, or because of the delicious cardamon and spices, or if it's dreamy mcdreamerson barista's intense eyes every morning (i know you hold that gaze and subtly smile at everyone...!). whatever it is, philz is totes worth the 10 min. tacked on to my commute.
author: Erica C.

description: I thought I knew what good coffee was until I went to Philz. When I tried their coffee for the first time I didn't know how I felt. Mabee i like it maybee i don't. Its different Then it hit me. Could this be the best coffee I ever had? Can this be better than Peets? Is this better than blue bottle? Survey says ......... Yes I think so. Its amazing I never knew coffee had so many natural flavors. You can taste the sweetness even when you drink it black( well I normally drink coffee black maybe that's why its sweet to me). Although its expensive for coffee ( about 3-4 bucks a cup) its worth every cent. Their motto is one cup at a time. They will grind the coffee right in front of you after you pick one of their many blends. My  2 favorite are the medium roast silken and ambrosia.  The owner is very nice too, he will talk to you and shake your hand. Overall the staff is great.  I do have to point out that some days their coffee taste better than others, so that might depend on who is making it or the beans. But even so its still good coffee. Their coffee is either heck hecka good or good.   Also they don't make expresso dinks so blue bottle and Peets are still champions in that area.
author: Derrick L.
